loans.name: Aligismet

texts.en: Aligismet A. lives in Beylagan, a small city in southwestern Azerbaijan. He is 45 years old, married and has three children. He engaged in taxi service in Beylagan City. Aligismet must keep his taxi in good working condition, so he is requesting a loan of $500 to bring his vehicle up-to-date with service and repairs.

loans.use: For vehicle repairs

loans.name: Anamelba

texts.es:
Anamelba, who is a member of the communal bank "La Primavera" (The Spring), lives at Asentamiento Humano La Primavera MZ "A" Lt 01 in the province and district of Moyobamba in San Martín. She has a stand in the Ayamaman Market where she sells used clothing. Many times she mends garments to be able to sell them. She decided to start a business because she needed to generate her own income to be able to give her children a good education. She is a very happy, enterprising, and optimistic person, and this helps her have good clients.

This loan of 1,000 nuevos soles, which she will repay in 6 months, will be used to buy used clothing in bundles to make the most of the celebrations at the end of the year, so she can have a well-supplied business and satisfy her clients' tastes.

Anamelba is 43-years-old, and her husband helps her with her business. He stays at the stand in the mornings, while she is there in the afternoons. This is so she can do her housework and also mend garments. She is happy with her accomplishments: she has a loyal clientele, and her goal is to continue with this business to make it even better.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

La señora Anamelba, socia del banco comunal La Primavera, vive en el Asentamiento Humano La Primavera MZ “A” Lt 01 de la provincia y distrito de Moyobamba, departamento de San Martín. Anamelba tiene un puesto en el mercado Ayaymaman en donde vende ropa usada, ella es quien muchas veces los arregla para ponerlo a la venta. Decidió iniciar en un negocio porque tenía la necesidad de generar sus propios ingresos para poder darles una buena educación a sus hijos. Es una persona muy alegre, emprendedora y optimista y eso le ayuda para tener buenos clientes.

El préstamo de S/. 1,000.00, el cual pagará en 6 meses, comprará ropa usada en fardos para aprovechar las fiestas de fin de año para tener bien surtido su negocio y satisfacer los gustos de sus clientes.

Tiene 43 años y dos hijos, su esposo le apoya en el negocio, él se queda en el puesto en la mañana y ella por las tardes para que ella pueda atender las labores domésticas y también arreglar las prendas para poder venderlas. Está contenta por sus logros obtenidos, tiene su clientela segura y su meta es continuar con este negocio implementarlo mejor.

loans.use: Purchase of used clothing

loans.name: Dolores

texts.es:
Dolores belongs to the communal bank of Women with a Future, located in the district of Calleria, in the neighborhood of Ucayali. She is 61 years old, and she is the mother of 11 children and all of her children help take care of her. She is married and her husband is a fisherman. With her first loan that she received from Manuela Ramos she decided to invest in fishing.

At the moment she relies on selling fish to earn her income. She has a motorcar that her son drives. She wakes up at 6 a.m. every morning to make breakfast and then she leaves to sell fish.

With the loan of 1,900 Peruvian Soles, which she will pay in 5 months, she will invest it in tools needed for her duty and paying the person who works with her.

Dolores is very happy, while fishing and the motorcar is really helping her to succeed in her business. She also feels more independent and she counts less on the support of her children and her husband. She hopes for great health in order for her to succeed. She is grateful for the support everyone has provided, especially Manuela Ramos.

Translated from Spanish by Edith of San Roque High School, Kiva volunteer

La señora Dolores pertenece al banco comunal Mujeres con Futuro, ubicado en Jr. Apurimac 409, distrito de Calleria, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 61 años, es madre de 11 hijos, todos mayores de edad que siempre la apoyan, es casada y su esposo es pescador. Con el primer préstamo de S/. 300 que recibió de Manuela Ramos decide invertir en la pesca.

En la actualidad cuenta con un negocio de venta de pescados al por mayor y con un motokar que es manejado por su hijo. Ella se levanta a las 6 a.m. para preparar el desayuno y luego va al puerto y dirige la venta de sus pescados.

Con el préstamo de S/. 1,900, el cual pagará en 5 meses, invertirá en la compra de una red paichitera, mantenimiento del bote y el motor y comprará 30 barras de hielo, 40 galones de combustibles y cubrirá el pago de su personal que trabaja con ella, además hizo el mantenimiento a su motokar, el cual le genera un ingreso diario.

Dolores está muy contenta, tanto el negocio de la pesca como el motokar están dando buenos resultados. También se siente más independiente y cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijos y el su esposo. Espera gozar de buena salud para poder seguir adelante. Se siente muy agradecida por el apoyo que le brinda Manuela Ramos .

loans.use: Maintenance on her boat and motor, and purchase of fishing supplies.

loans.name: Aubhon

texts.ru:
Aubhon B., 40, lives in Jomi district. He is married with four children and has a high school education. He works on the Aral collective farm. He has also been involved in private agricultural activities for about ten years. He rents some land where he plans wheat and other crops, such as flax. After the harvest, Aubhon sells a portion of the wheat and flax oil produced for cash. His family's portion supplies them with flour and oil for the next year. By developing rural agriculture, Aubhon provides the local market with wheat and oil at accesible prices. He plans to repay his loan within ten months.

Translated from Russian by Susie Armitage, Kiva volunteer.

Бобохонов Аюбхон житель района Джоми. Женат имеет четверых детей. Возраст 40 лет. Образование среднее. Специальности не имеет работает в колхозе Арал в дехканском хозяйстве. В частном порядке занимается земледелием около 10 лет. Имеет арендованную землю которую засеивает пшеницей и другими зерновыми, такие как лен.Этот бизнес помогает клиенту обеспечивать свою семью мукой, маслом и деньгами,т.к. после получения урожая клиент продает часть пшеницы и часть масла переработанного из льна. Часть той же продукции оставляет семье запсом на 1 год.Развивая сельское хозяйство клиент обеспечивает рынок данной продукцией по доступным ценам. Погасить кредит клиент планирует в течении 10 месяцев.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: TO STOCK HER GENERAL STORE AND CONTINUE TO GROW HER BUSINESS.

loans.name: Diouldé

texts.fr:
Mrs. Diouldé M. is a woman who has a little shop right in front of her house. Her aim is to help her husband support their family. She is asking for a short-term loan so that she can consolidate her little business venture.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Madame Diouldé M. est une femme qui fait du petit commerce devant son domicile pour aider son mari à faire face aux charges du ménage. Elle sollicite un prêt pour consolider ses activités.

loans.use:
to add to her business capital

renforcement fonds de roulement pour ses activites commerciales

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To increase her inventory and add tablecloths and curtains

loans.name: Melvin Leonel

texts.es:
In the city of Chinandega, Mr. Melvin C. works making and selling bread in the bakery that carries his name “C. Bakery.” He has put forth great effort in his business in order to support his children in their studies so they have the chance to become someone in life.

He needs to invest more in raw materials in order to continue making the delicious bread for which he is well-known. This is why he is seeking a loan through Ceprodel in order to purchase the raw materials to continue his humble business. Currently, he has repaid 9 loans on time and in accord with the agreements he has made with the Ceprodel institution.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer.

En la ciudad de Chinandega, el señor Melvin C. se dedica a su propio negocio de elaboración y venta de pan ofrecido en su panadería el cual lleva el nombre “Panadería C.”. Sus grandes esfuerzos los ha llevado a cabo porque desea mantener los estudios de sus hijos para que lleguen a ser alguien en la vida.

La necesidad que el negocio atraviesa es que requiere invertir en la compra de materia prima para la elaboración del delicioso pan. Es por esta razón que acude a Ceprodel para ser beneficiado con el crédito y de esta manera adquirir la materia prima para continuar con su humilde negocio. Actualmente su record crediticio es de 9 créditos con Ceprodel pagados en tiempo y forma de acuerdo a lo establecido por la institución.

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials

loans.name: Zakia's Group

texts.en:
Zakia baji is the wife of R. A. and has lived in a two-room brick house in Kot Radha Kishan, Pakistan for the last 10 years. She has three daughters and one son, all of whom are enrolled in a local school. Zakia baji sews clothes and does domestic chores for a living. Her husband runs a grocery store. She has successfully paid back three loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute in Pakistan) and is now applying for a fourth loan to buy more inventory for her husband’s shop.

She is applying for her loan with several other people. Salma baji wants a loan to buy more materials for her wood business. Bushra baji wants a loan to buy more tents for her tent-service business. Rubina baji and Tahira baji want a loan to buy more fruit for their fruit-selling businesses.

This is a group loan. The funds will be distributed among the members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand their businesses

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! Gloria M. lives in Dar es Salaam where she owns a Mama Lishe (local cafe) that she established in 2004. She is assisted by three employees in the running of her café and earns monthly profit of about 300 USD. When you see a SELFINA entrepreneur whose business title is "restaurant" or "café," you may have to adjust your mental image of what that is. A local restaurant or café in Tanzania usually consists of a rough wooden table and some long, wooden benches, with the sky as a ceiling. Such places don’t even appear in the Lonely Planet’s budget guide, but if you’re looking for a cheap and tasty meal, and someone to have a chat with, this is the place to be. The food is all local: rice, ugali (a hot sticky dough, made from maize flour), plantain (a cooked savoury banana), all served with beans, vegetables, meat, and a variety of yummy sauces. Gloria is requesting a loan of 800 USD in order to purchase a microwave and to make renovations to her café. Gloria hopes that her larger café will be able to hold more customers and thus enable her to expand her business and earn increased profits in the near future.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of microcredit in Tanzania. The organization is devoted to the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through microfinance as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets; because of this, they are deemed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support, hence poor access to basic needs and services. When a client needs working capital to buy a specific item, SELFINA buys the equipment for said client and extends a loan to her. The same equipment is then leased back to the client so they can use it while in process of paying back their loan, a process called a sale-and-leaseback arrangement. Once the loan has been repaid, SELFINA transfers the ownership of the equipment to the client. The advantage of microleasing over traditional microfinance loans is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy additional supplies for her cafe

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine M. is 52 years old and is divorced with two grown children. She runs a small grocery store and also sells poultry. She started these businesses in 1996 and works daily from 7am to 10pm, sometimes staying open until midnight on the weekends. She is able to earn a monthly profit of about $261-348.

This will be Josephine's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She is very excited for this opportunity and intends to use the loan to increase the inventory of her grocery store.

loans.use: To increase the inventory of her grocery store.

loans.name: Tong

texts.en: Mrs. Tong S., 60, and her husband, Mr. Phat Chey, 60, live on an island of Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1960 and have six children; three sons and three daughters. Two of their children are married and live outside the family home. One son raises cows and another son is a construction worker. Two daughters are silk weavers. Tong has been a silk weaver since 1979, a skill she learned from her mother in law. She sells her finished products to a middle man in the village, who then takes it to sell in Phnom Penh. Mr. Phat does farming and raises cows. Tong is requesting a loan of 400 to purchase silk materials for her two daughters and her weaving business.

loans.use: Tong would like to purchase silk material for weaving.

loans.name: Cacilda Angelina

texts.pt:
Cacilda Angelina C. nasceu em Maputo e tem 41 anos de idade, casada maritalmente e mãe de 2 filhas, a primeira com 19anos de idade e a segunda com 15 anos de idade, apenas uma que estuda e sustenta somente as filhas

Cacilda estudou até 5ªclasse e parou por falta de condições, os pais separaram ela ainda muito nova, onde teve que viver com o seu pai, ajudava ao pai a cuidar da machamba para conseguir o seu sustento, em 1989 juntou se com o marido casamento que resultou neste dois filhos. Em 1994 decide abrir um negócio como auto emprego para ajudar ao marido nas despesas da casa. O marido é mineiro trabalha na africa do sul.

Cacilda é criadora de frango a mais de 10 anos e tem apoio das filhas, onde compra o pinto por 16,00mt e vende o frango por 80,00mt a 110,00mt variando por tamanho ou idade. Tem tido um rendimento mensal 4000,00mt, ainda não faz poupança dado que os lucros investem no crescimento do negócio e na educação da filha.

Este é o primeiro empréstimo da Cacilda na Hluvuku e no Kiva. E conheceu a Hluvuku através dos vizinhos que já são clientes, cacílda tem como planos para futuro a educação das filhas.
texts.en:
Cacilda Angelina C. was born in Maputo and is 41 years old. She is married and has 2 daughters, ages 19 and 15. Only one of her daughters goes to school. Cacilda went to school thorugh the 5th grade when she had to drop-out as she could not afford it any longer. Her parents separated when she was young and she lived with her father where she helped support the family by helping her father take care of the farm. She got married in 1989, had her 2 daughters and in 1994 decided to start her own business to help her husband with the household expenses. Her husband is a miner working in South Africa. Cacilda has raised chickens for over 10 years with the help of her daughters. She buys each chick for 16.00MT and sells the grown chicken from 80.00MT to 110.00MT depending on size and age. Her monthly profit is around 4000.00MT, but she is unable to save money, as this income is used to grow her business and on her daughter's education. This is Cacilda's first loan from Hluvuku and Kiva. She learned about Hluvuku through her neighbors who are customers already. Her plan for the future is to send both of her daughters to school.

Translated from Portuguese by Camila Vasconcelos, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Criaçao de Frangos

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
Diana N. is 34 years old, married, and has two children who are currently in school. Diana has been a supplier and distributor of locally manufactured palm oil for two years. Palm oil is produced from palm nuts, while palm-kernel oil is produced from palm kernels, which are a by-product of palm oil. The palm-kernel oil is used to prepare many local dishes. Diana treks to Asamang in the Eastern region of Ghana to purchase the processed oil and then supplies it to food vendors to prepare meals.

She wants to use the loan to buy additional gallons of palm oil from the manufacturers, so she can better supply her customers who demand the product. She believes this will help expand her business and generate more income to support her family and finance her children’s education.

Diana belongs to the community group called “Mount Calvary” Trust Group where her picture was taken. In this group, members serve as guarantees for one another to access loans and to exert peer pressure to repay loans.

loans.use: Buy additional gallons of palm oil

loans.name: Familia Group

texts.en:
The Familia Village Bank is a new bank with 19 members, who after weeks of training are happy to begin their first loan cycle. Each of the members was invited to participate by the loan officer, and most of them live in the San Felipe and June 11th neighborhoods.  The group members are involved in a variety of businesses, like grains, sweets, basic dry goods, meat, vegetables, firewood, cosmetics, and food sales. Some sell from their homes, while others are street or market vendors.  The group members are requesting different loan amounts, like 300, 600 or 900 soles, and the group as a whole is requesting a total of 8,700 soles. They will use their loans to buy rice, sugar, pasta, meat, wheat, barley, cookies, caramels, cosmetics, firewood and wood.  The group members dream of owning prosperous businesses, owning their own stores (as opposed to renting), that their children will grow up to be working professionals, and of owning their own homes.
 
 Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow

El Banco Comunal Familia es un Banco Nuevo que recien inicia con 19 socias, quienes después D. semanas D. capacitación inician con mucha alegría. Todas ellas fueron invitadas por L. promotora, L. mayoria D. ellas son del asentamiento humano San Felipe y 11 D. junio.
Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como L. venta prendan D. cereales, golosinas, abarrotes en general, carne, verduras, leña, cosméticos y venta D. comida. Sus ventas los realizan en sus domicilios, ambulantemente, D. casa en casa y en mercados.
Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. préstamos, algunos montos son D. 300 soles, 600 soles y 900 soles, haciendo un total D. 8,700 soles D. préstamos en el Banco Comunal.
Los préstamos lo invertirán en L. compra D. azucar, arroz,  fideo, carne, trigo, cebada, galletas, caramelos, cosméticos, leña y madera.
Los sueños D. las socias es que sus negocios sean prósperos, tener locales propios, sus hijos sean profesionales y tener casa propia.

loans.use: Buy rice, sugar, pasta, meat, wheat, barley, cookies, caramels, cosmetics, firewood and wood

loans.name: Olanike Morenekeji

texts.en: Olanike Morenekeji O. is 40 years old and married with 3 children. She lives in Ibadan, Nigeria. She has a catering service for various ceremonies like marriages, birthdays, etc. She needs the loan amount of N80,000 to purchase more catering materials. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more catering materials

loans.name: Aziza

texts.en:
Aziza has run a small charcoal and firewood store in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for the last four years. She belongs to the Tusichukiane loan group, and currently earns an average monthly profit of $125. She works at her  business for 12 hours a day. She is seeking her second loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more charcoal and firewood for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.    

Aziza is 45 years old, married, and has six children ages 2, 10, 18, 21, 23 and 25.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal and firewood for her business.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en: Norma P., age 48, is blessed with two children who are now in college. Providing for the needs of her children prompted her to engage in business. Her husband is a construction worker and she can't rely on his income. With strong will, she borrowed PHP 5000 from HSPFI and she was able to open a food stall in the school canteen. Now she wants to buy raw materials in bulk, such as large sacks of flour and sugar, to produce more products on her own. Therefore, she needs PHP 7000 to purchase stock for her food stall and to support the needs of her children in school.

loans.use: To buy raw material in bulk

loans.name: Hugo

texts.es: El solicitante es el Sr. Hugo L.. El mismo es casado y posee cas propia con todas las comodidades necesarias de un hogar. Es casado y tiene 2 hijos que van al colegio de su Barrio Ita Paso. Hugo es microempresario se es prestador de servicios de profesion Maestro constructor de obras. Cuenta con 24 años de de antigüedad en el rubro. Cabe destacar que el mismo opera unicamente con Fundacion Paraguaya desde el 2006 con varias operaciones completas. El miimso solicito la suma de 2,500,000 a 12 meses para compras de herremientas para su actividad comercial para poder prestar mejor servicos a alas constructoras.
texts.en:
Hugo L. is married and has his own house with all the necessary home amenities. He has two children that attend the school in his neighborhood, Barrio Ita Paso. Hugo is a microentrepreneur, and his profession is master works builder. He has 24 years of experience in this field. He has only worked with Fundacion Paraguaya since 2006, and has finished various projects. He is seeking 2,500,000 PYG ($500) over 12 months to purchase tools for his economic activity to be able to provide better services to other builders.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase tools

loans.name: Auxilladora

texts.en:
Auxilladora I., 58, is a widowed mother of five children. She manages a small sari-sari store in her village. She started the business a year ago using her small savings of PHP 3,000 only. Auxilladora is also a seamstress. When she is not busy in her store, she makes dresses. The income she gets from sewing dresses is used for meeting the needs of her family.

She is asking a loan of PHP 10,000 from CEVI to buy stocks in her store to augment her income, thus growing her business. CEVI is helping her sustain her business. Now, she has access to CEVI credit assistance, trainings and insurance coverage.

loans.use: Purchase of sari-sari stocks

loans.name: Abdo

texts.en:
Abdo is a 31-year-old engaged man who lives in Bint Jbeil, in southern Lebanon. Abdo has been working as a sanitary worker for ten years. He requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua, Kiva's partner, in order to purchase tools for his work. This is his third cycle and he has always paid on time.

His previous loans helped him improve his work as well as his financial situation. Abdo is special in his work because he does it well. His clients are people from his region. When he first started his business, he didn’t have the experience, so building a network wasn’t easy for him. Also, he had to learn new techniques in order to face the competition. Abdo decided on doing his business because he wanted to have independent work. In the future, he plans on improving his business.

loans.use: Abdo will use the loan to purchase tools for his work.

loans.name: Prisque

texts.fr:
H. Prisque est née le 8 Septembre 1976 à Abomey Calavi dans le Département de l'Atlantique au Sud du Benin. Prisque est mariée et mère de deux enfants: Romain âgé de dix ans en sixième année du cours primaire et Ermine âgée de huit ans en quatrième année du cours primaire. Prisque est couturière de formation. Prisque vend aussi des tissus qu’elle distribue aux fonctionnaires à crédit et passe après pour récupérer son argent selon le délai convenu avec le client. C’est à Dantokpa, grand marché international du Bénin que Prisque achète ses tissus. Prisque a déjà eu trois crédits de ALIDé pour augmenter le niveau de son activité. Prisque sollicite un quatrième crédit pour renforcer son capital dans le but de satisfaire la forte demande de sa clientèle. 

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500.
texts.en:
H. Prisque was born on September 8, 1976 in Abomey Calavi, in Atlantique County in southern Benin. She is married and the mother of two children: Romain, age 10 and in the 6th year of primary school; and Ermine, age 8 and in the 4th year of primary school. Prisque is a seamstress by training. She also sells cloth that she distributes to civil servants on credit. And she comes by afterward to collect her money according to what is a suitable wait for the customer. There, in Dantokpa, the grand international market of Benin, she buys her cloth. She has already had three ALIDÉ loans for increasing her business level. She's requesting a fourth loan to boost her capital with the goal of satisfying the strong demand from her customers. ALIDÉ means “there is always a path for the poorest” in Benin’s local language of Fon. Benin is a small West African country located next to Nigeria and has a per capita GDP of $1,500.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 20 bolts of Hitarget cloth (12 m each) and 5 bolts of Hollandais cloth (12 m each)

loans.name: Oigul

texts.en:
Oigul is a widow and mother of four children. She sells clothing in the small market of Shahrituz. Oigul’s business is going well and demand has been very stable over the last 14 years. Oigul is an entrepreneur of high integrity. She is very hard working and energetic. Even when her competitors have similar product or lower prices, clients naturally gravitate to her because she makes them feel valued, respected and heard. Oigul is requesting a loan of 5000 Somoni to purchase seasonal clothing which will help her stabilize her business and income so she can support herself and her daughter.

-------------------------------- More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchase clothing for women for the summer season.

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn P. is 23 years old and the single parent of one child. She once experienced failure on her farm. She failed to buy insecticides and, as a result, she had a stunted harvest. She lost so much money from the very poor harvest that she doesn't want it to happen again! She has been doing everything possible to make her farm productive.  

Marlyn is asking for a loan of Php 10,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy needed fertilizers, insecticides and pesticides for her farm. She thinks that this action will lead her to an abundant harvest on her farm. 

Marlyn is an active client of Community Economic Ventures Inc. (CEVI). She is happy joining in the cluster meetings every week. Aside from the loan that CEVI offers, she is enjoying the insurance coverage and training as well.

loans.use: To purchase herbicides, insecticides, fertilizers and other farming needs

loans.name: 030 Quảng Hưng Group

texts.en:
Hằng N. Thị (12) is a 37-year-old woman living in the town of Thanh Hóa. Hằng is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 030 Quảng Hưng (18.05.030).

Hằng is married and has 3 school-aged children. To making a living, Hằng owns & operates a business making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling Ban Cuon (Vietnamese breakfast rolls made of rice noodles) in the local community. Hằng has been engaged in this business for over 2 years and earns approximately 1,200,000 Vietnamese dong (about $68 US) a month from these activities.

In 2004, Hằng joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Hằng has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,079,800 dong from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. She is now requesting a new loan of 6,000,000 dong which will be used to invest in renovating the business. The loan will be the 9th loan she has taken out from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Hằng plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

1. N. Thị Xuyến (71) is a 52-year-old woman who is requesting a 6,000,000 dong loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

2. M. Thị Toan (51) is a 30-year-old woman who is requesting a 6,000,000 dong loan to support her business in the food sector running a food stall.

3. D. Thị Xinh (41) is a 44-year-old woman who is requesting a 6,000,000 dong loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

4. N. Thị Tấn (66) is a 45-year-old woman who is requesting a 6,000,000 dong loan to support her business in the retail sector running a general store.

About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

Hằng N. Thị (12) là 37 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hóa. Hằng là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 5 các thành viên. Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 030 Quảng Hưng (18.05.030).

Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ buôn bán Bánh Cuốn trong cộng đồng địa phương. Hằng thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 2 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, Hằng kiếm được khoảng 1.200.000 VND. Vào 2004, Hằng đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. Hằng đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 3.079.800 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng đầu tư mở rộng công việc kinh doanh. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6.000.000 VND.

Khoản vay sẽ là 9th khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:

1. N. Thị Xuyến (71) là 52 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.

2. M. Thị Toan (51) là 30 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm.

3. D. Thị Xinh (41) là 44 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.

4. N. Thị Tấn (66) là 45 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hàng bách hóa.

Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. . Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva. .

loans.use: To invest in renovating the business

loans.name: Soulemane

texts.fr: Célibataire et devant subvenir à ses propres charges, ce monsieur a commencé en 2006 le commerce de détail de portables. Il veut reconstituer son stock  pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle qui grandit,pour cela il sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter 15 portables de hautes gammes.
texts.en:
Unmarried and having to support himself, this gentleman started a retail business for mobile phones in 2006.  He wants to replenish his inventory to satisfy further his growing customer base.  To do so, he is requesting a loan from WAGES to buy 15 high-end cell phones.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cell phones

loans.name: Sophal

texts.en:
Mrs. Sophal C. lives in Thorm Nei village in Takeo province. She is a flower seller. Her husband, Mr. Sao Bunleng, is a farmer who owns a plot of land on which he cultivates rice. He is shown with her in the photo.

Now, Mrs. Sophal C. is requesting a loan to add to her savings to buy a motorbike to more easily take her flowers to sell at the market. She is 49 years old and the mother of three children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the other is attending the local school.

loans.use: To add to her savings to buy a motorbike to more easily take her flowers to sell at the market

loans.name: Christiana

texts.en: Christiana A. sells sarongs and she is also a tailor in her community in Sapele, Delta state, Nigeria. She is 60, married and has 3 children. She hopes for a loan of N60, 000 to purchase more sarongs to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Fotima

texts.en:
S. Fotima is 40 years old. She is married with three children. Fotima has a tailoring business. Her business is sewing national women dresses. Her workmanship is very good and being young she has a good eye for design. She is very organized and with a good head for business. She has had this business for 10 years and gained a lot of experience. With her loan, Fotima will buy automated sewing machine for improving he business. Fotima smiles when asked what her dreams are for the future. She quickly replies that she plans to open a workshop, hire seamstresses and expand her business. With her spirit, she will surely succeed.  


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing automated sewing machine.

loans.name: Samar

texts.en:
Samar is a 35 year old woman who lives in Beirut, the capital of Lebanon, with her husband. Samar has been working as a hairdresser for ten years. Samar doesn’t own a hairdressing salon and doesn’t work from her house, rather she goes to her clients. This means she works only when she has clients. Samar requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase new tools, as well as to pay for her children’s school tuition. This is her second cycle and she has always paid on time.

Samar's work is special because she knows how to treat her clients well and is aware of new hairstyles. Her clients are her friends and neighbors. When she first started her business, she faced some financial issues which is why she decided to be a mobile hairdresser. Samar decided to do this business because of her experience. In the future, she plans on having more clients in order to have greater income.

loans.use: To purchase new tools, as well as to pay for her children’s school tuition

loans.name: Josiah

texts.en:
Josiah rears pigs. He lives in Ogbomoso, Oyo State, Nigeria. He is 56 years old and married with four children. He has been in this business for over 23 years and has been in LAPO, a Kiva partner, for the past two years. 

Josiah hopes for a loan of 50,000 Nigerian naira to purchase more piglets to rear and sell. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more piglets to sell

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en: Milagros D. is from the village of Dohinob. She is 64 years old and is married. Milagros owns and operates a business providing general alteration and tailoring services to local community members. She has been engaged in her business for over twenty years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Milagros joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional fabrics and materials. Milagros is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used for the same purpose. This loan will be her 2nd from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business and be able to save for the future. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fabrics and materials

loans.name: Khairullo

texts.en:
Khairullo is 25 years old, and he lives with his wife and two children. He is a livestock breeder. He has been doing this for the past 6 years and considers it very profitable. Khairullo takes his livestock to the pastures every morning for their nourishment. Then, after caring for them for several months, he takes them to be sold. But this phase is complicated due to transportation issues. Because he does not own his own vehicle, he must work within the schedules and prices that are offered to him. He also sporadically ventures into agriculture, but he does not do this full-time because he believes that times have changed considerably and it is no longer a satisfactory occupation.

Khairullo’s two children are his reason for continuing his efforts as a livestock breeder and farmer. Currently he needs a loan of 3,500 somoni to expand his business. Your support can help improve the quality of life for Khairullo and his family and help their business grow and prosper. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing of calves to expand the business

loans.name: Vanesa Rosario

texts.es:
La señora VANESA ROSARIO R. T. tiene 25 años, vive en el distrito deL PORVENIR, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad – Perú. Pertenece al Banco Comunal LIDERESAS EN ACCION. 
La socia presenta estudios hasta 6to. de Primaria y refiere que por falta de recursos económicos dejò de estudiar para empezar a trabajar; es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo quien depende economicamente de ella y se encuentra embarazada de 5 meses.
Vanesa  se dedica a  la venta de menús en su casa. 
Èste es su primer crèdito de 300.00 nuevos soles que utilizarà para copmprar arroz, azùcar, aceite, fideos, papas , mesas y bancos.
Ella sueña con ampliar cada vez màs su negocio y empezar con la venta de cenas por las noches.
texts.en:
Vanesa Rosario R. T. is 25. She lives in the Porvenir district, Trujillo province, in the department of La Libertad, Peru. She is a member of the "Lideresas en Acción" Community Bank. Vanesa completed 6th grade but had to leave school and start work due to economic difficulties. She lives with her partner and has one child; she is five months pregnant. Vanesa sells cooked meals from her home. This is her first loan, for $125, and she will use it to buy rice, sugar, oil, noodles and potatoes, as well as tables and benches. She dreams of steadily expanding her business and beginning to serve dinners in the evening.

Translated from Spanish by John Rynne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy rice, sugar, oil, noodles, potatoes, and tables and benches.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es: Elizabeth (48) comparte su vida con Mauro (55), viven felices en su casa propia al lado de sus hijas Elizabeth (23) y Janeth (22).Desde hace 12 años se dedica  a la venta de golosinas en su triciclo, el que compró con mucho esfuerzo para poder trabajar con mayor comodidad, le gusta el  trabajo ya que obtiene buenas ganancias y así puede colaborar en la  economía familiar, además la relaja mucho y puede interactuar con muchas  personas. El horario que sale a vender es  desde las 8 de la mañana hasta el mediodía ,luego se da un tiempo para el almuerzo y de ahí vuelve a salir con su triciclo a las 3 de la tarde para permanecer hasta las 8 de la noche; aunque  algunas veces le resulta cansado con el paso de los años ya se ha acostumbrado  al horario, y se siente contenta con el negocio  pero siempre piensa en el futuro de su familia es por eso  que tiene planeado aperturar una tienda estable en el futuro, ya que le sobran las ganas de salir adelante.Es su tercer crédito con MFP, promete ser  puntual y responsable en cada uno de los pagos como siempre.Con el dinero del préstamo comprará mayor cantidad de golosinas para surtir su triciclo y así aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Elizabeth (48) shares her life with Mauro (55). They live happily in their own home with their daughters Elizabeth (23) and Janeth (22). Twelve years ago, she started selling sweets in her food cart, which she bought with effort in order to make her rounds easier. She loves to work and makes a good profit, which goes to supporting her family. Work also relaxes her and she gets to interact with lots of people. She goes out in her food cart at 8 a.m., comes back for lunch at noon, then goes out again from 3 p.m. to 8 p.m. Although sometimes she finds herself tired after so many years, she has gotten used to the schedule. She does think about her family's well being, however, so she is planning on opening a store in the future, as she has a great willingness to prosper. In this third loan with Kiva partner MFP, Elizabeth promises to be timely and responsible with each of her payments, as always. With the money, she will buy more sweets and candy to stock her cart and improve her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Violeta Rubiani, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying products to increase her sales

loans.name: Rona

texts.en:
Rona J. is from the village of Catarman, Camiguin Province. She is thirty-three years old. Rona is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Rona owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. Rona has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Rona joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rona is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan Rona has taken out from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Sokha

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokha M. is a 31-year-old farmer who lives in Kouk Roka village, Takeo province. She owns a 4 hectare field to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. Leit Hang, is a cow middleman who earns a small income to improve his family's living conditions. Mrs. Sokha M. has four children: one is a laborer for a private company, two others are students at the local school, while the other is too young for school.

In her farming, Mrs. Sokha M. now faces some problems because her field has infertile soil and there is not enough water to support the rice field. She needs 2,000,000 riels from AMK to buy fertilizer, pesticide and fuel to support her rice field.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticide and fuel to support a rice field

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña Maria ha sido una mujer muy trabajadora, y madre de familia, de once hijos, todos mayores,  tiene 65 años de edad, y aun sigue cosiendo sus costura que aprendió desde su juventud y ha sido su fuente de ingreso para apoyar a su familia, su esposo es comerciante tiene una pequeña pulpería al lado de casa y ha sido quien aporto el dinero para iniciar su trabajo, así como junto lograron hacer su casa. Y han ayudado a sus hijos. Lleva treinta años en el trabajo de la costura, y ha captado muchos clientes, ya que hace diferentes trabajo como vestidos, trajes formales, sabana, fundas, entre otro trabajo, venta de cosmético  de la Avon. Que se venden por ser buenos y accesibles. Con este préstamo  quiere comprar telas variadas, hilos, Ciper, botones. Para poder hacer sus costuras y encargos de uniforme, pero también va  a comprar uniformes escolares hecho ya que esta muy retrasada con los encargo por que no pudo ingresar ante la solicitud y los estudiante ya entraron al colegio. Todos sus créditos lo ah  invertido en su negocio de venta de cosméticos como en su costura. Todo gracias a los financiamientos que Afodenic ha otorgado
texts.en:
Doña Maria is 65 years old and a hardworking woman and mother of eleven adult children. She learned how to sew as a young girl and turned this skill into a source of income to support her family. Her husband is a merchant who manages a small grocery store next to their house. The money he earned enabled her to start her business, and together, they have been able to make a home for themselves.

Maria has been sewing for a living for thirty years and has attracted many customers because of the different items that she produces such as suits, formal dresses, bed sheets, pillowcases, and other articles. In addition, she sells Avon cosmetics. Her sales have been good and this job is very accessible.

With this loan, she will buy different fabrics, threads, zippers, and buttons for making dresses and fulfilling orders for uniforms. She will also buy ready-made school uniforms because she got behind on her orders because she did not have the money to complete them before the students returned to school. All of her previous loans have been invested in her cosmetics and sewing businesses. She thanks AFODENIC for providing this financing.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fabrics, threads, zippers, and buttons

loans.name: Peninah

texts.en:
Peninah is 32 years old. She is married and has two children, one of whom is in school. She has been running a posho mill for four years. She earns extra income as an employee in the industrial area. 

She is a member of Faulu Kenya and has learned how to save her money. She describes herself as hardworking and hopes to expand her business and earn more income from it. She has requested a loan of 20,000 KES to add to her stock of maize.

[Editor's Note: Posho is a porridge-like food made from maize or cassava flour. A posho mill is a machine that grinds the corn or cassava into flour, so it can be made into posho.]

loans.use: To buy more maize

loans.name: Tohir

texts.ru: Махмадзиёев Тохир проживает в районе Яван. Возраст, 36 лет. Женат, имеет 4 детей. Жена, работает в дехканском хозяйстве. Сам Тохир занимается строительными работами по найму. Кроме того занимется растениеводством. Он в основном выращивает оващи и вывозит на рынок. Этим видом деятельности занимается уже 8 лет. Кредит берет для закупа минеральных удобрений.
texts.en:
Tohir M. lives in the Yavan district. He is 36 years old, married and has 4 children. His wife works at a dekhan farm. Tohir does construction work for-hire. Besides this work, he is involved in agriculture. He primarily grows vegetables and brings them to the market. Tohir has been involved in this business for 8 years now. He is requesting the loan for the purchase of mineral fertilizers.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Jarlie

texts.en:
Jarlie S. is a simple and industrious woman who spends her life loving and caring for her husband and two children, ages two and seven. She happily handles her career being a wife, mother and businesswoman. She started her own business when she joined ASHI in 2008 and received a loan. 

Her desire to give her children a better kind of life in the future inspired her to have her own business and augment her husband’s sporadic income as a hired laborer. First, she started selling vegetables and in her next loans, she started hog fattening and a “sari-sari” (variety) store.  To market her products, she sells them directly to people in their village and in a public market. 

Now, Jarlie is requesting another loan from ASHI to support her businesses and to grow them further until such time that they become profitable and stable. For her store, she wants to increase its inventory for the convenience of her customers who live around their village.

loans.use: To expand store inventory

loans.name: Osvaldo

texts.es:
El señor Osvaldo D. González de 48 años de edad es comerciante conocido en la zona, se dedica a la venta de varias mercaderías (productos de limpieza, productos de consumo, productos frigoríficos).
Empezó hace mas de 5 años trabajando por cuenta propia y con la ayuda de su señora lograron adaptarse al trabajo.
Su negocio muy concurrido y nos comenta que el negocio con un poco esfuerzo deja buena ganancia y mantiene muy bien todos los gastos de la familia.
Solicita dicho préstamo a Fundación Paraguaya para la  compra articulos de limpieza, escobas, repasadores, golosinas, embutidos, y otras mercaderías que se encuentran en oferta(mercaderías que por promoción se encuentran con los precios muy bajos).
texts.en:
Mr. Osvaldo D. González is 48 years old; he is well-known as a businessman in the district. He sells cleaning supplies, food staples and refrigerated foods, as well as other types of merchandise. He started the business more than five years ago and with the help of his wife it has gone well. The business attracts a lot of people and he states that with dedication he has been able to obtain good profits and cover his family’s expenses more than adequately. He has asked for a loan from Fundación Paraguaya to buy cleaning supplies, brooms, dishcloths, candy, sausages and other types of merchandise that he buys when he finds it on special offer.

Translated from Spanish by Montserrat Zuckerman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy brooms (straw and metal), dishcloths, detergents and other cleaning supplies, as well as candy, sausages and other products.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es: Yolanda tiene 48 años, ella vive al lado de sus hijos Sayra de 27 años, Jorge de 22 años y Nayeli de 08 años. Todos ellos viven juntos en su casa propia. Hace más de 3 meses se dedica a vender Golosinas, actividad que le ayuda a disponer de su tiempo para atender a su última hija que esta en edad escolar y que aún necesita de su apoyo. es por ello que este negocio, es la actividad perfecta para trabajar y dedicarse a  su familia, e esa manera su día de trabajo empieza con la labores del hogar durante las mañanas y por la s tardes sale a ofrecer su mercadería de forma ambulatoria, situándose algunas veces en el mercado de su zona y otras visitando a sus vecinas ofreciendo sus ricas golosinas. Ella se siente contenta con su trabajo y espera poder continuar así hasta que pueda tener su propia tienda de abarrotes. Este es su primer crédito con MFP y se compromete a ser muy puntual con todos los pagos, ya que para él, la responsabilidad es lo primero. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará más mercadería en dulces, galletas para que pueda aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Yolanda is 48 years old. She lives with her children, Sayra (27), Jorge (22) and Nayeli (8). They all live together in their own house. For three months Yolanda has sold sweets, a job which has allowed her to have time to take care of her youngest child, who is still school-age and needs her support. This business is perfect both for working and for taking care of her family. Her work day begins with housework in the mornings, and in the afternoons she goes out to offer her merchandise as a traveling saleswoman, sometimes setting up at the market in her area and sometimes visiting her neighbors to offer them her delicious sweets. She is happy with her work and hopes to continue it until she can have her own grocery store. This is Yolanda's first loan from MFP, and she promises to be very punctual with the payments, since responsibility is most important for her. With the loan, she will buy more candies and cookies so she can increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cookies and candies to stock her sales stand

loans.name: Amigas Inseparables Group

texts.es:
El banco de emprendimiento  AMIGAS INSEPARABLES   conformado por 12 integrantes, 4 varones y 8 mujeres, los cuales los socios viven en el km6, en los siguientes barrios: B/ 31 de marzo, B/ fabril, B/  bajo Beni,  todos los socios cuentan con negocio como ser; venta de ropa, costurera, venta de hamburguesa, venta de cosméticos, las capacitaciones fueron de 4 días en la cual todas las socias asistieron, y de acuerdo a su historial crediticio ninguna socia esta sobre endeudada 

Este banco de emprendimiento esta formado por una mesa directiva que fue elegida por votación  

PRESIDENTA: Sra. María, nació en santa cruz el 18 de mayo de 1961, cuenta con el negocio de la venta de carteras hace 4 años en el km6, tiene 2 hijos lo cual convive con el Sr. Jorge García el dinero del crédito lo utilizara en la compra de mercadería al por mayor y así incrementar su capital de trabajo.

TESORERA: Sra. Marisol, nació en santa cruz  el 23/01/1986, cuenta con la venta de ropa hace 3 años  en santa cruz, la Sra. Marisol  es soltera y no tiene hijos, vive en el km6 hace 21 años y el dinero del crédito será para el incremento de capital de trabajo.

SECRETARIO: Sr. Juan Carlos, nacido en la paz el 26 de junio de 1982, el es chofer propietario hace 5 años, tiene 2 hijos y convive con la Sra. Gabriela vive en el km6 hace 3 años.

El banco de emprendimiento AMIGAS INSEPARABLES están  muy agradecidos con emprender por haberles brindado nuevamente su apoyo.
texts.en:
The Amigas Inseparables (Inseparable Friends) enterprise bank is made up of 12 members, 4 men and 8 women, all of the partners live in Km6 in the following neighborhoods: 31 de marzo, Fabril and Bajo Benji. All the partners have their own businesses such as: clothing sales, tailor, hamburger sales and cosmetics sales. All the partners attended 4 days of training and according to their credit history none of them is over-indebted. This enterprise bank has an elected board of directors: President: María, born in Santa Cruz May 18th 1961, has had a purse sales business for 4 years in Km6, has 2 children and lives with Jorge García. She will use the loan money to purchase goods at wholesale in order to increase her working capital. Treasurer: Marisol, born in Santa Cruz Jan 23, 1986, has had a clothing sales business for 3 years in Santa Cruz. Marisol is single with no children, and has lived in Km6 for 21 years. She will use the loan to increase her working capital. Secretary: Juan Carlos, born in La Paz June 26 1982. He has been a driver-owner for 5 years, has 2 children and has lived with Gabriela in Km6 for the last 3 years. The Amigas Inseparables enterprise bank is deeply grateful to Emprender for having once again offered its support.

Translated from Spanish by Solson Scherman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase Working Capital

loans.name: Ounn's Group

texts.en: Mr. Ounn C. is 48 years old and was selected as the leader of a group loan of four members, located in Angk Khleu village, Kandal province. Each member of this group loan will use it to support their different purposes. Mr. Ounn C. and his wife, Mrs. Thy Noeun, are farmers who own 1.30 hectares of land to cultivate rice and water melons. For this farm, Mr. Ounn C. decided to ask for a loan to purchase a water machine to support his crops. Aside from farmers, they also own a rice mill machine. This couple has four children; one is a carpenter (table, chairs, etc.), and the other three are students and also support their parent's businesses.

loans.use: To purchase a water machine

loans.name: Benson

texts.en:
Benson N. is a mixed farmer from Kisii town in western Kenya. He is 41 years old and married with 5 children between the ages of 10 and 22. All the children are currently attending school.

Benson has been farming for 20 years, producing beans, maize, millet and milk which he sells to the local market. He also earns income from his tailoring shop in Kisii town. His major challenge in farming has been insufficient water for his dairy cows, lack of timely veterinary services and natural calamities like long dry seasons which makes it difficult to get animal feeds.

He recently completed his previous loan from Juhudi Kilimo for 30,000KES and has requested this loan of 50,000KES to purchase and insure a dairy cow. Through this loan, he will be able to provide enough milk for the family and use the extra income to educate his children.

He hopes to acquire atleast 3 quality dairy cows in the next 5 years.

He regrets for not taking advantage of the projects with Juhudi Kilimo earlier.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Nelson Yovany

texts.es:
el señor Nelson Yovany C. Argueta tiene 37 años de edad, esta casado y tiene 2 hijos, su esposa se dedica a atender la casa, el viaja todos los dias en bus a El Salvador para  vender sus productos y asi poder traer el sustento diario a su familia, Nelson vende relojes, lentes, extenciones electricas, antenas para tvs, radios, baterias para focos de mano, etc.
 
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de mercaderia.
 
vive en casa de su mama con su esposa y sus dos hijos.
 
su deseo es hacer su propia casa.
texts.en:
Nelson Yovany C. Argueta is 37 years old, married, and has 2 children. His wife takes care of the house, and he travels each day on a bus to El Salvador to sell his products, since this is the way that he supports his family. Nelson sells watches, sunglasses, electrical extension cords, TV and radio antennas, flashlight batteries, etc. He will use this loan to buy merchandise. He lives in his mother's house with his wife and their 2 children. His wish is to build his own home.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy watches, toothpaste, sunglasses, electrical extension cords, TV and radio antennas, and flashlight batteries

loans.name: Galina

texts.en:
Galina is divorced with one child. She sells children's clothing at several villages in the area of Styi town. Galina has been in this business for 14 years. Her monthly income is about 6,000 UAH.

Galina would like to borrow 6,500 UAH to increase the assortment of her inventories. She hopes to receive additional income and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To increase the assortment of clothing

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita S. is a married woman who lives in Barangay Basak, Lapu-Lapu City, Cebu. She earns her living by operating 4 business ventures:  a Sari-Sari Store, Food Vending, Electronic Re-Loading and a Water Vending business. Her husband, Ricardo S., who is shown in the accompanying picture, is 34 years old. He helps his wife in running the businesses. They have no children. 

Nenita joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2008 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 7 cycle loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Nenita has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 20000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 50,000, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 8th cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 29500, which she intends to use to purchase more stocks to sell in her various businesses. Nenita S. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To buy more inventory to sell.

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en:
Aminata is married and has 4 children. Aminata sells plastic products and cosmetics at the central market in Makeni city. She has 7 years experience in this type of business. Aminata is dedicated and determined to succeed in business. She opens her business at 7 am and closes it by 7 pm.

Aminata was initially financed by her husband. She has a good loan repayment history. Aminata needs a loan of 4,000,000 SLL to buy additional plastic footwear. She hopes to help her husband finish their house that is presently under construction and educate her kids. She thanks you for supporting her.

loans.use: To buy plastic footwear for her stall.

loans.name: Hem

texts.en: Hem S. is 30 years old and has been selling fresh fish in the local market for more than two years. She sells fish that she buys in bulk from her wholesale supplier and other fishermen. Hem S. is married to Shorn Kimsean, 28, who owns a shop where he provides a glass decorating service. This couple has three children who attend school and help their parents with their work when they are free from studying. Their small family house is getting old and frequently needs repairs. Hem S. has been planning to build a new house to live in, but her savings are insufficient to start construction. Therefore, Hem S. decided to seek a loan to be used to start building a new house.

loans.use: To start building a new house.

loans.name: Maria Angelica

texts.es:
María tiene 24 años de edad, reside en la Ciudad de San Miguel junto a su hijo de 7 años de edad, ella posee casa propia y es comerciante de ropa desde hace 5 años, ella comenzó trabajando como empleada de un negocio de ropa y luego inicio como propietaria de su propio local.
Ella solita un préstamo pues quiere invertir en los estilos y la moda del momento para atraer más clientes,  ella desea comprar blusas, short, pantalones que son las prendas que más se venden; con este préstamo ella comprara por mayor cantidad con la oportunidad de conseguir mejores precios.
Ella desea crecer y establecer un buen número de clientes, aumentar su comercialización y mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de su hijo.
texts.en:
María is 24 years old, and she lives in the city of San Miguel with her seven year old son.  She has her own house.  She has been selling clothes for five years.  She started working as an employee of a clothing business.  Later, she started as the owner of her own place.

She is requesting a loan to buy the current styles and the fashions in order to attract more customers.  She wants to buy blouses, shorts, and pants.  These are the garments that are sold the most.  With this loan she will buy in larger quantities, which gives her the opportunity to get better prices.

She wants to grow and to establish a good number of customers.  She also wants to increase her sales and improve the living conditions for herself and her son.

loans.use: Buy clothes

loans.name: Sulma Morena

texts.es: Sulma Morena H. D. F. D. 47 años D. edad, resiD. en el departamento D. La Libertad, en donD. vive junto a su esposo quien trabaja como agricultor, y junto a dos hijos, quienes se dedican a estudiar y ayudarle a su padre con el trabajo en sus tiempos libres. DesD. hace 10 años que Sulma se dedica a la crianza D. pollos y así mismo a la comercialización D. estos y D. gallinas, ella cuida estos animales en pequeñas incubadoras, las cuales son hechas D. forma artesanal, lo que le ha permitido salir adelante con su negocio. Ella solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar todos los insumos necesarios para mejorar las condiciones D. su granja, comprando más concentrado para aves, así mismo comprar todos los medicamentos necesarios para una mejor crianza D. los pollos y D. esta manera ofrecer un mejor producto. Sulma depenD. en gran manera D. este trabajo, ya que es por medio D. este como le da todo el apoyo necesario a su esposo con el hogar.
texts.en:
Sulma Morena H. D. F. is 47 years old and lives in the department of La Libertad with her husband, who works as a farmer, and two children, who are students and help their father with his work during their free time. For the past 10 years, Sulma has been raising and selling chicks, as well as selling hens. She cares for the animals in small handmaD. incubators, which has allowed her to be successful with her business.

She is requesting a loan so that she can purchase all of the supplies needed to improve the conditions of her farm. She will buy poultry feed concentrate, as well as all of the necessary medicines to better raise the chickens and have a better product to sell. Sulma depends greatly upon this work because it is how she provides all of the necessary support to her husband for their home.

loans.use: To purchase vitamins and feed for chicks and chickens.

loans.name: Filomena Magdalena

texts.es: La Sra. Filomena Vive en la ciudad de  la paz, en la zona de Tembladerani la casa donde vive es del Papa que todavía vive, la cliente es separada con su esposo hace ya 8 años. Cuenta con dos hijos a su cargo que actualmente están estudiando,  lleva con esta actividad 27 años y cuentan con toda la documentación respectiva como especialista en la preparación de comida rápida. El crédito será destinado para la compra de un kiosco en Villa Fátima donde pondrá una vendedora parea mejorar sus ingresos. Es una cliente bastante dinámica y responsable  además de incrementar sus conocimientos pasando diferentes cursos en cuanto a pastelería, comida rápida se refiere, la cliente esta muy agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Filomena lives in the city of La Paz, in the Tembladerani region. She lives with her father in a house that belongs to him. She has been separated from her husband for 8 years now. She has two children in her care and they are in school. She has had her business for 27 years and she has all the official training to work as a fast food cook. The loan will be used to purchase a kiosk in Villa Fatima. She will hire a salesperson to manage the stand and improve her income. She is a dynamic and responsible person. She has attended various cooking courses to expand her knowledge, including: pastry chef and fast food cook. She is very grateful for the support she is granted.

loans.use: To purchase a kiosk for her business.

loans.name: Estrellas De Tilapa Group

texts.es: Esta  foto fue tomada En la Panadería  de la Sra. Belen F A  es integrante del grupo  “Estrellas de tilapa” que esta ubicado en la localidad de San José  tilapa,  Puebla  en México. En la foto se ve el pan de muerto típico de la temporada que ella elabora  con mucho empeño y  dedicación. La panadería es el   negocio que inicio hace 20 años .Solicita  el préstamo para la compra de materias primas.  Sus clientes  prefieren comprarle por que su pan es elaborado artesanalmente (hecho a mano) no como el resto de las otras panaderías, él pan de Doña “BELEN” es considerado de los  mejores  de la región. En este momento se siente contenta por este nuevo préstamo. Tiene 43 años de edad, estudio hasta la secundaria, es casada y tuvo dos hijos  que ya son casados y que ya no viven con ella. Espera vender su pan en más localidades así como abrir otro expendio en un futuro no muy lejano.El grupo esta conformado por 9 integrantes.
texts.en: This photo was taken in Belen's bakery.  She is a member of the “Estrellas de Tilapa” (Stars of Tilapa) group which is located in the town of San José Tilapa, Puebla, Mexico.  In this photo you can see the 'pan de muerto' (bread of the dead) which is traditional for this season and which Belen makes with a lot of effort and dedication.  She started her bakery business 20 years ago.  She is requesting this loan to buy ingredients.  Her customers prefer to buy their bread from her because it is hand made unlike that sold in other bakeries.  Doña Belen's bread is considered some of the best in the region.  She is currently feeling happy with this new loan.  She is 43 years old, studied at secondary level, is married and has two children who are already married and no longer live with her.  She hopes to sell her bread in more places and hopes to open another store in the not-so-distant future.  The group has 9 members altogether.

loans.use: To buy ingredients

loans.name: Familia Group

texts.es:
El Banomunal Familia inicia su quinto ciclo con 11 socias, Teresa es la Presidenta del Banco Comunal Familia, tiene 49 años, es casada y tiene 4 hijos.
Teresa tiene una tienda D. abarrotes, venD. todo tipo D. producto D. primera necesitdad. Teresa inició su negocio debido al flujo D. carros para la salida Vía Los Libertadores, que es la carretera D. salida D. Ayacucho hacia Lima, empezó vendiendo caña y coca, poco a poco comenzó a surtir su tienda, ahora venD. abarrotes en general como: arroz, azúcar, fideos, aceite, detergente, jabones, papel higiénico, aguas gaseosas, aguas D. meza, entre otros y frutas.
El crédito que solicita lo invertirá en la compra D. panteones, leche, chocolate, ahora que se viene la campaña naviD.ña.
A Teresa le gustan las reuniones D. su bancomunal, las capacitaciones que recibe D. su promotora le han eneseñado a ahorrar y le ayudan mucho en su vida diaria. el sueño D. Teresa es que su negocio siga creciendo.
texts.en:
The “Banomunal” Family has begun their fifth cycle of loans with eleven members in their group. Teresa is the president of the Family Community Bank. She is 49 years old, married and has four children.
Teresa has a grocery store. She sells all types of basic food products. She started this business at the off ramp of “Los Libertadores” Street. This is the road that connects Ayacucho to Lima. She began her business by selling sugar cane and cocoa. Little by little she began to proviD. a greater variety of products. Now she sells general grocery items such as rice, sugar, noodles, oil, detergent, soap, toilet paper, sodas, bottled water and fruit.
The loan that she is asking for will be used to buy Christmas sweet breads, milk and chocolate as the Christmas season is approaching.
Teresa likes the meetings of the community bank. The training that she receives from the teacher has taught her how to save money and has helped her with her daily life. Teresa dreams that her business will continue growing.

loans.use: She will buy Christmas sweet bread, chocolate and coffee.

loans.name: Naisenke Salaash

texts.en:
For the last four years, Naisenke has been raising animals to sell in Naivasha town.  She is 23 years-old and married to Nkirimpa Ole Sitei. They have one child.

She was introduced to Kiva partner KADET by a friend and this will be her first loan.  She plans to use the loan amount to buy ten goats and fifteen sheep which she will raise and later sell for a profit.

In the future, she hopes to open a retail shop which will suppliment her livestock income.

loans.use: To buy goats and sheep.

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en:
Shirley is 38 years old and married. She resides in Antipolo, which is located in the Province of Rizal. She has a store in her house where she sells basic necessities and all types of products that people use in their homes. 

Shirley is requesting a loan so that she can have the funds needed to buy more food products and basic household necessities to sell. This will allow her to attract more customers and increase her sales. 

Her business is very important because it enables her to provide better financial stability for her family to live in a decent manner. She hopes to provide them with everything necessary to move forward against poverty. Shirley’s dreams of the best for her family are to have an expanded business and to have a happy family.  She has shown herself to be hard-working and strong-minded and able to make her dreams come true.
