She hopes that her business will continue to be more productive and improve her overall quality of living, rising out of poverty. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders across the world for sponsoring poor women like her who want to get ahead. She prays that they will be blessed.

loans.use: will pay for inventories of food products and basic household necessities.

loans.name: Minjin

texts.en: Minjin D. is 40 years old and lives with her husband and two sons in the Bayanhoshuu of Songinohairhan district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She and her family live together in a house and enclosure. Her older son is a college student and her younger son attends a secondary school. Her husband helps with her shoemaking business, which Minjin operates from her home. She has been engaged in this business since 1992 and has gained a lot of experience as a shoemaker. After many years of hard work and a loyal customer base, she has built a stable operation with many permanent customers at the local market. Minjin is requesting a 2,750,000 MNT loan in order to purchase materials and supplies to make a variety of traditional boots.

loans.use: to purchase materials and supplies

loans.name: Pheouk

texts.en:
Pheouk S., 53, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Siem Reap province, Cambodia, an area known for Angkorean temples. S. is a housewife, while one of her children is employed at a hotel, earning an income of about $5 per day to help cover the family expenses. Each month, the family has to spend $30 on food and $60 on the other necessary expenses. 

S. is requesting a loan of $800 to purchase a motorbike for family use. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her second loan from CREDIT, a long standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: buy a motorbike for family use

loans.name: Jerelyn

texts.en:
Jerelyn G. is from the village of Lopoc, Labson, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 32 years old and is single. Jerelyn operates a family member's business venture offering general services to the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 1,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Jerelyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to invest in expanding the business. Jerelyn is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will also be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be her 4th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to supplement her family's income. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita L. is from the village of Bannagao. She is 48 years old, married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Anita owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector planting and harvesting fruits and vegetables for sale. Anita has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2006, Anita joined Kiva partner, ASKI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Anita is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will also be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This loan will be her ninth from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
The Kiva borrower is a 54-year-old married man from Lebanon. He lives with his wife and two school-aged children. He has been running a clothing store since 1998. He has 20 years of experience in the same field. He always presents new collections to attract more customers to his shop. He cooperates with his wife who works as a tailor to satisfy the family needs. He has obtained his first Kiva loan and was a very good client with payments on time.

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1100 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to expand his store’s inventory and buy new clothing collections. He’s certain that the loan will help him diversify his merchandise selection. In the future, he is hoping to also sell shoes from his store. Currently, he mostly sells clothes.

loans.use: to expand his store’s inventory

loans.name: Jose

texts.en:
Jose D. is from the town of Rizal, Quirino, Isabela. He is 45 years old. Jose is married and has three school-aged children. 

To make a living, Jose raises crops, primarily rice, for sale. Jose has been engaged in his business for over 10 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month.

In 2007, Jose joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his business and living situation. Jose has successfully repaid a previous loan of 25,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. 

Jose is requesting a new loan of 23,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. This will be the seventh loan taken out by Jose from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand his business. 

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise

loans.name: Ana Karina

texts.es: LA SEÑORA  C. LABORA COMO  SECRETARIA EJECUTIVA, ES ACOMPAÑADA, TIENE  CINCO PERSONAS  A SU CARGO, ES EL PRIMER CREDITO CON CEPRODEL, LO NECESITA PARA PONER UNAS CUENTAS AL  DIAS DE  CONSUMO DE ENERGIA, AGUA,SERVICIOS BASICO SU VIIVENDA.
texts.en: Mrs. C. is employed as an Executive Secretary.  She has a spouse and five people are in her care.  This is her first loan with Ceprodel.  She needs it to pay her utility bills: electricity, water and basic home services.

loans.use: to pay her utility bills.

loans.name: Alymkul's Group

texts.en:
Alymkul K., 51, is the leader of this group. Just like many other residents of Kochkor,  Alymkul is engaged in agriculture. The entire family tries to help her out in finding better and better techniques for ploughing, watering and cultivating land. Her husband has been a member of a local farming community for a long time. He is a skilled technician and always knows how to use the right technology for the right kind of product. 

The family raises agricultural products starting from grains and berries, but also rare kinds of vegetables. Several years ago Alymkul managed to save a small amount to purchase electrical appliances for the house. The initial capital, invested nineteen years ago, was not in vain, since nowadays a monthly income from wholesaling vegetables reaches 5,000 soms.

 Alymkul says the equipment needed for field work is getting exhausted and is out of order, therefore she gathered this group and applied for a loan from Kiva. The requested loan will be spent on fuels and lubricants and food processing. 

         --- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
								
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase fuel and lubricants and do food processing.

loans.name: Rosa Elva

texts.es:
Rosa, reside en San Rafael Oriente, departamento de San Miguel, se dedica a la venta de medicina, vive con su mama, una hermana. Ella inicio el negocio por la necesidad de tener una fuente de ingreso, la realiza de forma ambulante y no tiene un horario establecido.
Ella comprara mercadería para surtir el negocio y salir a ofrecer a los clientes, para esto solicita un préstamo y comprar pastillas, frascos e inyecciones, ya que en  los clientes le solicitan los medicamentos de diferentes formas.
Su aspiración es ser una vendedora mayorista y proveer para su familia lo necesario para subsistir.
texts.en:
Rosa lives in West San Rafael within the San Miguel department.  She sells medicines, lives with her mother and one of her sisters.  She began her business out of necessity for having a source of income.  She sells on foot and does not have a fixed schedule.

She buys her merchandise to stock the business and then offers it to her customers.  She is asking for this loan to buy pills, jars, and injections, since her customers ask for their medicines in different forms.

She aspires to increase her sales and provide the necessities to her family.

loans.use: to stock her business

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en: Teresita, 46 years of age, is married and has two adult-aged children. She has operated her retail store in their village for almost three years and she earns approximately PHP 8,000. She wanted to request a loan from Kiva lenders of PHP 30,000 to purchase grocery items to sell in her retail store. She is determined and patient to improve her business to supplement the needs of her family. Her profit will be used as additional working capital for her business.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items to sell in her retail store

loans.name: Firat

texts.en:
Firat is a single, 25 year-old man.  He has an elementary school education. He lives with his parents and sister and he breeds cattle for a living.  Firat has been in this business for six years. He gets up very early every day to milk the cows and sells dairy in the Bilasuvar bazaar. 

Last year, he had a good economic income. Now Firat wants to get married and that is why he needs to expand his business.  He is going to use his 1100 AZN loan to purchase three cows.  In the future, Firat hopes to buy a bigger farm to support his growing family.

loans.use: to buy three cows

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann has been operating a healthcare center in a busy market for the last 12 years. Her primary business challenge is a shortage of electrical power. Ann plans to use the loan to buy more medicines for her patients at the heathcare center. She is a single mother with a daughter aged 13. 

This is Ann’s first loan with SMEP. In the future, Ann hopes to open a big hospital and several clinics in the surrounding area. 

Ann is highly dedicated to her work.

loans.use: to buy more medicines for her patients at the heathcare center

loans.name: Ricardina

texts.es: Ricardina nació en la ciudad de Cusco (Perú) y tiene 56 años de edad. Actualmente, Ricardina vive en la misma ciudad donde nació. Ricardina se dedica a la venta de comida de forma ambulatoria en el mercado de Huancaro de la ciudad del Cusco. Ya son 10 años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. En esta oportunidad  Ricardina requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como por ejemplo arroz, azúcar, fideos y otras cosas más. La socia es una persona responsable y trabajadora que por esas cualidades sus compañeras le invitaron a participar del banco comunal la “Chaska Ñawi” de la Asociación Arariwa.
texts.en:
Ricardina was born in the city of Cusco (Peru) and is 56 years old.  She currently lives in the city in which she was born.  Her business is selling food as an itinerant street vendor in Huancaro market, in the city of Cusco.  She has been in this business for ten years and she is doing very well thanks to the effort that she puts into her work.

On this occasion, Ricardina needs a loan to buy supplies such as rice, sugar, noodles, etc.  She is a responsible and hard-working person and, because of these personal qualities, her friends invited her to join Asociación Arariwa's “Chaska Ñawi” community bank.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as rice, sugar, noodles and other products

loans.name: Salam

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 37 years old, married and has one child.

Salam has had a food market since 2007, selling soft drinks, juices, cheese and dairy products. He has a deep understanding of local consumer needs. His store is situated in a crowded area so there are a good number of customers passing by. 
  
He is requesting a $2,000 loan to buy a generator and a refrigerator and to purchase additional foodstuffs. He is aiming to gain more profits so he can improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To buy a generator and refrigerator and to purchase additional foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Omar

texts.en:
Omar is a married man with four children; two attend school while two are underage. He lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past five years he has operated a photographing business, operating from door to door; his potentials customers are neighbours and passersby. He faces a major challenge in competition from other photographers. He dreams of expanding his business to cover a larger market area in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 Omar wants to purchase a digital camera. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase a digital camera.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is 35 years old. He is married to Jane, and together, they are blessed with two children who are school-going.

He owns a retail shop. He has been doing this business for the last 11 years and gets an income of 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) per month.

He is applying for his first loan of KES 40,000 from KADET LTD., with which he plans to purchase more stock of items like sugar, flour, breads and many others.

He will use the anticipated profit to expand his business and educate his children. He hopes to expand his business to be a wholesale instead of a retail shop. He is very hardworking.

loans.use: To purchase more stock of items like sugar, flour, bread and many others.

loans.name: Tobias

texts.en:
Tobias is 33 years old.  He is from Migori and is married, with two children.

Tobias runs a barber shop and has applied for his first loan from KADET LTD to enable him buy a shaving machine. The profits made from this business will be used for his family's needs.

He hopes to expand his business and open another barber shop in the future.

loans.use: To buy another shaving machine.

loans.name: Zoila Esperanza

texts.es: Zoila Esperanza D. 44 D. edad, habita en su propia casa con su querido esposo D. 55 años. Ella se dedica a la venta D. comida. El negocio lo tiene establecido en su hogar D. residencia y ya tiene 5 años D. dedicarse al mismo. Gracias a Dios y a sus esfuerzos el negocio es rentable y cada día los clientes solicitan sus deliciosos platos D. comida que ella elabora con mucho amor y dedicación. Ella trabaja duramente para lograr tener acceso a una mejor oportunidad D. vida ya que por el momento su situación no es del todo bien. Zoila es una mujer muy decidida por lo que a decidido solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para comprar la materia prima necesaria como: verduras, arroz, azúcar, carnes, pollo, frijoles, maíz, y D. mas productos que necesite para la elaboración D. sus deliciosos platillos. Tiene la fe puesta en Dios que logrará  resultados favorables D. esta decisión y podrá cumplir su sueño D. mejorar su calidad D. vida.
texts.en:
Zoila Esperanza is 44 years old.  She lives in her own home with her beloved husband, who is 55.  She works selling food.  Her business is located in her place of residence, and she has been working in her business for 5 years already.

Thanks to God and her efforts, the business is profitable, and each day customers are requesting her delicious plates of food, which she makes with much love and dedication.  She works hard to be able to get access to better life opportunities, as currently her situation is not all good.

Zoila is a very decisive women, which is why she decided to request a loan from INTEGRAL to buy the necessary raw ingredients such as: vegetables, rice, sugar, meat, chicken, beans, corn, and other products she needs to make her delicious dishes.  She has her faith fixed in God that she will achieve favorable results with this decision, and will be able to accomplish her dream of improving her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy the necessary raw ingredients, such as: vegetables, rice, sugar, meat, chicken, beans, corn, etc.

loans.name: Rocio

texts.es:
Roció nació en el departamento del Cusco al sur del Perú. Actualmente, Rocio tiene 34 años de edad, es casada y fruto de esta unión tiene tres hijos. 

Actualmente, Roció vive en la ciudad donde nació y donde desarrolla sus actividades, ella se dedica a la venta de artesanía como por ejemplo  chompas y mantas de alpaca. En esta oportunidad Roció requiere el préstamo para comprar lana de alpaca.

El Banco Comunal “Virgen de las Nieves” se reúne cada treinta en la ciudad del Cusco (Perú). Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial y por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y también porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Rocio was born in the Cusco Region in southern Peru.  She is now 34 years old, married, and has three children.

Rocio currently lives in the city where she was born and where she is developing her business.  She sells handicrafts, such as sweaters and blankets made of alpaca wool.  At the moment Rocio needs this loan to buy alpaca wool.

The Virgen de las Nieves Communal Bank meets every 30th in Cusco, Peru.  Cusco is known for being a very tourist-friendly, commercial area.  It is also known for its traditional Inti Raymi celebration and because one of the seven wonders of the world, Machu Picchu, is found here.

loans.use: to buy alpaca wool

loans.name: Mavchuda

texts.ru: Мавчуда жительница района Пяндж. Ей 42 года. Она вдова. У нее пятеро детей. Ее отец занимается торговлей. Сама Мавчуда занимается торговлей салатов. Этим видом деятельности она занимается 12 лет. Целью получения кредита является покупка продуктов для приготовления салатов.
texts.en: Mavchuda lives in the Pyandj district.  She is 42 years old, a widow and has five children.  Her father is involved in sales.  Mavchuda is involved in selling salads.  She has been in this business for 12 years.  The goal of this loan is to purchase products for preparing salads.

loans.use: to purchase products needed for preparing salads

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Ma. Rosie

texts.en:
Ma. Rosie is 42 years old and is married with two children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Ma. Rosie is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Ma. Rosie has been raising pigs for three years and also earns additional income from food vending and direct selling.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Merceline Neema

texts.en:
Merceline is a 37 year old married woman. She has 4 children with ages ranging from 8 years to 15 years. She describes herself to be visionary. She operates a a tailoring services business where she makes and sells clothes to the local people. She has been involved in this business for 3 years and employs 1 staff member. Her business is located in a shopping centre. She describes her biggest business challenges to be inflation and seasonality. 

She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to increase her stock of material. Her business goal is to expand it within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will put up rental units to make more income.

loans.use: To purchase more material

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 46 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 4 children.  Jocelyn has a shop that sells corn during harvest time & green bananas. She has had this business for 7 years. She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy fertilizers for bananas & corn fields.
Jocelyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2009.  In the future, Jocelyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for bananas & corn fields

loans.name: Prisca

texts.en:
Prisca is 26 years old and is married with two children. Her business is well, clean, and good. She sells various goods, such as cooking oil, water, bananas, sugar, etc. She has 2 years of experience in this business and employs one person to help her. Her business starts from 6am until 7pm every day except on Sunday.

Prisca has requested a loan from Kiva lender Vision Finance Company to purchase various goods, such as cooking oil, water, bananas, sugar, etc. to sell. With any profit from the loan, Prisca will expand her business to save for her future and to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To purcase various goods, such as cooking oil, water, bananas, sugar, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Martha Cecilia

texts.es: Martha de 40 años es una mujer muy trabajadora que conforma su familia con 6 hijos en las edades de 6 a 24 años y genera sus ingresos familiares de su negocio mediante el cual se dedica a la venta de refrescos y bebidas,  y productos de la canasta familiar. Cuando se inició en su aventura emprendedora, en San Jacinto, municipio donde aun vive en el departamento de Bolivar, lo hizo vendiendo dulcería en una chaza, o punto comercial informal,  al cual fue agregando, cervezas, gaseosas  y posteriormente aprovechando su clientela doméstica le fue adicionando arroz, azúcar, aceite, y café.  Su mayor fortaleza es el punto de venta, que  muy concurrido pues su ubicación  posee una afluencia natural de público y esto potencializa su crecimiento; en ello está trabajando para lograrlo, sin embargo su capital de trabajo le resulta insuficiente para lograrlo, esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo,  con el cual comprará víveres, cerveza y gaseosas, además de invertir en el acondicionamiento de su kiosco y darle una mejor presentación y ambiente confortable en función de sus clientes , principal objetivo de su quehacer..
texts.en:
Martha is 40 years old and is a hardworking woman with a family of six children between the ages of 24 and 6.  She generates her family income through her drink and grocery business.

When she began her entrepreneurial adventure in San Jacinto, located within the Bolvar province, she began by selling candy on the side, from a stall.  She later added beer and soft drinks.  Later, to take advantage of her customer demand, added rice, sugar, cooking oil, and coffee.

Her greatest strength is her point of sale, which is well visited, because its location provides a natural gathering for people and this will strengthen its growth.  She’s working to achieve this, however her working capital is not sufficient, so she’s asking for her first Kiva loan through “Fundación Mario Santo Domingo,” with which she will buy food, beer, and soft drinks.  She will also invest in maintaining her kiosk, giving it a better presentation and providing a more comfortable environment for her customers.  This is her main task.

loans.use: to buy inventory and maintain her kiosk.

loans.name: Abdelmouti

texts.en: AbdelMouti is a Palestinian young man, who is 33- year old, married and has two sons and one daughter. AbdelMouti is a Palestinian National Authority employee with a decent salary, he has a store for selling used home appliances such as: refrigerators, washing machines...etc, so he wants to improve his income by purchasing bulk of used home appliances, he wants to take a loan from FATEN to complete with the amount he has, so he will be able to purchase more home appliances and has better collection to resell and increase his income, so he can create to his family better living conditions. AbdelMouti is photographed in FATEN branch.

loans.use: To purchase bulk of used home appliances to resell.

loans.name: Kyako

texts.en: Kyako is a 26-year-old young man. He has no children yet. He describes himself as a social and talkative man. For the past three years, he has been selling slippers, shoes, and belts. In addition, he sells cows and goats. His business challenge is insufficient funds for improving his business. He hopes that by using the loan of KES 20,000, he will be able to boost the business by adding stock of slippers and shoes. Kyako's hope and dream for the future is to run a shop selling shoes made from bata manufacturing company.

loans.use: to increase his stock of shoes and slippers.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a hardworking married father of 6 children. He lives in his own house and has no other dependents. His goal for his family is to educate his children.

He is a crop farmer and has been farming for quite some time. He faces a challenge of seasonal variations which affects his crop yields and his dream is to venture into better methods of farming. Peter needs a loan to buy farm inputs (fertilizers, etc.)

loans.use: to buy farm inputs (fertilizers, etc.)

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 39 years old and lives in Malintuboan, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married with 2 children.

Rebecca works in the fishing industry and sells fish for a living. She has been doing this for 4 years. She has requested a loan of PHP 3000 to purchase more fish to sell.

Rebecca has been a member of PMPC for more than 1 year. In the future, Rebecca hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell by retail.

loans.name: Madoma Group

texts.es: Es un grupo formado por tres socias microempresarias una de ellas es Luz Marina quien vende comida todos los días en su casa, esta actividad la viene realizando desde hace 11 años, es casadas tiene dos hijos, y su esposo quien le ayuda en el negocio. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de materia prima como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, carne de res, carne de pollo, verduras etc. Mayra es diseñadora de trajes nocturnos y Hiondra tiene una tienda de variedades.
texts.en:
This group is formed of three micro-entrepreneurial members.  One of the women is Luz Marina, who sells food every day in her house.  She has been doing this for eleven years.  She is married and has two children, and her husband is the one who helps with her business.  

She will invest the loan in the purchase of raw materials, like rice, beans, sugar, oil, beef, chicken, vegetables, etc.  

Mayra is a designer of evening suits and costumes, and Hiondra has a variety store.

loans.use: to buy grains like rice, beans, sugar, oil, beef, chicken, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Laure

texts.fr: Laure âgée de 30 ans est mariée à un technicien du nom de Jonas. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et a leur charge. Laure vit avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la famille. Pour cette raison, depuis sept ans Laure prépare de la nourriture (riz, pâte de maïs accompagnés de diverses sauces) à son domicile. Cette activité lui génère des revenus l'aidant à subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants. Laure s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle, Laure pour une quatrième fois, sollicite un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les prets antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter des sacs de riz, de maïs et des condiments.

loans.name: Mahoutin Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MAHOUTIN  est composé de trois personnes qui sont des parents. C'est la troisième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Christine  est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Christine  a arrêté l’école au niveau primaire. Christine est âgée de 36 ans et vit au Bénin. Christine  est mariée à un revendeur du nom de Donatien. Le couple a six enfants, tous scolarisés et deux à leur charge. Les diverses charges de la famille sont supportées par le couple. Pour cette raison, Christine vend depuis quinze ans des produits de beauté, des mèches et des couches jetables. Christine s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle, Christine sollicite ensemble avec les membres du groupe MAHOUTIN pour une troisième fois, un crédit auprès d’ ALIDé.

loans.use: Acheter des produits de beauté, des mèches et des couches jetables.

loans.name: Martha Lilian

texts.en:
Martha is 64 years old and lives in the municipality of Puerto Berrio. Recently she become a widow and she’s the mother of 6 children, 4 men and 2 women, and even knowing that they all already are grown up, she feels responsible for them and looks out for them. She owns an hotel in her location that has been running for 20 years.

Now that her life has recovered from that sad lost, she wants to make her business better, she hopes she can improve her sales and get more new clients who visit her hotel. She’s asking for a loan so she can make some adjustments like paint the walls and change the doors. 

Martha dreams with changing her house, so it can look better and be more comfortable for her and her family. Help this woman to keep going and fighting in her life, to accomplish all her dreams, loan now.

loans.use: make some adjustments like paint the walls and change the doors

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Grace would like to add capital to her butchery business.

loans.name: Kimyu

texts.en:
Kimyu is married. She brings her goods from Khujand and Istaravshan which is about a 1-2 hours drive from her town. She makes this trip once a week.

Kimyu says that if she had more money she could have bought more goods on each trip and save time and money for the road.

She has been receiving loans starting 2003. Her first loan was $80. When she learned that she needs to form a group of entrepreneurs like herself for a solidarity group guarantee, she asked her friends from the same market to join her and they started receiving loans together. Since then, her business has developed dramatically. Now she sells not only female clothes, but added men's and children's clothes. Since Kimyu works in open-air market, she dreams of having her own shop. The next loan will be used for a trip to the wholesale market.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita I. sells cosmetics and perfume out of catalogs, representing the Avon, Zermat, and Yambal brands. Her customers pay her in two to six monthly installments. She lives in the Irpavi II neighborhood in La Paz. She has no fixed place of business but sells on order. She has a stable client base and finds new customers through referrals or through personal contact. This is her fourth loan from IMPRO. She is considered a first-class borrower meaning she has a good history of repayment. The loan will go to purchase merchandise like perfume, cosmetics and talc. She repaid her three previous loans promptly and this fact, along with her work experience, recommends her for this loan.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

Margarita I. es promotora de perfumes y cosméticos; ella ofrece sus productos mediante revistas y trabaja con las líneas de perfumes de AVON, ZERMAT, y YAMBAL. Sus clientes le cancelan en cuotas de dos a seis pagos mensuales. Vive en la zona de Irpavi II; ella no cuenta con un puesto fijo ya que las ventas que realiza son a pedido. Ella tiene un buen numero de clientes estables y siempre consigue nuevos clientes vía referencias o contactos personales. Es la cuarta vez que solicita un crédito. Su historial en nuestra institución la califica como cliente 1, es decir con cumplimiento Bueno en el pago de su obligación. El monto solicitado será destinado para la compra de mercadería (perfumes, cosméticos, talcos, etc.). Sus tres créditos anteriores fueron pagados puntualmente. Su trabajo y antecedentes crediticios con Impro le permiten acceder a este crédito ya que tiene experiencia en su negocio.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics for resale.

loans.name: Gbédézouhoin

texts.fr:
Gbédézouhoin K. is 44 years old and the mother of six. In addition, she cares for her aged parents. Her husband, a farmer, does not carry his share of the household responsibilites so, as the family breadwinner, Gbédézouhoin goes to market each day to sell her wares. She frequently has to turn to loan sharks to restock, a costly practice. In order to care for her family she is asking for a loan of $700 to purchase manioc with which to make the flour she sells in markets around the capital Lomé. She hopes in assuming this credit to free herself from the reach of loansharks so she can see the fruit of her labors.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

Agée de 44 ans, Madame K. Gbédézouhoin est mère de six (6) enfants et à charge ses parents devenus inactifs. Son mari cultivateur n’assume presque pas ses responsabilités vis-à-vis de sa famille. Devenue « chef » de cette famille, elle se débat chaque jour, allant de marché en marché afin d’écouler ses produits. Le peu de bénéfices dégagés rentre directement dans les dépenses du foyer l’obligeant à recourir souvent aux usuriers avant de s’approvisionner de nouveau. Ruinée par cette pratique et soucieuse de l’avenir de ses enfants, elle sollicite un crédit de $700 destiner à acheter des manioc et les transformer en gari destiné à la vente dans les marchés environnants et à Lomé la capital. Le financement dudit projet va sauver Madame K. Gbédézouhoin de la gueule des usuriers et lui permettra d’accroître ses revenus.

loans.use: To buy manioc to make flour.

loans.name: Chimnaz

texts.en: Chimnaz is 46 years old and lives in Khudat town, in the Khachmaz region. She is a mother of two children. Four years ago she started a business reselling clothes. She is now requesting a loan of $825 to buy clothes.

loans.use: To buy clothes for resale

loans.name: Ni Luh Wiryawati

texts.id:
Luh Wiryawati has a husband whose name is I Made Nama Yasa who works as a building laborer. As a laborer income is not constant, since he only get paid when work was there, and no income if no work. However live continues, and needs daily cost. To help her husband, Wiryawati decides to start pig farming, since this business could be done while taking care of children and house. With an initial capital of Rp 1,000,000 (about US$105) Wiryawati bought 1 mother pig that she raised for 6 months. After 6 months, the mother pig gave birth to 6 piglets; after raising these piglets for another 2 months, those piglets were sold at Rp250,000 (about US$26)/piglet. Profit was used to pay for schooling expenses for her 2 children who are still in Grade school, and also to cover family needs. Now with capital help from Dinari, Wiryawati could add the mother pig, and fattening piglets. With the hope that expected profit could increase family well being.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Luh Wiryawati memiliki suami yang bernama I Made Nama Yasa yang bekerja sebagai buruh bangunan. Sebagai buruh, pendapatan penghasilan tak tentu setiap harinya karena jika suaminya mendapatkan pekerjaan baru mendapatkan uang tetapi jika tidak, maka tidak mendapatkan uang. Sedangkan hidup harus terus berjalan dan membutuhkan biaya setiap hari. Untuk membantu suaminya Wiryawati memutuskan untuk memilih usaha beternak babi karena usaha ini bisa dijalankan sambil menggurus rumah dan juga mengurus anak –anaknya. Dengan modal awal Rp. 1.000.000 Wiryawati membeli 1 induk babi dan dipelihara selama 6 bulan. Setelah 6 bulan dipelihara induk babi mempunyai anak 6 ekor, setelah dipelihara selama 2 bulan anak babinya laku terjual dengan harga perekor Rp.250.000.- Keuntungannya dipakai untuk membiayai pendidikan kedua anaknya yang masih duduk dibangku SD dan juga untuk memenuhi kebutuhan keluarganya. Sekarang dengan bantuan modal usaha yang didapat dari Dinari Wiryawati dapat membeli tambahan jumlah induk dan juga bibit penggemukan. Dengan harapan keuntungan yang diperoleh meningkat demi kesejahteraan keluarga mereka.

loans.use:
To buy pig feedstock & feed

Membeli bibit babi dan pakan

loans.name: Faga

texts.en: Faga is a married mother of 7 from the village of Vaipuna. She operates a sewing business, and she has recently joined SPBD’s loan program in order to receive financial assistance for her business. She spends most of her time in her sewing room, and she hopes that she can make more money to support her family and to help with her children’s school fees.

loans.use: To buy sewing supplies

loans.name: Nuria

texts.es:
Señora Nuria is a member of the community bank called 'Cesar Vallejo', which is located in Calleria, Ucayali. She's 37 years old and has 3 children who still depend on her financially. She's married and her husband is a teacher. With her first loan that she received from Manuela Ramos, she decided to purchase a motor-tricycle taxi.

She has hired someone to drive the motor-tricycle taxi. She gets up about 6:00 am to prepare breakfast for her family, and then she gets the motor-tricycle ready for the driver. She splits the money she makes with her driver.

With this loan, which she will repay within 5 months, she will pay to renew her 'tags', pay for insurance, pay for her driver's permit, etc.

Nuria tells us that she has always found ways to move ahead in life even against all odds. She's very proud of herself and of her accomplishments. She's very thankful to Manuela Ramos for her support.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Nuria pertenece al banco comunal Cesar Vallejo, ubicado en Jr. Padre Abad 199, distrito de Calleria, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 37 años, es madre de 3 hijos, todos aún dependen de ella, es casada y su esposo es profesor. Con el primer préstamo de S/. 300, que recibió de Manuela Ramos decide invertir en la compra de un motocarro. En la actualidad cuenta con un motocarro, el cual lo maneja un chofer. Se levanta a las 6 a.m. para preparar el desayuno de su esposo y el de sus hijos y luego le entrega al chofer el motocarro para que salga a trabajar y así le pueda entregar la cuota diaria que le corresponde. Con el préstamo de S/. 1,200, el cual pagará en 5 meses, invertirá en el pago del derecho de placa de su motocarro, en la compra del SOAT para su motocarro, en la tarjeta de conducir, etc. Nuria manifiesta que siempre supo salir adelante entre viento y marea y está orgullosa de si misma y de ver que todo le esta yendo bien. También está muy agradecida con Manuela Ramos el gran apoyo que le brinda.

loans.use: To renew her tags, pay for insurance and for a driver's permit

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase material and sewing accessories for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Mrs. C. decided to start her business because of the support she received from this micro business. It helped her to be able to make the decision to start with a loan of three hundred dollars, which has multiplied to this day. This has helped her to have a solid base over the administration of the business. She has been running for 6 years in the same place and this helps her to be a able to proviD. her son with an education, and her other with his bachelor degree. Her efforts go towards giving them a better life. The solicitation of funds with go towards helping her business and will continue to contribute the its growth. We hope she will receive what is necessary to keep surviving

Translated from Spanish by James Lombardo, Kiva volunteer

La Sra C. decidió iniciar su negocio a raíz D. unas capacitaciones que recibió D. microempresa esto le ayudo a poder tomar la decicion D. emprender el negocio inicio con un capital D. trecientos dolares los cuales a multiplicado hasta la fecha las capacitaciones le ayudaron a tener una base solida sobre la administración del negocio y como atender al cliente, su negocio tiene seis años D. tenerlo en el mismo lugar esto le a ayudado para poder darle el estudio universitario a un hijo y poder ayudar a su otro hijo a que se supere actualmente esta cursando un bachillerato,sus esfuerzos van encaminados a darle una vida mejor a ellos. La solicitante reconoce que los financiamientos le ayudaron en sus inicios y siguen contribuyendo a que su negocio crezca y que le D. lo necesario para seguir sobreviviendo.

loans.use: She will invest in corn since they are in season and cheap.  This is done to be able to have the product in times when it is not readily available.

loans.name: Abdukodir

texts.ru:
Abdukodir M. lives in the town of Yavan. He is 56, married, and has children. He is in the business of agriculture. He owes a piece of land that he plants with seeds of wheat and potatoes. He sells his crops at a local market. He has been in this business for the past 20 years. For this new season, Abdukodir needs seeds and fertilizers, which he cannot afford due to his difficult financial position. For this reason, he decided to apply for a loan. He is planning to pay off his credit in 6 months.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer.

Мирзомуродов Абдукодир житель города Яван. Женат и имеет 56 детей. Занимается растениеводством. Имеет землю , которую засеивает пшеницей и картофелем. Урожай продает на сельском рынке. Занимается этим видом бизнеса уже 20 лет. Для засева в новом сезоне Абдукодиру необходимо купить семена и удобрения , а в связи с тяжелым финансовым положением он не может это сделать. Поэтому он решил получить кредит, который поможет сделать это ему. Погасить кредит он сможет в течении 6 месяцев

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Solat

texts.en:
Mrs. Solat S. and her husband Mr. Sam-At Kong were married in 1979. They have six children; three sons and three daughters. Two of their children are married and live outside the family home. The other four farm with their parents. The family is about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Solat and her husband have been farming since they were married. They plant bananas, flowers, and other crops, which they sell at the market in Phnom Penh. Mrs. Solat is now requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase fertilizer, seeds, pesticides, and to pay the fee for plowing.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer, seeds, pesticides, and to pay the plowing fee.

loans.name: Carmen Rosa

texts.en:
Carmen Rosa belongs to the María Milagrosa Village Bank and lives in Villa María del Triunfo in Lima.

Carmen lives with her husband and has a 9-year-old daughter. She started bringing lunches and menus to her husband’s work but this job was temporary because she didn’t have enough capital to make it every day. She has been owning her restaurant in her father’s house for 6 months, selling not only menus but also ice cream and fizzy drinks. She wants to grow her business and be prepared for this.

That’s why she aims to study, to set up a poulterer’s and to build the second floor of her house.

Carmen Rosa is soliciting a 400 soles loan so that she can purchase supplies such as rice, sugar, and oil, ingredients she uses every day.

loans.use: Carmen Rosa is soliciting a 400 soles loan so that she can purchase supplies such as rice, sugar, and oil, ingredients she uses every day.

loans.name: Essi

texts.fr:
Mrs. Essi K. was born in 1982. She is married and the mother of two children. She has proven her drive with her participation in managing the family expenses. A good manager and a master of her business, she is asking for a loan that will serve to finance an expansion of her corn field. With this, she will be able to increase her revenues in order to further contribute in the improvement of her family’s living conditions.

Translated from French by Lucia Franzese, Kiva volunteer.

Madame K. Essi est née en 1982, mariée, est mère de deux (2) enfants. Elle fait preuve de son dynamisme par sa participation dans les charges du foyer. Bonne gestionnaire et maîtrisant bien son activité, elle sollicite un financement qui va lui permettre d’agrandir son champ de maïs. Par ceci, elle pourra augmenter ses revenus afin de contribuer davantage dans l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: Expansion of corn field

loans.name: Celina Dalila

texts.es:
Celina is 22 years old and lives with her husband and their 9 year old son. After completing a program in cosmetology, she set up a small salon in her home. She runs the business every day, offering all kinds of hair cuts, color treatments, make up, etc. Her prices are fair and she offers good quality. The salon is now 2 years old thanks to a lot of hard work. This motivates Celina to work even harder and she likes her business, but her expenses are also growing as the business grows. Now there are new regulations from the city to file different papers. She is requesting the loan to purchase necessary items for her salon like a new hair dryer, as well as pay the necessary fees to the city so that she can operate her business

Celina tiene 32 años, vive con su esposo y su hijo de 9 años. Luego de prepararse en un centro de educación ocupacional en la especialidad de cosmetología, ella decidió instalar su fuente de ingreso en su casa, es así, que tiene su propio salón de belleza, donde atiende todos los días, durante todo el día, ofrece todo tipo de cortes de cabello, tintes, maquillaje, etc. sus precios son módicos y su trabajo de calidad.El salón de Celina ya ha cumplido 2 años de intensa labor, esto le anima a seguir adelante ya que le gusta mucho lo que hace, además cada vez tiene mejores ingresos, ahora está en los todos los trámites de regulación y permisos municipales para tener todos sus papeles en regla. Celina solicita este préstamo porque con ello implementará su salón, podrá adquirir una nueva secadora de cabello y culminar el pago para el permiso municipal.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO PURCHASE A NEW HAIR DRYER FOR HER SALON, AS WELL AS PAY THE NEW FEES IMPOSED BY THE CITY TO RUN HER BUSINESS.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es: Nelly, a sus 21 años es propietaria de un pequeño taller de  fabricación de muebles, viene forjando este negocio con su esposo, con quien hace poco tiempo decidió unirse, con muchas ilusiones de formar un hogar donde reine el amor y tranquilidad.Esta joven  pareja se complementan también en el trabajo, mientras él se dedica a la fabricación de variedad y hermosos muebles,  Nelly se encarga de captar los pedidos y distribuir los productos finales.Con el dinero que solicita Nelly, desean implementarse con todas las herramientas de trabajo para su pequeño taller, con esa perspectiva se esfuerzan diligentemente poniendo en cada uno de sus  trabajos su mejor esfuerzo, creatividad y un buen servicio.
texts.en:
At 21 years of age, Nelly is the owner of a small furniture making shop. She established this business with her husband who she recently decided to join in marriage. They have dreams of building a home where love and tranquility reign. This young couple also compliment themselves in their work. While her husband dedicates himself to manufacturing the beautiful furniture, Nelly is in charge of receiving orders and distributing the finished products. With the loan that Nelly is requesting, they want to furnish their shop with all the necessary tools. With this in mind, they work diligently putting their best efforts, creativity and service in each of their jobs.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase necessary tools for furniture making shop.

loans.name: Yeredon (To Know Oneself) Group

texts.fr:
Yeredon est un regroupement de cinq (5) femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 50 ans et 3 enfants vivant dans des grandes familles traditionnelles élargies au quartier Banconi de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali). Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de collaboration au niveau du marché où elles opèrent toutes. Elles font généralement l’achat et la vente du bois de bois de chauffe, des jus de  boissons en poudre, des condiments alimentaires et des  tissus.
Le groupe est à son 6ème prêt solidaire (prêt du groupe). Tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.
Avec ce prêt, les membres du groupe comptent acheter, 10 paquets de jus de boissons en poudre, 6 chargements de charrette en  bois de chauffe, 30 mètres  de tissus et un important stock de condiments alimentaires (aubergine, oignons, gombo, etc.). Elles achètent les marchandises au marché de Sikasso auprès  des grossistes.Quant au bois de chauffe, il est acheté auprès des paysans ayant une autorisation de vente de bois. Les produits ainsi acheteés sont revendus à domicile et au marché du quartier de Médine où elles ont chacune, une place et une grande table sur laquelle elles étalent leurs marchandises.
Avec une clientèle  composée généralement de femmes, les membres du groupe Yeredon effectuent leurs ventes en détail, au comptant et à crédit.         
Elles espèrent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen de 20.000 FCFA par mois qui sera utiliser pour subvenir aux besoins de la famille et investir le reste dans les activités.
texts.en:
Yeredon is a group of five married women who, on average, are 50 years old and have 3 children. They live in large extended traditional families in the Banconi neighborhood in Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They met each others through neighboring ties and collaborations in the market where they all work. They typically buy and sell firewood, powdered drinks, condiments and fabrics. The group is seeking its sixth solidarity loan (group loan). All previous loans were repaid without problems. With this new loan, the women intend to buy 10 packs of powered drinks, 6 cartloads of firewood, 30 meters of fabric and a large quantity of condiments (eggplants, onions, okra, etc). They purchase goods from wholesalers in the market of Sikasso. Firewood gets purchased from farmers having an authorization to sell wood. The products are then resold at home and in the market of the Médine quarter where each woman has an emplacement with a table to display their wares. Having a mostly female clientele, the members of the Yeredon group retail their goods for cash and on credit. They hope to turn a monthly profit of XOF 20'000 (ca US$ 40) on average, to be used to provide for their families, and to invest the remainder in their businesses.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy powdered drinks, firewood, condiments, and fabrics

loans.name: Gavhar

texts.en:
Gavhar A.  is 52 years old is married and the mother of 5 older children. Only theyoungest child remains unmarried. Gavhar’s husband is retired and receives a pension so Gavhar's business is the main source of income for the family. After receiving proper training, Gavhar opened her business embroidering and selling national skull caps for men and women. She has been working really hard at building this business for the past 10 years.

Gavhar is dreaming of arranging the marriage of her younger son. With this purpose in mind, Gavhar has plans to expand her business and is requesting 2000 Somoni ($600 USD) for the term of 12 months. Gavhar is planning to use the loan to purchase fabrics for embroidering the national skull-cap. Gavhar had shown herself as a reliable client as this is her third loan from IMON. Your support will really help her.

loans.use: Purchase of fabrics for embroidering the national skull-cap.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen K. is an entrepreneur Tanzanian woman. She runs a business selling charcoal and selling traditional clothes, known as batik, to customers. She has been in the business for three years now. She purchases the charcoal bags wholesale direct from producers and transports direct to her store where she sells to customers.

Helen needs a loan of TZS 600,000 (USD$500) to buy more charcoal bags.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Erico

texts.es:
El señor Erico tiene 41 años, está casado y tiene 2 hijos, su actividad diaria es la de vender chipas, pan, galletas, pan dulce, etc. en su local propio y en algunas oportunidades en forma ambulante, la elaboración de la misma se encarga su esposa con la ayuda de su hija, quién en forma paciente produce una buena cantidad de estos productos .
En el oficio esta dedicado desde hace mas de 20 años y es muy conocido en la zona porque su calidad de persona y por las delicias de sus chipas y pan caseros.
Con los préstamos que obtuvo de la Fundación Paraguaya, lo invirtió en la compra de materia prima para la elaboración de chipas y panes, tales como almidón, queso, aceite vegetal, leñas, harinas, levaduras, entre otros productos, esto le permitió tener una buena cantidad de producción lo que hace que los costos de producción bajen y por ende le genera la posibilidad de bajar el precio de venta de sus producto sin descuidar su utilidad.
texts.en:
Mr. Erico is 41 years old, and is married. He has two children. Erico sells chipas, bread, cookies, sweetbread, etc. from his home and also sometimes as a street vendor. Erico's wife and daughter patiently bake these foods in large quantities. Erico has been working in this business for 20 years, and he's well known in the area for his good character and his delicious chipas and bread. Erico has invested past loans from Fundación Paraguaya in prime materials to make chipas and breads, such as starch, cheese, vegetable oil, firewood, flour, and yeast, among others. This has allowed him to produce in large quantities and thereby lower the costs of production. He is then able to lower the price of his products without decreasing his profits.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise such as cheese, eggs, milk, starch, vegetable oil, flour, yeast, etc.

loans.name: Jamilya

texts.ru: Турдиева Джамиля проживает в городе Турсун-Заде. Работает в городской поликлинике-медсестрой. Возраст 39 лет, разведена и имеет двоих детей. Имеет участок земли . где сеет пшеницу. Для этого вида деятельности и запрашивает кредит, который нужен для покупки семян. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Jamilya T. lives in Tursunzade. She is 39 years old, divorced and has two children. She is a nurse at a municipal polyclinic, and she owns a plot of land where she grows wheat. She would like to get a loan for buying seeds. She plans to pay it off within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to puchase seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Jamila

texts.en:
For the last 10 years, Jamila has made a living selling clothes in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar. She currently earns an average monthly profit of $125 and works at her business for 14 hours a day. Jamila is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more clothes to sell to her customers. She is hoping that this loan will allow her to increase her profits and expand her business.  

Jamila is 31 years old, married and has three children who are 11, 6 and 3 years old.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Phalla

texts.en:
Mrs. Phalla H., 35, and her husband, Mr. Poeun Dong, 39, live in a small village off of National Road No. 2, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1991 and have one son and three daughters. Two of their children attend school and the other two are still young.

Phalla has been a garment factory worker for one year. Mr. Poeun Daung has been a mason for over twenty years, a skill he learned from his brother. He works in and around his village. Phalla is requesting her first loan of $1,000, which will purchase a motorcycle for her husband drive to work, allow them to dig a water well, and pay for the building of an additional roof at the back of their house.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for transportation, to fund the digging of a water well, and to allow for the building of a roof for the house.

loans.name: Dora Luz,

texts.es:
Dora es una de los clientes más responsables y antiguas de su grupo de microcrédito. Ella estudiaba la carrera técnica de cosmetología y también de docencia en educación primaria, no obstante, sus estudios se vieron truncos a raíz de que tuvo a sus hijos, que hoy en día ya tiene dieciocho y once años.   

Con la idea de apoyar en los gatos del hogar y darle una mejor educación a sus hijos decidió dedicarse a trabajar. Por un tiempo estuvo trabajando para otra persona en una tienda de abarrotes, Luego decidió comprar su propio puesto en el mercado. Es así que desde hace siete años, vende abarrotes, pero además, también genera ingresos extras con la venta de productos de belleza por catálogo.

Más adelante, ella quisiera retomar sus estudios para poder ser una mejor empresaria y agrandar sus negocios.
texts.en:
Dora is one of the most responsible and oldest members of her microfinancing group. She studied cosmetology and also elementary education. Nevertheless her studies ended when she had children, who today are 18 and 11 years old. With the idea of supporting the household expenses and provide a better education to her children, she decided to work. For some time she worked for another person in a grocery store. Then she decided to buy her own stand in the market. So for 7 years she has been selling groceries and in addition she generated extra income by selling beauty products via catalog. In the future she would like to return to her studies to be a better businesswoman and expand her businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy school supplies and uniform for her younger child

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
Emilia is a hard-working wife and mother hoping for a better way of living. She is 46 years old and married to Reynaldo. They live in the mountainous place of Jones, Isabela. Their children are: Hamly, 25 years old; Reylie, 20 years old; and Reyginald, 10 years old, who is in grade school.

To help her husband provide for the needs of their family, Emilia uses her skills doing manicures and pedicures for her own business. She provides home service to her neighbors and friends, and she earns a daily income of 150 PHP. This amount is the budget for their immediate needs at home.

Emilia requests a loan for $125 (5,000 PHP). She plans to use the loan to purchase supplies for her business, such as nail polish, nippers, and so on. If God permits, she also plans to allot half of the amount to start a hog-raising business for extra income. She hopes that lenders will support her financially in the business.

loans.use: Purchase supplies for manicure business

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Gloria N. M. works as a merchant selling an assortment of goods such as eggs and Pampers at Elmina which she has done since 1997.  Gloria N. has received Vocational School education.  She is a widow and has 4 children.  She is responsible for paying her children’s school fees and also her family’s bills. Her loan will be used to purchase eggs in crates and other goods to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save and build a house.

loans.use: purchase eggs in crates and other goods to sell

loans.name: Mamarachab

texts.ru: Мамарачаб - мужчина средних лет 1968 года рождения. Женат и имеет 5-х детей. Занимается продажей горюче-смазочных материалов около своего дома. Он продает бензин, солярку для заправки и масло для смазки. Он закупает товар у оптовиков и продает попутным машинам, так как его дом находится близко к трассе. Мамарачаб кредитуется в нашей организации уже 2 года. За этот период он успешно закончил 4 займа. Он очень благодарен кредитной организации за эту поддержку.
texts.en:
Mamarachab is a middle-aged man who was born in 1968. He is married and has five children. Mamarachab sells fuel and lubricants near his home. He sells gasoline, diesel fuel, and oil. He purchases goods from the wholesalers and sells to passing cars, since his house is located near the highway. Mamarachab has been a loan customer with MicroInvest for two years. In that time, he has successfully repaid four loans. He is very grateful to the loan institution for this support.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sale of fuel and lubricants

loans.name: Vuthy

texts.en:
Mr. Vuthy S., 37, and his wife, Mrs. Chansipheach Nao, 39, live along National Road Number One to the Cambodia/Vietnam border, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. They were married in 1992 and have three children: two sons and one daughter. The eldest son attends school and the other two are still too young.

Vuthy’s wife sells pickled cucumbers and papayas. She buys cucumbers and papayas from her village to make pickle and sells it in her village and in front of a garment factory.

Vuthy has been a security guard for one month. His old motorcycle doesn’t work properly and he very often spends a lot of money repairing it. So, he is applying for his first loan of $700 to purchase a motorcycle to replace the old one.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike to replace the old one

loans.name: Rozik

texts.ru: Розик Зардаков проживает в городе Куляб. Возраст 52 года. Женат, имеет 4 детей. Розик более 4 лет занимается торговлей. Он имеет торговую точку на рынке, где торгует посудой. До этого он работал педагогом. Клиент просит кредит, для увеличения товараоборота.
texts.en:
Rozik Z. lives in the city Kulob. He is 52 years old, married and has 4 children. Rozik has been involved in sales for over 4 years. He has a retail store at the market, where he sells dishware. Previously, he worked as a teacher. Our client is requesting this loan in order to increase goods turnover.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing goods turnover

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Expand stock

loans.name: Leoraria

texts.es:
Leoraria es socia del Banco Comunal Buena Suerte.
Leoraria es soltera, tiene 37 años y 2 hijos, Leoraria tiene un restaurante en un local alquilado ubicado al frente del mercado 12 de abril, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de su hija, además Leoraria viaja a las diferentes ferias de la región en donde compra cereales.
Leoraria necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de mesas y sillas.
Los sueños de Leoraria son tener un negocio en la ciudad de Lima y tener local propio.
texts.en:
Leoraria is a member of the village bank "Buena Suerte" (Good Luck).

Leoraria is single, 37 years old, and has two children. Leoraria has a restaurant in a rented place in the front of the 12th of April market. She runs this restaurant with her daughter. Also Leoraria travels to different markets in the region to buy grains.

Leoraria needs a loan of 1000 soles to put towards buying tables and chairs

Leoraria's dreams are to have a business in the city of Lima and to have her own place.

Translated from Spanish by Cathy Coffman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying tables and chairs

loans.name: Tundaan

texts.en:
Tundaan M. is from the village of Puntian in Quezon in the Bukidnon Province. She is 37 years old and married with 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Tundaan sells home products and furniture to tourists and local community members. Tundaan has been engaged in her business for over 9 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

Tundaan joined HSPFI in 2007 to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Tundaan has successfully repaid a previous HSPFI loan of 20,000 PHP which was used to expand her product offering. Now Tundaan requests her 5th new loan, for 23,000 PHP, to further expand the business.

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: To expand her business.

loans.name: Koffivi

texts.fr: D. Koffivi est homme de 36 ans marié et père de 2 enfants. Il habite à kpalimé. Avec ce prêt, il veut acheter du ciment pour la construction d’une maison qu’il va louer plus tard.  Il voudrait mettre ses frais de location de coté, pour que dans l’avenir ses enfants puisse aller à l’université de lomé.
texts.en:
Koffivi D. is 36 years old, married and the father of two children. He lives in Kpalimé. He will use this loan to buy cement for the construction of a house that he will rent out. He wants to save the income from the rent, so that in future his children can study at the University in Lomé.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cement for the construction of a house

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth owns a small retail shop called JB Shop in Thika, just outside Nairobi. She has requested a loan of KES 80,000 in order to buy additional stock of food items. Her shop is located along a major highway, and business has been doing well. Elizabeth also owns several rental homes which allow her to bring in additional income. She hopes to one day own a supermarket. Elizabeth is a mother to a 3-year old boy and describes herself as loving and hard-working.

loans.use: Increase stock in her shop.

loans.name: Youness

texts.en: Youness is a 24-year-old single man living with his parents. After graduating from the university in 2007, he decided to open his own business in computer programmer. Today, Youness is requesting to borrow $1,200 to renovate his shop in order to attract more clients and increase his income.

loans.use: to renovate his shop

loans.name: Margret

texts.en: Margret is 45 years old and married with four children. She sells frozen foods like chicken, turkey, beef and fish. She is a hard working woman and she opens her stall daily to enable her to meet the demands of her customers. She hopes for a loan of N150,000 to purchase more frozen foods to sell. This is the high season for the sales of frozen foods and she hopes to meet the demands of her customers. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more frozen foods to sell

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary E. is married and has four children. She has no educational background. Since 2006, Mary has sold food supplies such as tomatoes, pepper, and garden eggs at Elmina near Atoaba. Her husband is a driver. Mary uses her income to help pay school fees and utility bills.

Mary will use the loan to purchase more food supplies for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Mary plans to save money for reinvestment purposes.

loans.use: To purchase more food supplies for sale.

loans.name: Juana

texts.en:
Juana F. is 48 years old and is married to Roberto Lopez who is 52 years old. They have three children who are all currently studying.

Juana is a street vendor. She began her business in 2000. Her husband helps her in her business, and together they have built up a large and loyal clientele.

Juana’s dream is to buy a van so that she can sell a greater variety of products and cover a bigger area and market.

She is applying for a loan to buy more merchandise to increase her stock and satisfy the demands of her customers.

loans.use: Buy additional merchandise.

loans.name: Clara

texts.es:
Clara R. es una socia trabajadora y dinámica, vive en el distrito D. Callerìa, región D. Ucayali; tiene 45 años, madre D. 2 hijos mayores D. edad.
Clara se dedica a la venta D. zapatos y sàbanas; cuenta con el apoyo D. su esposo el que trabaja en un aserradero. 
Clara forma parte del Banco Comunal “Juntas hasta el fin” desD. hace tres años. 
El primer préstamo que recibió fuè D. 300.00 nuevos soles que utilizò en la compra D. productos para la venta D. comida. 
Ahora necesita un préstamo D. 1,000.00 nuevos soles, una parte será para invertirlo en zapatos, y la otra parte en madera para el arreglo D. su casa. 
La meta D. Clara es tener un restaurant con variedad en platos para sus clientes.
texts.en:
Clara R. is one of our hardworking and dynamic members. She lives in the District of Callerìa, Ucayali region. She is 45 years old and the mother of 2 adult children. Clara sells shoes and bed sheets. She has the support of her husband, who works in a sawmill. Three years ago, she joined the Communal Bank “Juntas hasta el Fin” (Together until the End). The first loan she received was in the amount of 300 soles and was used to buy ingredients for selling prepared meals. She is now requesting a loan of 1000 soles. Part of the loan will be used to buy shoes. The remainder will be used to buy wood for remodeling her house. Clara’s goal is to have a restaurant where she can offer a variety of dishes to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase shoes to sell & wood for remodeling her home

loans.name: Freddy Alberto

texts.es:
El Señor Freddy Alberto R. López, tiene la edad de 42 años, Labora como Responsable de Bodega en el Centro de Capacitación CECNA, el tiene Tres hijos a su cargo, todos están en edad escolar, esta Casado, ha trabajado créditos con  CEPRODEL durante Dos años, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido 2 créditos en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias a los financiamientos otorgados por CEPRODEL,  el es un cliente excelente.
 
El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción como: Zinc, perlines, etc. El que utilizara para la remodelación del Techo de la vivienda en la que habita, con el objetivo de darle mayor seguridad y mejores condición de vida a sus hijos y esposa.
texts.en:
Señor Freddy Alberto R. López is 42 years old. He works as a manager of a warehouse in the CECNA Training Center. He is married and has 3 children in his care; they are all school-aged. He has worked with CEPRODEL for two years; in this time he has taken 2 loans. Thanks to the financing granted by CEPRODEL he was able to make improvements to the house in which he lives. He is an excellent client. The loan requested will be used in purchasing construction materials such as zinc sheeting and metal structural supports to be used to remodel the roof of the house he inhabits, with the objective of giving it better security and providing a better quality of life for his children and his wife.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of construction materials

loans.name: Mrs. Phea Phai Village Bank Group

texts.en: Mrs. Phea P. is 32 years old and lives in Prey Pnhi village in Takeo province. She is a village bank president and this village bank consists of nine people. She is a farmer who owns a 0.60-hectare field used to cultivate rice. She and her husband, Mr. Kea Chan, are also silk weavers. Since this business is going well, Mrs. Phea P. would like to expand her business so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more silk to weave to meet her customers' demands. Mrs. Phea P. is the mother of two children. One of her children is a student in the local school and the other one is too young to study or work. All the members are shown in the picture but one member in the back is blocked.

loans.use: To buy more silk to weave

loans.name: Eleanor

texts.en:
Eleanor R., is making sure that her family has adequate provision for their daily needs. Married to Edmundo R., a construction painter, she is blessed with four children. She makes sure that she helps her husband earn so that their family can have a better life. She has been selling doormats and rags for several years.

Eleanor has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year now. She regularly attends the weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently.

Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, Eleanor was able to borrow six times in CCT’s cooperative. She is consistent in paying her dues because she used the money she borrowed to buy raw materials for her rag-making business. Her business lets her earn a profit of PHP 3,200 per month.

Now, with your help, Eleanor would like to obtain a PHP 8,000 loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital for her expanding business by buying raw materials needed for making doormats and rags.

Eleanor dreams that her children will be able to finish their studies someday.


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of fifteen to thirty community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To buy raw materials needed for making doormats and rags

loans.name: Divino Niño Jesus Group

texts.es:
El comité Mujeres Divino Niño Jesús del barrio San Juan de la ciudad de Luque, se formo gracias a que una de las integrantes se entero del programa del comité por una amiga suya y se acerco a la Fundación  informarse mejor para poder iniciar un nuevo comité en su barrio, actualmente el comité se encuentra en el sexto ciclo del programa Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras de la Fundación Paraguaya y esta conformado por 16 integrantes las cuales invierten en distintas actividades.
Las actividades que ellas realizan se detallan a continuación.

La señora Deborath A. se dedica a la venta de mercería e invirtió el dinero en la compra de mercaderías varias para el incremento de sus venta.

La señora Noelia G. se dedica a la venta de comestible e invirtió el dinero en la compra de insumos para la elaboración y venta de los mismos.

La señora Myrian R. es modista e invirtió el dinero en la compra de insumos tales como telas e hilos para la elaboración y venta de sus prendas.

María Elena V. se dedica a la venta de comestible e invirtió el dinero en la compra de insumos para la elaboración y venta de los mismos.

La señora Julia R. J. tiene un kiosko en su casa e invirtió el dinero en la compra de insumos para la elaboración de sus comestible y en golosinas y bebidas varias.

María Juana F. se dedica a la venta de comestible e invirtió el dinero en la compra de insumos para la elaboración y venta de los mismos.

La señora Limpia G. tiene un kiosko en su casa e invirtió el dinero en la compra de insumos para la elaboración de sus comestible y en golosinas y bebidas varias.

La señora Carmen M. tiene una despensa e invirtió el dinero en la compra de mercaderías al por mayor para el incremento de su negocio. 

La señora Gloria P. se dedica productos de limpieza e invirtió el dinero en la compra de químicos para la elaboración y venta de sus productos.

La señora Ildefonsa Díaz es modista e invirtió el dinero en la compra de insumos tales como telas e hilos para la elaboración y venta de sus prendas.

La señora Tania A. se dedica a la venta de helados e invirtió el dinero en la compra de helados de varios gustos para el incremento de su negocio.

María Ross Mary O. se dedica a la venta de comestible e invirtió el dinero en la compra de insumos para la elaboración y venta de los mismos.

María Rocio Díaz N. se dedica a la venta de comestible e invirtió el dinero en la compra de insumos para la elaboración y venta de los mismos.

La señora Margarita G. tiene una despensa e invirtió el dinero en la compra de mercaderías al por mayor para el incremento de su negocio. 

La señora Lorena S. se dedica a la venta de comestible e invirtió el dinero en la compra de insumos para la elaboración y venta de los mismos.

La señora Salvadora S. Díaz se dedica a la venta de comestible y bebidas e invirtió el dinero en la compra de insumos para la elaboración y venta de los mismos.
texts.en:
The committee, Women Divine Baby Jesus of the neighborhood San Juan of the city of Luque was formed thanks to one of the members who found out about the committee program by a friend of hers who went to the foundation (Kiva’s field partner) to be better informed and to form a new committee in her neighborhood. At present, the committee is in its sixth loan, the Committee of Enterprising Women of the Foundation of Paraguay is comprised of 16 members that invest in different activities.

The activities that they do are detailed in the below.

Mrs. Deborath A. sells haberdashery and invested the money to buy various merchandize to increase her sales.

Mrs. Noelia G. sells foodstuffs and invested the money to buy the raw materials to prepare and sell food.

Mrs. Myrian R. is a dressmaker and invested the money to buy products such as fabric and thread to make and sell her clothing.

María Elena V. sells foodstuff and invested the money to buy the raw materials to prepare and sell food.

Mrs. Julia R. J. has a kiosk in her home and invested the money to buy raw materials to prepare food and to buy candy and various drinks.

María Juana F. invested the money to buy the raw materials to prepare and sell food.

Mrs. Limpia G. has a kiosk in her home and invested the money to buy raw materials to prepare food and to buy candy and various drinks.
