Mrs. Carmen M. has a small store and invested the money to buy merchandize wholesale to increase her business.

Mrs. Gloria P. sells cleaning products and invested the money to buy chemicals to make and sell her products.

Mrs. Ildefonsa Díaz is a dressmaker and invested the money to buy products such as fabric and thread to make and sell her clothing.

Mrs. Tania A. sells ice-cream and invested the money to buy ice-cream in various flavors to increase her business.

Mrs. Ross Mary O. sells foodstuffs and invested the money to buy the raw materials to prepare and sell food.

Mrs. María Rocio Díaz N. sells foodstuffs and invested the money to buy the raw materials to prepare and sell food.

Mrs. Margarita G. has a small store and invested the money to buy the merchandize wholesale to increase her business earnings.

Mrs. Lorena S. sells foodstuffs and invested the money to buy the raw materials to prepare and sell food.

Mrs. Salvadora S. Díaz sells foodstuffs and beverages and invested the money to buy raw materials to make and sell the food.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandize such as: disks for empanadas, meats, condiments,  baked goods, vegetables, napkins, cloth and thread, sodas, beers, charcoal, rice, sugar, flour, herbal medicines, milk, chemicals to make cleaning product, ice-cream among other items.

loans.name: Samwel

texts.en:
Samwel is 49 years old. He is married to Margaret Nyambura and they have three children, all of whom are in college. He has operated his taxi in Naivasha town for the past five years.

Samwel was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his first loan. He plans to service his car and put a new coat of paint on it with proceeds from the loan.

He plans to start commercial farming in future.

loans.use: To service and repaint his taxi

loans.name: Nolvia

texts.es:
La señora Nolvia B. es Peluquera con mas de 14 años en el rubro  tiene 37  años de edad. Es madre soltera  de 2 hojos que actualmente se encuentran estudiando la secundaria vive    en la ciudad de Encarnación.
Es propietaria de una Peluquería  que atiende en su domicilio . El salón de belleza es atendida por ella misma, gracias, a las actividades que realizan han podido salir adelante e ir creciendo en sus micro-empresas,  además mediante esta y las otras que la familia realiza ellos pueden mantener su hogar, llevar una vida digna y solventar cualquier imprevisto que se le pudiera presentar.  

El destino del crédito es para realizar ampliación y mejora de su local.
texts.en:
Novia B. is a hair-stylist with more than fourteen years of experience in her field. She's thirty-seven, single and has two children currently in middle school. She lives in the city of Encarnación. Novia has a beauty salon in her house, which she runs herself. Thanks to the work they put in, they've been able to succeed and keep growing the small business. Between the salon and other family activities, they are able to maintain their home, live a decent life, and resolve any eventualities that might come up. Novia plans to use her loan to expand and improve her salon.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials to improve the shop, including brick, sand, and paint.

loans.name: Barno

texts.en: Problems and money shortages never defeated Barno, who has always looked for a way to get past obstacles and continue to improve her situation. She is an extremely hard-working and energetic woman. She is 43 years old, married, and the loving mother of four children. Barno started her own business because her husband’s salary was not enough for their family expenses. For more than fourteen years she has operated a store where she sells women’s shoes. Her store is well known and people love to visit it because it's clean, tidy, and run by someone who is very kind and thoughtful. Barno hopes that her store will keep growing so that she can maintain a comfortable life for her family, especially for her children. To make that possible, she has applied for a new loan that she will use to buy more shoes to sell. With this purpose in mind, Barno requests 8,000 Somoni. She promises to repay the loan on time and thanks everyone supporting her. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase new women's shoes in order to increase her range of goods

loans.name: Americo

texts.es:
El señor Américo Q. vive en casa de sus padres, en la zona de Llojeta, ubicado en las afueras de la ciudad de La Paz.
El señor Américo trabaja como chofer de transporte publico en la ciudad de La Paz, ingresos con los que se mantiene.
El crédito será para la conclusión de obra fina de una habitación que le cedieron sus padres en su vivienda.
Esta es la segunda vez que solicita préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado la califican favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Sr. Americo Q. lives in his parent's house in the Llojeta neighborhood on the outskirts of the city of La Paz. Sr. Americo works as a public bus driver in the city of La Paz and he makes enough to pay basic expenses. He will use the loan to finish a room in his parent's house. This is Sr. Americo's second loan and a socio-economic analysis indicates that he is a good candidate for a loan and should be granted one.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a room in parent's house.

loans.name: Luis

texts.es: El Sr. Luis junto con su esposa tienen un taller Mecanico , el se dedica al arreglo de motores de vehiculo y en ocaciones de Chaperio de Vehiculos tiene Operarios a su cargo a los que les pagan por porcentaje. El Sr. Luis no cuenta con deudas en ninguna otra institucion y necesita el credito para remodelar su taller ya que le han ofrecido un contrato con una empresa grande y eso le generara muchos mas clientes e ingresos a la vez.  El taller se encuentra ubicado en el 4ºanillo entre centenario y Roca y Coronado, el Sr. Luis es una persona muy trabajadora desde muy pequeño empezo como ayudante de un taller mecanico de ahi aprendio su oficio y le esta enseñando a su esposa ya que ella le ayuda en taller mecanico, con el dinero del credito quiere refaccionar su taller, para ampliarlo ya que con el contrato que le ofrecio esta Empresa tendra muchos clientes, y asi tener mas ingresos que mucha falta le hace, esta muy agradecido con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito..
texts.en:
Luis and his wife own an auto mechanic shop that repairs motor vehicles, and occasionally a full-service body shop is under his supervision for which they pay a percentage. Luis does not have debt at any other institution and needs the loan to remodel his auto mechanic shop. A large company has offered him a contract, and it will generate many more clients and revenue at the same time. The workshop is located on the 4th ring between Centenario and Roca and Coronado. Luis has been a very hardworking person since he was young. He started as an assistant in an auto mechanic shop where he learned his craft. He is now teaching his wife so that she can help him in the auto mechanic shop. With the loan, he wants to refurbish his shop and to expand it with the contract that has been offered by the large business. He will have many clients and thus have more revenue that he is lacking. He is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the trust provided in granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Carrie Ting, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Remodeling his auto repair shop

loans.name: Enita Lili

texts.es:
Enita de 45 años, vive en una zona urbana de Guayaquil, tiene tres hijos de 17, 14, 5 años que aun estudian, empezó a coser por la falta de dinero hace 17 años atrás después de tener su primer bebe, poco a poco fue incrementando su capital y pudo remplazar su maquina vieja con una nueva. 

Ahora trabaja desde muy temprano hasta que termine todos los pedidos del día, Enita cose ropa, borda y confecciona ropa. Con el préstamo quiere comprar telas y hilos para su taller de costura. 

En el futuro quiere una casa propia y tener hay mismo su taller de costura.
texts.en:
Enita is 45 years old. She lives in an urban area of Guayaquil. She has three children; 17, 14, and 5 years old. The children go to school. After having her first baby 17 years ago, she started to sew because she needed money. Little by little she was increasing her capital, and she was able to replace her old machine with a new one. Now she works from very early in the morning until she finishes the day’s orders. Enita sews clothes, embroiders, and makes clothes. With the loan she wants to buy fabric and thread for her seamstress shop. In the future she wants her own house and to have her seamstress shop in the house.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fabric and thread

loans.name: Celia

texts.es:
Celia es una madre de familia de 22 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y a su hijo en el distrito de Cayaltí, una zona agrícola que se encuentra ubicada a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo

Se dedica desde hace más de año y medio a la venta de comida en un puesto ambulante ubicado en el paradero de la línea de transporte Chiclayo – Oyotún (Oyotún es un distrito ubicado a media hora del distrito de Cayaltí). Allí ella ofrece todo tipo de alimentos a los choferes y transeúntes del lugar. El negocio es su principal fuente de ingreso, adicionalmente se dedica también a la crianza y venta de animales de corral.

Celia desea adquirir una mesa y utensilios de cocina para poder trabajar de una mejor manera, por ello ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles que le ayuden con el logro de su objetivo.

Celia es una joven que lucha diariamente y da lo mejor de sí para sacar adelante a su familia. Su mayor anhelo es tener un pequeño restaurante.
texts.en:
Celia is a 22-year old mother who lives with her husband and son in the Cayaltí district, an agricultural zone located one hour from the city of Chiclayo. For more than a year, she has dedicated herself to selling food from a stall located parallel to the Chiclayo - Oyotún transportation line (Oyotún is an area located a half-hour from Cayaltí). From there, she offers all types of food to the drivers and passengers in the area. The business is her primary source of income, however she also raises and sells farm animals. Celia would like to buy a table and kitchen utensils in order to better perform her work. This is the reason she has turned to Edpyme Alternative for her first loan of 500 Peruvian soles to achieve her objective. Celia is a young woman who fights each day to help get her family ahead. Her greatest wish is to one day have a small restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a table and utensils for her business.

loans.name: Muhabbatkhon

texts.en:
Y. Muhabbatkhon is 39 years old. She is married with two children. Muhabbatkhon is a market vendor. She sells dishes and plates in oriental style in the central local market. Muhabbatkhon has been in this business for 9 years already. Over these years the business turned into a successful one, allowing Muhabbatkhon to support her family and her husband’s parents. Since Muhabbatkhon's husband is currently unemployed, the business generates the main income for the family. 

Now Muhabbatkhon is planning to increase her stock and to purchase dishes and plates wholesale. With this purpose in mind, she requests 7000 Somoni. Muhabbatkhon thanks everyone supporting her and promises to repay the loan in a timely manner. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing dishes and plates wholesale

loans.name: Hilda

texts.en:
Hilda D. is from the village of Nipaan, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 39 years old, married and has 2 school-aged children. Hilda owns a fishing business. Hilda has been engaged in her business for 7 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2008, Hilda joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Hilda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC, which was used to purchase additional materials for her business. Hilda is requesting a new loan of 2,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and increase working capital. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Hilda from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy materials for fishing

loans.name: Munawar

texts.en:
Munawar lives in an area of Lahore called Ismail Nagar in Pakistan.  She lives in a two-story house; the first floor is rented out. At this time, when the cost of living is getting higher and higher, she is always ready to help her husband meet the financial needs of the family. Her husband runs a grocery shop in the market. He is out of stock these days, which is affecting his image and business. Due to the unavailability of stock, he is losing his customers, which is not good for his business growth. 

Munawar mentioned that if her husband doesn't earn any income in a single day, Munawar has to use the money she receives from her renters. In this way, she can’t save any money.  Therefore, Munawar has applied for a loan from Asasah to help her husband with his grocery shop. She is hopeful that her husband will be able to re-establish his business and generate a good income so she can save money for rainy days.

loans.use: To buy more stock to re-establish the grocery shop

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en:
Loreta L. is from Barangay 18, Gingoog City. She is 51 years old. Loreta is married and has 2 adult children. To make a living, Loreta owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Loreta has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Loreta joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Loreta is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Loreta from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Good People Group

texts.en:
Mai F., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called Good People. Mai is 49 years old, married, and has five children who range from 15 to 31 years old. She was only able to attend school through 4th grade due to poverty. 

For 13 years, she has been operating a mini restaurant in 72nd, Paynesville, outside of Monrovia, Liberia.

She plans to use her 9,000 Liberian Dollars portion of this 41,000 Liberian Dollars group loan to buy more gallons of cooking oil, bags of rice, meat, fish, beans, etc. She describes herself as a quiet woman.

Her dream is to grow her business, and continue to educate her children.

In the photo that accompanies this, Massa is inset at lower right because she was absent during disbursal.

loans.use: To buy more gallons of cooking oil, bags of rice, meat, fish, beans, etc.

loans.name: Tống

texts.en: X. Tống H. (20201030024) is a 42-year-old female living in the town of Huyện Yên Phong, Bắc Ninh province. She is married and has two school-aged children. X. owns and operates a business providing general services to local community members. She has been engaged in this business for over sixteen years and earns approximately 4,800,000 VND a month. In 2007, X. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,392,000 VND from SEDA. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding her business. X. is now requesting a new loan of 9,632,000 VND which will be used to purchase materials needed to expand services provided. The loan will be her 5th from SEDA. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About SEDA: The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide micro-finance services to the low-income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. ***************************************************** X. Tống H. (20201030024) là 42 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố huyện Yên Phong - tỉnh Bắc Ninh. Cô ấy đã lập gia đình và có 2 trẻ ở độ tuổi đi học. Để kiếm sống, X. Sở hữu và thực hiện hoạt động kinh doanh. Công việc kinh doanh hoạt động tại lĩnh vực dịch vụ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh trên cơ sở dịch vụ. Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ cung cấp các dịch vụ nói chung cho người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương. X. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 16 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, X. kiếm được khoảng 4.800.000 VND một tháng. Vào 2007, X. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. X. đề nghị khoản vay lần đầu tiên từ SEDA. Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng đầu tư mở rộng công việc kinh doanh. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 9.632.000 VND. Khoản vay hiện tại sẽ được sử dụng để mua vật tư cần thiết để mở rộng dịch vụ được cung cấp. Khoản vay sẽ là 5th khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA. X. dự định sẽ sử dụng nguồn thu nhập bổ sung từ công việc kinh doanh cải thiện/ mở rộng công việc kinh doanh của người vay. Về SEDA: Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam *Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to expand services provided

loans.name: Mercedes María

texts.es:
EL  Banco Comunal 8 De Mayo, que se reúne cada quince días en la hermosa ciudad de Portoviejo capital manabita rodeada por maravillosas playas, de clima cálido y agradable, con mujeres hermosas y luchadoras.

Aquí encontramos a la señora  Mercedes, tiene sesenta años de edad, esta casada 34 años y a pesar de que no pudo tener hijos ha criado a  tres chicos como si fueran sus hijos, dos de ellos ya son mayores de edad y una linda bebita de 5 años que ahora es su vida. Su esposo trabaja en la cooperativa Coactur.

Vende productos de Yanbal (productos de belleza y perfumería) y Leonisa (ropa interior para damas). Trabaja todos los días en las tardes, dice que ya lleva en el negocio de Yanbal 14 años y que tuvo varios problemas al principio pero que ahora ya no, gracias a que tiene muchos clientes que le hacen sus pedidos, pero en la ropa interior  recién comenzó y le ha ido muy bien ya que estas ha tenido mucha acogida por sus clientes.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en ir a Quito a comprar estas prendas ya que tiene varios pedidos y quiere aumentar sus clientes en este sector de mercado. Es su quinto ciclo en el Banco Comunal y espera seguir cumpliendo para seguir recibiendo los créditos.
 
Sus metas son seguir adelante en su trabajo.
texts.en:
The 8 de May Communal Bank meets every 15 days in the beautiful city of Portoviejo, capital of Manabita. The city is surrounded by marvelous beaches, a warm and pleasant climate, and beautiful and tenacious women. Here we have Mercedes, who is 60 years old. She has been married for 34 years. Even though she could not have children, she has raised three children as if they were her own children. Two of them are adults. The pretty five year old baby is now her life. Her husband works in the Coactur cooperative (a transportation cooperative). She sells Yanbal (beauty products and perfumes) and Leonisa (underwear for women). She works everyday in the afternoons. She says that she has been in business with Yanbal for 14 years. At the beginning she had various problems. However she does not have problems now thanks to the many customers that order from her. She recently started with the underwear business, and it has been going very well for her. The products are very well received by her customers. She will use this loan to go to Quito to buy these garments because she has various orders. She wants to increase her customers in this sector of the market. She is in her fifth cycle with her communal bank. She plans to continue meeting her responsibilities in order to continue to receive loans. Her goal is to get ahead in her work.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish (TL), Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy women's underwear

loans.name: Ana Marina

texts.es: Ana Marina L. de 54 años de edad, es una señora muy alegre y amable, quien trabaja desde su casa la cual esta ubicada en San Agustín, ubicado en el departamento de Usulután. Ella posee una tienda en la cual vende productos de primera necesidad para el hogar y para las personas tales como: jabón, shampoo, pan, leche, golosinas, y otros productos más los cuales son básicos en este tipo de negocios. Ana vive junto a su esposo y dos hijos. Ella cuenta con muy buenas referencias por parte de sus vecinos y amigos, ya que Ana es una mujer muy trabajadora, la cual se dedica por completo al bienestar de su hogar. Ana solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda surtir su negocio con todo lo necesario para aumentar su inventario y de esta manera ofrecer más productos a sus clientes y así mejorar sus ganancias y poder salir adelante junto a su familia.
texts.en: Ana Marina L., 54, is a very cheerful and friendly person who works from her house, which is located in San Agustín in the department of Usulután.  She has a small store where she sells everyday personal consumer products and products for the home such as: soap, shampoo, bread, milk, candy and other products that are common in this type of business.  Ana lives with her husband and 2 children.  She has very good references from her neighbors and friends, since Ana is a very hardworking woman who is completely dedicated to the welfare of her household.  Ana requests a loan to restock her store with everything she needs to increase her inventories so that she can offer more products to her customers.  In this way she can increase her earnings and provide for her family.

loans.use: to buy products that are basic necessities

loans.name: Fabiola Eunice

texts.es: La Sra. Fabiola tiene 3 hijos vive junto con su esposo en casa de su suegra la Sra. es muy emprendedora y apoya a su esposo con los gastos de la casa, su actividad es  la venta de cosméticos y perfumes su mayor deseo es poder estudiar en la universidad ya que ella al Casarse con su pareja abandono la universidad, ahora viven bien cómodamente en la casa de los padres de su esposo y el crédito que desean es para poder comprar un ropero mas grande para su dormitorio ya que el que tiene  quedo muy chico para el tamaño de familia con la que ella ahora cuenta, ahora su deseo es poder ahorrar dinero para comprarse un lotecito y ahí poder construir su casa.
texts.en: Mrs. Fabiola has three children that live with her and her husband in their mother-in-law’s house. She is very enterprising and helps her husband with the household expenses. She sells cosmetics and perfumes. Her greatest dream is to study at the university. When she got married she had to leave her university studies. Now they live comfortably in her husband’s parent’s house. With the loan that she is requesting she will buy a larger wardrobe for her bedroom. The wardrobe is very small for the size of their family. According to what she has told us, she wishes to save money in order to buy a small piece of land and construct a house.

loans.use: She would like to buy bedroom furniture.

loans.name: Koffi

texts.fr: Koffi a 40 ans, marié et père de 2 enfants.  Il fait cette activité 10 ans déjà. Pour s’occuper de sa famille il fait le commerce de boisson local. Il s’approvisionne à Kouvé  et revend  près de la maison Dra à Lomé. Il sollicite ce prêt pour satisfaire mieux ses clients.
texts.en: Koffi is 40 years old, married and the father of two. He has been in this business for 10 years already. In order to provide for his family, he sells traditional local liquor. He stocks up in Kouvé and sells by the Dra house in Lomé. He is seeking this loan in order to better meet customer demand.

loans.use: Purchasing traditional beverages

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John N. is a 36 years old, married, and has five children. John has a masonry business, which has been in existence for four years. He primarily operates his business in the Gede and Watamu area where most of his clients live.

This is the first loan John is requesting from KADET after being introduced to the company by another client. He is asking for a loan for  5,000 KES and he plans to use it to buy more working tools for his business.  John wishes to use the anticipated profit from the business to continue educating his children and providing for his family.  He hopes that one day his business will grow big enough to enable him become a sought-after mason.

loans.use: To buy new tools

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy N. lives in the Kisaasi neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has 4 children, all of whom are in school.  Mercy  has a restaurant business.  She has been in this business for 5 years and she works 6 days out of every week. Mercy sells her products in a shop on a  retail basis.

Mercy has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bunches of bananas, cassava, sweet potatoes, rice and beef.  The main business challenges for Mercy include transportation and the rainy season.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a fully stocked hotel.

Mercy lives in a home that she rents.  She has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include food, school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs like bunches of bananas, sweet potatoes, cassava rice and beef.

loans.name: Altangerel

texts.en: Altangerel P. is 32 years old and lives with his mother, siblings and infant daughter in Uvurhangai province in central Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian housing tent. His mother operates a salt trading business, while he operates a machinery parts trading business in his town. He started his business in 2007 by selling motorcycle parts and providing a car repair service. Over the years, he has gained much experience in his trade and always tries to grow and improve his business. He has built a stable business and positive reputation among his customers, and today his working capital exceeds 1,000,000 MNT. His earnings have enabled him to have his own workplace. For the future, he hopes to expand his business by increasing his working capital, to improve his family's standard of living. Altangerel is a hardworking man and is requesting a 1,700,000 MNT loan to buy supplies for his motorcycle parts trading business.

loans.use: To buy supplies for his motorcycle parts trading business

loans.name: Luz Argentina

texts.es: Luz Argentina R. D. H. D. 34 años D. edad, es una persona muy responsable y trabajadora quien vive junto a su esposo y cuatro hijos todos menores D. edad, con quienes resiD. en Colón, ubicado en el departamento D. La Libertad. Luz trabaja D. sol a sol elaborando tortillas en su hogar, así mismo se dedica a la venta D. ropa D. forma ambulante y también comercializa jugos enlatados, lo cual realiza con mucho entusiasmo y deseo D. salir adelante y contar con una vida mejor junto a su familia, razón por la que solicita un préstamo a Integral a través del cual pueda contar con el monto D. dinero necesario para invertir en sus negocios, surtiéndolos, D. forma que cuente con más maíz para elaborar tortillas, y más ropa y jugos para comercializar, D. forma que sus ganancias crezcan y su economía mejore en gran manera.
texts.en: Luz Argentina R. D. H. is 34 years old. She is a very responsible and hardworking person who lives with her husband and four young children. They resiD. in Colón, located in the La Libertad department of El Salvador. Luz works from dawn to dusk making tortillas in her home. She also sells clothing and juices on the street, which she does enthusiastically and with a desire to get ahead in order to make a better life for her family. For this reason, she is requesting a loan from Integral which will allow her to invest in her businesses and stock them so that she has more corn on hand to make tortillas with and more clothing and juice to sell. This way her profits will increase and her financial situation will improve greatly.

loans.use: To buy clothing and canned juices to sell and corn for making tortillas.

loans.name: Fawziyeh

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. She is 35 years old, married and has four children.

In 2008, Fawziyeh opened her own sewing project for women and children's wear. She is very experienced in this field and now she is becoming well known and has a good reputation in her local community.

She is requesting a $2,000 loan to buy two new sewing machines and a small generator to increase her production. She is aiming to grow bigger and increase her sales.

loans.use: To buy two sewing machines and a small generator

loans.name: Soem

texts.en:
From the province of Kompong Chhnang province, Soem R. weaves bamboo baskets for sale. She sells her finished product to buyers who come directly to her house. She makes over fifty sets of baskets before selling out. She also orders baskets from the other villagers and sells them to make extra profit. Her husband helps her buy the raw materials and weave baskets. Usually, the couple can earn an average of $3.50 per day for supporting their family’s needs. 

Due to the coming harvest season, Soem R. would like to purchase many sacks of rice to store and then resell when prices are high. Soem R. is a 65-year-old married woman blessed with three children, and all of her children are married.

loans.use: To purchase rice to stock up while prices are low for future sales.

loans.name: Maribeth

texts.en:
Maribeth D. is from the village of Lumbia, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 31 years old. Maribeth is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living Maribeth owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling rice per kilogram in the local community. Maribeth has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009 Maribeth joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maribeth has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional rice and for use as working capital. Maribeth is requesting a new loan of 14000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional rice to sell. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Maribeth from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional rice  to sell

location.town: Lumbia, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Evans

texts.en:
Evans, 48, is a married father of 4 school-aged children whose ages range between 4 and 16. Three of the children are currently attending school. He has been practicing mixed farming for the last four years in Nyamira town, western Kenya. His mixed farm produces tea which he sells to a local factory, milk and maize which he sells locally. He also operates a hotel business in the same area.

He has requested a loan of 25,000 Kes through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says that with the dairy cow, his family will be guaranteed enough milk for domestic consumption and sale. He plans to expand his farming and hotel businesses in future. His biggest challenge has been prolonged drought and too much rain which affect his production.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma R. is from the town of Rizal, Quirino, Isabela. She is 47 years old. Wilma is married and has two adult children. To make a living, Wilma owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Wilma has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Wilma joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Wilma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 25,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Wilma is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. This will be the 7th loan taken out by Wilma from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: Yuri Antonio

texts.es: Yuri Antonio se dedica a brindar el servicio de tricitaxi. Tiene más de 6 años que tiene este negocio. El se encuentra muy agradecido con este medio de vida que le ha proporcionado los ingreso necesarios, tiene 1 hijo menor de edad a su cargo, ya que anteriormente alquilaba un triciclo pero con mucho esfuerzo logro obtener el suyo propio, pues necesitaba obtener más ingresos para mantener a su familia. El es un hombre muy responsable que ha adquirido cierta experiencia con su negocio y sus clientes. Este crédito es para la compra de llantas, asientos, pedales, cadenas, entre otros arreglos que quiere realizarle a su tricitaxi.
texts.en:
Yuri Antonio provides transportation services with his tricycle taxi and has been in this business for more than six years. He is extremely grateful to be earning a livelihood that can provide the necessary income. Yuri has one dependent child. He previously rented a tricycle, but with great effort he was able to obtain one of his own so that he could earn more income to support his family.

Yuri is a responsible man who has gained experience by working with his business and his customers. This loan will be used to buy tires, seats, pedals, chains, and other parts so that he can make repairs to his tricycle taxi.

loans.use: To purchase tires, seats, pedals, chains, and other parts for his tricycle taxi.

loans.name: Poni

texts.en: Poni sells tea and bread. She is 28 years old, married, and has one child who does not go to school. Poni took out a loan to stock more tea and bread to sell. She hopes to pay her child's school fees with extra profits from her business in the future.

loans.use: to stock more tea and bread to sell.

loans.name: Jorge De Jesus

texts.es:
Jorge, reside en El Transito departamento de San Miguel, es agricultor, siembra maíz y frijol, vive con su esposa y tienen dos hijos de 1 y 3 años de edad, tiene casa propia.
Él está solicitando un préstamo para el cultivo de maíz y frijol, con el cual quiere pagar el alquiler del terreno,  este préstamo será una gran ayuda para iniciar con anticipación el cultivo.
Su objetivo es tener una buena cosecha, tener una gran producción con la que pueda dar a sus hijos lo necesario.
texts.en:
Jorge lives in El Transito in the department of San Miguel. He is an agriculture who harvests corn and beans. He lives with his wife and they have two children, aged 1 and 3 years old. They own their own house.

He requests a loan for his corn and bean plantations. He needs to pay the rental fees of the land. This loan will be a great help to start his plantation ahead of time.

His objective is to have a good harvest and a good yield with which to give his children what they need.

loans.use: to pay land rental fees for the fields where he cultivates corn and beans.

loans.name: Shazia's Group

texts.en:
Shazia is 33 years old, a housewife, and does her household responsibilities by staying at home. She is a very responsible person and performs her daily routine work very responsibly. Her husband is involved in the wheat-selling business. He also has a donkey cart and provides loading services with it to his clients.  

Shazia is the mother of four children. Only two of them are able to attend school and are getting their education.

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband. Through the loan, he will buy wheat in bulk which will help him fill larger orders on time and earn more profits.  Her husband has been operating this business for the past seven years and Shazia is very confident that an investment will be beneficial for him. 

She is a new loan user and this is her first loan application to Asasah.

loans.use: To buy wheat to sell.

loans.name: Zacquia

texts.en:
Zacquia is 23 years old. She has one child who is two years old. She stays with her husband and they run a business together.

Zacquia owns a bakery in which she makes bread and snacks such as donuts. She has done this business for four years and this business has enabled her to feed her family.

She is requesting a loan to buy wheat flour and cooking oil for baking so that she can increase the quantity of the products she sells and hence make more profits.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour and cooking oil.

loans.name: Zarrina

texts.en:
Zarrina is married and has two children. Her husband is a machinist. Zarinna helps her husband to take care of their family. She sells everyday products in her grocery store, which is located near her house. She purchases the goods two times a week from Khujand City. Her monthly income is about 1,500 Tajikistan somonis (TJS). Zarrina would like to get a loan of 6,000 TJS for purchasing a new assortment of foods in order to expand her business and allow customers greater choice. She carefully and responsibly applies for loans.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, as it served as a key post along the Silk Road and marked the end of Alexander the Great's extensive rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists, and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON’s History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to buy a new assortment of foods

loans.name: Los Girasoles Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama los  girasoles , sus representantes  le pusieron así por que el girasol es una flor muy linda ,entre arbusto sucio  pero sin embargo se ve linda, llena  de esperanza igual ellas ,están llenas de sueños y fundación realidad le da la oportunidad de asearlo realidad.
Esta  ubicado en la localidad  del Carrizo estado de Oaxaca , esta conformado por  doce integrantes.
El representante  del grupo es la señora Amelia , tiene la escolaridad de la secundaria terminada , tiene dos hijos una mujer y un varón, la niña se llama Natalia de  doce años de edad, y julio de  dieciocho años de edad, ella necesitaba el préstamo para  la compra de alimentos ,es que vede antojitos mexicanos en las noches .
Sus clientes  necesitan un lugar mas grande , así que con sus ganancias piensa hacer
mas grande su local .
La señora Amelia  deseaba  este préstamo  para aumentar las ganancias de su negocio 
y así hacer  de su negocio  un lugar mas grande , uno de sus sueños es hacer  un restaurante para tener una mejor calidad de vida para ella y sus  seres queridos que son sus hijos.
Otro de los representantes es la señora  Analy  también forma parte del grupo  , tiene  veinte años  estudio hasta la secundaria , tiene un hijo de  cuatro meses , ella necesitaba el préstamo para comprar mas ropa ella se dedica ala venta y compra  de ropa , pues ella se dedica ala venta y compra de ropa.
Sus clientes le aconsejan de que ponga su local para que cuando ella no tenga tiempo de irlos a visitarlos  ellos pueden ir a su local y ver la ropa que le llega, para ya no sacarla de la bolsas si  no que ya las tenga exhibidas.
Uno de sus sueños es ese  hacer mas grande su negocio  para tener mas contentos a   sus
clientes y así tener mas ganancias para tener una mejor calidad de vida
A largo plazo desea hacerse de una buting.
Los otros diez integrantes  se llaman :
María Luisa – para la venta de antojitos mexicanos.
María  Adelina-para la venta de quesos.
María Gregoria- para la venta de antojitos mexicanos.
Ricarda _ para la  venta  de antojitos mexicanos.
Rosario-para hacer mas grande su cocina económica.
Francisca Galacia-para la    venta  de antojitos mexicanos.
Margarita-para la venta de ropa.
Gregoria-para la venta de ropa.
Adelia-para la venta de pollos.
Reina –para la venta de quesos.
texts.en:
This group is called “Los Girasoles” (The Sunflowers).  The group representatives gave it that name because the sunflower is a very beautiful flower.  Even though the sunflower is among messy shrubs, it still looks beautiful.  It looks full of hope, just like they are.  They are full of dreams, and the Fundación Realidad gives them the opportunity to make them come true.

The communal bank is located in Carrizo in the state of Oaxaca.  It is comprised of 12 members.  Amelia is the representative of the group.  She has a high school education.  She has two children, a daughter and a son.  Her daughter, Natalia, is 12 years old.  Julio is 18 years old.  She needs the loan to buy food.  She sells Mexican snacks in the evenings.  Her customers need a larger place.  She plans to use her earnings to make her place bigger.

Amelia wanted this loan in order to increase the income from her business.  That way she will make her place of business bigger.  One of her dreams is to establish a restaurant in order to have a better quality of life for herself and her loved ones, who are her children.

Analy is another of the representatives, and she also forms part of the group.  She is 20 years old, and she went to school up to high school.  She has a four month old son.  She needs the loan to buy more clothes.  She devotes herself to selling and buying clothes.  Her customers advise her to set up a sales location so that when she does not have time to go see them, they can go to her place to see the clothes that she receives.  They will do that so that they are not paying for what they have not seen.

One of her dreams is to have a larger business in order to make her customers happier.  That way she will have more income in order to have a better quality of life.  In the long term she wishes to have a boutique.

The other ten members’ names and reasons for the loan are:

María Luisa – to sell Mexican snacks.
María  Adelina-to sell cheese
María Gregoria- to sell Mexican snacks.
Ricarda - to sell Mexican snacks.
Rosario-to increase her prepared food sales. 
Francisca Galacia- to sell Mexican snacks.
Margarita-to sell clothes.
Gregoria- to sell clothes.
Adelia-to sell chickens.
Reina –to sell cheese.

loans.use: to buy and sell food.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 38 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. 

Teresita sells viands like fried fish, afritada & pancit bihon. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy raw ingredients to cook dishes to sell.

Teresita has been a member of HSPFI since 2005. In the future, Teresita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for cooking dishes to sell

loans.name: Jomar

texts.en:
Jomar is now 33 years old. Together with his wife, he works to improve their income from business. His wife has been selling a variety of products like spices, canned goods and some crackers and candies in her store located in the village where they live for almost five years now. Jomar is working as a company driver. 

Jomar is requesting a loan of PHP 8,000 that he will use to buy groceries such as soft drinks, bread, ingredients, canned goods and noodles to sell for his wife to sell in the store. This couple is able to earn an average total of PHP 3,000 each month. 

In the future, Jomar wants to work harder for the improvement of their livelihood towards a living that is free from hunger.

loans.use: to buy groceries such as soft drinks, bread, ingredients, canned goods and noodles to sell

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy is 41 years old and married to Nicholas. They have two children. She has been running her transportation business for the past five years with a monthly profit of KES 8,000. She has been loaned KES 30,000, which she plans to use to service the car and buy spare parts. With the anticipated profit, she plans to build her family a home. In the future, she hopes to buy another car.

loans.use: to service the car and buy spare parts

loans.name: Jeremias

texts.pt:
Nasceu em Manjacaze, provincia de Gaza, sul de Moçambique, casado e pai de 8 filho dos quais  6 frequentam a  escola e 2 ainda não tem idade escolar. Fez a 4ª classe e parou por falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e sustenta seus irmãs enviando dinheiro para ajudar nas dispesas. 

Nunca saiu da sua terra natal, é negociante ha mais de 20 anos e dedica-se a compra e venda de produtos diversos e tem um rendimento de cerca de 2.500.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BIM).
Nunca fez emprestimo noutros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de um amigo que tambem é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu quarto emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 15.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar produtos (peixe, batata, sumos, arroz, amendoim, e outros) para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria. Os primeiros emprestimos foram de: 15.000.00mt, 15.000.00mt, e 10.000.00mt, ambos para o comercio.
Pretende ampliar a sua actividade comercial, e iniciar a obra da sua residência para oferecer mais conforto a sua familia, assim irá solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Jeremias was born in Manjacaze, Gaza province, in southern Mozambique, is married and father of eight children, six of whom attend school and the other two are still not in school age. After completing fourth grade, he dropped out of school for lack of financial possibilities. He lives in his own house with his family and supports his sister by sending money to help with expenses. 
He has never left his homeland and he has been running a business for now twenty years; he buys and sells various products and he make a profit of about 2.500.00mt a month, that he uses for household expenses and saves something in his bank account (BIM). 
He had never requested a loan by other banks until he met Hluvuku through a friend who is also a client of this institution. This is his fourth loan by Hluvuku, of the amount of 15.000.00mt  to be used to purchase products (fish, potatoes, juices, rice, peanuts, and others) to increase his supply stock. The previous loans were 15.000.00mt, 15.000.00mt and 10.000.00mt, all of them used for his business. 
He intends to expand his business and to refurbish his house to offer more comfort to his family, so in the future he will request further loans by Hluvuku.

loans.use: to purchase goods to resell (fish, potatoes, juices, rice, peanuts and others)

loans.name: Manuel Felipe

texts.es:
El  socio pertenece al banco comunal “COMUZONE II” el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Huanchac, en la Provincia de Cusco y Departamento de Cusco.

El  socio Manuel; tiene 36 años de edad, el socio es soltero; él socio tiene 2 hijos de 14, 3 años de edad;  él socio  es policía y el también se dedica  a la compra y venta de repuestos, el socio tiene su negocio de venta de autopartes y repuestos para automóviles, el socio cuando no está trabajando está administrando y atendiendo personalmente su negocio, le socio requiere le préstamo para poder ayudarse y comprar mercadería, el socio quiere invertir el crédito en la compra de repuestos para automóviles. El socio solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de repuestos de automóviles.

El  socio agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the communal bank, COMUZONE II, it is located in the district of Huanchac in the province of Cusco, department of Cusco.

Manuel is 36 years old, he is single and has 2 children of ages 14 and 3.  Manuel is a policeman but also buys and sells spare automotive parts.  He has his own business where he sells new and used automotive parts.  When he is not working he personally tends to his business and is requesting this loan to help out and purchase automotive parts.  He is thankful for the support offered and also commits himself to fulfill his payments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of automotive parts.

loans.name: Benita

texts.es:
Benita nació en la ciudad D. Yanahoca (provincia D. Urubamba, departamento del Cusco). Actualmente, Benita tiene 65 años D. edad, es casada y fruto D. esta unión tiene cinco hijos. 

DesD. hace 7 años que Benita radica en la ciudad del Cusco y donD. desarrolla sus actividades, ella se dedica a elaboración D. chicha D. jora y a la venta D. comida, ella también tiene una segunda actividad económica que es la crianza D. animales menores como por ejemplo cuyes, pollos y gallinas. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. En esta oportunidad Benita requiere el préstamo para comprar más cuyes y pollos.

El Banco Comunal “Comuzone IV” se reúne cada treinta en la ciudad del Cusco (Perú). Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial y por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y también porque se encuentra una D. las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Benita was born in the city of Yanahoca (which is in Urubamba Province, in Cusco Department).  Benita is 65 years old and is married; the fruits of this relationship are her five children.

For the last seven years, Benita has resided in the city of Cusco, and this is where she works.  She works making "chicha D. jora" (a traditional corn liquor) and selling meals.  She also has a second economic activity raising small animals, for example guinea pigs, chickens and hens.  She has been doing this for several years, and it is going very well for her thanks to the persistence she brings to her work.

On this occasion, Benita is requesting the loan to buy more guinea pigs and chickens.

The "Comuzone IV" Communal Bank meets monthly in the city of Cusco (in Peru).  Cusco is well-known for being an area with much tourism and commerce, for its traditional festival of Inti Raymi, and also because it is the location of Machu Picchu, one of the seven wonders of the world.

loans.use: to buy more guinea pigs and chickens.

loans.name: Domero

texts.en:
Domero is 55 years old and lives in Panaon, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. He is married with three children. 

Domero has engaged in a transport business activity. He owns and operates a motorcycle, which stands as the prime means of income for the family. He is driving around routine destinations very often and sending passengers to their designated point of destinations. He has had the business for three years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) each month. He has requested a loan from GDMPC worth PHP 15,000 to repair the vehicle and continue his means of living as quickly as possible. 

Domero has been a member of GDMPC for two years. In the future, Domero hopes to expand and improve the business for a better living. He hopes to retain the business for long, long years.

loans.use: To repair the vehicle.

loans.name: Rafael David

texts.es:
Rafael, continua en su nucleo familiar, al lado de su esposa y un hijo, por el momento esta iniciando nuevamente la siembra de maiz, por lo que necesita un nuevo préstamo para comprar fertilizantes, herbicidas y semilla para la siembra, con estos materiales espera que sus cosechas sean abundantes y sanas.
El en su dedicacion a los cultivos, piensa que con estos prestamos, con un plazo accesible, ha logrado realizar sus actividades y salir a delante, siendo muy responsable.
texts.en:
Rafael continues living with his immediate family (his wife and son).  Right now, he is starting to sow his corn again.  He therefore needs a new loan to buy fertilizers, herbicides and seeds for his sowing.  Using these materials, he hopes to enjoy abundant and healthy harvests.

Rafael is committed to his crops.  He believes that through these loans, with their affordable repayments, he has managed to carry out his business and get ahead in life.  He is a very responsible person.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, herbicides and seeds

loans.name: Zunilda

texts.es:
La señorita Zunilda tiene 31 años de edad, es soltera, tiene un hijo que es menor y que depende de ella. Vive con su mamá en la ciudad de Carapeguá.
Es artesana, desde muy joven se dedica a tejer, lo que le deja un buen ingreso, dicha profesión lo aprendió de su mamá que le enseñaba desde que ella tiene memoria. Hace 20 años que teje. Comenta que tiene muy buenas manos para las artesanías. Ella dice que vende sus productos por Carapeguá y también tiene pedidos de Asunción. Sus vecinos dicen que es responsable y trabajadora, valores importantes para el progreso.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de hilos, agujas, colorantes y demás, los cuales son esenciales para el tejido. Agradece a la Fundación por la oportunidad que esta le da.
texts.en:
Señorita Zunilda, age 31, is single. She has one son who is young and depends on her. She lives with her mother in the city of Carapeguá.

Zunilda is an artisan who has been involved in weaving since she was very young. This gives her a good income. She learned the profession from her mother, who used to teach her since she has the same skill. She has been weaving for 20 years.

Zunilda says she has very good hands for handicrafts. She says that she sells her products in Carapeguá and also has orders from Asunción (the capital). Her neighbors say she is responsible and hardworking, important values for making progress.

She is applying for the loan in order to purchase thread, needles, dyes and additional materials that are essential for weaving. She is thankful to the Fundación Paraguaya for the opportunity it has given her.

loans.use: to purchase thread, needles, dyes, and other materials essential for weaving.

loans.name: Raida

texts.es: Raida de 55 años de edad es una mujer casada, vive en un hogar propio en la misma ciudad de Tarma. Vio nacer a 6 hijos, de los cuales solo vive con uno, el menor de 13 años. Desde que se casó, se dedica a la administración de una orquesta musical, llamada “Los Rolys Band”. Su esposo es el director, y 3 de sus hijos varones tocan diversos instrumentos dentro de la banda. El repertorio es variado desde salsa, merengues, cumbias, etc., por esa razón Raida y sus músicos son contratados constantemente, “ya son muchos años que llevo en esto, y nos va muy bien, con decir que ya tenemos contratos hasta febrero del 2012”, explica. Además comenta, que en los eventos como: fiestas de promoción, matrimonios, bautizos, quinceaños, etc., obtiene más ingresos.  “Tocamos 2 veces por semana como mínimo, por presentación de 7 horas ganamos 1400 soles, de eso pagamos como 600 soles a los músicos”, detalla. Raida, considera que esta profesión será la que sus hijos y nietos desarrollen, ya que fue heredada de su suegro quien inculcó el arte de la música a sus hijos. Espera ver a sus nietos realizarse en ese campo, si es que lo tienen en cuenta, de lo contrario los apoyará como siempre. Raida gracias a su ayuda podrá obtener su segundo préstamo de MFP, así que se compromete de manera firme, a ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas. En cuanto al trabajo con su banco comunal afirma que se siente cómoda. Con el dinero del préstamo, ella podrá ordenar la confección de 8 ternos para las nuevas presentaciones de su banda. Ahí invertirá un promedio de 1800 soles, dinero que piensa completar con los ahorros que tiene.
texts.en: Raida, 55 years old, is a married woman and lives in her own home in the city of Tarma.  She gave birth to 6 children and lives with only one, the youngest who is 13 years old.  Ever since she got married, she has run a musical band called “Los Rolys Band”.  Her husband is the director, and three of her sons play different instruments in the band.  The repertory varies from salsa, merengues, to cumbias and more.  Because of this, Raida and her musicians are constantly employed.  “Since I’ve have been doing this for many years we are doing very well, and we have contracts until February of 2012,” she explains.  Also, she mentions that at events like prom, weddings, baptisms, and birthdays they earn more income.  “We play 2 time a week at least.  For 7 hour shows we get 1400 soles, 600 of which goes to the musicians,” she says.  Raida believes that her children and grandchildren will continue this business, which was inherited from her father-in-law who instilled the art of music in his sons.  She hopes to see her grandchildren realize this dream if they so chose, but she will support them no matter what.  Raida will be able to get a second loan with MFP with your help, and promises firmly to be punctual in making payments.  In terms of working with the communal bank, she feels very comfortable.  With the money from the loan she will be able to order 8 suits to be made for upcoming shows.  She will invest on average 1800 soles, which she will add to her savings.

loans.use: buy 8 suits for her band's shows.

loans.name: Eda

texts.en:
Eda is a 50-year-old woman, and she is married with two children. Her husband is a farmer and also drives the jeep. 

Eda wants to help her husband repair and paint the van, but she doesn't have enough money. So she needs to take out a loan of 10,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP). When Eda gets the loan, she will be able to help her husband repair and paint the taxi. This will improve the taxi's condition and enable her husband to work extra hours to increase the family's income which in turn will improve the family's living conditions. 

Eda is a very loving mother and wife; she does everything for her family.

loans.use: to buy paint, tires, and pay for the maintenance of her van

loans.name: Rosalyn

texts.en:
Rosalyn is 33 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 5 children. Rosalyn is making and peddling snacks like banana cue, butchi, and shakoy. She has had this business for 3 years. She has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy raw ingredients needed for making snacks.
Rosalyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Rosalyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients needed for making snacks.

loans.name: Pablo

texts.es:
El señor Pablo   es un señor   trabajador, humilde y creativo  se dedica a la  venta  carne de res y de marrano  y a la venta de pozole.
Esta felizmente casado  con le señora  Roció a quien quiere  y desea darle lo mejor  a ella y a su hijo el pequeño Pablito.
Don pablo  nos cuenta  que gracias a fundación está  creciendo su negocio ya tienen una camioneta para ir a lo pueblos vecinos a  vender la carne el hueso.
Pidió el préstamo para la compra  ganado y marrano para la matanza.
Le da las gracias a fundación por el apoyo que le ha dado para  hacer más grande su negocio.
texts.en:
Pablo is a hardworking, humble and creative man who has a business selling beef, pork and pozole (pork and hominy stew).  He is happily married to Rocio, who he loves, and he wants to provide the best for her as well as for their son, little Pablito.

Pablo tells us that thanks to the Fundación his business is growing; now they have a van to go to neighboring towns to sell the meat and the bones.

He requested this loan to buy livestock and pigs to slaughter.

He thanks the Fundación for the support that they have given him in order to make his business grow bigger.

loans.use: to buy livestock and pigs to slaughter

loans.name: Felipe

texts.en:
Felipe is a hardworking man. Though he has a disablity, he still generates an income for the sustenance of his family. He is married and has one child. His wife helps him transplant rice seedlings on his two hectare rice field, and he also hires laborers to do some farming activities.

Felipe is requesting a loan of 30,000 Philippine pesos to buy three bags of rice seed, six bags of fertilizer, and pesticides.  Someday, he hopes to achieve financial stability so that he can provide a better quality of life for his family.

loans.use: to buy rice seed, fertilizer, and pesticides for use in farming

loans.name: Tumf

texts.en: Tum, 44, is married and resides with her husband and four children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She is a porridge vendor. Her husband is a fish paste vendor. Two of her children are garment workers. Tum is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase construction materials to repair her house and build a bathroom. In the future, she would like to run a grocery store at home to generate more income to support the family. Moreover, she plans to run a poultry farm and support her children to study until they get their bachelor's degree.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to repair her home and build a bathroom

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Hello, world, meet Joel from Koibatek, located in North Rift, Kenya. Joel is a 34-year-old farmer who is practicing a mixed form of farming: He grows cash crops and keeps dairy, as well. Joel also runs a small cereal-trading business on the side to make extra income for his family. 

Joel is seeking a KES 65,000 loan to purchase a stock of cereals for his business. He will use your money to aggregate local cereal produce that he will sell in urban markets that offer better prices. Profits from this business will help Joel to meet the basic needs of his family.

loans.use: to purchase cereals

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is an exemplary mother. She doesn't have an education, but with a dream and a lot of motivation she has taken care of her family, made up of 3 children and a husband. All of this she has achieved with her humble cereal selling business, into which she has put all of her dedication and love. The Nandi hills area has a high demand for cereals but the major problem she faces is lack of capital to increase her business. Through the loan she will be able to meet the demand and satisfy the demand for cereal in her village. The work this mother does to survive with her loved ones is commendably dignified, and it is well worthwhile to provide her the benefit of the support she needs and is asking for.
 Be inspired and make a loan.

loans.use: To buy cereals.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is 62 years old and married with two children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of household goods to sell.

Norma has been in this business for 25 years. 

In the future Norma would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of household goods to sell

loans.name: Zohra

texts.en:
Zohra was born in Gubadli region of Azerbaijan. She is Internally Displaced Person (IDP). She settled with his family and 3 children in Sumgait. Difficulties of life forced them to start the business. She is the only breadwinner in the family. In the beginning she used to sell vegetables. By borrowing the loan amount of $300 she wants to buy refrigerator and improve condition of her family. 
Zohra applies for $300 to buy the refrigerator.

loans.use: To buy the refrigerator

loans.name: Samadhon

texts.en:
Samadhon has a University degree from Dushanbe Medical Institute. He works as a dentist in the village called Kizil-pilol, of Isfara district. At the beginning his main income from his work as a dentist was enough to feed his family. Over time the family was growing and now Samadhon supports his wife, who doesn’t work, and four children.

From his childhood he has known how to take care of cows and decided to earn money by keeping livestock in his yard. His family helps him in this. When he is at work, his children and his wife take care of the cows and feed them. When he received his first loan he bought a bull-calf and fodder. Since then he bought several bulls and sold the ones that were big enough to sell at a good price. He would like to use his next loan for repairs of the cow-shed in his yard.

loans.use: Repairs of cow-shed

loans.name: Séna

texts.fr:
Séna N. is about 30 years old and is the second wife of her unemployed husband. She had her first child this year. But because they live in poverty, the child did not survive. She now finds herself childless. However, being very courageous and wanting to lift herself out of poverty no matter what, she has engaged in the business of selling condiments.

Today, she has a lot of ambition; that is to say, she wishes to expand the range of goods she offers for sale. Because of a lack of funds to start things off, she is requesting a loan of $1,000. Ms. N. is a very active woman who has the wish and desire to work although she lacks the means. Ever attentive to her commitments, she has always repaid her loans without any problems.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer.

Agée de 30 ans environ, Madame N. Séna est la deuxième femme d’un mari sans emploi. Elle a eu son premier enfant cette année ; mais à cause des conditions de vie misérables, l’enfant n’a pas pu résister. Elle se retrouve aujourd’hui sans enfant. Mais très courageuse et voulant à tout pris sortir de la pauvreté, elle a entrepris un petit commerce de vente des condiments.

Aujourd’hui elle a beaucoup d’ambition c'est-à-dire ajouter d’autres produits à la vente des condiments. Mais faute de moyens pour démarrer cette activité, elle sollicite un crédit de $1000. C’est une femme très active qui a la volonté de travailler mais c’est les moyens qui lui manquent. Tenant toujours à ses engagements, elle a toujours remboursé ses crédits sans incidence.

loans.use: Acquiring condiments to sell

loans.name: K. Rodolphe

texts.fr:
Born in Bénin in 1976, Mr. Rodolphe K. L. currently lives in Afomonou with his wife and children. In addition to his family, he has three others to support, making a total of six people. His main business is growing pineapples. Educated to 10th grade, he has taken the small savings he made from sharecropping and invested them in agriculture in general and pineapple production in particular. Today he knows many companies that make pineapple juice, so he has to increase his production. To do so, he wants to take advantage of this opportunity to benefit from a loan of $1,200 to buy fertilizer and introduce a new type of pineapple that is more profitable. This way, Mr. Rodolphe L. will be able to improve the living conditions of everyone in his care.

Né au Bénin en 1976, Monsieur L. K. Rodolphe vit actuellement à Afomonou avec sa femme et ses enfants. Outre ses derniers, il compte à sa charge trois (3) personnes soit au total six (6) personnes. La production des ananas est son principal travail. Instruit de niveau secondaire, il a investi sa petite économie issue du métayage dans l’agriculture en général et la production des ananas en particulier. Aujourd’hui, il a fait la connaissance de nombreuses sociétés productrice de jus d’ananas, ce qui l’oblige à augmenter sa production. Pour cela, il veut saisir cette opportunité pour bénéficier d’un crédit de $1200 afin d’acheter de l’engrais et introduire une nouvelle espèce d’ananas plus rentable. Ainsi, Monsieur L. Rodolphe pourra améliorer les conditions de vie de toutes les personnes à sa charge.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Nohemi Guadalupe

texts.es:
Nohemi is married and has two children. Her husband is now employed, but Nohemi started her business because her husband had lost his job and they didn't have enough income to be able to live or to support their children. She decided to sell hamburgers at night and grew her business little by little. Now her business is the principal source of income for her family, and she has many customers. She wishes to keep growing her business.

Nohemi is requesting a loan of $750 to buy a larger grill, satisfy her demand, and put a roof on part of her business, because when it rains, she can't provide good service. With this loan, she will improve her location, and her customers will be more comfortable. She is offering to repay the loan in six months. Nohemi and her family thank you very much for the support that you offer them to grow their business.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer.

Nohemi esta casada y tiene 2 hijos, su esposo trabaja como empleado en una empresa, ella empezó con su negocio por que su esposo se encontraba desempleado y no tenían ingresos para poder vivir ni mantener a sus niños, por ello ella se decidió a vender hamburguesas por las noches y poco a poco fue creciendo con su negocio y ahora su negocio es su principal fuente de ingresos, que se encuentra en su casa y ya cuenta con mucha clientela y desea continuar y seguir creciendo con su negocio.

Noemí esta solicitando un préstamo por US $ 750 para comprar una parrilla más grande y poder cubrir su demanda además techar una parte de su negocio por que la lluvia no le permite dar un buen servicio y con esto mejorará su local y sus clientes estarán más cómodos, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en 6 meses. Ella y su familia te agradecen mucho el apoyo que le brindas para crecer con su negocio.

loans.use: To purchase a grill and to put a roof on part of her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her stock

loans.name: Choo

texts.en: Mrs. Choo C. T., 32, works on her rice paddy growing crops and vegetables and typically earns around $2/day in revenue. Her husband is a middleman buying and selling oxen, making around $3/day of profit. Mrs. Choo C. T. has three children. Two of them are students and another one is too young to attend school. She has humbly requested for a loan to purchase a hand tractor to help with the plowing of her farmland to grow more crops.

loans.use: To purchase a hand tractor to ease the plowing of her farmland

loans.name: Maksudhoja

texts.en:
Maksudhoja is 30 years old and married with 3 children. The two older children attend school and the younger is only 3 years old.

Maksudhoja has been running his business for 2 years. With his wife's assistance he fries and bakes pasties and patties with meat. They also operate a small snack-bar serving pasties and patties. Maksudhoja and his wife are very nice and polite people, whose friendly service has attracted many clients to their business. They depend on the revenue generated by their business to support their family.

Today Maksudhoja requests US$600 to buy plates and dishes for his business and to repair the roof of his small snack-bar. This is Maksudhoja's first loan. He plans to work hard to pay back the loan in 6 months and not to let down all the people who decide to support him.

loans.use: Purchasing of plates and dishes, repair of the roof

loans.name: Virtudes

texts.en:
