Virtudes is forty-five years old, and she and her husband have two children who attend school. For three years, Virtudes has been running a small business selling vegetables to people of Los Alcarrizos community of Santo Domingo. This poor section of Santo Domingo’s periphery is densely populated, and all the neighbors know one another. So, Virtudes’s business is very successful and much visited.

With her loan, Virtudes plans on purchasing more fresh vegetables to add to her current stock. She hopes to become the most well established supplier of these goods in her area.

loans.use: To increase stock in fresh vegetables

loans.name: Agripina Isabel

texts.es:
Senora Agripina is part of the group "Women of Fair Field" and is dedicated to the sale of crafts, ceramics and chompas vests. Her business is located on the side of the Parade plaza in the city of Huarez, department of Ancash.

With a loan of $125 (300 Pen), to be recieved in 4 payements, she will buy a variety of crafts, of wool, and better jewls to sell and incrase their incomes.

She is 48 years old and has been separated from her husband for 8 years. She has 3 daughters and work in order to bring her daughters and her business ahead in life.

This story has been translated from Spanish to English by Nikita Ramchandani, KIVA Volunteer.

La señora Agripina pertenece al Grupo Mientras Tanto Mujeres del Campo ferial, se dedica a la venta artesanías, cerámicas, chompas chalecos. Su negocio esta ubicado al costado de la plaza de armas de la ciudad de Huaraz, departamento de Ancash. Con el préstamo de S/. 300.00 el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará, variedad de artesanías,de lana , joyas al por mayo para venderlos y mejorar sus ingresos. Ella tiene 48 años de edad, es separada de su esposo hace 8 años, tiene 3 hijas y trabaja para sacar adelante a sus hijas y a su negocio.

loans.use: To buy materials to vend.

loans.name: Tabitha

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 48 year old Tabitha M.. She is married and has four children aged 14, 20, 24, and 30. She also has two dependents, who live with her because they are her nephews. In 2007, Tabitha established her soap business. She requires a loan in order to purchase additional stock of soap in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility, as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock of soap in bulk.

loans.name: Pham Thi

texts.vi:
Ms. Pham Thi S., 39 years old, has joined TYM since 2004. Her family includes of her husband, herself and two young children who are still going to school. Their family main source of income are from raising pigs as well as her husband's wage as construction worker. Her husband earning is quite stable so she has been able to repay the loan regularly and on time. Each year, she sold three batch of pigs as well as one batch of fishes and can get close to a thousand dollars. The profits had been used to buy new furniture and pay for her children's education. As the cost is high, the profit have not been very large so she still need more money to invest into her business. During this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 575 USD to repair her breeding facilities and buy more pigs

Translated from Vietnamese by Anh H. Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Phạm Thị Sự, 39 tuổi, tham gia Quỹ Tình thương năm 2004. Gia đình chị gồm 2 vợ chồng và 2 con đang trong độ tuổi đi học. Nguồn thu nhập chính hiện nay của gia đình từ chăn nuôi và tiền công anh đi làm thợ xây. Do chồng đi làm công nhật nên việc hoàn trả tuần của chị Sự rất thuận lợi. Mỗi năm bán vài 3 lứa lợn và 1 vụ cá, gia đình chị Sự thu lãi vài nghìn USD. Phần lợi nhuận thu về được chị dùng mua sắm đồ đạc, chi phí cho các con ăn học. Thu nhập từ chăn nuôi cao nhưng chi phí lớn vì hiện nay giá cả đang tăng nên chị Sự rất cần có thêm vốn để đầu tư. Mức vốn đề nghị của chị Sự vòng này là 575USD để sửa chữa chuồng trại và mua con giống.

loans.use: Buy pigs

loans.name: Pov

texts.en:
Mrs. Pov M., 58, and her husband, Mr. Vanthorn Nai, 57, who live along National Road number two about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 1982 and have one son, who is a taxi driver.

Mrs. Pov has been selling blankets, mosquito nets, and scarves for just over one year. She buys them from markets in Phnom Penh for resale in her village. Her husband, Mr. Vanthorn is a mason. 
Mrs. Pov is requesting a loan of US$300 to purchase more blankets, mosquito nets, and scarves for resale.

loans.use: To purchase blankets, mosquito nets, and scarves for resale

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en:
Valentina lives in Nikopol and runs her business located in the Central Market. She became an entrepreneur only six months ago. She was in need of money and bravely started her small venture selling cosmetics and body care items. Valentina presently makes about $200 in profit each month.

Valentina is planning to use the loan of 3000 Grivnas ($US675) to increase her seasonal stock. She is always ready to work inventively to realize her personal and financial goals. We believe the client has the determination to make her business expand following the route of success and providing a supplemental income to her household.

loans.use: To increase her inventory.

loans.name: Rebeca

texts.es:
Rebeca is a member of the communal bank called " Alondras".

She's 46 years old. She's married and has 4 children, 3 of them are going to school. Rebeca goes to 2 local fairs, one located in Julcamarca and the other in Quinua, to sell her products such as vegetables and fruit. She purchases wheat/cereal products and leather material at the fairs to later sell in bulk in the city of Ayacucho. Aside from this, Rebeca also grows alfalfa in her land located in Totora which she later sells at the local supermarket in the city of Ayacucho.

Rebeca needs a loan to purchase rice, sugar and more fruit.

Rebeca's dreams are to one day buy a car so that her son can use to go to work, expand her business and to have financial stability.

Translated by a Kiva Volunteer.

Primer Préstamo: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=29927&_tpos=5&_tpg=1

Rebeca es socia del Banco Comunal Alondras.

Rebeca es casada, tiene 47 años y 4 hijos, 3 de ellos estudian, Rebeca vive en el pequeño valle de totora que se ubica a 10 minutos de la ciudad de Ayacucho, Rebeca viaja a dos ferias de la región de los distritos de Julcamarca y Quinua en donde vende abarrotes, verduras, frutas, y de las ferias compra cereales, cueros, cochinilla que vende a mayoristas en la ciudad de Ayacucho. Además Rebeca se dedica a la agricultura de alfalfa en sus terrenos de Totora, los cuales son vendidos en el mercado de abastos de la ciudad de Ayacucho.

Rebeca necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar, frutas.

Los sueños de Rebeca son comprar un carro para que trabaje su hijo, ampliar sus negocios y tener estabilidad.

loans.use: To purchase rice, sugar and fruit

loans.name: Valeriana

texts.es: Valeriana es una mujer que siempre sobresalió en la bella labor del tejido, al igual que toda su familia está profundamente  ligada a esta actividad,  gracias a sus ágiles manos logra tejer  innumerables y coloridas prendas de vestir, que luego de  reunir una buena cantidad las vende personalmente en el mercado San José  de su  ciudad natal, Juliaca.Con  esta actividad tiene la dicha de brindarles educación y tranquilidad a sus 2 hijos, quienes son el motor que la impulsa a seguir adelante, el proyecto de Valeria, y para lo que solicita este préstamo, es aumentar el volumen de producción,  está segura que obteniendo mayor cantidad  de materia prima concretará su propósito.
texts.en:
Valeriana is a woman whose work in the beautiful art of weaving always stands out. Like the rest of her family, she has strong ties to this activity. Thanks to her agile hands she has been able to weave innumerable and colorful clothing items, which she later sells personally at the San Jose Market in her native city of Juliaca. This work has allowed her to provide for the education and well-being of her two children, her constant motivators to keep making headway. Valeriana's goal, and the reason why she's requesting a loan, is to increase her production volume, which she can achieve by purchasing more raw materials (fabrics, thread, etc.).

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Acquire larger quantities of raw materials (fabric, thread) to increase production

loans.name: Savrinisso

texts.ru: Эгамбердыева Савриниссо жительница района Джиликуль. Возраст 52 года. Работает учителем в средней школе района.Кроме того имеет хозяйство , где разводит домашний скот. Планирует получить кредит для покупки молодой породистой  коровы для разведения и увеличения поголовья скота. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев. Получение возможного кредита даст возможность развивать животноводческий сектор , а так же обеспечить население мясом и молочными продуктами.
texts.en:
Savrinisso E. lives in the Jillikul region of Tajikistan. She is 52 years old and works as a school teacher. In addition, she raises livestock. Savrinisso plans to obtain a loan for purchasing a young cow of good breed. She would be able to repay the loan in the next 12 months. The loan would contribute to the development of the animal husbandry sector and supply the local population with meat and dairy products.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase a young cow

loans.name: Akouvi

texts.fr: Akouvi G. est une couturière de profession. Pour faire de belles coupes pour mieux satisfaire la clientèle, Akouvi souhaite avec ce crédit acquérir nouvelle machine à coudre et des tissus pour les revendre à la clientèle. Ceci lui permettra da gagner plus d’argent pour mieux subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants. Akouvi est mariée et mère d’un enfant. Dans la photo, elle est habillée en t-shirt raillé. Les autres personnes sont ses apprentis.
texts.en:
Akouvi G. is a seamstress by profession. To produce stylish clothing that satisfy her customers, she would like to use this loan to acquire a new sewing machine and some fabrics to resell to them. This will enable her to earn more money to provide for her children better. Akouvi is married. In the photo, she is the one dressed in a striped T-shirt. The others are her apprentices.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine and some fabrics to resell

loans.name: Luz

texts.es: Luz tiene 46 años, vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos que la apoyan en todo. Ella se dedica a la crianza de pollos desde hace 8 años, lo que le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar adecuadamente a sus pollos y que los mismos estén al gusto del cliente. Le es rentable porque es algo muy productivo, ya que cada 45 días ella empieza a vender sus aves a los compradores de su zona. Lo difícil es no contar con un galpón adecuado, ya que desde siempre los ha criado dentro de su casa. Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP. Luz necesita ampliar su galpón, comprar más pollos bebes y lo necesario en alimentos para su respectiva crianza.
texts.en:
Luz is 46-years old and lives with her husband and two children which she supports. For the last 8-years, she has dedicated herself to breeding chickens. She enjoys her job because she adequately cares for her chickens and enjoys assisting her clients. The business is very profitable as she is very productive; every 45 days she starts selling the chickens to buyers in the market.

The hard part is not having and adequate barn as she is rearing the young chicken around her house. This is the second loan with MFP for which Luz needs to expand her barn, buy more breeding chickens and chicks, as well as some much needed chicken feed to properly raise her animals.

Translated from Spanish by Jenson Abraham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To expand her barn and purchase more poultry

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of inventory (sugar, tea, milk, pasta, rice, meat, beverages, vegetables, etc.)

loans.name: Muhabbat

texts.ru: Баракаева Мухаббат проживает в районе Шахринау. Замужем и имеет шестерых детей. Муж работает таксистом . Кредит понадобился для того, чтобы закупить запчасти для ремонта автомашины мужа. погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Muhabbat B. lives in the Shahrinaw district. She is married and has six children. Her husband is a taxi driver. She needs the loan in order to buy spare parts for repairs to her husband's car. The loan will be repaid over 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of spare auto parts

loans.name: Thouch

texts.en:
Thouch R. is an elderly mother who is 55 years old. She has two childR. and lives with her husband in Prey Chor district, Kampong Cham province. She and her husband are farmers who grow and sell rice at the market to earn approximately US$ 2 every day. They are supported by two childR., one who is a garment worker and another who is a laborer.

Mrs. Thouch R. would like to take out a loan of US$ 1000 to open a grocery store that her daughter will run. Once the loan is funded, her daughter will leave her job as a garment worker to operate the grocery store.

loans.use: starting up a grocery store

loans.name: Aida

texts.en: Aida L., 50, blessed with 7 children, is a resident of Valderama, Imbatog, Cabanglasan Bukidnon. She established her retail store two years ago. She is engaged in running a small retail store to be able to increase her income. She applied for PHP 11,000 as a loan from HSPFI. She finds difficulties in supporting her family because her husband is only a laborer. With her loan received, she can now purchase additional goods for her retail store to satisfy the needs of her family and customers as well.

loans.use: Purchase goods for her retail store

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth sells provisions and clothes. She has been in this business for a long time. She hopes for the loan amount of N 100,000 to purchase more provisions and clothes to sell. She is 48 years old and married with 6 children. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and clothes to sell

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan sells crates of drinks and rechargeable phone cards to make a living. She is an active LAPO client. She hopes for the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more crates of drinks and rechargeable phone cards to sell.

She is 32 years old and married with two children. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more crates of drinks and rechargeable phone cards to sell

loans.name: Firuz

texts.en: Firuz was born in 1986. He lives in the Guba region. 2 years ago he started a dairy business. Now he needs a loan of 2000 AZN to buy 2 cows to expand his dairy business.

loans.use: to buy 2 cows

loans.name: Boymurot

texts.ru:
Куранов Боймурот – мужчина  44-х лет, женат, имеет 3-х детей.
Он  занимается откормом и продажей скота, а его жена занимается переработкой и продажей молока. Боймурот  кредитуется уже 2 года. Когда он пришел в первый раз брать кредит, у него было очень малое количество скота. Сейчас у Боймурота большое количество мелко рогатого скота. Сейчас у его жены только одна дойная корова. Боймурот планирует купить для своей жены еще одну дойную корову с теленком, и он благодарен нашим кредиторам за помощь в осуществлении его планов.
texts.en:
Boymurot K. is a 44-year-old man, who is married and has three children. He raises and sells cattle, while his wife processes and sells the milk. For two years, Boymurot has been taking out loans. When he first came for financing, he had very few cattle. Now he has a large number of small-horned cattle, but his wife only has one milk cow. Boymurot is planning to purchase an additional milk cow with a calf for his wife, and he is grateful to MicroInvest for the assistance in carrying out his plans.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cattle

loans.name: Eli -Attiégou Group

texts.fr: Cette association est composée de 04 femmes mariées avec des personnes à charges, elles exercent toutes des activités génératrices de revenu  à savoir la vente de caleçon,  des assiettes et  des céréales. Elles veulent  dynamiser l’activité sociale du groupe raison pour laquelle elle sollicite de  WAGES leur second crédit pour agrandir leur activité génératrice de revenu par l’achat de 04 sacs de riz, 02 sacs de haricots, deux douzaines de caleçons  et 04 cartons d’assiettes.
texts.en:
This association is composed of 4 married women, all of them responsible for other people. They all earn a living in various ways, for example selling men's underwear, dishes, and cereals.

They want to strengthen the charitable work the association does, and for that purpose they are requesting their second loan from WAGES to expand their businesses by buying 4 sacks of rice, 2 sacks of dried beans, 2 dozen pairs of men's underwear, and 4 cartons of dishes.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of underwear, dishes, cereals, and various items

loans.name: Eusebio Julio

texts.en:
Eusebio Julio M. is 47 years old, single, and resides in Boane. He is originally from Chibatu, where he lived until 1980. He then moved to Tete to continue his studies. He studied until the 9th grade and was forced to stop due to economic and social pressures. In 1982 he moved again from Tete to Maputo.

Eusebio provides for his 3 children between the ages of 12 and 17. He is employed by Delta Force where he has worked for the past 9 years. This will be Eusebio's third loan with Hluvuku and he intends to use it to make improvements to his home.

loans.use: Construction Materials

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma L., 32, and Lito, 37, are a young couple blessed with a three-year old child. Gemma and Lito live in a government housing project for the poor in Caloocan City. Lito is a bus driver.

Gina buys cosmetic items from different reputable brands and re-sells them to customers on short installment terms. Most of her clients are working professionals and wives of her husband's co-workers. She's been in this business for six years.  Gina earns Php 3,000.00 every week and saves a large portion of her income for the renovation of their house.  She will use her new loan to build up her inventory.

She dreams of owning a small stall to serve as a showroom for her items.  She's also dreaming of purchasing a taxi for her husband.

loans.use: To increase her inventory

loans.name: Apolonia

texts.es:
Apolonia es socia del Banco Comunal Rikchariy que significa Despierta en quechua.
Apolonia es casada, tiene 32 años y 1 hijo, Apolonia compra y vende artesanía variada como telares, adornos, productos que comercializa en la ciudad de lima y Cuzco.
Apolonia necesita un préstamo de 600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de telares.
Los sueños de Apolonia son cambiar de negocio por otro mas rentable y tener una tienda estable.
texts.en:
Apolonia is a member of “Banco Comunal Rikchariy” (Rikchariy means “Wake Up" in Quechua). Apolonia is 32 years old and she is married with one child. She buys and sells an assortment of handicrafts such as fabrics and ornaments that she sells in the cities of Lima and Cuzco. Apolonia needs a loan of 600 Soles to buy fabrics. Apolonia’s dreams are switching to a more profitable business and having a fixed store location.

Translated from Spanish by Carlos Morales, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fabrics.

loans.name: Mekobaun A1 Group

texts.en:
Matias H. lives in Bokong Village, in the Taebenu Subdistrict, of the Kupang District of East Nusa Tenggara Province in Indonesia. In the dry season, the weather in his village is quite hot and the plants turn yellow. The road to enter the village is unsealed and bumpy, and it is about a 1 hour drive from the TLM Baun Branch Office to this village.

Matias leads a group called Mekobaun A1 Group; the group has 7 members. Matias is 34, married and has been blessed with 3 little children: Musa H. - 5 years old, Ibrahim H. - 3 years old and Alfred H. - 2 years old. 

To fulfill his family’s daily needs, Matias works hard  cultivating his farm. There are coconuts, bananas and beans and corn planted on the farm. He usually starts his day at 7.00 am and works until 12.00 pm; he returns home to have lunch and rest for 1 hour and then goes back to work until 05.00 pm. He usually takes public transport to sell his agricultural products at Oeba Market. It costs IDR 15,000 per return trip. By selling his agricultural products Matias is only able to generate small income of about IDR 50,000 to IDR 150,000 per week; it depends on which crops he can harvest from the farm. Even though Matias only generates a small income from his farm  he always tries his best to supply his family needs every day. 

Matias has a plan to renovate his house, to better meet his family needs and provide a better future for his children. For this reason, Matias is interested in joining the TLM Cattle Fattening Program. He is requesting a loan amounting IDR 3,400,000 to buy cattle to be fattened over a twelve month period. He hopes that he will be able to generate profit that can be used to buy building materials to renovate his house. The other group members of Mekobaun A1 are also requesting loans to buy cattle to be fattened. All of them hope to have a better life.

loans.use: To buy cattle to be fattened

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To prepare and serve meals

loans.name: Costa

texts.en: Costa is a 43 year married with six children aged between 4and 20 years All her children go to school. She takes care of additional family members (her brother’s children). Costa resides and owns three roomed house where she is staying with ten people. There is electricity and no piped water at home  The family gets three meals a day. She resides and works in semi urban area which in the outskirts of Kampala and works seven days a week. Costa owns fries eatables like samosas chapatti and mandazi and moves Door to Door in Kawempe. She buys and doesn’t pay rent for business premises She uses public transport to and from shopping.  She sells to all categories of people and on both retail and whole saleCosta has been with MCDT for eight year servicing her twenty fourth loan, working with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to stock more baking flour cooking oil and cow peas She is aspiring of employing at least 20 employees.

loans.use: To buy cooking oil andbaking flour

loans.name: Kuña Arandu Group

texts.en:
The committee Kuña Arandú formed on June 23rd, 2009, thanks to Gregoria R., who contacted the Fundacion Pargauya on founding a Women’s Committee. After a few days they formed a group of 18 women, who are all now working with Fundacion Paraguaya.

On average, each group member took out a loan of 455,000 Gs., which is intended for different activities such as selling grocery items (rice, sugar, dairy, baked goods, meat, etc.), cosmetics, crafts, etc.

Noelia R. wants to use her loan to sell cosmetics.  
Gregoria R. wants to use her loan to sell ñandutí. 
Gloria V. wants to use her loan to sell food. 
Gilda A. wants to use her loan to sell her artwork. 
Claudia E. wants to use her loan to sell her artwork. 
Petrona J. wants to use her loan to sell food. 
Blanca E. wants to use her loan to sell her artwork. 
Marcelina A. wants to use her loan to sell her artwork. 
Luz A. wants to use her loan to sell her artwork. 
María C. wants to use her loan for her grocery store. 
Pabla V. wants to use her loan to sell chips. 
Sonia V. wants to use her loan to sell aperitifs. 
Mirta V. wants to use her loan to sell food. 
Rumilda E. wants to use her loan to sell her artwork. 
Benicia E. wants to use her loan to sell food. 
Delia R. wants to user her loan to sell her artwork. 
Laura F. wants to user her loan for teaching. 
Nadia F. wants to use her loan to be a domestic maid.

loans.use: Foodstuffs, merchandise

loans.name: Suzan Namukasa’S Group

texts.en:
Susan is a 30-year-old married woman with six children between the ages of 4 and 16.  All her school go to school. She resides in and owns a three-roomed house, where she is staying with eight people. The family has access to electricity but no piped water. 

She owns a retail shop, where she sells all day-to-day essentials. She pays for transport costs to and from where she buys her merchandise in Kikuubo, one of the busiest places in Kampala. On average she receives 20 customers a day. She works in the outskirts of Kampala. She has been in this business for six years and with MCDT for 10 years. She is servicing her 17th loan, working with the same group mates. 

Her monthly expenses include school fees and medication. Her challenges include defaulters and the rainy season, because when it rains, very few customers come to her retail shop because it is in a muddy place. Susan wants to use this loan to buy more merchandise like boxes of soap, cartons of salt, sacks of sugar and jerrycans of cooking oil. She aspires to see her business grow stronger and to start selling only on a wholesale basis.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of soap, cartoons of salt and bags of sugar

loans.name: Azizbek

texts.en:
K. Azizbek is 22 years old. For more than 4 years he has been selling DVD's and CD's. He works in the market. Azizbek orders the delivery of the disks from Russia and tries to have all new movies, concerts of the popular singers etc. The business is successful and generates the main income for the family. Today Azizbek requests $800 US Dollars to purchase the lot of DVD's, CD's for resale. Azizbek thanks all those supporting him and promises to meet his loan payments.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchase supplies of DVD's and CD's for resale

loans.name: Morgado

texts.pt:
Morgado B. nasceu no Distrito de Boane, Província de Maputo, sul de Moçambique, tem 29 anos de idade, casado e pai de 2 filhos de 2 anos de idade, e outro de 4 meses. Fez 12ª classe, actualmente continua o ensino a distância. Vive com a família numa casa alugada e ainda sustenta a mãe que vive também em Boane enviando dinheiro para despesas de casa.

Nunca saiu da sua cidade, em 2001 terminou com o curso de Professor, no Distrito da Manhiça e foi enquadrado no Ministério da Educação como Professor afecto em Boane e trabalha das 7h as 12h por dia. Aufere um salário de 5.700.00mt por mês, poupa algum na sua conta bancária.

Já teve empréstimos numa instituição de crédito (TCHUMA), depois de conhecer a Hluvuku preferiu iniciar os seus empréstimos, sendo este o seu 4º crédito, no valor de 11.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (ferro, cimento, areia e outros) para dar continuidade com a sua obra. Os empréstimos anteriores foram de 8.900.00mt,13.000.00mt e 15.000.00mt, todos para a mesma actividade.

Futuramente gostaria de solicitar mais empréstimo para concluir a sua obra, comprar mobiliário e concluir o ensino superior.
texts.en:
Morgado B. was born in southern Mozambique, in the district of Boane, Maputo province. He is 29 years old, married, and father of two children, 2 years old and 4 months old. He completed the 12th grade, and continues with distance learning. He lives with his family in a rented house, and takes care of his mother who also lives in Boane, sending her money for her household expenses. In 2001 he finished teacher's training in the district of Manhiça and was assigned by the Ministry of Education as a teacher in Boane, working from 7 to noon each day. He earns a salary of 5700 MZN a month, and manages to save some in his bank account.

Morgado used to take out loans from a credit institution (TCHUMA), but after learning about Hluvuku he chose to start getting loans through them. This is his fourth loan, in the amount of 11,000 MZN. He plans to buy construction materials (rebar, cement, sand and other) to finish building his house. The previous loans were in the amounts of 8900 MZN, 13,000 MZN, and 15,000 MZN, all for the same work. He would like to request additional loans in the future to finish his house, purchase furniture, and finish his higher education.

Translated from Portuguese by David Kaisel, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials (cement, rebar, sand and others)

loans.name: Juntas Venceremos (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El  banco comunal Juntas Venceremos es un banco que se encuentra en la ciudad de Cuenca, es una ciudad que fue declarada Patrimonio Cultural del Ecuador  por su riqueza arquitectónica y sus obras artísticas, el Centro Histórico está formado por la zona residencial más antigua, encontramos también la mayoría de iglesias con mérito arquitectónico, nuestras socias son personas que siempre lleva sus tradiciones en su corazón, su gentileza y amabilidad, siendo personas que buscan la manera de sobresalir en la vida.

La Sra. María Q. es socia del banco comunal Juntas Venceremos, vive  por la comunidad de la Calera en la ciudad de Cuenca,  tiene 42 años de edad y se encuentra casada, su esposo trabaja en la cerámica de Cuenca, es un gran pilar y ejemplo en su hogar, en esta unión conyugal han procreado 3 hijos que se encuentran de 14, 10 y 8 años de edad, su primer hijo se encuentra estudiando en el Colegio y sus dos últimos hijos están estudiando en la escuela, con el esfuerzo y sacrificio conyugal han logrado construir su casa propia.

María se dedica a los servicios de limpieza realizando este negocio hace 3 años y nos comenta que le va bien, también está comenzando con un negocio propio que es la elaboración de yogur y se encuentra realizando esta actividad hace 6 meses, aprendió la elaboración de este producto en un curso que tomo y ahora lo está poniendo en práctica, se lleva con todas las compañera del banco comunal con las que comparten sus historias de la vida cotidiana, se encuentra 3 años realizando los prestamos en la fundación y los prestamos le han beneficiado para mejorar un poco económicamente su hogar, con el nuevo préstamo que realiza en la fundación  va a invertir en la compra de  productos para la elaboración de su yogur, su mayor sueño es de ver a sus hijos ser unos profesionales y superarse en la vida.

La Sra. Sandra M. es socia del banco comunal Juntas Venceremos, vive por el sector de la Orquídeas, en la parroquia Hermano Miguel en la ciudad de Cuenca, tiene 39 años de edad, se encuentra divorciada hace 9 años, el motivo fue que su esposo viajo hacia el extranjero y se olvido de su familia y con el procreo 4 hijos, se encuentra con un nuevo compromiso con quien lleva 4 años y ha procreado 2 hijos uno se encuentra de 3 años  y su segundo hijo murió a los 25 días de nacido, la causa fue  por su enfermedad de diabetes, naciendo su hijo enfermo, su esposo trabaja como cobrador de un bus interprovincial.

Sandra se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de ropa, realizando esta actividad hace 2 años, trabaja recorriendo las fabricas en donde ya tiene conocidos y nos comenta que le está yendo bien, tiene una muy buena amistad con todas las socias del bankito, se encuentra en su tercer ciclo que realiza los prestamos en la fundación, y fue una amiga quien le incentivó  a que forme parte del banca, todos los prestamos que le han entregado le han beneficiado en su negocio y para su enfermedad, con el préstamo que recibe de fundación Espoir lo va a invertir en su negocio, su mayor sueño es de salir del país para darles un mejor futuro a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The Juntas Venceremos Communal Bank is a bank in the city of Cuenca. It is a city that was declared the Cultural Patrimony of Ecuador for its fine architecture and artistic works. The Historical Center is formed by the oldest residential area. We can also find there the majority of churches of architectural value. Our members are people who always carry their traditions, their grace, and their kindness in their hearts. They are people looking for a way to succeed in life. María Q. is a member of the Juntas Venceremos Communal Bank. She lives in the Calera community in the city of Cuenca. She is 42 and married. Her husband works with ceramics in Cuenca. She is a great pillar and example in her household. They have three children who are 14, 10, and 8. Her first son is studying in college, and the last two are in school. With marital effort and sacrifice they have been able to build their own home. María has been providing cleaning services for three years. She tells us that it is going well. She is also starting her own business making yogurt. She has been doing this for six months. She learned how to make this product in a course that she took. Now she is putting it into practice. She gets along with all of her colleagues in the communal bank. She shares stories of daily life with them. She has been working with loans from the foundation for three years. The loans have benefited her household economic situation a little. She will use the new loan from the foundation to buy products to make yogurt. Her greatest dream is to see her children become professionals and succeed in life. Sandra M. is a member of the Juntas Venceremos Communal Bank. She lives in the Orquídes sector in the Hermano Miguel parish in the city of Cuenca. She is 39, and she has been divorced for nine years. Her husband traveled abroad and forgot his family. She had four children with him. She has been in a new relationship for four years. They have two children. One is three years old. The second child died 25 days after being born. The cause was her diabetes, and he was born sick. Her husband works as an interprovincial bus conductor. Sandra sells all types of clothes. She has been doing this for two years. She goes to the factories where she knows people. She tells us that it is going well. She has a good friendship with all of the members of their bank. She is in her third cycle of loans with the foundation. A friend motivated her to become part of the bank. All of the loans she has received have benefited her business and helped her illness. With this loan from the Espoir Foundation she will invest in her business. Her biggest dream is to leave the country to give her children a better future.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy milk, natural yogurt, and clothes like t-shirts and pants, etc.

loans.name: Sambaur

texts.en: Mrs. Sambaur M. lives in Kraing Sbaek village in Takeo province. She is farmer who owns a small piece of land where she cultivates rice to earn a living. Her husband, Mr. Nheom Phon, makes pots to sell. In this business, he has a problem because he wants to deliver his pots to his customers, so his wife decided to ask for a loan to buy a horse who will pull a cart to deliver the pots.  Mrs. Sambaur M. is the mother of six children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the other four are attending the local school and the youngest one is only one year old and too young to work or study. Her husband is present on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy a horse to help deliver goods

loans.name: Vouch Heang

texts.en:
Mrs. Vouch Heang C. lives in Mok Sinath village in Kandal province. She is a farmer who owns a 1.5-hectare field where she cultivates rice to earn a living. In this plantation, she now faces some problems because her field is infertile and she does not have enough water to support the field. She decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer while with the rest of the loan she will hire a water machine to water her crops.

Her husband, Mr. Sinart Mok, is a farmer who is shown on the right of the photo. Mrs. Vouch Heang C. is the mother of six children one of whom is a construction worker, another is a farmer while three are students in the local school and the youngest one is too young to study or work.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and to hire a water machine to water her crops.

loans.name: Mariatou

texts.fr: Née en 1974 à Tchaorou au Nord du Bénin, L. Mariatou  est mariée à TAÏROU Djiman et est mère de trois enfants. Tous les enfants sont scolarisés.  Mariatou s’est installée depuis quatre ans à Avotrou à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, où elle vit avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la famille. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et assurer les charges de la famille, Mariatou vend de l’igname, de la farine de cossette d’igname et de charbon de bois à son domicile. Mariatou s'approvisionne à Tchaorou, au Nord du Bénin. Il y a près de 11 ans que Mariatou mène cette activité, et Mariatou a déjà obtenu quatre crédits qu'elle a bien remboursé auprès de ALIDé. Mariatou ambitionne renforcer son fonds de roulement et élever le niveau de son activité, afin de satisfaire la demande de plus en plus élevée de ses clients. C'est la raison pour laquelle Mariatou sollicite un cinquième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Born in 1974 in Tchaorou, in the North of Bénin, Mariatou L. is married to Djiman Tairou and is the mother of three children. All three children attend school. Four years ago, Mariatou settled in Avotrou in Cotonou, the economic capital of Bénin, where she lives with her children and husband. The couple shares the family responsibilities. To meet her needs and to fulfill family responsibilities, Mariatou sells yams, flour made from yams, and charcoal from her home. Mariatou gets her supplies in Tchaorou, in the north of Bénin. Mariatou has been doing this type of work for nearly 11 years, and she has already received four loans which she has paid back to ALIDé. Her ambition is to increase her working capital and to raise her level of activity in order to satisfy the growing demand of her clients. This is why Mariatou is requesting a fifth loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Shannon Arnold, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sacks of whole and sliced yams

loans.name: Florentino

texts.es:
el señor Florentino O. tiene 35 años de edad, es casado con la sra. Reina Molina, su esposa le ayuda en el hogar con sus hijos.
Florentino es una persona muy humilde y trabajadora, se dedica a la venta de pescado y a veces hace el trabajo de albañil.
tiene 3 años de dedicarse a esta actividad.
Florentino esta solicitando el credito para la compra de pescado seco ya que se aproxima la epoca de semana santa en donde se vende bastante este producto para la fabricacion de la sopa de torta de pescado. esta es una sopa muy sabrosa y tipica de Honduras.
texts.en:
Mr. Florentino O. is 35 years old, and is married to Mrs. Reina Molina, his wife who helps him in the home with their children.

Florentino is a very humble and hardworking person; he sells fish and sometimes works as a mason. He has 3 years of experience in this activity.

Florentino needs the loan to buy dried fish since holy week is nearing and he sells a lot of this product to prepare a traditional fish cake soup. This soup is very delicious and characteristic of Honduras.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fish.

loans.name: Sunday

texts.en:
Sunday Y. is currently in the business of selling greens at the market and is requesting a loan to purchase more greens, vegetables and fruits, to sell. Sunday is 60 years old and is widowed. She has five children, and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to further educate her children.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase more greens, vegetables and fruits to sell

loans.name: Phelomina

texts.en:
Phelomina A. cooks banku (locally called by the Fante’s as 'etiw') and fried fish to sell at Elmina. She is married and has been blessed with two children. She has been through junior high education. Phelomina has been selling banku with fried fish for some time now. Her husband is into wood work production. Phelomina uses her income generated from her banku business to help her husband take care of the home. Phelomina will add the loan to her income to purchase bags of maize for banku to be able to meet the demands of her customers. With the new profits that may accrue from her expanded business, Phelomina plans to reinvest back into her business. 

To prepare her banku, she makes sure she gets her corn dough. (Maize that has been milled and left for a day. usually after milling, is not used immediately but left until the following day before it can be used.) and cassava dough. She makes a mixture with the cassava and corn dough in a porridge form, stirring on fairly hot heat for sometime to get a firm but fine texture, a texture firm enough to be eaten. The accompanying dish can either be any kind of soup or sauce of your taste such as palm nut soup, groundnut soup or peanut soup, okra soup, hot pepper sauce with fish of any kind.

loans.use: To purchase maize for banku

loans.name: Josefa

texts.en: Josefa A. is from the village of Upper Centro, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is 65 years old, is widowed, and has one adult child. Josefa owns and operates a business selling personal home products to tourists and local community members. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2007, Josefa joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Josefa is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will again be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her 4th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Rwenyangi Group

texts.en:
A friendly and hardworking N. Beatrice, aged 45 years, is happily married with a family of five children aged between 25 and 10 years.

Beatrice’s business story began way back in 2000. She started up a restaurant preparing local dishes and this has contributed a lot towards the welfare of her family. By being strategically located and handling her customers with good customer care, she has been able to  keep her customers.

This loan is to help Beatrice in modernizing her business with new furnishings that are eye-catching to bring customers into her business. With that she will be able to realize more sales and profits that will trigger her development economically, and enable her to meet the day-to-day expenses and general welfare of her family.

loans.use: To buy furnishings for her restaurant

loans.name: María Zoila

texts.es:
María Zoila  P. es otra  socia del banco comunal  San Pedro, vive  en una casa arrendada  en la comunidad San Pedro en la parroquia Victoria de Portete en la parte suroccidental del cantón Cuenca.  En éste lugar encontramos  un majestuoso monumento en honor a los héroes de la Batalla de Tarqui, en este lugar se libró la batalla entre los ejércitos ecuatoriano comandado   por el Gral. Antonio José de Sucre y el peruano.

 Es nuestra socia  hace tres ciclos y es una mujer muy dinámica de  30 años, es casada y ha concebido seis hijos que se encuentran de 13, 11, 9, 7, 5, 1 años, sus cinco hijos estudian  en la escuela de la comunidad, su esposo es aserrador de árboles y ella se dedica a la costura hace diez años, esta labor la realiza en su  casa y  su especialidad es el bordado de polleras arte que le  enseño una compañera, no tiene un horario fijo ya que todo depende de las obras que tenga que realizar. Con el  crédito que obtendrá  va a comprar cuyes, pollos y alimento para iniciar un nuevo negocio de esta manera  tener otra fuente de ingresos.

Su meta es de terminar su casa que aún está en construcción.
texts.en:
María Zoila P. is a member of the San Pedro Communal Bank. She lives in a rented house in the San Pedro community in the Victoria de Portete parrish. It is in the southwest part of the Cuenca canton. This is the place where we find the majestic monument honoring the heroes of the Battle of Tarqui. This site is where the battle took place between the Peruvian army and the Ecuadorian army commanded by General Antonio José de Sucre. She has been a member for three cycles. She is a very dynamic 30 year old woman. She is married and has six children. They are 13, 11, 9, 7, 5, and 1 years old. Five of her children go to school in the community. Her husband cuts trees. She has been working as a seamstress for ten years. She does this in her house, and her specialty is embroidering t-shirts. A friend taught her this art. She does not have a fixed schedule because everything depends upon the work that she has to do. She will use the loan to buy guinea pigs, chicken, and feed to start a new business. This way she will have another source of income. Her goal is to finish her house, which is still under construction.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy guinea pigs, chicken, and feed to start a new business

loans.name: Elvia Soledad

texts.es:
Elvia de 62 años, vive en una zona urbana en el Guasmo de Guayaquil, es viuda pero tiene tres hijos de 42, 33 y 31 años, hace 22 años atras falleció su esposo y tuvo que ingeniarse un plan para que sus hijos terminaran de estudiar, aunque sus ahorros no eran muchos Elvia los invirtió en víveres y los empezo a vender en las afuera de su casa. 

Poco a poco con esfuerzo y dedicación Elvia tuvo ingresos para una pequeña tienda y asi darle una mejor vida a sus hijos, en la actualidad trabaja desde las 06h30am hasta las 23:00pm todos los dias. Vende dulces, bebidas, arroz, etc. Con el préstamo quiere comprar arroz, bebidas, papeleria para su tienda. 

En el futuro quiere terminar de construir su casa, y poder tener mas tiendas para sus hijos.
texts.en:
Elvia is 62 years old and lives in an urban area of Guasmo de Guayaquil. She is a widow but she has three children, ages 42, 33 and 31. Her husband died 22 years ago and she had to come up with a plan so her children could finish school. Although she didn't have much savings, Elvia invested in supplies and started to sell items outside of her home. Little by little with hard work and dedication, Elvia used the income to open a small store and thus provide a better life for her children. Currently she works from 6:30 a.m. until 11 p.m. every day selling candies, soft drinks, rice, etc. With the loan, she plans to purchase rice, soft drinks and stationery supplies for her store. In the future she wants to finish construction on her home and be able to have more stores for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice, soft drinks and stationery supplies

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose A. is currently in the business of selling food at her restaurant and is requesting a loan to stock more supplies of beans and rice.  Rose is 42 years old and married. Her husband is a police man. She has 4 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to secure a house for her children.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To buy more supplies of beans and rice for her restaurant

loans.name: Poline

texts.en:
N. Poline is 18 years old and lives in the town of Kinoni in the Masaka area of Uganda.  She is single, has no children, and is currently out of school.  Poline has a business in Kinoni selling coffee beans to local buyers in her village.  She has had this business for over two years now.

To expand her business, Poline is requesting a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used for buying greater supplies of coffee beans which she will then resell at her business.  Poline hopes to expand her young coffee business and generate more profit in order to contribute financially to her family. 


Note to lenders: BRAC Uganda has recently begun posting a new loan product to Kiva which funds young entrepreneurs in BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program.  This Kiva borrower is receiving a new ELA loan. The ELA program first provides disadvantaged adolescents, usually girls who are out of school, with livelihood training and financial literacy skills.  Afterwards, ELA participants can receive microfinance loans to expand their small businesses.  

These loans offer adolescents a unique chance to access finance at a young age and improve their prospects for the future, and target a segment of the population not typically served by traditional microfinance.  Kiva is privileged to partner with BRAC Uganda in posting these new loans, and give Kiva lenders the opportunity to fund deserving young entrepreneurs and support a promising new sector in microfinance.

loans.use: Additional coffee to sell

loans.name: Alrey

texts.en:
Alrey B. is from the town of Katipunan. He is 30 years old, married, and has four school-aged children. To make a living, he provides VCD and DVD rental services to local community members. He has been engaged in his business for over two years and earns approximately $215 a month from these activities.

In 2009, Alrey joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from PMPC. 

Alrey is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding his business. This will be his 3rd loan from PMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to continue to expand his business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Rona Lorraine

texts.en:
Rona Lorraine G. is from the town of San Fabian Echague. She is 29 years old. Rona Lorraine is single. To make a living, Rona Lorraine owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. Aside from that, she also retails rice grain in her store. Rona Lorraine has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 13500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Rona Lorraine joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Rona Lorraine has successfully repaid a previous loan of 50000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Rona Lorraine is requesting a new loan of 50000 PHP which will again be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the fifth loan taken out by Rona Lorraine from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Titus Ndugi

texts.en:
Titus is a 21 year old single man. He buys maize, sweet potatoes and groundnuts, which he cooks and sells to his customers.  He has been in the business for a period of about two years. He gets a monthly income of KES 20,000 per month.

He wants to use his loan to improve on his business by buying more maize and groundnuts to sell. He hopes to expand his business and be a distributor.

loans.use: To buy more maize, sweet potatoes and tomatoes to sell.

loans.name: Champion Group

texts.en:
Watchie G., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called Champion. She is 41 years old, married and has five children who range from 15 to 25 years old. She was only able to attend school through ninth grade due to a lack of funds. For four years Watchie has been selling lappas (a traditional dress for women) in Redlight Market in Paynesville, outside of Monrovia, Liberia. She describes herself as a hard-working woman.

Watchie plans to use her 6,000 LRD portion of this 30,000 LRD group loan to buy more lappas. Her goal is to expand her business and build a house.

loans.use: To buy more lappas

loans.name: Mary  Moige

texts.en:
Mary Moige, 40 years old, is married to Kennedy, a civil servant, and they have six children aged between 8 and 20 years old. They live in mwimto;kikuyu. Mary has been running a posho (maize) mill as a primary business and also practicing dairy and  poultry farming as a secondary business. She has been operating these businesses since 2005 and she earns a profit of KES 10,000 per month.

Mary was introduced to KADET LTD by a friend who is also a member of KADET microfinance. She applying for her third loan of KES 30,000, which she plans to use to buy sacks of maize to grind and chicken and animal feeds to add to her stock. The income that she hopes to earn will be ploughed back into the businesses. 

In the future, she hopes to eventually increase her dairy cows to ten and to be able to distribute fresh milk to her neighborhood. Her businesses have given much support to her family, especially in providing the necessary basics such as food and school fees for her six children, one of whom was an orphan. Mary is hardworking and hopes to give her children a better education

loans.use: To buy chicken and animal feeds and sacks of maize to grind

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase feed for her dairy cattle

loans.name: Lois

texts.en:
Lois S., 46, is married to Kroeun, 45, who is a local farmer and motor taxi driver. The couple is blessed with two kids who are still enrolled in school. She produces furniture such as cradles and mats. She also saves many sets of these items and then sells them to a wholesaler. She purchases small pieces of clothing in bulk at the cheapest cost from garment factories and turns them into furniture to sell. 

Currently, her husband wants to start a new workshop for mending motorcycles in front of his house in order to earn more profits and to support the family's expenses. She said that her savings is not enough for opening this workshop. So Lois S. will take out a loan to open the workshop for her husband's business.

loans.use: To open a workshop for her husband's business

loans.name: Aurora Elizabeth

texts.es:
En la ciudadela El Progreso de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal  Ilusiones, esta es una zona urbano marginal muy poblada en esta ciudad se la conoce como el sector de la cárcel ya que en esta zona queda la cárcel de mujeres de Portoviejo.

En este lugar encontramos a la señora Aurora ella tiene 23 años de edad,  está casada y fruto de esta relación tiene dos hijos de 4 y 1 año. El esposo trabaja en una vulcanizadora.

Se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta,  tiene muchas clientes que le que hacen los pedidos con anticipación. Trabaja cuatro días en la semana en la entrega y cobros ya que deja a crédito y cobra por quincena. Su mercadería la compra en Guayaquil cada quince días  o al mes de acuerdo a los pedidos que tenga y la urgencia de estos.
 
Este crédito es para comprar ropa ya que le han pedido para esta quincena y quiere cumplir con sus clientes. Está en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio y le gusta por la seriedad de sus compañeras del Banco.
 
Su sueño es llegar a ser una gran empresaria.
texts.en:
In the El Progresso neighborhood of Portoviejo the Ilusiones community bank meets every two weeks.  This is a very densely-populated, marginal urban area of the city which is known as 'the prison sector' because the Portoviejo women's prison is located in this area.

This is where we find Aurora who is 23 years old, married, and has two children aged 4 and 1.  Her husband works in a tire repair shop.

Aurora sells all types of clothes door to door.  She has many customers who make advance orders.  She works four days a week delivering clothes and taking payment since she leaves the clothes with her customers on credit and collects payment every two weeks.  She buys her goods in Guayaquil every two weeks or every month depending on how many orders she has and how urgent they are.

This loan will be used to buy clothes since her customers have made orders this fortnight and she would like to be able to fulfil them.  Aurora has been with the community bank from the start and she likes it because her fellow bank members are very responsible.

Her dream is to become a big businesswoman.

loans.use: To buy clothes

loans.name: Rina Yanira

texts.es: Rina Yanira H. D. R. D. 38 años D. edad, posee una sala D. belleza, en la cual realiza cortes D. cabello, tintes, pedicure, manicure, faciales y todo lo relacionado con el cuidado D. la imagen. Ella vive junto a su esposo y junto a dos hijos menores D. edad. Rina colocó su propio negocio en su casa D. habitación con el enorme deseo D. mejorar la estabilidad económica D. su casa, ella es una persona muy trabajadora y visionaria la cual no solo realiza diferentes tipos D. servicios, sino también comercializa perfumes, tratamiento para el cuidado del cabello, peines, cremas para el cuerpo, shampoo y otros productos más, a pesar que cuenta con un año y medio D. poseer su negocio, en la actualidad cuenta con varios clientes, quienes se sienten a gusto con el trabajo hecho por Rina y por sus precios tan accesibles. Ella solicita un préstamo con el fin D. poder comprar mayor cantidad D. productos, así mismo introducir a su salón nuevas marcas las cuales son D. mucho prestigio, con lo que desea atraer más clientes a quienes les pueda elaborar un mejor trabajo.
texts.en: Rina Yanira R. H. is 38 years old and has a beauty salon where she provides hair cuts, dyes, pedicures, manicures, facials and everything related to image care. She lives with her husband and with her two young children. Rina placed her own business in her home with the enormous desire to improve the economic stability of her home. She is a very hardworking and visionary woman who not only performs different types of services but also sells perfumes, hair treatments, body lotions, shampoos and other products. Despite only having owned her business for one and a half years, she currently has several clients who are comfortable with Rina's work and with her affordable prices. She is requesting this loan to buy more products in order to introduce new brands in her salon which are more prestigious so that she can attract more customers.

loans.use: Purchase products for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Urugero Group

texts.en:
Viviana is 30 years old, married, and has four children, two of whom attend school.  Her husband is a farmer. Viviana is a leader of the borrowing group called Urugero, which means Example for Others, in Kinyarwanda. Viviana sells beans and she has had this business for about four years. The group members sell different commodities at the local marketplace. 

Viviana has requested this loan to buy more beans to sell. She hopes to buy a house from the profits. In the future, she would like to have stock which is valued at 1,000,000 RWF and a shop of the same value.

loans.use: To buy more beans to sell

loans.name: Alba Ii Group

texts.es:
La Banca Comunal “ALBA II” iniciará su  tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, en el Centro Focal de Villa Exaltación.  Está compuesta por diez integrantes.  La mesa directiva está compuesta por la presidenta, tesorera y secretaria de actas. Los negocios que ellas desempeñan son variados: venta de frazadas, venta de ropa, venta de dulce, venta de conservas, pasanacu, bazar, venta de cosméticos, venta de conservas, venta de licores y dulces, producción de gallinas.

En el caso de la presidenta, señora Jhaneth  tiene el negocio de venta de ropa desde hace tres años, realiza sus ventas en la Feria de la zona 16 de Julio. 
Cuando se le consulta sobre lo que le gusta de Pro Mujer ella indica que le gusta el tipo de garantía con la que se otorga el crédito, es decir la garantía solidaria, mancomunada e indivisible.
texts.en:
The ALBA II community bank is beginning its third loan cycle with Pro Mujer, in the Villa Exaltación regional office.  The group has ten members.  The executive committee is made up of a president, treasurer and secretary.  The members' businesses are varied: selling blankets, selling clothes, selling sweet treats, selling jams, 'pasanacu' (community solidarity fund), store, selling cosmetics, selling jams, selling liquor, selling sweet treats and raising chickens.

Jhaneth, the group's president, has had a business selling clothes for three years.  She makes her sales in the '16 de Julio' district market.

When we ask Jhaneth what she likes about Pro Mujer she answers that she likes the type of guarantee with which the loans are awarded, that is to say a mutually-binding, joint and indivisible guarantee.

loans.use: To buy clothes

loans.name: Walter Wilfredo

texts.es: Walter Wilfredo L. de 52 años de edad, vive junto a su compañera de vida en el calvario en el departamento de Usulután. Walter es un hombre muy trabajador el cual se dedica a la venta de zapatos, su venta es ambulante ya que a diario el debe colocar sus productos en la acera del centro de Usulután, un lugar muy concurrido y de mucho comercio. La venta de zapatos es la única fuente de ingresos con la que él cuenta para tener todo lo necesario para vivir, es por esta razón que ella solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de zapatos en diferentes estilos y tallas, el mayor deseo de Walter es el poder aprovechar esta temporada navideña y de esta forma mejorar sus ingresos y así invertir aún más en su venta.
texts.en:
Walter is 52 years old and lives with his life companion in El Calvario, Usulatan department.  Walter is a hard working man dedicated to selling shoes.  He does so on the streets, and every day he has to place his merchandise on the sidewalks of central Usulutan, a much-frequented location that offers lots of commerce.

Shoe sales is the only source of income Walter can count on to provide all that is necessary to live, and for that reason he is requesting a loan in order to purchase more shoes in different styles and sizes.  Walter's greatest desire is to be able to take advantage of this Christmas season and improve his income, in order to invest even more in his sales.

loans.use: TO BUY SHOES TO SELL

loans.name: Ellaindina's Group

texts.en: Ellaindina O. owns and operates a general store selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in her community. She is 31 years old, married and has two school-aged children. They are from the village of Brgy. Tucal, Solano, Nueva Vizcaya. Ellaindina has been in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2007, Ellaindina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from ASKI which was used to purchase additional products to sell. Ellaindina is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This will be her seventh loan from ASKI. She plans to use additional income to improve the general living conditions of her family. Ellaindina is the leader of a seven member group accessing a loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Abdukholik

texts.en: Abdukholik runs a small business, selling household goods in Khujand’s busy central market called Panjshanbe. He is married with two children. After school, he was not able find a good-paying job, so he decided to go into business for himself. He has now been self-employed in his current business for eight years and is the sole breadwinner for his family. Abdukholik is very determined and serious about his business. These characteristics have helped him promptly repay six loans from IMON International. Maintaining a reasonable pricing policy and client-friendly service have always been priorities in Abdukholik’s work and have ensured the success of his business. Abdukholik is asking for a loan of $3,000 to increase his assortment of goods. The loan will not only be beneficial for Abdukholik’s business as it will promote its expansion, but it will also help him meet his household expenses and set aside some savings for future needs. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road and for the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing more foodstuffs for increasing the range of goods for selling

loans.name: Va

texts.en:
The woman shown in the picture above, Mrs. Va S. is a 49-year-old farmer residing in the rural area of Kompong Cham province. To earn a living, she sell Khmer noodle in the morning to the neighbors in and around her community. Beside this work, she has also been planting the rice crop that is her annual business. Mrs. Va S. was married, but she divorced from her husband several years ago. She lives with her three children; all of whom are single, and one of them is working in the ferment factory as a sewing worker, earning a profit of approximately $80 per month. Her daughter always shares her salary with Mrs. Va S. to use in the daily expenses. 

Because her daughter doesn’t have her own vehicle to ride to work, Mrs. Va S. would like to ask for a loan to buy a new motorbike for her daughter to ride to her job location.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike for her daughter to ride to her job.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel A. is from the village of Malinao, Banisilan, Cotabato. She is 29 years old. Maricel is married and has one infant. To make a living, Maricel owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling animal feed & farm-related products in the local community. Maricel has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Maricel joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maricel has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Maricel is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional stock of chicken and hog feeds. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Maricel from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock of chicken and hog feeds

loans.name: Nehemiah

texts.en:
Nehemiah is a farmer from the town of Nyamira in western Kenya. He has been practicing mixed farming for the last 14 years. His mixed farm produces tea, milk and bananas, which are sold to the local market. He also earns income from his business selling cows to the local market.

Nehemiah is 36 years old and married with four school-aged children who all attend school.

He has requested a loan of 40,000 KES through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The extra income from this loan will help improve the living standards of his family. His primary challenges in this business have been hailstorms, which affects his production, price fluctuations and lack of a ready market for his products.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Seam

texts.en:
Mrs. Seam A. (in the photo) lives in a village across the Mekong River, approximately twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City. She has four children - two sons and two daughters. One has full-time employment, one is a construction worker, one is weaver and another one is in school. 

Seam sells mangoes. She buys them under contract from her fellow villagers and transports them to sell in the Phnom Penh market. Her husband assists her in the business. Seam is asking for her first loan of $1,000 to purchase additional mangoes for resale.

loans.use: to purchase mangoes under contract for resale

loans.name: Cirila

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SANTA ROSITA DE AYLLUPAMPA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Cirila; ella tiene 39 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de crianza de pollos y también se dedica a trabajar en un hospedaje y los pollos lo vende en forma independiente en la provincia de Urubamba por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere tener un lugar más amplio donde pueda vender los pollos. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar pollos y alimentos para los animales.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Cirila is a member of the "SANTA ROSITA DE AYLLUPAMPA" communal bank, located in the district of Urubamba, province of Urubamba, department of Cusco.

She is 39 years old, married with 2 children. As well as her daily activities she has a chicken raising business. She also works in a hostel. She sells the chickens independently in the province of Urubamba. Thanks to this business she is able to support her children. She'd like to have a larger place where to sell the chickens. She is requesting a loan to buy chickens and chicken feed. She is happy with the loan and is committed to repaying it as agreed.

loans.use: to buy chickens and chicken feed.

loans.name: Etienne

texts.en: Etienne is 31 years old.  He has 4 children who are between one and nine years old. Two of his children are in school, while the other two are not yet school age. Etienne’s wife is a farmer. Etienne sells sorghum and makes a drink, called Ubushera, out of it (that's the drink in the photo).  He also sells Irish potatoes at wholesale. This business has helped Etienne feed his family. He is requesting a loan to buy more sorghum and will stock enough to make more of the sorghum drink.

loans.use: to buy sorghum.

loans.name: Carlos Alexander

texts.es:
Carlos, reside en Usulután, es soltero, vive con sus padres, es empleado y posee un taller de motocicletas, su trabajo es en Moto Star y al mismo tiempo tiene un taller en su casa.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para mejorar el local del taller y compra de repuestos para motocicletas, para ampliar el local necesita hierro, cemento y arena, entre otros materiales, este préstamo le ayudara para adquirir estos materiales.
Su aspiración es crecer en el negocio, ya que quiere ir mejorando su condición económica y la de la familia.
texts.en:
Carlos lives in Usulután, he his single and lives with his parents. He is an employee and he also owns a motorcycles garage. He works for Moto Star*, and he runs a garage in his house as well.
The loan he is currently requesting will be used to make improvements to his garage and to buy motorcycle spare parts. To extend the garage he needs iron, cement and sand among other materials, and this loan will help him purchasing such materials.
He hopes that his activity will grow, as he wants to improve his own economic condition as well as that of his family.

<cite>*Moto Star is a car company in El Salvador.</cite>

loans.use: To buy iron, cement, sand and motorcycle spare parts.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fruit and vegetable vending business in the Philippines.
