She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more stock of vegetables and fruit to sell in her stall.

Evelyn has been in this business for 11 years. Evelyn earns more income from clothing sales.

Evelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables and fruit to sell

loans.name: Gea

texts.en:
Gea is 30 years old and is married. She has 3 children aged 4, 6 and 8.

Gea manages a coconut farm. She makes copra to sell. She also tills a small parcel of land for growing rice. Gea applied for a loan so she could buy rice seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. She hopes to earn more and save for her children's future.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Oyun

texts.en: Oyun is a 55-year-old widow who lives with her four children in a house in the Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. Her two eldest children are construction workers, while the youngest one goes to college. With the help of her daughter, Oyun manages a traditional Mongolian clothing business in a rented stall at a trading center. She graduated college as a tailor in 1977 and worked at a public center until 1999, when she started her business. She is one of the most experienced tailors in her town. Now she has many regular customers and 1,200,000 MNT worth of working capital. She makes a variety of traditional Mongolian clothes for all ages. Her products are well-known amongst her customers for their quality and durability. She is a polite and hardworking lady who says, "One must possess a good character in order to have a pleasant life." She is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan to purchase materials for her business.  She is planning to renew her equipment soon.

loans.use: to purchase materials for her business

loans.name: Jorge Heberto

texts.es: Jorge Heberto tiene 3 hijos menores de edad, su actividad económica es la venta de leña y leche. Tiene más de 30 años en su negocio por lo que ha buscado la forma de mejorar cada día su negocio, algunas veces no tiene muchas ganancias debido a fuertes lluvias y algunos clientes no le compran, pero esto no lo detiene a salir adelante con su actividad. El crédito que solicita es para la compra de leña en gran cantidad y así mejorar sus ganancias.
texts.en: Jorge Heberto has three children who are all underage. He works selling wood and milk. He has been in this business for more than 30 years. Every day he seeks ways to improve his business. During some periods he has a low income because of heavy rains that prevent his customers from buying his goods. However, this doesn't prevent him from getting ahead in his business. The loan he is requesting is to purchase large quantities of wood so that he can improve his income.

loans.use: to purchase wood.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 37 years old, married and has four children. One of the children works.

Ali has owned a generator since 2008.  He distributes power lines for houses. He has more than three years experience and has a good reputation. He is well known in his area.

He is requesting a $3,000 loan to build a soundproof room for the generator. He is aiming to gain more profits so he can improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To build a soundproof room for his generator.

loans.name: Rafael

texts.es: Rafael, tiene la edad de 39 años, está casado  y vive con sus 4 hijos y su esposa que son su mayor prioridad. El pretende con el crédito realizar la compra de los insumos para asistir la siembra de su cafetal. El cuenta con un terreno establecido en un área de excelentes condiciones para la producción, por lo cual opto por repoblar el cultivo. El piensa establecer un cafetal en muy buenas condiciones para la producción de café esta próximas cosecha y así generar ganancias. El tiene como meta generar los ingresos necesario para salir adelanta con su familia y con los pagos del crédito. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Rafael is 39 years old and married. He lives with his wife and four children who are his greatest priority. Rafael intends to use this loan to buy supplies for planting coffee. He has a plot of land in an established area that has excellent conditions for production. For this reason, he chose to plant this crop. Rafael plans to establish a coffee plantation with very good conditions for production in subsequent harvests so that he can generate revenue. His goal is to earn the necessary income to move his family forward and repay his loan.

This is the first loan he has received from FUDECOSUR. Rafael has not had any other loans with the state banks. FUDECOSUR is providing this loan with better terms and a lower interest rate.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for planting coffee.

loans.name: Mwanalima

texts.en:
Mwanalima earns her living by selling khangas (garments made with traditional fabrics) to her neighbors and to passers-by. She has been engaged in this business for two years. Her primary challenge is competition from other khanga sellers in the area. 

She is a single woman who lives with her extended family in a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

With the Kshs 20,000 loan, she wants to purchase 30 pieces of khangas to offer for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase 30 pieces of khangas to offer for resale

loans.name: Gmtb-Djeffa Group

texts.fr: Le groupe GMTB-DJEFFA est composé de neuf personnes qui sont des artisans et qui mènent des activités communes au Bénin. C'est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. Le représentant du groupe, du nom de Tadagbé Augustin est celui qui a la main levée sur la photo. Tadagbé est âgé de 46 ans et est mariée à une revendeuse du nom de Yvette. Le couple a quatre enfants  tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Tadagbé Augustin vit ensemble avec sa femme et ses enfants. Les diverses charges de la maison sont assurées par le couple. Pour y parvenir, Tadagbé Augustin a appris la maçonnerie. A côté de cette activité Tadagbé Augustin fait l'élevage des porcs. Tadagbé Augustin mène cette activité depuis dix ans. Tadagbé Augustin s’approvisionne au Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Tadagbé Augustin sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe GMTB-DJEFFA, un premier crédit.
texts.en:
The nine members of the GMTB-DJEFFA are artisans who work together in Benin. This is the first time that the group has asked for assistance from ALIDé, in order to increase their level of activity. 

The group's representative, Tadagbé Augustin, is standing in the photo, with his hand raised. He is 46 years old and married to a retailer named Yvette. The couple has four children, all of whom have received schooling and are in their care. Tadagbé Augustin lives with his wife and four children. Household expenses are taken care of by the couple. In order to meet these expenses, Tadagbé Augustin learnt the trade of masonry. Alongside this, he raises pigs - an activity that he began 10 years ago. He obtains his supplies in Benin. In order to satisfy his customers and to increase his turnover and income, Tadagbé Augustin, along with the other group members, is requesting a loan for the first time.

loans.use: to buy accessories for masonry.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: Julia tiene 43 años, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos en su casa propia en la cual radica desde hace 6 años.Tiene 8 años de  experiencia en ventas de comida en un centro educativo cercano a su casa. Vende todos los días que hay clases y descansa los fines de semana. En esta  tarea de atender a los clientes cuenta con la ayuda de sus hijos y en ocasiones su esposo, mientras ella sirve los platos. Su puesto de ventas es un cafetín donde no solo vende comida sino también golosinas para los niños que estudian que son sus principales consumidores lo cual le permite tener más ganancias. Julia tiene metas en concreto para su negocio y se ha decidido implementar su local de ventas para que funcione en mejores condiciones.Es la quinta vez que esta solicitando un crédito con MFP  en todo este tiempo que ha solicitado crédito en un inicio de manera grupal ha demostrado su puntualidad en el pago de sus cuotas. Y en esta ocasión su dinero lo invertirá en la compra de  nuevos cubiertos y mercadería para su negocio.
texts.en:
Julia is 43 years old.  She lives with her husband and her three children in her own house, where she has resided for the last six years.  

She has eight years of experience selling food at an education center near to her home.  She works every day that there are classes, and rests on the weekends.  She has the help of her children, and occasionally her husband, in tending to the customers, while she serves the food.  Her sales location is a cafe where she doesn't just sell food, but also candies for the children students who are her main consumers; this allows her to have more earnings.

Julia has concrete goals for her business, and has decided to put them in place at her sales premises so that she works in better conditions.

This is the fifth time that she is requesting a loan through MFP.  In all this time that she has requested loans, initially as part of a group, she has demonstrated punctuality in making her repayments.  And on this occasion, the money will be invested in the purchase of new silverware and merchandise for her business.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of new silverware and merchandise for her business.

loans.name: Los Almendritos 1 Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama los almendritos 1, los integrantes del grupo decidieron ponerle este nombre, ya que en L. casa donD. se reúnen hay varios árboles D. almendros, L. historia es acerca D. L. señora Braulia GabrieL., ya que es una integrante del grupo,  cuenta con 27 años D. edad, está casada con el señor Agustín quien es campesino, tienen hijos, Ricardo, Jennifer y Daysi, D. los cuales solo dos estudian, el mayor acaba D. entrar a tercer año D. primaria, y L. menor esta en segundo D. preescolar, y L. bebe apenas tiene 10 meses, elL. se dedica a L. elaboración y venta D. antojitos mexicanos desD. hace 3 años.

Doña Braulia se decidió por ese negocio, ya que dice que tiene mucha demanda, y le genera muy buenas ganancias, además D. que quería buscar L. manera D. sacar a sus hijos adelante, para darles una muy buena calidad D. vida, invirtió su crédito en L. compra D. mas insumos como son: jitomates, variedad D. chiles, papas, cebollas, pollos, carne, maíz, aceite, sal y demás, para continuar con L. elaboración D. sus ricos platillos.

El sueño que tiene doña Gaby (como mejor L. conocen sus clientes) y espera algún día poder cumplirlo es el D. construir un local para poner su restaurante, y así tener una mejor producción, ya que es su anhelo mas granD., también para poder mejorar e incrementar sus ingresos y así continuar apoyando a sus hijos con sus estudios y asegurar su futuro.

Nos dice que los integrantes D. su grupo, son personas muy responsables, trabajadoras y puntuales, ya que tienen tiempo D. conocerse y se llevan muy bien, puesto que viven en L. misma colonia.

ElL. esta muy agradecida con fundación realidad y kiva por el apoyo del préstamo que le otorgaron, ya que gracias a esto su negocio esta mejorando mucho.

Otros D. los compañeros D. doña Gaby son: María, Anal Aura, Minerva, Ignacia, Adán, Caritina y María Julia, quienes realizan variadas actividades como: venta D. maíz, madera, pollos, comida, ropa, zapatos, refrescos, tamales y algunos abarrotes.
texts.en:
This group is called "Los Almendritos 1" ("The little almonds 1"). The members of the group decided to name it that way because there are many almond trees around the house where they gather.
This story is about Braulia GabrieL., who is a member of the group. She is 27 years old and married to Agustín, who is a rural worker. They have children named Ricardo, Jennifer and Daysi. Only two of the children go to school - the oldest one just got into the third year of elementary school, the younger one is in the second year of preschool, and the baby is only 10 months old.
She has been making and selling typical Mexican snacks for three years. Braulia decided to get into this business because she says there is much demand for it and she makes very good profits. Also, she wanted to find a way to get her children ahead in order to improve their quality of life.
She used the loan to purchase more supplies such as red tomatoes, different kinds of pepper, potatoes, onions, chicken, meat, corn, olive oil, salt, etc., so that she can continue making her tasty snacks.
Gaby (as she is better known to her customers) hopes that someday she will be able to achieve her dream. She dreams of building a place where she can establish her restaurant and increase her production, which is her biggest wish. She also wishes to improve and increase her profits so that she can continue to proviD. education for her children and ensure their future.
She reports that the members of the group are very responsible, hardworking and punctual people. They have known each other for a long time and get along very well, because they live in the same neighborhood.
She is very thankful to Fundación Realidad and Kiva for the support and the loan she has been granted, since because of it, her business has been going much better.
Other fellow members of Gaby's group are María, Anal Aura, Minerva, Ignacia, Adán, Caritina and María Julia. They are in various activities such as selling corn, wood, chickens, food, clothing, shoes, soft drinks, tamales and some groceries.

loans.use: to purchase more supplies such as red tomatoes, different kinds of pepper, potatoes, onions, chicken, meat, corn, olive oil and salt.

loans.name: Nguyễn Thị Nghĩa Group

texts.en:
Nghĩa is a 27-year-old female living in the town of Yên Phong distict - Băc Ninh province.  Nghĩa is the group leader of a four-member group loan offered by SEDA.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Yên Hậu nhóm 03.

Nghĩa is married and has one school-aged child. To making a living, Nghĩa owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector making and selling food.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling pork products in the local community. Nghĩa has had this business for over two years and earns approximately 3,500,000 Viet Nam Dong (VND) a month from these activities.

In 2010, Nghĩa joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nghĩa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,152,000 VND from SEDA, which was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. She is now requesting a new loan of 7,392,000 VND, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. The loan will be the second loan taken out by this borrower from SEDA. Nghĩa plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

1.  Mến is a 34-year-old female who is requesting a 7,392,000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock pigs.

2.  Quả  is a 45-year-old female who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock. She will use the loan to buy food for pigs and chickens.

3.  Ngọc is a 22-year-old female who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock pigs.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

Nghĩa là 27 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Yên Phong distict - Băc Ninh province.  Nghĩa là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 4 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Yên Hậu nhóm 03 (3).

Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ buôn bán các sản phẩm từ T.t heo trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Nghĩa thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 2 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Nghĩa kiếm được khoảng 3.500.000 VND.  Vào 2010, Nghĩa đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Nghĩa đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 5.152.000 VND từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua các thành phần thô cần thiết để chế tạo sản phẩm để bán.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 7.392.000 VND.

Khoản vay sẽ là 2nd khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.

Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:

1.  Mến là 34 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 7.392.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi lợn.

2.  Quả  là 45 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi lợn và gà.

3.  Ngọc là 22 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi lợn.

Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam

*L. ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Kijembe Group

texts.en:
Ashifa, who is in her early 30s, is married and has four children, three of whom go to school. She has had a business selling clothes for the past two years. She works from 8 a.m to 7 p.m. daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit. 

This will be her first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She wants to use the loan to buy more clothes, fabrics, and sarongs to sell. She sells door to door. Her dream is to one day be able to open a beauty salon.

She will share this loan with her loan group "Kijembe," which has a total of 16 members. Members hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: To buy more clothes, fabrics, and sarongs

loans.name: Dioscora

texts.en: Dioscora is married with 10 children. She is 57 years old and lives in Dansalan, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. Dioscora sells charcoal to earn a living and has had this business for three years. Each month, she earns 3,500 Philippine pesos (PHP) doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for 14,900 PHP to purchase more sacks of coconut shell for the making of charcoal for retail. Dioscora has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Dioscora hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of coconut shell for the production of charcoal for retail

loans.name: Shinenemehbayar

texts.en: Shinenemehbayar is 22 years old and lives with his disabled mother and brother in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Huvsgul Province, Mongolia. His brother helps with his business. He started his firewood retailing business in 2008 since he had no money to put himself through college. He goes through a forest and collects dead trees to resell. He needs a motorcycle to transport the firewood. He is a sharp and diligent man who says,"It is hard and slow to collect wood by walking. If I collect it by vehicle, it would be fast and profitable and then I can put my younger brother into a college." He is requesting 1,000,000 MNT to buy a motorcycle.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle to transport the firewood

loans.name: Mostafa

texts.en:
Mostafa. a 50-year-old Lebanese married man who lives with his wife and three children, two of whom are still studying, has been working as a medicine trader since 1992. He has also been a sales agent for a locA. company since 2007.

It is very common in Lebanon to have multiple businesses in order to meet the high costs of living. Even so, life is sometimes very difficult, so today, Mostafa is requesting a loan of $2000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to pay his son’s university fees. His only goA. is to ensure a good education for his children.

loans.use: to pay his son’s university fees.

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en: Amelita is 28 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has two children. Amelita has a shop that sells clothing, like t-shirts, blouses , jackets & pants. She has had this business for 1 year. She requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy stock of clothing to sell.  Amelita has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Amelita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stock of clothing tos ell

loans.name: Galia

texts.es:
Galia de 38 años, es una mujer felizmente casada con Dilmer, con quien tiene 2 hijos de 14 y 6 años de edad. Esta familia vive en una casa propia en la ciudad de La Merced. Galia es una mujer de negocios. “Con tal de que el trabajo sea honrado, yo hago lo que sea para ganarme la vida”. Esta frase la caracteriza, ya que a pesar de que su esposo cuenta con un empleo seguro y rentable, ella no se queda atrás y también sale a la lucha. Actualmente viene ofreciendo productos lácteos como: quesos de Oxapampa, yogurt natural, manjar, etc., y para adquirir estos productos viaja cada quincena de mes hacia la ciudad de Oxapampa. “Es rentable el negocio de los quesos, por ejemplo yo compro cada kilo a 8 soles y lo vendo a 15 soles”, menciona.
Sus clientes ya la conocen, son en su mayoría amigas y madres del colegio de sus hijos quienes la recomiendan a otros compradores, por eso no le faltan pedidos en todos los meses del año. Así también ya inició con al venta de panteones, adornos y algo de ropa importada, para adquirir  esta mercadería viaja hacia la ciudad de Lima.
Más adelante, Galia espera instalar una tienda para no tener que movilizarse de casa en casa. Con su ayuda, ella podrá acceder a su primer préstamo de MFP, por eso se responsabiliza de pagar las cuotas en las fechas señaladas. Además dice sentirse emocionada de pertenecer a su banco comunal: “Mujeres al éxito”.
De obtener el dinero del crédito, comprará productos para la campaña navideña como son: panteones, ollas, artículos de cocina, ropa importada, etc.
texts.en:
38-year-old Galia is happily married to Dilmer, with whom she has two children who are 14 and 6 years old.  This family lives in their own home in the town of La Merced.  Galia is a businesswoman.  "As long as the work is honest, I do whatever to earn a living".  This sentence characterizes Galia because, despite the fact that her husband has a secure and profitable job, she doesn't get left behind and also works tenaciously.  Galia currently works selling dairy products such as Oxapampa cheeses, natural yoghurt, curds, etc.  In order to acquire these products, she travels every two weeks to the city of Oxapampa.  "The cheese business is profitable.  For example, I buy every kilo for 8 soles and sell it for 15 soles", she says.

Galia's customers already know her.  They are mainly friends, and mothers of pupils who attend her children's school, who recommend her to other buyers.  For this reason, she always has orders year round.  Galia also started selling panettones, decorations and some imported clothes.  In order to acquire this merchandise, she travels to the city of Lima.  In the future, Galia hopes to set up a store so that she doesn't have to go door to door.  With your help, she will be able to access her first loan from MFP.  She pledges to make her repayments on the assigned dates.  In addition, she says that she feels very happy to belong to her community bank "Mujeres al éxito”.

With her loan money, Galia will buy products for the Christmas season such as panettones, pots, cooking implements, imported clothes, etc.

loans.use: to buy panettones, pots, cooking utensils and imported clothes

loans.name: Ida Parfaite

texts.fr:
Cliente de 42 ans, celibataire avec 2 enfants a sa charge, elle se lance dans la vente des chaussures en 2000 pour subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants.
Ayant fait preuve d'une bonne capacité d'épargne et des successives remboursements sans défauts de paiements,les prêts ont transforme puissamment  sa vie, elle a élargie son activité, elle a  acheté sa marchandises en gros et avec ses bénéfices elle continue a renforcer son activite.
Tres pragmatique, elle tient a aller vers l'avant, son ambition est d'aller elle meme a l'étranger pour  s'approvisionner, Elle prend soin de ses enfants et s'occupe valablement de leur scolarité.
texts.en:
This forty-two year old client, single with two children in her care, launched into shoe sales in 2000 to provide for the needs of her children. Having proven a good capacity for savings and successive repayments with no defaults, these loans have powerfully transformed her life. She has enlarged her business, she has purchased wholesale merchandise, and with her profits she continues to strengthen her business.
Very pragmatic, she is keen to look to the future, and her ambition is to go abroad herself to stock up. She takes care of her children and attends validly to their schooling.

loans.use: to buy children's and women's shoes.

loans.name: Sin

texts.en:
Sin and his wife, Phally (pictured together), are vegetable farmers. They grow cauliflower and cucumber on their farmland in the village where they live. Sin is asking for his first loan of $500 to buy pipes and a water pumping machine to spray his farm.  

The couple has been married since 1987 and have three sons and one daughter. Three of their children attend school and the other one is still young. They are living in a village about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

loans.use: to buy pipes and water pumping machine to spray his farm.

loans.name: Yoeurn

texts.en: Yoeurn is 52, married and lives with her husband and two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She and her husband earn a living by growing rice and raising pigs. One of her children earns a living as a garment worker. In order to improve her family's life, she is applying for a loan for $500 to buy more piglets to raise and sell. Her goal for the future is to continue expanding her herd so she can earn enough money to improve her house and send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more piglets to raise.

loans.name: Haby

texts.fr:
Haby a plus de 53 ans mariée et mère de 7 enfants, elle réside avec son époux, ses deux coépouses et leurs enfants en charge à Hamdallaye, un des  quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso ( troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Haby après avoir mené beaucoup d’activités sans succès notamment l’agriculture au village, elle s’est initiée à cette activité d’achat et de vente des calebasses et divers depuis plus de dix ans. 
Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a environ sept années. Après 6 prêts solidaires (prêt du groupe) dans une Association des femmes de son quartier (Association BENKADI de Hamdallaye), elle est à présent à son cinquième prêt individuel. Ses prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés. 
Ainsi, elle sollicite ce  nouveau prêt pour acheter,  17 colis de calebasses à Tona région de Ségou (quatrième région administrative du Mali) avant de les revendre  en détail au grand marché de Sikasso près de la mairie centrale de la localité à une clientèle composée généralement des femmes et surtout des miniers.
Elle envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 100 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Haby is 53 years old, married, and mother of seven children. She lives with her husband, her two co-wives, and the children whom they raise. They live in Hamdallaye, a working-class neighborhood in the city of Sikasso (the third-largest administrative region in the Republic of Mali). 

Over ten years ago, after having pursued several different business activities unsuccessfully - notably, village agriculture -, Haby began buying and selling calabash and other items.

Striving to improve the satisfaction of her ever-growing customer base, she decided to join the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso six years ago. After receiving six group-based loans as a member of an association of woman from her neighborhood (the BENKADI Association of Hamdallaye), this will now be her fifth individual loan. Her previous loans were repaid properly.

She is asking for this new loan in order to buy 17 packages of calabash in Tona, in the region of Ségou (the fourth-largest administrative region in Mali). She will then resell the calabash individually at the large market near the City Hall of Sikasso. Her customers are typically women, and especially miners.

With this loan, she plans to achieve monthly profits of 100,000 FCFA, which will mainly the used to cover family expenses and pay the interest of her loan. The rest will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy calabash

loans.name: Wangninan 20 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe WANGNINAN 20 est composé de trois personnes qui sont issues de la même famille et sont dans le même groupe de tontine. C'est la quatrième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Denise est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Denise est âgée de 51 ans n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Denise est mariée à un certain Blaise. Le couple a deux enfants, un scolarisé et tous à leur charge. Les diverses charges de la famille sont supportées par le couple. Pour cette raison Denise vend depuis six ans des assiettes  à son domicile. De façon secondaire, Denise vend également divers articles. Denise s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Denise, ensemble avec les membres du  groupe WANGNINAN 20, sollicite un quatrième crédit.

loans.use: Acheter des assiettes.

loans.name: Adela

texts.en:
Adela is a fish vendor for four years now. She sold sold fish to neighbors and town dwellers in her community.  She is 51-year old, married and has 4 school-aged children. She lives in the town of Panglao.
Her husband is a carpenter. 

She joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Adela is requesting a loan  to purchase PHP which will be used to purchase assorted fish, weighing scale, cellophane and ice.  

 She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

loans.use: to purchase assorted fish, weighing scale, cellophane and ice

loans.name: Graciela

texts.en:
Graciela is a woman that has always succeeded at what she sets out to do, thanks to her virtures. She is singel and has one son, and lives in the city of Queretaro. She has always aimed to be a successful person but above all, she wants to provide her son with a promising future with an education, one that she can now provide him. This is why she started fixing and repairing shoes where she worked as an employee. Now she is the owner of the same shop, and every day she works to expand the business.

With the unconditional support of her son and her positive outlook, she has achieved great things. Today she requires a loan in the amount of $375 to expand her business and to purchase a compressor and fix a sewing machine. With your generosity you can help Graciela continue growing and continue providing an education for her son. Do not wait any longer. She thanks you.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Graciela es una mujer que siempre ha logrado lo que se propone, gracias a sus virtudes, ella es soltera y tiene un hijo, vive en la localidad de Querétaro. Siempre ha luchado por ser una persona exitosa y sobre todo por brindarle a su hijo un futuro prometedor a través de la educación que ella le pueda ofrecer. Es por eso que hace tiempo comenzó a ahorrar y logro comprar el taller de reparación de calzado donde ella trabajaba como empleada, ahora es la propietaria, y cada día lucha más por hacerlo crecer.

Con el apoyo incondicional de su hijo y su buen ánimo ha logrado grandes cosas, en este momento ella requiere de un crédito por la cantidad de $375 DLLS para poder crecer, pues necesita comprar una compresora y arreglar una de las máquinas de coser con las que trabaja. Con tu generosidad tú puedes ayudar a Graciela a seguir creciendo y brindarle la educación a su hijo, no lo dudes más, ella te lo agradece.

loans.use: repair machine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Jiona would like to buy three hair-driers and chemicals

loans.name: Groupement

texts.fr:
G. is a group of thirteen (13) members, nine (09) of whom are women. This group is on their fifth loan. The main problem faced by these women is the lack of mills in the villages, which it leads to children having to skip school and go to the nearby villages to crush the corn before being able to eat it; if not, they cannot eat before returning to school.

To remedy this situation, these women are asking for a loan of $1200 to buy a corn mill and a manioc grater for the village.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer.

G. est un groupement de treize (13) membres dont neuf (09) femmes. Ce groupement est à son cinquième crédit. Le problème majeur de ces femmes est le manque de moulins dans le village et les enfants sont obligés de sécher les cours et aller dans les villages environnants pour écraser le maïs avant de pouvoir manger ; sinon ils ne peuvent pas manger avant de retourner à l’école.

Pour remédier à cet état de chose les femmes sollicitent un crédit de $1200 pour acheter un moulin à maïs et une râpeuse de manioc pour le village.

loans.use: To buy a corn mill

loans.name: Adjovi Paula

texts.fr:
Mrs. Adjovi Paula A., 50 years old, is an energetic woman who works tirelessly to provide for the needs of her four (4) children. Her business is the sale of fabric, which she has already been practicing for 10 years. Today her household expenses have become heavier and the income she derives from her occupation is more and more insufficient.

She would like to expand her business but her financial means are very limited. This is why she is applying for a loan of $600 that will allow her to purchase fabric in bulk and then resale it for a larger profit. The execution of this project will bring relief to a whole family.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva volunteer.

. Agée de 50 ans, Madame A. Adjovi Paula est une femme dynamique qui travaille sans relâche pour assurer les besoins des quatre (04) enfants à sa charge. Son activité est la vente des tissus qu’elle exerce depuis 10 ans déjà. Aujourd’hui, les charges de son ménage sont devenues plus lourdes et le revenu qu’elle tire de son activité est de plus en plus insuffisant.

Elle désire alors agrandir son commerce mais ses moyens financiers sont très limités. C’est ce qui l’amène à solliciter un crédit d’un montant de $600 qui lui permettra d’acquérir en gros les tissus et de les revendre pour plus de bénéfice. La réalisation de ce projet soulagera toute une famille.

loans.use: Purchase of fabric in bulk for resale

loans.name: Ni Kadek

texts.id:
In order to help her family's income, Ni Kadek W. farms a pig. Every morning and evening, she prepares feeds for her pig. Each breeding pig can give birth to 8 piglets which she farms for 3 months. After those piglets are quite mature, they are sold to grower farms. It is Balinese custom to farm pigs for consumer and religious ceremonies. Each pigs can be sold for about $35 to $40. Her total revenue can reach $300, with $70 net profit. Most of her cost is for feeds. From this earnings, she still could not support her family of 5. Ni Kadek W. needs additional $175 capital with which she plans to buy 2 more breeding pigs, so she can increase her earnings and better help her husband to support her family.

Translated by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

Untuk membantu menopang perekonomian keluarganya Ni Kadek W. memelihara 1 induk babi .Setiap pagi dan sore menyiapkan pakan untuk babinya. Satu induk dapat melahirkan 8 ekor bibit babi dan dipelihara selama 3 bulan. Setelah dirasa cukup besar kemudian anak babi dijual. Kebiasaan yang ada di Bali adalah keperluan daging babi untuk konsumsi dan keperluan untuk upacara keagamaan. Harga per ekornya mencapai Rp. 350.000.- sampai dengan Rp. 400.000,- Total penjualan seluruhnya dapat mencapai Rp. 3.000.000,-Keuntungan bersih mencapai Rp. 700.000,- setelah dikurangi semua pengeluaran untuk pakan. Dari pendapatan ini belum bisa menopang kehidupan keluarganya yang berjumlah 5 orang. Ni Kadek W. membutuhkan tambahan modal usaha Rp. 1.400.000.- Harapan kedepannya akan membeli 2 ekor induk lagi sehingga keuntungan akan lebih banyak lagi, sehingga dapat membantu pendapatan suami untuk mencukupi kebutuhan keluarganya.

loans.use: Purchase pig feed

loans.name: Santos

texts.es:
Santos is a farmer and raises dairy cows. He sells their milk to a company called PIL Andina, an industrial milk plant. He lives in the community of Ancocagua in the sector of Laja, about 3 1/2 hours from La Paz, with his wife and three children ages 17, 13, and 10. He also works as a doorman at the technical institute which is located in their community. This loan will be used to buy a good cow and increase the production of milk to sell. It will be his first loan with Impro, and his evaluation shows he is qualified to receive the money.

Santos es agricultor y también cría ganado vacuno, cuya producción de leche comercializa a PIL Andina (Planta Industrializadota de Leche). Vive en la Comunidad de Ancocagua sector Laja a tres horas y media de la ciudad de La Paz., junto a su esposa y sus tres hijos de 17, 13, y 10 años respectivamente. También se desempeña como portero del Instituto Normal Técnico que se encuentra en la misma comunidad. El crédito lo destinara para la compra una vaca lechera de raza mejorada para incrementar la producción de leche. Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada le califica para otorgarle el préstamo.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO PURCHASE A MILK COW AND CONTINUE TO GROW THE BUSINESS

loans.name: Sua

texts.en: Sua is a widowed woman from Saaga village 64 years of age. She is the one who started Saaga centre two years ago, she is also the chief. Her business is taro plantation does by her two sons whom lived together with her. Her first, second loan were used to buy stuff for her business. She used to take 2-3 bags of taro to the twice a week and she gets $200.00-300.00 WST ($80-120 USD).

loans.use: To buy farming supplies for her taro plantation

loans.name: Mugongo A4(Iii) Group

texts.en:
Mariam is a single mother of two children. She has a hotel business and needs more equipment to keep this going well. She would use the loan and the profits earned to buy more house furniture and to pay school fees for the children.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy food warmers.

loans.name: Tofiq

texts.en: Tofiq A. is a 49-year-old farmer who sells milk and yogurt to the local bazaar traders. He also breeds calves. He has ten years of experience in this field. He lives with his family in a small village in the Saatli region. He applied for a loan of $1200 to purchase one milker cow for $600 and two baby calves for $300 each.

loans.use: To purchase one milker cow and two baby calves.

loans.name: Shukrullo

texts.ru:
Shukrullo Ziedullaevich B. lives in the Varzob region of Tajikistan. He is 29 years old, married and has 4 children. Shukrullo has a college degree in education. Currently he works as a contractor for hire, but his salary is not enough to support his family. That is why Shukrullo supplements the family income by raising cattle for sale. He has a small barn where he keeps his animals. Shukrullo purchases young calves, feeds them then sells the animals at the market at a higher price. His cattle business earnings supplement the family income. However, he would like to purchase more calves to expand his business and for that he requires this loan. Currently it is a good deal to buy meat cattle, since the animals are thin after the winter and are sold at a lower price. Shukrullo has been raising and selling cattle for the last 10 years. He is planning to pay back the loan in the next 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer

Бобиев Шукрулло Зиедуллаевич житель Варзобского района. Клиенту 29 лет женат , имеет 4 детей. Образование высшее. По специальности преподаватель. Работает строителем по найму. Получает заработную плату , но этого ему не хватает на жизнь. Поэтому клиент дополнительно подрабатывает занимаясь животноводством, путем разведения крупно-рогатого скота.Имеет небольшой коровник , в котором имеются бычки.Покупает молодых бычков , откармливает и перепродает на рынках по более выгодной цене. Это помогает обеспечивать семью.Но клиент хочет купить дополнительно еще одного бычка, но для этого ему нужно получить кредит.Именно сейчас покупка бычка может быть выгодна , так как после зимы животные исхудавшие , продаются по низим ценам. Занимается этим видом бизнеса занимается уже 10 лет. Погасить кредит клиент планирует в течении 12 месяцев

loans.use: Purchase of cattle

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.es:
Ms. Vicenta H. lives in her own home with her children on Mario Alborta street in the Sopocachi zone of the city of La Paz. She is legally separated from her husband.

She sells different types of products by special order, such as electronics, toys, provisions, etc. She is requesting this loan in order to increase her capital, since she currently has many orders but does not have enough capital to purchase more merchandise. Vicenta has already obtained a loan through Kiva, which has been repaid before the due date.

She has an excellent credit history and qualifies for a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Vicenta vive en casa propia con sus hijos; está separada del esposo, su domicilio esta en la calle Mario Alborta de la zona de alto Sopocachi de la ciudad de La Paz.

La actividad que realiza es la venta de productos de diferentes clases como ser artefactos eléctricos, juguetes, víveres, etc. todo a pedido; el crédito que solicita es para aumentar su capital ya que tiene muchos pedidos y no cuenta con el capital suficiente para comprar más stock de mercadería. Vicenta ya obtuvo un crédito a través de Kiva, el cual ha sido pagado antes de su fecha de vencimiento.

Su antecedente histórico es bueno y califica para obtener un nuevo crédito.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise such as: appliances, toys, provisions, etc.

loans.name: Juana Francisca

texts.es:
Juana is 50 years old, married and lives in the Isaías Gómez barrio of Managua. She has five beautiful children who are grown up and live on their own. Her husband makes aluminum and glass windows and helps with the household.

Juana's business is renting chairs and tables, which she started with her own money and the support of her husband. She has been doing this for two years and it has gone well. She also works in a church as a minister and earns a salary. She plans to use the loan to add an extra room to her home. Her goals for the future is to increase her inventory and add to her clientele, and to support her children with their education so they are successful.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

La Sra. Juana es casada y habita en el barrio Isaías Gómez, tiene 50 años de edad, con cinco hermosos hijos que viven independientes. Su esposo elabora ventanas de vidrio y aluminio y así ayuda a su hogar. El negocio de doña Juana es el alquiler de sillas y mesas, este negocio lo comenzó con dinero propio y apoyo de su esposo. Tiene dos años de experiencia y le ha ido bien ella también trabaja en una Iglesia como reverenda donde devenga un salario. El préstamo lo quiere para construir un cuarto para mejorar su vivienda. A futuro es aumentar más sus inventarios y obtener más clientelas, apoyar a sus hijos en la educación para que sean hombres de bien.

loans.use: Build an additional room for her home / Construcción de habitación en su vivienda

loans.name: Shazia M.riaz's Group

texts.en:
Shazia is the wife of M.. She has been married for the last 6 years and is a mother of one son. She successfully completed her first loan from Asasah a microfinance institute in Pakistan. Her husband has a pesticide business and she is applying for a loan to improve his business.

She has been joined in her loan group by three other women. One member is Naseem baji who wants the loan to expand her bakery business. The other members, Sajida baji and Rani baji, will use the funds to expand their fruit business and grocery shop, respectively.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members and each will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans and if one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand their businesses

loans.name: Yeredon (Knowing Yourself) Group

texts.fr:
The members of the Yeredon group are married women with an average of 25 years of age and 4 children. They live in traditional families with their husbands, in-laws and children in the village of Sikouna 1 in the Fana area (Koulikoro region in Mali). They buy and sell food condiments, charcoal and various other items. The women of the Yeredon group are related or have built strong friendships. This is their first group loan with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution. The sources of their supplies vary according to the items they sell; for charcoal, it is primarily sold on the spot in the surrounding villages through farmers officially appointed to trade it in the area. The main point of their cash sales is in Sikouna 1 and at the market on market days. Their customers are made up of wholesalers from the cities, women and some men. With this loan, they would like to grow their monthly income with which they will pay the interest on the loan and invest the remainder in their respective activities. Their long-term goal is to become wholesalers. Please note that due to health reasons one group member is missing from the photograph.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Volunteer.

Les membres du groupe Yeredon sont mariés avec une moyenne d’age de 25 ans et 4enfants .Elles vivent dans des familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, les beaux parents et les enfants dans le village de Sikouna 1 sous préfecture de Fana (Région de Koulikoro République du Mali). Elles font généralement le commerce de condiments alimentaires de charbon de bois et d’articles divers. Les femmes du groupe Yeredon ont une relation de voisinage d’alliances et d’amitié. Elles sont à leur premier prêt solidaire de groupe avec Soro Yiriwaso. Les sources d’approvisionnement sont diverses et variées suivant les articles : pour le charbon de bois c’est essentiellement sur place et dans les villages environnants avec les paysans officiellement mandatés pour l’exercice de cette activité. Elles effectuent leurs ventes sur place à Sikouna 1 en gros au comptant en détail et au marché surtout les jours de foire. Leur clientèle est composée de forains grossistes venant des villes, de femmes et de quelques hommes. Avec ce prêt les membres du groupe Yeredon comptent réaliser des bénéfices moyens mensuels qu’elles utiliseront à payer les intérêts du prêt et investir le reste dans leurs activités respectives Elles envisagent devenir des grossistes. C’est pour des raisons de santé qu’une cliente manque à la photo de groupe.

loans.use: Purchase of charcoal and various items

loans.name: Abdullah

texts.en:
This is Abdullah W.. He is 20 and a resident of the Sorkhrood district in Ningarhar province. Abdullah and his family have been living in their village since the Taliban regime in Afghanistan. Before that they lived in Pakistan. Abdullah has two brothers and a sister and they all live with their parents. His father is about 55, and he lost his left arm in a mine explosion during the war in Afghanistan.

When Abdullah's family returned to their homeland, Abdullah was 14 and his brothers were about 12 and 10. His father has faced some serious illnesses, so Abdullah had to accept all responsibility for being the only breadwinner for his family.

Abdullah was studying in class 7, but he had to leave school and start working. So he opened a small catering shop (tent service) in the Sorkhrood bazaar. First he made some shelves, and then purchased different equipment like plates, spoons, carpets, and other goods for his shop with capital he had of 45,000 Afghanis.

Abdullah is a hard-working man. He was able to enroll his elder brothers in a private educational course in addition to their schooling. Meanwhile, he is attempting to resume his education. But he thinks that first he must expand his business and buy enough materials for his shop, and through it increase his daily income from $8 to $12.

This young man seems have good capability, and he tries to utilize it in his business. He has requested a 50,000 Afghanis loan from AFSG. He decided to purchase some generators, chairs and tables with this money and after a few months he will open a new shop near the old one.

Abdullah dreams about starting in his new shop, and then sesuming his remaining education. He wants to express his appreciation in advance to his lenders, and wishes them good luck.

loans.use: To buy generators, chairs and tables to rent

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
Sonia es socia del Banco Comunal Los Sauces de Compañía.

Sonia es conviviente, tiene 35 años y 1 hijo de 4 años, Sonia vive en la comunidad de Compañía que es un valle que se ubica a 1 hora de la ciudad de Ayacucho, Sonia junto a su esposo se dedican a la fabricación artesanal de ladrillos, para lo cual cuenta con la ayuda de peones para lo cual utilizan una arcilla especial de la zona, luego son secados al sol y seguidamente quemados en un horno artesanal. Sonia en algunas oportunidades también cosecha tara de terrenos que arrienda.

Sonia necesita un préstamo de 1250 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de leña y tierra. Sonia sueña con adquirir más terrenos para ampliar su producción, construir su casa de material noble y que su hijo puea estudiar.
texts.en:
Sonia is a member of the Los Sauces de Compañia Community Bank. Sonia is 35 years old and live with her partner and her 4 years old son. She lives in the community of Compañia which is located in a valley one hour from the city of Ayacucho. Sonia and her partner are dedicated to make artisan bricks with the help of some workers. They use a special clay from the area, then the bricks are sun-dried and immediately after they are burned in an artisan oven. In some occasions, Sonia also rents parcels of land for crops

Sonia needs a 1250 soles (Peruvian currency) loan which she will invest in buying wood and soil. Sonia dreams of getting more land to increase her production, build her house out of basic materials and provide her son with an education.


Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sonia needs a 1250 soles (Peruvian currency) loan that she will invest in buying wood and soil.

loans.name: Rokiya

texts.en:
Rokiya T. is 42 years old. She is married and the loving mother of three children. Difficult living conditions and low wages forced her husband to leave for Russia for earnings. Considering that, she started a business two years ago. Rokiya breeds cattle, and buys small cattle at the market at a low price, feeds them and then resells them at the same market at a more profitable price. Her eldest son also tends to this business. Rokiya works hard in order to make the business successful and generate a stable income for the family. 

Today, Rokiya is planning to purchase cattle for her household to raise and resell. For this purpose, she requests 1500 Somoni (US $450) for the term of 9 months. Rokiya would like to thank everyone for their support and promises to manage the loan without violations and delinquency.

loans.use: To purchase cattle for breeding and selling.

loans.name: Sabanoh Ii Group

texts.en:
The loan group Sabanoh II consists of  Pa Hassan K., Yeabu V., Abdul R. K., Adama K. and James C., all local entrepreneurs in the village of Mokonta, about nine miles from Makeni.  A previous loan from Kiva through SMT had a meaningful impact on their lives, as the members used it to pay for their children’s school fees, feed themselves and their families and buy seeds to enlarge their farms. Today, they are requesting another loan to buy more goods to add to their businesses.

Pa Hassan K. (on the left in the photo), 45, the leader of the group, has sold dried pepper for the last 15 years and is the married father of five children. Three of his children are in secondary school and two are in primary school. His wife is a subsistence farmer who usually grows rice, cassava and potatoes. 

While he usually trades with only two bags of pepper, this new loan will allow Pa Hassan to expand his business by purchasing about six bags of dried pepper on his buying excursions to Masombiri village, a distance of about 36 miles round trip. As well, he would also like to invest part of the loan in farming. 

For the entire group, an increase in profit means increasing their business stock and investing in subsistence farming.  They thank you for your support.

loans.use: To expand his business by buying six bags of pepper.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace O. sells charcoal and is requesting a loan to buy more products to sell, like sugar and beans. Grace is 31 years old and married. Her husband is retired. She has five children and they all go to school. With the extra profits generated from her loan, she hopes to be able to construct another house that she would rent. 

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services that are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To expand her inventory with products like sugar and beans.

loans.name: Las Kantutas Group

texts.es: EL GRUPO "LAS KANTUTAS" ESTA REPRESENTADO POR EL SEÑOR BERNARDINO Y CONSTITUIDOS POR 16 MIEMBROS LOS CUALES SE DEDICAN AL COMERCIO D. PRODUCTOS COMO ROPA, TEJIDOS, SANDALIAS, COSMÉTICOS  A LA ELABORACIÓN D. PAN, AL TRANSPORTE PÚBLICO Y A LA CONSTRUCCION D. VIVIENDAS. COMO EN TODO RUBRO COMERCIAL SIEMPRE EXISTE LA COMPETENCIA Y LA OFERTA D. PRODUCTOS A BAJO COSTO, POR LO QUE LOS SOCIOS (AS) TIENEN QUE TENER LOS PRODUCTOS D. MAYOR DEMANDA A MENOR PRECIO, UNA D. LAS VENTAJAS DEL GRUPO ES QUE SUS PUESTOS D. VENTA SE ENCUENTRAN ALEJADOS D. LA CIUDAD POR LO QUE TIENEN MAYOR POSIBILIDAD D. VENTA, PERO LA DESVENTAJA D. ELLO ES LA EDUCACIÓN RURAL PARA SUS HIJOS POR LO QUE ELLOS TIENE LA ESPERANZA D. ENVIAR A SUS HIJOS A LA CIUDAD EN DOND. RECIBIRÁN UNA MEJOR EDUCACIÓN.  EL DESTINO DEL CRÉDITO ES PARA EL INCREMENTO D. MERCADERÍA E INSUMOS PARA CUMPLIR CON LAS DEMANDAS DEL MERCADO. LOS SOCIOS VAN CUMPLIENDO SU TERCER CICLO POR LO QUE CONOCEN DEL TRABAJO CON GRUPOS SOLIDARIOS ASÍ COMO LA RESPONSABILIDAD Y  HONESTIDAD QUE SE REQUIERE PARA UN FINANCIAMIENTO COMO EL OTORGADO POR LA FUNDACIÓN AGROCAPITAL.
texts.en:
The Kantutus group is represented by Bernardino and is maD. up of 16 members who operate various businesses including: clothing sales; fabric sales; footwear sales; cosmetics sales, sales of baked goods; taxi services; and construction services. As in all commercial endeavors, there's competition and offers to sell similar products at lower costs, so the members have to have products for which there's a lot of demand and sell them for less. One advantage for the group is that their businesses are located outsiD. of the city which gives them greater opportunities to sell. The disadvantage of that for them is that their children can only get a rural education. They hope to send their children to the city where they would receive a better education. The loan will be used to buy merchandise and supplies to meet the demands of the market. The members will be completing their third cycle so they know how to work within a cooperative and have demonstrated the responsibility and honesty required to get financing like that provided by Fundacion Agrocapital.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: Julia tiene 33 años, es madre soltera de dos hijos; Junior de 10 y Erlin de 8, con quienes vive en su casa propia. Se dedica a la elaboración de prendas en su pequeña sastrería desde hace 13 años, a ella siempre le ha gustado el oficio de corte y confección y es por eso que se dedica a realizar este trabajo en el cual se siente muy bien, ya que decide sus horarios y se exige ella misma para acabar las prendas que le solicitan. La confección de ropa es un trabajo que requiere de mucho esfuerzo para un buen acabado final, muchas veces Julia se llega a cortar o a punzar con las agujas y alfileres, siendo esto las dificultades en su trabajo, a lo que ella ya se acostumbró sabiéndolo sobrellevar pensando que son los gajes del oficio. Julia se encuentra en su octavo préstamo con Microfinanzas PRISMA, demostrando en este tiempo, casi 4 años con MFP, ser muy responsable y puntual en los pagos. Con el dinero que solicita comprará mayor cantidad de tela para confeccionar más prendas y así aumentar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Julia is 33 years old and is a single mother with two children: Junior, 10 and Erlin, 8. She lives with her children in the home that she owns. She works making clothes in her small tailoring shop and has done so for the past 13 years. She has always liked designing and making clothes and that’s why she has this job. She really likes it because she decides her schedule and she challenges herself to finish the clothing [her customers] order. Making clothes is a job that requires a lot of effort in order to have a good finished product. The difficult part of her job are the many times Julia has cut or jabbed herself with needles and pins. But she has learned how to deal with this and knows it is just one of the risks of being a seamstress. This is Julia’s eighth loan with Microfinanzas PRISMA and in her 4 years with MFP she has always been very responsible and on-time with her payments. With this loan money she will buy more material and fabric to make more clothing and increase her earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fabric for making clothes

loans.name: Obloior

texts.en:
Obloior is married and the father of two children. He has a large and friendly family including: his wife, children, mother and brother. For 5 years, he has been engaged in a farming business. The love for his children is the motivator that keeps him working hard for their future. He works fast together with the help of his brother to achieve quality produce.

The high price of fertilizer has caused his production to slow down; he wishes to do better, have more production and increase the number of hectares with crops. To do that, Obloior needs capital, which he is requesting through a loan and hopes that you can help him. This way he can look forward to a profitable production to increase his income and pay for his children’s education.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing seed, fertilizer, fuel and lubricants

loans.name: Nantume Kasfa Group

texts.en:
N. Kasfa, is 45 years of age she is married with seven children .she rants a one roomed house where she leaves with her children
She does take care of extended family her grand child.
Her greatest expenses in a month are feeding and rent for the house.
She sells ripe bananas in the market. She receives about 10 customers a day.
And she has done this business for over for years now
Her challenges are the price fluctuations for commodities which in turn force her to raise the prices of her bananas
She has been with MCDT for over 3 years and this is her 6th loan.
she wants to use this loan to buy more bananas for sell,
and she would like to expand her business given the capital.

loans.use: increase on stock

loans.name: Valeria,

texts.es:
Valeria tiene un taller de compostura y confección de ropa.. El taller tiene mas de veinte años, que lo ha implementado como una tienda de ropa, pues además de confeccionar ropa a medida también compra ropa ya hecha para venderla en su casa. Hoy en día la venta de ropa comprada le genera mayores ingresos, pues la competencia de los productos occidentales, que están mucho más baratos, hace que la gente prefiera comprar ropa ya hecha.

Ella empezó trabajando en una fábrica de jeanes de una marca reconocida. Este trabajo lo abandonó ya que se gano un terreno en el lugar donde vive actualmente. Para no perder el terreno debía mudarse a vivir ahí, de este modo su trabajo le quedaba muy lejos y decidió abrir su taller propio. Poco a poco ha ido cumpliendo sus metas. Una vez que obtuvo el terreno ha ido construyendo su casa poco a poco. Hoy ya tiene todo un primer nivel construido, así que Valeria esta pensando continuar construyendo un segundo nivel para poder implementar su taller con más máquinas.
texts.en:
Valeria has a repair and dressmaking shop. The shop, which is now more than 20 years old, began as a clothing shop. Along with dressmaking to measurements, she also buys already-made clothing to sell in her house. Nowadays, selling the purchased clothing generates the greatest income, since the competition from Western products, which are much cheaper, means that the people prefer to buy already made clothing. She began working in a jeans factory for a well-known label. She left this job when she got the plot of land in the place where she actually lives. In order to not lose the land, she had to move to live there. Because of this, her job was far away and she decided to open her own shop. Little by little she has accomplished her goals. Once she had the plot of land, she went about constructing her house little by little. Today she already has all of the first level finished, so now Valeria is thinking about constructing a second level to be able to put more machines in her shop.

Translated from Spanish by Julie Lutz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy shirts

loans.name: Urozdavlat

texts.en:
I. Urozdavlat is 21 years old. He is not married and lives with his parents. Urozdavlat is a noble worker dedicated to raising animals, primarily sheep, which he buys and sells in the commercial city markets. This work is very agreeable to him, because raising animals is what he enjoys most.

Urozdavlat requires a certain amount of money to increase the number of his sheep. By increasing his product he hopes to increase his household income, as well to stay solvent in terms of his ability to continue buying and selling animals.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to epic mountain passes, communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, and a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93 percent of the country is mountainous and only 7 percent of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To buy sheep.

loans.name: Falix Achieng

texts.en:
Falix Achieng O. is a 28-year-old motorcycle driver. He is married, but does not yet have children as he wants to have more money first. He lives in Nylanda slum and rents a motorcyle (called a piki-piki in Kenya) that he uses to transport passengers. He would like to one day own his own, but needs at least 65,000 KSH to do so. He tells me that for a ride from Dunga Beach to Nylanda (a distance of about 3 km) he charges around 70 KSH (just under 1 USD). His wife also runs a small business and his hope is to one day be a big businessman.

Falix recently joined the K-MET volunteer Community Health Worker (CHW) group in Kisumu, Kenya. As a CHW he will be trained by K-MET and will begin visiting members of his community who are sick with a variety of illnesses. His work will include distributing Nutriflour (a vitamin-enriched flour produced by K-MET) to malnourished patients, providing reproductive health education, referring patients to local clinics and hospitals, and providing basic health care.

video.title: Kiva Entrepreneur Falix Achieng  from  Kenya

loans.use: spare parts and maybe a motorcycle

loans.name: Felina

texts.en: Mrs. Felina T. is a thirty-six year old woman and married with four children. When her husband retired from the Philippine Army she decided to venture into a business as a new source of income to support and provide for the needs of her children. She succeeded and opened up a "sari-sari store" (mini grocery store). Next, she planned to open a "carenderia" or eatery as her additional income but due to financial problems, she knew that her plan could not come into reality. She decided to borrow PHP 30,000 from Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative. With this she has enough money to venture into business, and with the skills in managing a business that she already has, she knows her business will prosper and she can secure the future of her children - especially in their education.

loans.use: To open an eatery

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Mrs. Sok C. is thirty-four and lives with her other family members in the province of Kompong Cham. She is blessed with four children who are minors.

She and her husband currently generate a daily profit by growing crops for sale. Sok C. will use the loan money to purchase an ox to plow her farmland. She will use the remainder of the loan to buy cucumber seeds to grow.

loans.use: To purchase an oxen to plow her farmland

loans.name: Diana

texts.en: Ms A. Diana has a retail shop (grocery) located at Kakyeka. She has been operating the business for four years. She has one child not yet in school. She is requesting a loan to increase the stock in her shop by purchasing items like sugar, toilet paper, soap, bread etc. She intends to increase her stock and hopes to enlarge her shop into a big grocery and retail shop.

loans.use: To purchase more stock for her shop

loans.name: Savrigul

texts.en:
S. Savrigul is 40 years old. She is married with 4 children of school age. Savrigul sells fabrics used for sewing traditional dresses. She has been in this business almost for 12 years. Savrigul has a very good taste and she is ready to advise her customers which textile to choose for this or that occasion. That is why she has her constant customers. Moreover Savrigul’s prices for fabrics are attractive for various levels of the population as she has a wide range of goods for any taste and any wallet.

The income that she derives allows her to educate her children. She hopes that she can continue to provide for them so they will be able to receive an adequate education. Now Savrigul needs 3000 Somoni to purchase new fabrics in order to increase the range of goods for sale.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing new fabrics in order to increase her range of goods

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es: Isabel es una mujer muy trabajadora y una buena madre de familia, se dedica al cuidado de sus 4 hijos, quienes son estudiantes; y junto con su pareja lograron construir su propia vivienda. Hace 20 años viene trabajando al lado de su esposo en la venta de pescado, al por mayor, en el mercado de su localidad, gracias a estos años de experiencia ha logrado conseguir gran cantidad  de clientes, quienes son comerciantes minoristas. Pero para realizar esta actividad tiene que despertar de madrugada y salir rumbo al mercado donde trasporta grandes cantidades de mercadería para luego venderla a sus clientes, es por ello que desde tempranas horas tiene que estar pendiente de su negocio, terminando su labor a las 10 de la mañana, hora que regresa a su hogar para atender a sus hijos. Es así que Isabel viene trabajando y desea seguir realizándolo por mucho años más, ya que tiene proyectado comprar un auto para trasportar sus pescados a diversos lugares de la ciudad. Este es su 5to préstamo con Microfinanzas PRISMA, Isabel refiere que sus anteriores créditos fueron de gran ayuda en su desarrollo personal y en el de sus compañeras de banco comunal. Los 2000 soles que solicita posibilitarán la mejora de su capital de trabajo, pues comprará mayor cantidad de pescado.
texts.en:
Isabel is a hardworking woman and a good mother to her family. She takes care of her 4 children who are students, and together with her husband, they have built their own home. For 20 years, she has worked alongside her husband selling fish at the wholesale market in their town. Thanks to their years of experience they have been able to attract a large number of customers, who are mostly retail merchants. Their day begins at dawn when they head to the market where large quantities of merchandise arrive for them to sell to their customers. The early hours are when they do their best business, ending their work day at 10am. This allows them to return home to care for their children.

Isabel hopes to continue working for many more years and plans to buy a car to transport fish to different places in the city. This is her 5th loan with Microfinanzas PRISMA. Isabel says her previous loans helped her with her own personal development and that of her fellow communal bank members. The loan of 2000 soles that she is requesting will improve her operating capital and will be used to purchase large quantities of fish.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her inventory of fish

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en: Ofelia M. of Brgy. Ma-ao, Bago City, Negros Occidental, is a 59-year-old married woman with one adult child. For the past thirty years she has owned and managed a food stall which serves a variety of meals to the local community. This business earns a respectable PHP 10,000 per month for her small family. In her own words, Ofelia says that, "The thirty years in this business has been fulfilling for me because I proved to myself, my family and other people that I could manage and even improve my life without having a College degree. I just put a lot of trust in God and I am always honest in all my business dealings. When NWTF-Project Dungganon came to our community, at first I was hesitant to join because I wasn't sure that I could afford the weekly payments, but after attending the training seminar in 2004, I knew that I could do it. Now I am proud to say that it was Project Dungganon that helped me improve my food business and allowed me to venture into other lines of business, which has greatly improved the financial stability of my family." Ofelia is now borrowing PHP 15,000 for her 14th loan so that she can have additional working capital for her diversified businesses. But most of it will be invested in her food business. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the call of not just a few, but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: To use as additional working capital for her business

loans.name: Nana

texts.en: Nana A. sells both fresh fish and smoked fish. She goes to the shore, buys from the fishermen, sells some fish while it's fresh, and smokes some to sell in El Mina near Abreshia.  Nana has received a senior high school education.  She is married and has six dependents. Her husband is a farmer. Nana has been selling fish since 1971. She helps her husband pay their fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more fish for to process and sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to educate her children.

loans.use: To buy fish

loans.name: Maximo

texts.es:
Máximo es socio del Banco Comunal Minka.
