Máximo es casado, tiene 60 años y 3 hijos, Máximo tiene una panificadora en su casa, donde elaboran panes típicos como el chapla,  el horno es rustico a leña, sus ventas los realiza en el mercado magdalena.
Máximo necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de harina, azúcar y leña.
Los sueños de Máximo son mejorar su negocio y tener maquinas para su panificadora.

loans.use: Para la compra de harina, azúcar y leña.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: effectuer du labour et acheter des engrais

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy sewing materials like linen, thread, thimbles, etc.

loans.name: Bakhtier

texts.en:
G. Bakhtier is 38 years old. He is married and has four adorable children of school age. Bakhtier’s wife is not working. She keeps house and takes care of their children. Bakhtier has a very large family. In addition to his wife and kids, he is supporting his parents and sister. To be able to do this, Bakhtier is running a business. He sells perfumery for women and men, deodorants, air fresheners, shaving cream, and more. All the goods are supplied from Almaty, Kazakhstan. Today, Bakhtier is requesting $1500 US dollars, as he is planning to expand his business and increase his capital. Bakhtier would like to thank all supporting him and promises to pay the loan in time. Your support will really help him. Be an important part of the growth of Bakhtier’s business.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history and diverse culture, which is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet influence, New West culture, and Central Asian traditions. It served as a key post along the Silk Road and marked the end of Alexander the Great's extensive rule. It was the birthplace of the great Persian poet Rudaki and famous Islamic philosopher Ibn Sina. And it is home to epic mountain passes, communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON’s History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing new goods for increasing his range of products

loans.name: Eileen

texts.en:
Eileen, 38, is a mother of two children. She is married to Rene, and they live in Norala, South Cotabato. Together they work hard in their 1-hectare (2.5-acre) rice field. The income is enough to provide for their daily needs. Her eldest child is 16 years old. They want their children to finish their studies.

Eileen asked for support from Community Economice Ventures, Inc. to provide a loan of 15,000 PHP. This loan will be used to buy farm supplies and fertilizer to improve her farm.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies and fertilizer

loans.name: Nuevo Renacer 2 Group

texts.en:
Rosa is the coordinator of her group called Nuevo Renacer (New Rebirth), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in North Santo Domingo, among the slums that ring the city, where crime is prevalent and running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her husband and child.

Rosa is excited to be taking her third loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loans without incident. She plans to use this loan to invest in her fantasia (fantasy), a business which caters to women, by purchasing combs, shampoo, conditioner and blouses to sell in her business. She will use the profits to save money and also on special treatments for her daughter who is mute and deaf, a large financial burden. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To purchase combs, shampoos, conditioners, blouses.

loans.name: Darlene Gay

texts.en:
Mrs. Darlene Gay C., 27 years of age, is married and is a resident of 2nd South St., Barangay I, Tangub City. She has two minor dependents now at school age. Her husband is an overseas seaman in the person of Mr. June Nathan C..

Although she is receiving a monthly allotment from her husband, still Darlene is doing some business activities in order to help her husband, especially in meeting their daily needs and as preparation for their children’s education in the future.

With a love of cooking, Darlene opened a little eatery in her home and a food stall in the city food court and has been in the business for almost three years. Now, she is earning an average net income of not less than P10,000 a month and she is also giving employment to others who were unemployed.

Darlene joined Paglaum MPC a year ago because she is very much interested in our products and services and for our being one of the most outstanding cooperatives in Northern Mindanao and the awarded coop for being “Most Outstanding Cooperative in the Philippines” during the search for the COOP-LGU Partnership Award, 2006.

With a good credit record and performance, Darlene was able to obtain her 3rd loan of P30,000 to add to the capital of her existing two food operations, especially during this peak season of Christmas because Tangub City is known as the “Christmas Symbol Capital of the Philippines”.

The future income of this loan will be used for her family’s daily needs, to pay her obligations to our Coop and also as savings for future use, especially for her children’s education.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her eatery businesses

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace M. is 44 years old, currently single and has three school-aged children. She lives in Danao, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. Grace has a fishing business, which she has owned and operated for twenty years now. She earns about $337 a month from her fishing business. Grace is pictured above with the battery engine for her fishing boat which, she says, no longer works very well, and she would very much like to replace. 

Grace joined PMPC in 2008 and has taken our a previous loan of 7,000 PHP. She is currently requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP and would like to use the loan proceeds to buy a new battery and other equipment to enhance her fishing boat. She is planning to use the profits to pay back her loan. She is also trying to save some money so that she can renovate her house sometime in the future. 

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.use: To buy a new battery and other equipment for her fishing boat

loans.name: Shamsubonu

texts.en: B. Shamsubonu is 38 years old and is married with two children of school age. Shamsubonu sells the fabrics used for sewing the national dresses and has been in this business for almost five years. She has very good taste and she is ready to advise her clients which textile to choose for this or that occasion. That is why she has her regular customers. Moreover, Shamsubonu’s prices for fabrics are attractive for various levels of the population as she has a wide range of goods for any taste and any wallet. The income that Shamsubonu derives allows her to educate her children. She hopes that she can continue to provide for them so they will be able to receive an adequate education. Now, Shamsubonu needs 5,000 Somoni to purchase new fabrics in order to increase the range of her goods. She promises to repay the loan without any violation and expresses her gratitude to everyone supporting her. Your generosity can change her family’s life. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase new fabrics in order to increase the range of her goods

loans.name: Sagitario Group

texts.es:
ALCANCIA COMUNAL SAGITARIO
El Alcancía Comunal SAGITARIO, inicia su segundo ciclo con 10 socias que realizan diferentes tipos de negocios. 

Como Presidenta tenemos a la señora Teresa, que al igual que algunas socias se dedican a la crianza de cerdos, ella invierte tiempo y dinero en su negocio pero sabe que no es en vano, ya recibirá algunas ganancias que le ayudaran a mejorar su calidad de vida.

Saturnina es casada hace 15 años y tiene 4 hijos de las cuales 2 son menores de edad y por los que tiene que trabajar.
Al igual que se esposo, se levanta temprano para poder alimentar a los cerdos que los tienen en jaulas alejados de su casa.
Para ella ha sido beneficioso este tipo de trabajo ya que solo le ocupa algunas horas y el resto del tiempo lo dedica a sus hijos, porque lo más importante para ella es brindarle mejores oportunidades a su familia

Además de criar cerdos la Sra. María se dedica a la venta de comida en su casa toda la semana, con esos ingresos extras desea abrir un pequeño restaurant que le permita mejorar la infraestructura de su casa,  además invertir en la educación de sus hijos. Su familia está muy orgullosa de ella ya que es una persona trabajadora.

Los deseos de las socias son tener una casa propia, ampliar sus negocios y ver realizados a sus hijos profesionalmente.
texts.en:
ALCANCIA COMUNAL SAGITARIO (SAGETARIUS COMMUNAL OUTREACH) The “Alcancia Comunal SAGITARIO” is in its second cycle with ten members who run different types of business. Teresa is the group’s President who, like some of the other members, raises hogs. She invests time and money into her business, but she knows that it is not in vain. She will soon receive an income that will help provide her with a better quality of life. Saturnina has been married for 15 years and has four children, two of whom are minors and for whom she must work. Her husband rises early in the morning to feed the hogs, which they keep in pens some distance from their home. For her, this type have work has been beneficial, since it only consumes a few hours a day, and she can spend the rest of the day with her children. The thing she considers most important is to be able to offer better opportunities to her family. In addition to raising hogs, Maria also sells prepared food from her home every day. She would like to use this extra income to open a small restaurant and use the subsequent income to make some improvements to her home and further invest in her children’s education. Her family is very proud of her, as she is a hard working woman. The members’ goals are to have their own homes, expand their businesses, and see their children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Supplies

loans.name: Jaime Daniel

texts.es:
El joven Jaime Daniel C. es casado tiene un hijo habita en el barrio Pedro Joaquín Chamorro,  es profesor de primaria en el  Centro Educativo Jesús de Nazareth desde hace seis años.

El señor Jaime C. solicito préstamo para cubrir unos gastos  personales de su familia,  es primer credito que se le otorga.
texts.en:
The young man, Jaime Daniel C., is married, has one child and lives in the Pedro Joaquín Chamorro neighborhood. He has been a teacher in the educational center for six years.

Mr. Jaime C. is requesting a loan to cover some personal family expenses. This is his first loan.

Translated from Spanish by Lauren Jackson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: for personal use

loans.name: Gabriel

texts.en:
Gabriel has his business in two phases. He drives for commercial purposes in the morning, and in the evening he does his restaurant business with his wife. These businesses have enabled him to meet the basic needs of his family. Gabriel is 41 years old and married with four children. His children are in a primary school and they are doing well. 

Gabriel hopes to overhaul his car. He believes this will make his car more attractive to customers. He also wants to purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell. He needs the loan of NGN150,000 to achieve this purpose. He thanks all his lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs and overhaul his car

loans.name: Rita

texts.fr: D. Rita est née en 1968 à Allada dans le département de l’atlantique. Il ya très longtemps que Rita vit à Allomey, à Allada. Mariée à TODJO Dorothée, un agent de la poste, Rita est mère de deux enfants tous scolarisés. Rita vit avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple supporte ensemble les charges de la famille. Pour subvenir aux divers besoins de ses enfants, Rita vend des liqueurs non loin de son domicile. Rita fait ses provisions à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Rita a peu fréquenté l’école mais exerce son activité depuis fort longtemps.  ALIDé a déjà accordé un crédit à Rita, crédit qu’elle a bien remboursé. Rita souhaite accroître son chiffre d’affaire, c’est la raison pour laquelle elle sollicite un deuxième prêt auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Rita D. was born in 1968 in Allada in the "département" (administrative district) of Atlantique. She has lived in Allomey in Allada for a very long time. Married to Dorothée TODJO, a post office worker, Rita is mother to two children who are both at school. Rita lives with her husband and children. The couple shares responsibility for supporting the family. In order to provide for her children's various needs, Rita sells liqueurs not far from her home. She gets her supplies in Cotonou, the economic capital of Bénin. Rita attended school very little but has been carrying out her business for a very long time. ALIDé has already granted one loan to Rita, which she repaid correctly. Rita would like to increase her turnover and for this reason she is applying for a second loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of ten boxes of liqueurs

loans.name: Gladys Augusta

texts.es:
L. socia Gladys; pertenece al banco comunal “CHOQUEQUIRAO INC”, situado en el distrito D. Huanchac, provincia del Cusco y departamento D. Cusco.

Nuestra socia tiene 51 años D. edad elL. es soltera, no tiene hijos y nuestra socia es secretaria D. profesión, elL. también tiene su propio taller D. corte y confección, L. socia diseña hermosos trajes D. vestir y trabaja en el centro D. desarrollo humano desD. hace 1 año; Nuestra socia requiere el préstamo para poder invertir en su negocio, elL. desea comprar telas, hilos, y utilizar parte D. ello para el capital D. su negocio.

Nuestra socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado por este medio para elL. poder seguir generando divisas y se compromete a cumplir con el pago total D. L. deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Gladys, 51, is a member of the “CHOQUEQUIRAO INC” communal bank located in Huanchac district, Cusco province and department. She is single and has no children. She is a secretary by profession but also has her own dressmaking workshop. She designs beautiful dresses and has worked in the human development center for a year. She needs funding to invest in her business; she needs to buy fabric and thread and will use part of the funds to capitalize her business. She appreciates and values the loan granted by this means so that she can continue to generate income and pledges to repay her entire loan in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabric and thread and to increase her business's capital.

loans.name: Dora Alicia

texts.es: Dora Alicia J. F. de 29 años, posee una tortillería en su casa de habitación la cual esta ubicada en el departamento de Sonsonate, lugar en el cual vive junto a sus tres hijos de 17, 15 y 9 años de edad, los cuales se dedican a estudiar gracias al enorme esfuerzo de su madre quien trabaja para poder brindarles todo lo necesario a sus hijos los cuales dependen por completo de ella. Dora es madre soltera, quien por esta razón trabaja muy duro realizando diferentes actividades como vender tamales los fines de semana y de lunes a domingo vender pupusas y tortillas, ella es una persona que no tiene descanso, ya que su mayor anhelo es el de poder suplir todas las necesidades básicas de su familia, si importar el esfuerzo que eso implique. Dora solicita un préstamo a través del cual cuente con el dinero necesario para invertir más en sus ventas comprando la materia prima más importante para su trabajo la cual es el maíz, este producto ella espera comprarlo por mayor y así mismo comprar queso, chicharrón, algunas verduras y otros alimentos más los cuales le hagan posible vender más.
texts.en:
Dora Alicia J. F. is 29 years old and manages a tortilla shop from her home in the Department of Sonsonate. She lives with her three children (ages 17, 15, and 9) who are dedicated to their studies. Thanks to the help of her mother, Dora is able to work so that she can provide everything her children need since they are completely dependent on her.

Dora is a single mother, so she works very hard in different activities such as selling tamales on the weekends and selling pupusas and tortillas Monday through Sunday. She is a person who does not rest. Her greatest wish is to be able to provide for all the basic needs of her family, regardless of the amount of effort required. Dora is requesting a loan so that she will have the necessary funds to buy the most important ingredient used in her work, which is corn. She hopes to acquire this product in bulk, as well as cheese, pork rinds, vegetables, and other foods that will make it possible for her to sell more.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase corn, cheese, pork rinds, vegetables, and other foods

loans.name: Sopey Mame Diarra Bousso Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité SOPEY MAME DIARRA BOUSSO est un des groupes qui forme le Banc Villageois de DIAMAGUENE de Thiès. Il est composé de 9 membres toutes issues du même quartier que porte le nom dudit Banc Villageois. Elles sont en moyenne âgées d'une quarantaine d'années et sont toutes mariées et mères d'au moins de 4 enfants. Elles se sont organisées et formé leur groupe par affinités, elles sont très engagées dans les différentes activités de leur Banc Villageois, à savoir les rencontres mensuelles, les réunions de remboursement etc...
Leurs activités sont diverses, elle pratiquent le petit commerce de poissons fumés et/ou séchés, de l'encens, des beignets, du poisson frais et certaines, à l'exemple de Sagor Diakhaté font de l'élevage de volailles. 

Madame Aïda M., la responsable du groupe de solidarité est âgée de 53, elle est mariée et mère de 6 enfants dont les 3 sont en charge, les autres sont majeurs et se prennent en charge. Elle a également la charge de sa belle fille pour laquelle son mari n'a pas encore de travail. elle est vendeuse de parfums, d'encens et de chaussures. Elle fait cette activité depuis 7 ans. Elle s'approvisionne au marché central de la ville pour ensuite revendre son produits dans le quartier en faisant du porte à porte. 

Son nouveau crédit lui permettra de renforcer son activité afin de générer plus de bénéfices et soutenir son marie dans les différentes charges familiales. Son objectif est d'aider financièrement son mari pour l'achèvement de leur maison en chantier.
texts.en:
The SOPEY MAME DIARRA BOUSSO solidarity group is one of the member groups which make up the Banc Villageois in DIAMAGUENE de Thiès. It is made up of nine members all coming from the same district which carries the name of the said Banc Villageois. They average around 40 years of age and are all married and mother to at least four children. They got together and formed this group out of affinity for one another and they are very committed in the various activities of their Banc Villageois, such as the monthly meetings, the repayment meetings etc. Their activities are diverse: they have small businesses selling smoked and/or dried fish, incense, fritters and fresh fish; some of them, such as Sagor Diagkaté, raise poultry. Mrs. Aïda M., who is in charge of this solidarity group is 53 years old, married and mother to six children, of whom three are in her care; the others are adults and look after themselves. She also has responsibility for her daughter-in-lax for whom her husband does not yet have any work. She is a vendor of perfumes, incense and shoes. She has been carrying out this activity for seven years. She gets her supplies and the central market in the town and then resells her products on a door-to-door basis in the neighorhood. Her new loan will allow her to strengthen her activity in order to generate more profit and also to help her husband out with the various family expenses. Her aim is to help her husband financially to finish the construction of their house which is underway.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Strengthen the group's economic initiatives

loans.name: Anwer's Group

texts.en:
Anwer bibi has applied for a loan to financially support her husband who wants to expand his business of selling goats. 
He buys goats, raises them, and then sells them for a profit. He will buy more goats from the loan money. 

Anwer bibi also does embroidery work to support her family financially. She has two sons and both of them work independently. She is hopeful that investment in her husband’s business will bring their financial problems to an end. She is hopeful for a better future.

loans.use: Purchase goats to sell

loans.name: Henriette

texts.en:
Henriette is 33 years old and married with 3 children who are 3, 4, and 6 years old.  Henriette is commonly known in the business of selling clothes for women and this is her 3rd successful year in this business.  The hours of her business are from 7 am until late in the evening.

Henriette is now requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to expand her business through purchasing additional styles of clothes for sale.  With this loan, Henriette will hopefully earn more profits and these profits will allow her to keep reinvesting for better financial stability.

loans.use: Different styles of women's clothes for resale

loans.name: Begg Diam Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité BEGG DIAM est composé de (6) femmes issues du même quartier. Le groupe de solidarité est crée le 14/12/2008 au sortir de la formation du comité de gestion du Banc Villageois de SERAS1 qui abrite ledit Groupe de solidarité. Elles ont eu à mener beaucoup d'activités ensemble, elles font des tontines, des rencontres périodiques de sensibilisation et d'information etc.  l'activité principale dans ce groupe c'est le petit commerce de légumes, des habits et de fruits de saison (pastèques, mangues, oranges, mandarines). Ce prêt leur permettra a financer ses activités ci-dessus. 

Madame NDEYE G., debout en deuxième position à partir de la droite sur la photo avec une écharpe verte claire sur la tête (et mise en évidence dans un médaillon en bas de la photo tout à fait à droite) est la présidente du groupe de solidarité. Elle est âgée de 53 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 4 enfants et a aussi la charge de ses 07 petits fils et petits filles. Elle fait du petit commerce, elle vend des pagnes, de l'encens et des colliers en perles. Son présent crédit lui permettra de renforcer sa marchandise. Elle soutien son mari dans la prise en charge de la famille, par exemple la santé et la nourriture.
texts.en:
The BEGG DIAM solidarity group is composed of 6 women from the same district. The solidarity group was created on December 14, 2008 at the end of the training by the management committee of the “Banc Villageois” of SERAS1, home to the said solidarity group. They have had to run many activities together. They hold tontines, recurring awareness and information meetings etc. This group’s main activity is the small-scale trade of vegetables, clothes and seasonal fruits (watermelons, mangos, oranges, tangerines). This loan will enable them to finance the activities above. Mrs. NDEYE G., standing second from right on the photo with a light green scarf on her head (shown in the inset at the bottom right of the photo) is the solidarity group’s president. She is 53 years old, married and the mother of 4 children. She is also in charge of her 7 grandsons and granddaughters. She runs a small-scale business. She sells loincloths, incense and pearl necklaces. Her current loan will enable her to build up her stock of goods. She supports her husband in providing for the family’s needs such as healthcare and food.

Translated from French by Marie-Elodie Bazy, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The financing of the solidarity group's business activities

loans.name: Seam

texts.en: Seam S., 29, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for quality palm products. S. sells groceries for an income of USD 8.6 per day. Her husband is a fisherman, earning an income of USD 6.6 per day. S. is requesting a loan of USD 800 to purchase more groceries to stock the store. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her fifth loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy more groceries for her store.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma G. is from the village of Kilikili, Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 39 years old. Vilma is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Vilma owns & operates a specialized retail store, selling and dealing daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste from a direct selling company in the local community. Vilma has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 4500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Vilma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Vilma is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Vilma from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more bags of rice, cooking oil, meat, fish, beans, etc.

loans.name: Enedina

texts.es: Rita tiene 30 años, vive con su esposo y su hijo en su casa propia. Hace más D. 10 años se dedica D. manera independiente a L. agricultura, sembrando maíz y habas que son productos nativos D. su zona, asimismo cultiva papa que es un tubérculo que crece en cualquier parte D. L. serranía peruana. Al cabo D. un tiempo y cuando ya están maduros, son llevados a vender al mercado mayorista D. su zona. Sin embargo cuando tiene que esperar que dichos productos puedan ser cosechados, elL. se dedica al bordado artesanal, siendo su casa un lugar indicado, por ser tranquilo además que está pendiente D. su familia. se siente muy satisfecha con las dos actividades que realiza, ya que le genera los ingresos necesarios para cubrir los gastos D. L. familia. Para el futuro desea intensificarse en estas actividades, D. esa manera logrará que su economía se más estable. Es su primer crédito con MFP, esta muy contento D.  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte D. su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso D. sus actividades. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en L. compra D. sacos D. abono para L. siembra D. maíz que realizará en las próximas fechas.
texts.en:
Rita is 30 and lives with her husband and child in her own home. For more than 10 years she has worked as a farmer planting corn and beans which are native to the area. She also grows potatoes which grow anywhere in the Peruvian mountains. When the crops are ripe they are taken to the local wholesale market. While she is waiting to harvest she works making artisan embroidery. Her home is ideal for this since it is peaceful and she can take care of her family. In the future she hopes to intensify these activities and so have a more stable income. This is her first loan with MFP and she is happy to know that she has the financial support as well as thankful to all those people responsible for making the loan possible. The loan will be very helpful in the advancement of her activities. She plans to invest the loan in the purchase of fertilizer for the upcoming corn crop.

Translated from Spanish by Solson Scherman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertlizer for the upcoming season

loans.name: Esmeraldas Sumi Group

texts.en:
This photo was taken in the home of Socorro J., one of the members of the group “Esmeraldas Sumi”, which is located in the State of VeraC. in Mexico. The women are standing around a table of donuts that Doña Socorro sells. She has been selling donuts for 12 years and her customers consider her to be a hardworking person. At the time of her loan request, Socorro felt happy to be reinvesting in her business. She is a 31 year old single mother who studied through elementary school and has two sons. Socorro wants to use this loan to buy supplies such as flour, oil, and sugar for making donuts. In addition, she hopes to see her children succeed in their studies and make improvements to her home so that she can proviD. them with better living conditions.

Lucia H. is the president of the group. She is 43 years old and studied through the sixth graD.. Lucia is a single mother and has one daughter. She has worked has a seamstress for 20 years. Lucia is requesting a loan to buy thread and fabrics to maintain her sewing business.

The group consists of 12 members. The other members are as follows:

María del Socorro E. sells clothing EsteL. M. C. sells lingerie Cristina P. sells clothing Evelia L. sells food L. R. sells cheese Zuleima H. sells shoes Ana María O. sells clothing Ignacia J. sells clothing Rosa María B., sells clothing Zita D. L. L. O. sells shoes

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase flour, oil, and sugar for making donuts

loans.name: Joralyn

texts.en: Joralyn M. runs a sari-sari (variety retail shop) selling both daily use products and food, including homemade viands, in her community. She is 29 years old, married and has one school-aged child. They are from the village of Dalirig, Manolo Fortich, Bukidnon. Joralyn has been in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2010, Joralyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Joralyn is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase products to sell. This will be her first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Leny

texts.es: Lenny, de 32 años, vive en casa de su madre, en compañía de ella, sus hermanas y sus 2 pequeños hijos; juntos trabajan cada día para salir adelante. Cada día de esta emprendedora mujer es de lucha constante por sacar adelante a sus hijos, siempre trabaja en distintos oficios que le ofrecen, y en la actualidad vende distintos implementos necesarios para el hogar como adornos de sala, ropa de dormir, accesorios para la mujer, entre otros pedidos que le hacen sus clientes. Dice que le gusta mucho su trabajo de comercialización, pues lo  realiza durante sus ratos libres además brinda a crédito y obtiene buenas ganancias  y no descuida la crianza de sus hijos, ya que  sola los mantiene. Quiere continuar con su negocio, pero como es una mujer emprendedora para el futuro tiene planeado instalar un pequeño bazar en su casa, de esta manera espera alcanzar el progreso. Es el primer crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente ya que no quiere quedar mal con las personas que se esfuerzan por hacer posible este préstamo que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso; además esta muy satisfecha con el trabajo de su grupo pues esta integrado por personas responsables y trabajadoras como ella. Lenny tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de mercadería para abastecer su negocio, ya que  quiere ofrecer lo mejor a sus clientes.
texts.en: Lenny is 32 years old and lives with her mother, her sisters and her two small children. Together, they work every day to get ahead. For this enterprising woman each day is a constant struggle to raise her children. She works the various jobs that she is offered and currently she sells a variety of home supplies such as room decorations, sleepwear and women's accessories, among other requests made by her clients. She says she loves her job because she can do it during her spare time, she gives her customers credit and earns good profits and she does not neglect her children's upbringing since she is the only provider. She wants to continue with her business but because she is an entrepreneurial woman she plans to set up a small shop in her home and in this way progress. This is her first loan with field partner MFP and she promises to pay her dues on time because she does not want to disappoint the people who make possible this loan which will allow her to continue working in search of progress. Also she is very pleased with her group's work because it is composed of responsible and hard working people like her. Lenny plans to invest the requested loan in buying merchandise to stock her business because she wants to offer the best to her customers.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise to stock her business.

loans.name: Felix Amada

texts.es:
Félix Amada es una señora muy trabajadora, se dedica al comercio de productos de venta de cerdos, compra y vende cerdos ese es su negocio desde hace años. Procreo cuatro hijos de los cuales uno trabaja con ella, en el destace, otro ingreso que tiene es la costura pues repara ropa, y hace nueva. 
Felix ha venido trabajando con la institución durante ocho ciclos en donde ha logrado comprar más cantidad  cerdo ya que muchas veces no se alcanza por el costo del cerdo. Pues el financiamiento ha sido de gran beneficio en su negocio.
Con esta nueva inversión comprara dos cerdos, y hacer sus nacatamales que día a día vende, como la carne, fritos entre otros ricos platillo de esta especie.
texts.en:
Felix is a very hard-working woman who is dedicated to selling pork products.  She has bought and sold pigs for years.

Felix has 4 children, 1 of whom works with her in the butcher shop.  Another is a seamstress who makes and repairs clothes.

Felix has worked with this institution during 8 loan cycles, making it possible for her to buy more pigs, since often, she lacks the funds to cover the cost of the pigs.  So, the financing has been of great benefit to her business.

With this new investment she will buy 2 pigs, and continue making the “nacatamales” (a local favorite) which day by day she sells, along with fried meat, among other rich dishes of this sort.

loans.use: TO BUY TWO PIGS AND INCREASE MEAT SALES

loans.name: Gladys Miriam

texts.es:
Gladys de 44 años, da sur servicios como enfermera y ginecóloga en una zona periurbana. Vive con su esposo y dos hijos en un lugar que está ubicado en la Perimetral de Guayaquil zona rodeada de un estero.  

Desde que era joven le gusto ayudar a la gente para que mejoren sus vidas. Cuando entro a la universidad decidió especializarse en ginecología para no solo ser doctora sino ayudarle a la gente que no puede tener un tratamiento médico en donde ella vivía. Ubico su negocio en “Bastión Popular” de servicios de enfermería y ginecología a unos valores muy económicos. En la actualidad da sus servicios como doctora en un local que tienen en su casa y en la zona de “Bastión”. También ayuda a las mujeres que quieren superarse y no han tenido la posibilidad de tener un estudio enseñándoles a realizar chequeos médicos y planificar sus vidas familiares.   

Para seguir ayudando a las mujeres ella quiere comprar con el préstamo materiales de enfermería y ginecología. En el futuro quiere abrir un nuevo consultorio en el sur de la ciudad ya que es ahí donde está la mayor parte de gente que no ha tenido oportunidad de superación.
texts.en:
Gladys is 44 years old.  She provides her services as a nurse and gynecologist in a peri-urban area.  She lives with her husband and two children in a place in Perimetral de Guayaquil, an area which is surrounded by a salt marsh.

Since she was very young, Gladys has always liked to help people to improve their lives.  When she started university she decided to specialize in gynecology.  She didn't just want to become a doctor but also wanted to help people where she lived who couldn't afford medical treatment.  She set up her business in “Bastión Popular”, providing nursing and gynecological services at very affordable prices.  She currently provides her services as a doctor in premises which are located in her own home and in the “Bastión” area.  She also helps women who want to improve themselves and haven't had the opportunity to study, teaching them to perform medical check-ups and plan their family lives.

In order to continue helping women, she would like to use her loan to buy nursing and gynecological materials.  In the future, she would like to open a new doctor's office in the south of the city since that is where most people who haven't had the opportunity to improve themselves live.

loans.use: To buy nursing and gynecological materials

loans.name: Segundo Pablo

texts.es:
Segundo Pablo V. N. tiene 52 años. Es casada, vive con la esposa y con los hijos, vive en el cantón de San Miguel en la Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 5 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. YAGUI GRANDE se encuentra ubicada A 30 minutos de la Oficina San Miguel, perteneciente al cantón San Miguel, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz y papas, esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

Segundo se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y papas. Compra sus productos en Ambato y San Miguel y los vende en la feria de San Miguel los días jueves.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de maíz y papas. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es poder construir una casa.

Le gusta el deporte y pasear con la familia.
texts.en:
Segundo Pablo V. N. is 52 years old. He is married and lives with his wife and children. He lives in the San Miguel canton (subdivision) in the Bolivar province. He has five children. 

The V.R.C. Yaguie Grande is located 30 minutes from the San Miguel office and belongs to the San Miguel canton. This solidarity group dedicates itself to short-cycle farming of corn and potatoes. They have been doing this for a long time. 

Segundo dedicates himself to farming corn and potatoes. He buys his products in Ambato and San Miguel and sells them at the fair in San Miguel on Thursdays. 

He is requesting this loan to buy agricultural supplies and fertilizers to grow corn and potatoes. The help from this loan will help him economically to provide for his necessities. He faces challenges such as pests and diseases and the changes in the climate. His dream is to be able to build a home. 

He likes sports and going out with his family.

loans.use: Agricultural supplies and fertilizers.

loans.name: Juana

texts.en:
Juana S. is from the village of Kibaning, Kalilangan, Bukidnon. She is 60 years old. Juana is widowed and has 8 adult children. To make a living, Juana owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods and junk food in the local community. Juana has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Juana joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Juana is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Juana from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell like canned goods.

loans.name: Medina

texts.en:
Medina is 58 years old, married, and supports her family by operating a general store. She lives in Medellin, Cebu. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2009 and has improved her living condition with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her general store business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 6,000.

Medina would like to borrow PHP 10,000 so that she can purchase more stock to sell in her store. This will be her 3rd loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 6,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Medina aspires to elevate her family's living condition and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Carmencita

texts.en:
Carmencita C. is from the village of Bal-ason, Gingoog City. She is 50 years old. Carmencita is married and has 5 adult children. To make a living, Carmencita owns & operates a manufacturing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from manufacturing & selling brooms to local businesses and community members. Carmencita has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Carmencita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Carmencita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional materials and as working capital. Carmencita is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Carmencita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products

loans.name: Chea's Group

texts.en:
Four people are making a group loan. They are located in Preaek Khmaer village in Kandal province. Mrs. Chea C. was born in 1972, and she is the group leader, selected by the other members of this group.

Mrs. Chea C. is single and lives with five family members at her home. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land that she uses to grow different vegetables for selling. Even with the farm, she still earns less than enough income to support her family members. So she would like to ask for a loan to buy rice for food.

loans.use: To buy rice for food

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios L. is from the village of Eastern, Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 57 years old. Remedios is married and has 9 adult-aged children. To make a living, Remedios owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling daily use products such as detergents, coconut wines & charcoal in the local community. Remedios has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 7500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Remedios joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Remedios has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Remedios is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell, like coconut wines & charcoal. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Remedios from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell, like coconut wines & charcoal

loans.name: Candida Del Carmen

texts.es:
Doña Cándida de 54 años de edad, reside en la Ciudad de San Miguel, se dedica a la venta de tortillas, vive con sus hijos David de 28 años y Carmen de 18 años de edad, ellos trabajan y ayudan a doña Cándida en los gastos del  hogar. 
El negocio de las tortillas lo realiza en su casa junto a su hija Carmen y comienzan a vender de 10:00am a 2:00pm, este negocio lo administran las dos, y actualmente solicita un préstamo para comprar maíz, esta es su principal material para preparar la venta y realizar las tortillas, ella piensa hacer la compra al por mayor ya que de esta manera tendrá a mejor precio el quintal de maíz y se ahorrara mayores gastos, teniendo suficiente para un periodo.
Su objetivo es mejorar cada día el negocio y aumentar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Doña Cándida is 54 years old and resides in the city of San Miguel with her children, David (age 28) and Carmen (age 18). Both of her children work and help with the household expenses.

Doña Cándida sells tortillas and manages her business from her home. She and her daughter Carmen begin selling at 10am and continue until 2pm. They both operate the business. Cándida is currently requesting a loan to buy corn, the main ingredient used for preparing tortillas to sell. She plans to buy in bulk so that she can get the best price for a quintal of corn (1 quintal = 46kg). This will help her save on her expenses, which will help build sufficient capital over time.

Her goals include improving her business each day and increasing her earnings.

loans.use: To purchase corn for preparing tortillas.

loans.name: Genie

texts.en:
Encouragement is like energy to a tired soul, and Genie T. proves so. Genie, 58, is married to Roel and is currently running her own sari-sari (variety) store. They have four children who all stay at home in Ascoville, Malaria, Caloocan City.

Genie’s sari-sari store is located very near their home, so she can manage it simultaneously with her household chores. The store has been running for five years now. As she meets the immediate needs of her neighbors for instant food and toiletries, Genie is able to earn PHP4,800 as a net income monthly.

To help her continue operations of her business, she would like to request for a PHP20,000 loan. She will use this money to purchase additional merchandise for her store, such as sachets of shampoo, coffee, and canned goods. Genie sees this loan as an encouragement for her to strive all the more for the improvement of her store. Indeed, the store allows her to increase the level of her lifestyle.

Vacations are a hindrance to the daily sales of her store. But she is currently working on her strategies to cope with such time of the year. Genie desires to see her store gradually turn into a grocery.

As a CCT community partner, she faithfully attends the group's weekly fellowship* meetings where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she receives.

*All CCT community partners and clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Magali Francisca

texts.es: La señora M. S., tiene una pulpería en su casa de habitación, la cual atiende personalmente con la ayuda de su hijo mayor,  con los prestamos que se le han atendido ha venido ampliando su negocio y mejorando su vivienda con las ganancia que le genera la pulpería, con el apoyo de su esposo que trabaja como mecánico, mantienen los gastos de la casa y la educación de sus hijos. Ahora necesita de este nuevo financiamiento para mejorar el inventario de la mercadería  y dar mayor atención a sus clientes para obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en: Mrs. Martinez S. runs a small general store out of her home.  She personally runs the store with the help of her oldest son.  With the loans she has previously received, she has expanded her store and improved her home with the income she has generated through the store.  With the help of her husband who works as a mechanic, they cover the household expenses and the education of their children.  Now she needs a loan to improve the inventory of her store in order to better tend to her customers and increase her earnings.

loans.use: to purchase general store products: sugar, rice, beans, oil, corn, coffee, soap, paper, clothes, shoes.

loans.name: Maria Ines

texts.es: Me llamo Ines, soy de la comunidad de San Francisco Talachichilpa, yo me dedico a bordar, hacer servilletas y de ves en cuando hago chamarritas para los bebes o faldas para las señoras, siempre he tejido y bordado me enseño mi madre y ha sido como ya una costumbre de estar tejiendo, vendo las cosas que hago, por ejemplo vendo mas los manteles para la mesa, cubren toda la mesa y se ven bonitos como adornos, pido el prestamo para hacer manteles y bordados, hacer servilletas y venderlas para ganar dinero, mis deseos es que asi como haga un bordado se venda, es un poco dificil vender lo que hago porque hay mucha gente que sabe bordar y se les hace normal, pero ya saliendo hay mucha gente que les gusta y les atrae el tejido, tengo 11 hijos ya son casados, vivo sola porque enviude, la casa en la que vivo es propia.
texts.en:
My name is Ines, and I am from the San Francisco Tlachichilpa community.

I embroider napkins and sometimes I make jackets for babies or skirts for women.  I have always weaved and embroidered.  My mother taught me, and it is now like a habit to be weaving.  I sell the things that I make.

For example, I sell tablecloths the most.  They cover the entire table, and they look pretty as decorations.

I am requesting a loan to make tablecloths and embroideries, to make napkins, and to sell them to earn money.

My wish is that as I make embroidery it sells.  It is a little difficult to sell what I make because a lot of people know how to embroider, and they do so regularly.  But, it now appears that a lot of people like it and are drawn to woven goods.

I have 11 children who are now married.  I live alone because I am a widow.  The house in which I live is my own.

loans.use: to buy fabric to embroider and weave

loans.name: Briceida Elizabeth

texts.es:
En el balneario de San Clemente  cada quince días se reúne el Banco Comunal 1 de Diciembre. Este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas, que son muy visitadas por muchos turistas nacionales y extranjeros,  ofrece diversidad de lugares hermosos y una rica variedad de platos típicos de la región.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Briseida, tiene 25 años de edad, está casada y fruto de esta relación tienen un lindo bebe de un mes de nacido. Su esposo es guardia de seguridad.

Ella tiene un restaurante en sociedad con su mama en el cual venden todo tipo de platos pero sobre todo mariscos, ya que eso es lo mas buscan los turistas que llegan hasta esta hermosa playa que es muy visitada sobre todo los fines de semana, trabajan todos los días desde las 5h00 hasta las 16h00, preparan desayunos, almuerzos y platos a la carta, nos cuenta que llevan con su restaurante ya por 8 años y que les ha ido muy bien.
 
Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar arroz, carne, pescado y otros ingredientes para la preparación de los alimentos. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace  cinco años, es la fiscal de pagos del banco y le gusta porque los créditos son de gran ayuda para todos en el grupo. 

Su sueño es tener otro restaurante pero para ella sola.
texts.en:
The 1 de Diciembre communal bank meets every two weeks in the San Clemente resort.   This place is known for its beautiful beaches that are visited by many local and foreign tourists.  It offers a diversity of beautiful places and a rich variety of traditional, regional dishes.

We met Briseida, 25, here.  She’s married and has a beautiful one-month-old baby.  Her husband is a Security Guard.

She has a restaurant in partnership with her mother where they sell all sorts of dishes but especially seafood since that’s what the tourists who frequent this beautiful beach that’s very popular especially on weekends, most want.  They work every day from 5am until 4pm preparing breakfast, lunch and a la carte dishes.  She tells us that they’ve had the restaurant for 8 years and they’ve done very well.

She will use this loan to buy rice, meat, fish and other ingredients to prepare the dishes.  She’s been in the communal bank for five years and she’s its Payment Supervisor.  She likes it because the loans are of great help to everyone in the group.  Her dream is to have another restaurant but just for herself only.

loans.use: to buy rice, meat, fish and other meal preparation ingredients.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is married with six children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Erlinda is 63 years old. She has a restaurant business in the Philippines. 

Erlinda requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Erlinda has been in this business for six years. In the future, Erlinda would like to save money to expand her business further.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Kadii

texts.en:
Kadii is a married woman with six children.  Four have completed their education while 2 still attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past 10 years, she has operated a vegetable stall business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. Her major challenge is seasonality: during the hot dry season, the availability of vegetables is lower. She dreams of expanding her stall in the future.

With the KSHS 30,000 loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase bundles of vegetables, bananas, tomatoes, potatoes and onions for sale. She joined Yehu because of simplicity in lending procedures.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of vegetables, bananas, tomatoes, potatoes and onions for sale.

loans.name: Biakida

texts.en:
Biakida is a married woman with 2 children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past 4 years, Biakida has operated a charcoal selling business, selling by retail to her neighbours and passersby. Biakida faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation and seasonality in her business. She dreams of expanding her business and selling by wholesale in the future. With the KES 30,000 loan she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal and coconuts to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal and coconuts for sale.

loans.name: Elaine

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “RICHARY ANTEÑA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Anta, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Elaine; ella tiene 36 años de edad y es casada y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de repuestos de moto, ella trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m,la socia también se dedica al negocio de tejer chompas, ella teje chompas para niños, varones y mujeres y lo vende en las distintas ferias que se realiza en el distrito de Anta, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de repuestos de moto y negocio de tejidos de chompas. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar repuestos de moto y para comprar lana de colores para tejer las chompas.
                                                     
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Elaine, 36, is a member of the “RICHARY ANTEÑA” communal bank located in Anta District belonging to Anta Province and Cusco Department.

She is married and has three children.  She alternates her daily activities with the sale of motorcycle spare parts.  She works from 8am until 7pm.  She also knits sweaters for children, men and women that she sells in the various markets that take place in Anta District.  She wants to expand the motorcycle spare parts business and the sweater knitting business so is asking for a loan to buy motorcycle spare parts and wool yarn in assorted colors to knit the sweaters.

She is happy about the loan and commits to pay her installments.

loans.use: to buy motorcycle spare parts and assorted color wool yarn to knit sweaters.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a married woman with one child who is still too young for school. She lives at a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food, rent bills and clothing.

For the past two years, she has operated a cosmetic vending business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of competition from other cosmetic sellers in her area of operation. She dreams of establishing another branch in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000 loan, she wants to purchase bundles of cosmetics and pay for transportation. She decided to join Yehu to access loans in order to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of cosmetics and pay for transportation.

loans.name: Rafael Angel

texts.es:
Rafael Ángel es vecino de la comunidad de las Bonitas de Platanares, en Pérez Zeledón, de la provincia de San José. Es una zona donde se presenta la actividad agropecuaria, los habitantes de la región en su mayoría son productores de café y de ganado doble propósito. 
El está solicitando un préstamo por el monto de ₡600.000 (seiscientos mil colones), esto para la compra de productos de limpieza para su local, el cual es una pañalera llamada Pérez, donde tiene a la mano todo lo que los vecinos necesitan en el momento.
El desea incrementar el negocio para que su microempresa crezca cada día más y darles a sus clientes lo mejor.  El negocio de Rafael inicio como un nuevo ingreso para mejorar la calidad de vida de mi familia, y así darles un mejor estudio a sus hijos.  Su meta es poder darle final a todos sus proyectos cumpliendo con sus expectativas.
Rafael es parte de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de las Bonitas, es su primer préstamo y nos  ha dicho que ser socio de esta empresa ha sido una excelente opción para obtener su crédito ya que es más fácil y rápido el trámite.
texts.en:
Rafael is a member of the “Bonitas de Platanares” (Beautiful Bananas) community in P. Zeledon, San Jose province. In this zone people practice farming; the inhabitants in their majority are producers of both coffee and cattle.

Rafael is requesting a loan of 600,000 colons to buy cleaning products to sell in his general store, which is named “P.”. He tries to have on hand everything the neighbors need at the moment.

Rafael wants to expand the store so that his micro-enterprise grows daily and he can give his customers the best. His business began as a new source of income to improve the quality of life of his family, and provide a better education for his children. Rafael's goal is to be able to complete all his projects, fulfilling his expectations.

Rafael is a part of the “Empresa de Credito Comunal de las Bonitas” (Beautiful Enterprise of Communal Credit). It is his 1st loan and he tells us that being a member of this enterprise has been an excellent option for obtaining loans, since it is easier, and the processing of paperwork is faster.

loans.use: to buy cleaning products to sell.

loans.name: Kymbatbu's Group

texts.en:
Kymbatbu is 40 years old and leads this loan group. She lives in the coal-mining town of Tashkomur with three children. Her husband makes a living as a welder, while she earns an income as a seamstress and clothing designer. Doing this type of work has been her passion since childhood and she was able to turn it into a profession in 1995. Over time, she has built up a relationship with textile suppliers and people who buy her products, which are unique in their quality and beauty. Most of her clients are women, so Kymbatbu recently added household items to the list of products she sells. She earns about 9,000 soms a month, and is applying for this loan to buy more fabric and materials to use in making new masterpieces.  

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
								
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and materials.

loans.name: Ayélé Akpédzé

texts.fr:
Ayélé Akpédzé est une femme âgé(e) de 30 ans. Elle est mariée å un employé de bureau. Elle a 01 enfant. 
Ayélé Akpédzé travaille comme revendeuse de mèches, de chaussures et sacs depuis 2008. Elle vend à ses clients dans l’enceinte d’un hôpital. Elle achète les produits à Lomé. 
Ayélé Akpédzé a requis son second cycle de prêt à WAGES afin d’acheter des mèches, des chaussures et des sacs
.
texts.en: Ayélé Akpédzé is a 30-year-old woman. She is married to an office worker and has one child. Ayélé Akpédzé has been selling hair extensions, shoes and bags since 2008. She sells her wares from a room in a hospital and buys her supplies in Lomé. She is asking for a second loan from WAGES so that she can buy more stock.

loans.use: to buy hair extensions, shoes and bags for resale.

loans.name: Jose Israel

texts.es:
José, vive con su familia, por sus hijos de  15, 13, 10, 8 años de edad, y su esposa, ellos se dedican a la fabricación de productos de loza, de esta actividad dependen todos, es por eso que todos colaboran para hacer comales y ollas, este negocio don Israel lo aprendió desde pequeño y lo ha venido perfeccionando en el transcurso de los años, hoy en día este  es el que le ayuda a solventar  las necesidades del hogar; él nuevamente está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de materiales como leña, losa cruda y nacazcol.
Estos materiales le permitirán continuar trabajando con su familia, y realizar las ventas de los productos y obtener ingresos, para cubrir lo que es más necesario.
El objetivo de don José es que sus a sus hijos sigan estudiando, además tener lo suficiente en alimentación para mantener a su familia, también tener oportunidad de crecer como artesano dándose a conocer en otros mercados.
texts.en:
José lives with his family: his children, aged 15, 13, 10 and 8 years old, and his wife.  They work manufacturing pottery cookware.  They are all dependent on this activity, and this is why they all work together to make griddles and pots.  Don José learned this business when he was young, and has looked to perfect it over the years.  Today, this is what helps to pay for the household necessities.

He is currently requesting a loan to buy materials such as firewood, clay, and nacazcol (a black dye).  These materials will allow him to continue working with his family, and to sell his products and earn income to cover what's most necessary.

Don José's objective is for his children to continue in school, and additionally to have enough food to keep his family.  He also wants to have the opportunity to grow as an artisan, to give him a reputation in other markets.

loans.use: to buy firewood, clay, and nacazcol (dye) to make griddles and pots.

loans.name: Los Vecinos Group

texts.es:
Éste Banco comunal se llama “Los Vecinos”, lo conforman 15 emprendedores quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros relacionados con el comercio, entre los cuales se encuentran, venta de ropa, preparación de frituras, masas, local en servicio de manicura, pedicura, relajación, venta de abarrotes, helados, quesos y longanizas. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la comuna de Recoleta, ciudad de Santiago.
Jennifer integrante del grupo del Banco comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra en la tercera fila, ocupando el segundo lugar de izquierda a derecha, su cabello es castaño claro y viste un sweater color fucsia. 
Se dedica a preparar y vender comida rápida, específicamente pizzas, papas fritas, empanadas, sopaipillas, té y café. Sus ventas las realiza afuera de su casa. 
Trabaja en éste rubro desde hace 10 años y desde hace 2 años en forma particular, desde su domicilio particular. Sus insumos los compra en la vega (feria para comerciantes), ahí compra una vez por semana.
Comenta que su clientela va muy bien.
Jennifer trabaja los días jueves, viernes, sábado y domingo. 
Con el crédito comprará bidones de aceite, bolsas de papel, harina, masas y bebidas.
Sus metas son tener un kiosco afuera de su casa, de manera más establecida. 
Jennifer vive junto a su esposo, sus dos hijas de 7 y 3 años de edad, además junto a su padre, hermano y cuñada. 
Sus sueños son estudiar la carrera de enfermería. 
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de los créditos y servicios otorgados por Fondo Esperanza, el grupo en del cual participa es unido y comprometido. 
Recoleta es una de las 34 comunas de Santiago (capital de Chile) y se encuentra ubicada en el sector centro-norte del Santiago, región metropolitana. Cuenta con un activo comercio, destacando el barrio comercial de Patronato que ha acogido principalmente a comerciantes árabes (en un principio) y coreanos (en la actualidad).
texts.en:
This communal bank is called Los Vecinos [Neighbors] and has 15 entrepreneurs working in various areas of trade, among which are selling clothing, preparation of snacks, pastries, manicures, pedicures, relaxation, selling groceries, ice cream, cheeses and sausages. All of them live in the district of Recoleta in Santiago.

Jennifer, a member of the communal bank, can be found in the photo in the 3rd row (from the back), 2nd from the left, with light brown hair and wearing a fuchsia sweater. She prepares and sells fast food, especially pizzas, French fries, pies, sopaipillas [fried dough], tea and coffee. Her sales take place at home, outside her house.

She has been working in this field for 10 years and 2 years ago she began selling from her own home. She buys her supplies in La Vega (for fair trade) once a week. She comments that business is going very well.  Jennifer works Thursday, Friday, Saturday and Sunday.  With this loan she will buy large containers of oil, paper bags, flour, pasta and drinks. Her goal is to be more established and have a kiosk outside her house.

Jennifer lives with her husband, her 2 daughters who are 7 and 3 years old, together with her father, brother, and sister-in-law.

Her dream is to become a nurse. She is very happy and grateful for the loans and services provided by Fondo Esperanza [Hope Fund]. This group in which she participates is united and committed.

Recoleta is one of the 34 districts of Santiago (capital of Chile) and is located in the north-central metropolitan area of Santiago. It has an active trade highlighted by the commercial village of Patronato, originally mostly Arab traders, but today mostly Koreans.

loans.use: to buy large containers of oil, paper bags, flour, pasta and drinks

loans.name: Mamadou

texts.fr: Commerçant dans une ville qui se trouve a proximité de la capital du Sénégal, il s'active dans ce domaine depuis plus de 5 ans. Ce prêt lui permettra de renforcer sa boutique et d'augmenter son fonds de roulement afin d'améliorer sa productivité. Il veut assi acheté des marchandises pour renforcer son stock de marchandises afin de satisfaire l'exigence de ses clients et les permettre de ne plus se déplacer au marché pour faire des achats.
texts.en: This is a trader from a town near to the capital of Senegal, who has been active in this field for more than five years. This loan will allow him to develop his shop and increase his working capital in order to improve productivity. He also wants to buy some goods in order to boost his stock and satisfy customer demand so that his customers will not have to go to the market to buy their products.

loans.use: to boost his stock

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort sells salted fish, provisions and corn dough in Jukwa, near Abura. She has been selling corn dough (shown in the photo) for 20 years.

Comfort has received senior high education. She is married and has 3 children. Her husband is a blacksmith. Comfort assists him in taking care of the home. Her loan will be used to buy corn to make dough to sell. Comfort hopes to use the new profits from her business to buy extra bags of maize.

loans.use: to buy corn to make dough to sell.

loans.name: Mary Jean

texts.en:
Mary Jean is 47 years old. She is married with two children.

Mary Jean has a shop that sells ready-to-wear clothes like t-shirts, blouses and pants. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 8,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy additional t-shirts, blouses and pants to sell.

Mary Jean has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Mary Jean hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional ready-to-wear clothing like t-shirts, blouses, and pants.

loans.name: Sphy

texts.en:
Sphy (shown in the photo) is 30 years old. Her husband, Mr. Phally Ny, is 22. They have been married since 2008 and have a 1-year-old son. The family lives about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh. 

Sphy has been a tailor since 2007. She operates the business at home. Her husband is a lathe operator. She is requesting her first loan of $1,100 to purchase a motorcycle for commuting.

loans.use: To buy additional fabric for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad is a 34-year-old Lebanese man who lives with his wife and four school-aged children. He has been working as a farmer cultivating vegetables for the past 15 years. With his requested loan of $800 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l., he will be able to buy new farming supplies, such as fertilizers and seeds, in order to increase his productivity during the coming season. In the future, Ahmad plans to further expand his business and start cultivating exotic fruits.

loans.use: to buy new farming supplies such as fertilizers and seeds.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en: Arlene is 37 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 6 children.  Arlene has a shop that sells coconut shells and wood charcoal by the sack. She has had this business for 3 years. She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy wood & coconut shells for charcoal making.  Arlene has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Arlene hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy wood & coconut shells for charcoal making

loans.name: Roque

texts.en:
Roque has been farming rice since he got married to Milagros. He has been involved in this kind of business for 21 years. Roque had no other choice for an employment except rice farming because he only finished his elementary education.

He is now 47 years and has two children. Though his family experience of scarcity in financial matters, he still strives and perseveres to provide his family's needs.

Someday, Roque aims to see all his children earn a degree and be able to seek a good employment, too.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds and fertilizers used in farming.

loans.name: Ningbéri

texts.fr:
Ningbéri est une femme âgé(e) de 56 ans. Elle est mariée à un technicien et a 04 enfants. Un seul va à l’école. Le premier a 33ans et le dernier 21.
Ningbéri travaille comme revendeuse de charbons de bois et des céréales depuis 2010. Elle vend à la maison à toute personne et achète les produits à Lomé.
Ningbéri a requis son crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter plus de marchandises afin de sa satisfaire sa clientèle. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité
Dans les prochaines années, Ningbéri voudrait élargir le commerce Elle dit qu’avec les profits, Elle prévoit d'assurer l’avenir de ses enfants surtout la benjamine.
texts.en:
Ningbéri is a 56-year-old woman. She is married to a technician and has four children. Only one goes to school. The firstborn is 33 and the youngest 21 years old.

Ningbéri has been selling charcoal and cereals since 2010. She sells from home to all types of individuals and buys her products in Lomé.

Ningbéri requested her loan from WAGES in order to buy more merchandise in order to satisfy her clientèle. She wants to reinvest in her business.
