In the coming years, Ningbéri would like to expand her business. She says that with the profits, she plans to ensure her children's future especially that of the youngest.

loans.use: to buy bags of charcoal and cereals.

loans.name: Bernard

texts.en:
Bernard is 72 years old, he is married to Esther. They are blessed with four adult children. He has been in the bee-keeping business for the past year, with a monthly income of KES 8,000, which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his first loan with KADET after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Barnard will use the loan to buy beehives. With the anticipated profit from the business, he will open a retail shop. His hopes and dreams are to open a wholesale shop, which will increase his income.

loans.use: To buy beehives.

loans.name: Putri Jaya Group

texts.en:
Hapazoh is a mother of three children. One of her children is still in school. She has been selling merchandise like sugar, eggs and drinks for five years. The business is running smoothly. The income that she gets can contribute to the income from her husband as a laborer to provide their daily basic needs.  She plans to use her part of the loan to buy more merchandise such as sugar, eggs, and snacks to sell in her store. In the future, she wants to have a bigger store. She also hopes her child can get an education through college.

Other group member businesses are selling cell phone minute refills and selling clothes on credit.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise such as sugar, drinks, eggs, and snacks to sell

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is 35 years old and married with 5 children who are between the ages of 12 and 1 years old.  She has been actively farming in her home area of Kitale for eight years and sells her farm produce of milk, maize and beans to the local market.  Besides farming she operates a food vending business with her sales made to casual workers in the town, especially in construction sites.

Eunice has requested a loan of  35,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to boost her poultry farming by buying more birds.  She says this will enable her to enjoy the economies of scale and give better returns for her investment.  She aspires to grow her business so that she can sustain high transport costs to supply the goods to the market and to have access to better markets.

Eunice is however worried about the high cost of treating poultry birds for diseases.

loans.use: To buy poultry birds

loans.name: Luz Dary

texts.es:
Luz Dary es una persona que ha tenido que atravesar por muchas adversidades en su vida, sin embargo, sus ganas de trabajar y espíritu de lucha le han permitido superar las adversidades y continuar progresando junto a su familia. Luz Dary se encuentra casada y es madre de 3 hijos de 19, 6 y 1 año de edad, quienes son su motivación para trabajar fuertemente en su negocio. Luz Dary tenía una tienda general en su municipio, pero debido a la fuerte violencia que tuvo su municipio durante un tiempo, su negocio, ya que no era visitado por nadie, dejó de ser rentable. Posteriormente, cuando pasó la época de violencia, Luz Dary aprovechó una gran oportunidad en su municipio, que fue la creación de un sector para la pesca, en el cual en diferentes épocas del año hace torneos; allí montó una tienda donde ofrece productos como snack, licores y gaseosas. Los clientes de Luz Dary son generalmente turistas, quienes visitan la zona para aprovechar de la actividad de la pesca. Debido a que próximamente iniciará un torneo de pesca en este sector, Luz Dary quiere surtir su tienda con el ánimo de poder tener gran variedad de productos para los visitantes que tendrá durante el torneo, y es por esto que busca que un préstamo le brinde la posibilidad de acceder a la compra de gaseosas, snack, y licores para surtir su tienda para la temporada donde sus clientes aumentan considerablemente. 

Luz Dary espera que de esta manera sus ingresos aumenten considerablemente, pues podrá satisfacer las necesidades de su numerosa clientela. Además, Luz Dary espera que con ingresos adicionales su familia pueda gozar de una mejor calidad de vida y mayores oportunidades de trabajo.

loans.use: Compra de gaseosas, snack, y licores para surtir su tienda para la temporada donde sus clientes aumentan considerablemente.

loans.name: Andris Tagni Group

texts.es:
Está conformado por 3 mujeres emprendedoras, que se integraron hace 3 meses con el propósito de acceder a financiamiento para mejorar sus ingresos familiares e incrementar el inventario de sus pequeños negocios. Andris Tagni es un vocablo miskito que significa flor de naranja.

Bertha Jasmina: Es la coordinadora del grupo solidario, originaria de Waspam, tiene 25 años de edad, casada, tiene un hijo de 2 años. Desde hace 5 meses estableció su pequeño pulpería en su vivienda de madera, con el propósito de comprar mercadería solicita su primer financiamiento: Granos básicos, chiverías, entre otros productos. Su sueño es tener un negocio prospero en el mercado municipal.
texts.en: It is made up of 3 enterprising women who three months ago joined together with the purpose of accessing financing in order to improve the family incomes and increase the inventory of their small businesses. Andris Tagni is a Miskito term which means orange bloom. Bertha Jasmina is the coordinator of the supportive group. She is a twenty-five year old native of Waspam, married, and has a two year old child. Five months ago she established her small grocery store in her wooden house. She requests her first loan to buy merchandise: basic grains and snacks, among other products. Her dream is to have a prosperous business in the municipal market.

loans.use: to buy basic grains and snacks, among other products.

loans.name: Samang

texts.en:
A local resident in Battambang province, SamAng is 36 years old and is married with a son who is under the age of school. To support family living, she is growing rice, selling fish, and working for others for a fee.
Since she is in need of working capital, SamAng decided to apply for a loan from VisionFund to buy organic fertilizer, a cow, and fish to resell. She hopes to earn more income to send her son to school and to upgrade the standard of living.

loans.use: To buy organic fertilizer to boost rice crop yields and to buy fish to resell to send her son to school.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Jane would like to buy beads materials

loans.name: Regina

texts.en: Madam Regina sells fabrics from house to house in her community. She is a client of Kraban Support Foundation and very hardworking. She is seeking a loan of $900.00 from Kiva to enable her purchase more fabrics for sale.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Ablavi

texts.fr:
Ablavi A. was born in 1979 in Anfoin. She is married and the mother of two. She dropped out of primary school and, very early on, began a business selling fruit juice. Having saved a little money, she started an itinerant business selling generic pharmaceuticals in her village. Today, with a dozen years in this domain, she knows all the in's and out's of her work. Her dream now is to get established in one location that bears the name of her business. And then she would supply this mini-pharmacy with all the the basic medicines. This is why she needs a loan of $1,000. The success of her dream will lead to improved living conditions for her and her family.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Née à Anfoin en 1979, Madame A. Ablavi est mariée et mère de deux enfants. Elle arrêta ses études au cours primaire et commença très tôt un commerce de vente de jus de fruits. Ayant fait un peu d’économie, elle se lança dans la vente des produits génériques qu’elle fait promener dans les villages. Aujourd’hui avec une dizaine d’années dans le domaine, elle cerne les rouages de son activité. Son rêve ce jour est de s’installer dans un local qui portera le nom de son activité, ensuite doter sa mini pharmacie de tous les médicaments de première nécessité, d’où le besoin d’un fonds de crédit de $1000. La réalisation de son rêve pourra l’amener à une amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: Supply her mini-pharmacy with all the basic medicines

loans.name: Akouwa

texts.fr:
At the age of 41, Mrs A. Akouwa runs a business selling raw ingredients used in the preparation of sauce. Divorced from her husband, she is responsible for her five (5) children which she has trouble supporting. A lack of business capital has kept her from buying merchandise in bulk. Instead, she has had to buy on credit which costs more money. This is why she is asking for a loan to fabricate a shelving unit to better display her merchandise and attract more clients. This loan of $700 will allow her to provide for the family and improve their living conditions.

Translated from French by Susan Bell, Kiva Volunteer.

Agée de 41 ans, Madame A. Akouwa exerce comme activité la vente des produits de consommation destinés à préparer la sauce. Divorcée de son mari, elle a en charge ses cinq (5) enfants qu’elle arrive à supporter difficilement faute de fonds de commerce pouvant lui permettre d’acheter les marchandises en gros et éviter l’achat à crédit qui lui revient plus cher. C’est pourquoi, elle sollicite ce crédit pour fabriquer une étagère pour mieux exposer sa marchandise et attirer plus de clients. Ce crédit de $700 permettra à la famille de subvenir à ses besoins et d’améliorer ainsi leurs conditions de vie.

loans.use: fabrication of a shelving unit and purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Firdos

texts.en:
I am Firdos B. and I have four children. I stitch clothes to order for my neighborhood clientele. My husband operates a vegetable cart with the help of our eldest son. Our monthly income is approximately US$ 120.

Last year I took a loan from Asasah, a microfinance institution, and invested the money in my husband’s vegetable business. The profits got better and we were able to raise our meager standard of living. We also managed to buy a donkey for our cart. My husband plans to expand his business further and open a vegetable shop. He needs a loan of US$ 325 to add to our savings to use for this purpose.

loans.use: Expand my husband's vegetable business

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
Nancy is 43 years old and lives with her husband and children on Guaman de Ayala Street in the area of Villa Nuevo Potosí in the city of La Paz. She dedicates herself to business and runs a grocery store from her home. In addition, she studied hairdressing and also occupies herself with this activity on Saturdays and Sundays. The requested loan will be used to increase her store's inventory and thus, offer her customers a variety of products. This is her first time with IMPRO. This is also her first loan and a completed credit evaluation qualifies her for one.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Nancy tiene 43 años de edad y vive en la calle Guaman de Ayala de la zona de Villa Nuevo Potosí de la ciudad de La paz con su esposo y sus hijos; ella se dedica al comercio y tiene una tienda de abarrotes en su mismo domicilio de la cual genera sus ingresos, pero además estudio peinados y también con esta actividad trabaja los días sábados y domingos. El crédito que solicita es para aumentar su mercadería de la tienda y así ofrecer una mayor variedad a sus clientes. No tiene antecedente con IMPRO; este será su primer crédito y la evaluación socio-económica la califica para poder acceder a uno.

loans.use: buy merchandise for her store's inventory

loans.name: Talisami

texts.en: Forty five year old plantation owner Talisami, alongside with her husband, has struggled to keep their plantation alive.  To add to the stress, they have six children.  This current loan will go towards purchasing chemicals needed, as they are thinking of expanding their plantation.  It will also help purchase fencing wires and more taro tops to grow new produce. An honest living is what Talisami would like to achieve, as well as farming her land.

loans.use: To buy farming supplies for her plantation

loans.name: Jamil

texts.en:
The saying “start small and grow up, start big and blow up” is the guiding principle for K. Jamil. He started producing animal feed ten years ago and has never turned back. He processes cattle and chicken feed out of maize husks, small fish, cow bones and snail shells. He has a milling machine and a mixer which he uses to produce the feed. In a day, he produces 20 bags, which in most cases are already ordered by clients. Jamil got the idea of starting a business when he was working with UGACHICK, a local breeding and animal feed processing plant in Kampala.

K. and his wife are blessed with 5 children whom they provide with all the necessities of life. K. is 39 years of age and hopes to erect a commercial building in Lugazi Town before he is 45 years. He is an honest person and delivers all orders as requested. This has led to an increased number of customers. The business is growing very fast, thus the need for more funding.

loans.use: Kayiwa wants to buy 2 tonnes of maize grain to process animal feed

loans.name: Salieu

texts.en:
Salieu is 55 years old and married with four children. He buys cows from the village and sells them in Freetown.

His previous loan enabled him to purchase two cows a month for sale. This has reduced time needed for transporting/traveling to Freetown.

Mr. J. is requesting a loan of $1,200 (Le.3,500,000) to increase his stock and thus reduce time for traveling.

Mr. J. is also a chairman of a loan recovery committee in the village. He oversees that clients repay their loans to SMT on time. For a year and half, loan recovery in Dogolia village has been 100 percent.

loans.use: Salieu wants to reduce his time and costs for traveling to buy cattle by purchasing more at one time.  He needs additional capital to do so.

loans.name: Kiriri Development Group

texts.en: Damalie, the chairperson of Kiriri Development Group, is 32 years old and married with 2 girls and 2 boys. She also helps to look after 3 cousins, including paying their school dues. She is a nursing assistant at Kanzira Health Centre II, and she has a 6-year-old clinic at home that sells mostly herbal medicines like Chlorophyll, Gano Coffee, and Diana tonic in syrup form, which help reduce fats and pressure in the body. She buys the medicine from DianaPharm at the Royal Complex building in Kampala. Members of her group really love the group and would love to see it grow, this being their second time asking for a loan. Thank you for your kind hearts.

loans.use: Damalie intends to buy more Chlorophyll, Gano Coffee, and Diana tonic in syrup form for her clinic, as well as cover the transport costs to Kampala, once she gets the Kiva loan.

loans.name: Karla Petrona

texts.es:
Karla is a young 30 year-old who works as an nursery assistant in the children’s hospital. The loan would be used to make improvements to her mother’s house, with whom she lives. She is a very responsible and hard-working person, but her small salary makes it difficult to make any improvements to the home.

It is a small dwelling that is part of a municipal project and she hopes to build a bedroom. She is single and supports her mother, who works as a housekeeper. She is a responsible and honest young woman, with a strong spirit to improve her situation. She is highly regarded by her workmates.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Karla es una joven de 30 años, trabaja como auxiliar de enfermeria en la clinica materno infantil, el crédito lo utilizará para mejorar la vivienda de su mamá con quien habita, es una persona responsable y muy trabajadora, ella tiene un salario muy bajo y muy dificil puede realizar otras obras en la vivienda. Ésta es una vivienda muy pequeña de un proyecto de la alcaldia y pretende construir un dormitorio, es soltera y apoya a su mamá que trabaja como doméstica, es una joven responsble honesta y con espiritu de superacion y muy estimada por sus compañeras de trabajo.

loans.use: Purchase construction materials to build a bedroom.

loans.name: Nuura

texts.en: Nuura is married and she has one child. Nuura been buying and selling large quantities rice, millet, beans, peanuts, wheat and some grocery products for ten years. She travels to the northern part of Ghana to buy her products and retails them in the central region of the country. The cost of her frequent travels reduce her income. She will use her loan to buy more bags of rice, millet, beans, peanuts, etc., on each trip so that her travel expenses are fewer and she can avoid price hikes. She is a member of the group called “Odwanwhefo Pa” meaning the Good Shepherd.  Members agree to guarantee for each other to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more bags of rice, millet, bean, peanuts, wheat, etc

loans.name: Sakeena's Group

texts.en:
Sakeena baji is the wife of K. H.. She has been married for the last 40 years. She is a mother of five children: three sons and two daughters. Her first daughter and son are married. Her remaining children just received education till 5th standard. Her husband is a driver. He has been in this profession for the last 5 years. She is applying for a loan for her husband, who wants to buy auto-rickshaw.

She has been joined in her loan group a few more members: Shaheen baji, who wants loan to buy an auto-rickshaw; Khalida baji wants loan to buy electric items for her electric shop; Anwar baji wants a loan to buy a donkey cart; Sajida baji wants loan to buy ice for selling.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To improve their financial conditions

loans.name: Moise

texts.fr:
Mr. Moise H. was born April 24, 1964, in Grand Popo in the department of Mono. He is married and a father of two: Casimir, 10, and Justine, 8, who both go to school. He is a professional driver but also manages a spare parts store for high-priced vehicles for his big brother. He is seeking this loan to start up his own shop to sell the same in-demand spare parts.

Translated from French by Sherry W., Kiva Volunteer.

Monsieur H. Moise est né le 24 Avril 1964 à Grand popo dans le département du MONO. Il est marié et père de 02 enfants: Casimir 10ans en classe de CM1 et Justine 08 ans en classe de CE1. Il est conducteur de véhicule de profession, mais gère parallèlement à cette activité un magasin de vente de pièces de rechange pour véhicules de grande valeur appartenant à son grand frère. Il sollicite ce crédit, dans le but créer sa propre boutique pour vendre les même pièces de rechange d'engins très demandées par les clients.

loans.use: To purchase spark plug, carburator, and spare parts

loans.name: Sarah Nabukenya's Group

texts.en:
Sarah is a leader of 4 members of a group. She is 38 years old and married with 2 children. They are ages 15 and 10. Both of them are in school. The community she resides in and works in is semi-urban with a neighboring slum.

She makes local brew out of sugar and wheat flour, which she sells retail and wholesale. Her clients are the village members and residents of the nearby slum.

Her main challenges are the unstable prices, high rental fees, and limited capital.

She has been able to increase her stock and to contribute to her family's welfare.

She would like to increase her stock, to start selling beer and soft drinks, to buy a plot of land, and to build herself a house. Sarah has successfully paid back more than 3 loans.

loans.use: To start selling beer and soda

loans.name: Ry

texts.en: Ry H., born in 1954, resells fish that she purchases from the local fishermen near the docks in Siem Reap where she lives with her husband, Ry Nghit. She typically makes US$4 each day while her husband works in construction and provides US$3 each day to help support their four children. Two of their children are also employed—one in construction and one in the fishing industry. They help to provide additional income for the family. The family's typical daily expenses are $2 for food, $0.35 for utilities, $1 for education, and $1.25 for transportation needs. Ry H. would like to expand her business and increase her customer base so she can increase her income, allowing her to provide more for her family. She has asked CREDIT for a loan of US$200 to purchase more fish from the fishermen and increase her inventory so that she can sell more to her customers. In the future, Ry H., would like to expand her business through the purchase of a stand in the local market where she could have a more permanent location and reach more customers.

loans.use: Purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Sintia

texts.es: Sintia tiene 20 años, es una mujer sorprendente, a su corta edad es propietaria de 3 motocarros, los mismos que le generan ingresos económicos muy rentables. Ella administra sus herramientas de trabajo con el solo fin de ahorrar, para poner su tienda ropa y zapatos. Sintia tiene su pareja, Jesús, con quien vive y quien la apoya mucho, sobre todo con sus motocarros. Adicionalmente, se dedica a la crianza de pollos, pero por la temporada y los cambios climatológicos ha dejado esta actividad por un tiempo. Sintia quiere ver en buen estado a sus motos, es por eso que necesita de un capital para mandar a repararlas y así trabajen bien, sin complicaciones. Apoyemos a Sintia, joven con grandes visiones de negocio.
texts.en:
Sintia is 20 years and a surprising woman. At her young age she is an owner of three motocarts, which generate a very profitable income for her. She managers her work equipment with the only goal of saving up, so that she can start her clothing and shoe shop. Sintia has her husband, Jesús, with whom she lives and who supports her a lot, especially with her motocarts. Additionally, she is dedicated to raising chickens, but because of the season and the climate changes, she has left this activity for a time. Sintia wants to have her motocarts in good condition, which is why she needs capital to send them for repairs so they'll work well and without complications. Let's support Sintia, such a young woman with grand business visions.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy spare parts and send her motocarts for repair.

loans.name: Franz

texts.es: Franz, de 30 años de edad, de estado civil soltero, vive independientemente en una parte del terreno de sus padres, que éstos le cedieron. Se dedica a elaborar dientes postizos, ya que estudio para ello, a su vez, dentro de su campo de trabajo atiende a personas con problemas dentales, este trabajo lo viene realizando desde hace 2 años. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es demostrar a sus pacientes y clientes su buena labor. Le es muy rentable, ya que cuenta con una clientela selecta que recurren y lo recomiendan. Lo difícil es no contar con un local adecuado. Con este ya es la séptima vez que renueva un préstamo con MFP. El dinero que ahora solicita es para mandar a construir un local adecuado para poner su laboratorio dental y así dar una mejor acogida a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Franz, 30 years old and single, lives independently on a piece of land he inherited from his parents. He dedicates himself to producing dentures, since it was his area of study, and at the same time within his field of work he also helps people with dental problems. He has been doing this work for two years. What he likes about his occupation is demonstrating his excellent abilities to his patients and customers. The enterprise is very profitable for him, given he has select customer base who provide return business and recommend him to others. The difficult part is finding an adequate location. This would be the 7th time he renews a loan with MFP. The funds he is currently seeking are to have a satisfactory locale built where he could install his dental laboratory and, as a result, be able to provide a more comfortable environment for his customers.


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a location for his dental laboratory.

loans.name: Elena

texts.es: Elena tiene 23 años, es soltera y vive con sus padres. Se dedica al cultivo de café, actividad que desarrolla por 5 años, siendo la cosecha lo que más le agrada realizar por los frutos que puede ver de su trabajo. Gracias a que este producto es solicitado en diversos lugares de su país puede  tener la tranquilidad de siempre tener buena venta. Lo difícil es sembrar adecuadamente  sus plantaciones, ya que el trabajo de preparado y abonado es muy cansado. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP. Elena invertirá el dinero en la compra de abonos y más plantas de café, por lo que calcula le costará un promedio de 1000 soles, monto que supera a lo solicitado.
texts.en:
Elena is 23 years old, single, and lives with her parents. She has been growing coffee for 5 years, and this is the crop that she likes to grow the most as she can see the fruits of her labor. Thankfully this product is in demand in different places in her county so she can be assured of always having good sales. What is difficult is adequately sowing her crops, as preparing the ground and fertilizing is very tiring. This is her first loan with MFP. Elena will invest the money in purchasing fertilizer and more coffee plants, which she calculates will cost 1000 soles, an amount beyond what she is soliciting.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizer for her plants

loans.name: Srey Pao

texts.en: Mrs. Srey Pao S. is 29 years old and she now lives in Chek village in Kandal province. She is a pig breeder. Her husband, Mr. Thon Phat, is farmer who owns a plot of land where he cultivates rice. In the plantation, he faces some problems because he does not have enough rice seeds, fertilizer, and pesticides to support his field. Additionally, he does not have enough money to purchase fuel for the pump in order to water or to hire laborers to work on the field. Thus, Mrs. Srey Pao S. decided to ask for a loan for her husband's purposes. She hopes to increase their income and improve their living conditions with this loan.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds, fertilizer, and pesticides

loans.name: Ghaleb

texts.en:
Ghaleb is a 43-year-old man who lives in Nabatieh, southern Lebanon, with his wife and their seven children. Ghaleb has been working as a workshop operator in construction for twenty years. He requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase tools for his work. This is the first time that Ghaleb has requested a loan.

Ghaleb is special in his work because he is good and moreover, he is fast. His clients can be anybody. When he first started his business, he had difficulties starting up the business. He decided on doing his business because he needed to have a bigger income in order to cope with his family needs. In the future, he plans to expand his business and gain more cash.

loans.use: to purchase tools for his work

loans.name: Bahodur

texts.ru: Саидов Баходур проживает в городе Вахдат. Возраст 29 лет. Женат , имеет двоих детей. Работает парикмахером уже семь лет. Его салон находится в центре города. Планирует получить кредит для того, чтобы купить машинку и другой инвентарь , необходимый для его дела. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 10 месяцев.
texts.en:
Bahodur S. lives in Vahdat. He is 27 years old, is married and has two children. He has been working as a hairdresser for seven years now. His salon is located at the center of the city. He plans to take out a loan in order to buy a machine and other inventory necessary for his craft. He will be able to pay back the loan over 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a machine and necessary inventory

loans.name: Setimba Edith Group

texts.en:
Edith S. is 30 years old and is married with two children, ages 4 and 12. She rents a one-roomed house where she lives with her family. She prepares three meals a day, and her greatest expenses every month are her house rent and school fees for her children. She works seven days a week selling her charcoal at the market, serving about 30 customers a day. The main challenge Edith faces is that her customers often want to buy her charcoal on credit, which hurts her ability to conduct business.

She has been with MCDT for four years now. The reason she joined was because she needed a loan to improve her business.

Edith will use this loan to increase her business. She hopes to save enough money from her business to build a house.

loans.use: To increase charcoal stock.

loans.name: Jerobia

texts.es: La señora Jerobia tiene 45 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de cosméticos, prendas y es costurera, lleva nueve años en las ventas, el cual inicio con ahorros, la costura la aprendió desde muy joven, el cual ha sido una fuente de ingreso para su familia. Reside en Villa Reconciliación, tiene tres hijos de 6,15 y 20 años de edad, su esposo es electricista. Este es su octavo ciclo en Afodenic que quiere para hacer un muro en su casa para reguardar su seguridad para su familia. Su objetivo es comprar otra maquina para hacer los bordados modernos y captar clientes.
texts.en:
Jerobia is 45 years old. For nine years, she has sold cosmetics and clothing and worked as a seamstress. She started her business with her savings. She learned how to sew as a young girl. Now her skill has become a source of income for her family. Jerobia lives in Villa Reconciliación. She has three children, ages 6, 15 and 20. Her husband is an electrician. This is Jerobia's eighth loan with [Kiva partner] Afodenic, which she is requesting to build a wall in her house to increase her family's security. Jerobia would like to purchase another sewing machine so she can make contemporary embroideries and attract more clients.

Translated from Spanish by Todd M. Anderson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials for building a wall

loans.name: Mahmud

texts.en:
Married and the father of five children, R. Mahmud was born on January 29, 1959. Coming from an area where cattle-raising is popular, Mahmud has been selling cattle since 1989. He buys them in his village from the farmers who raise them and then sells them at the markets. As his business capital is limited, he buys just a few and then after he sells those, he returns to buy more. Today Mahmud would like to expand his business by increasing his capital, so that he can then maximize his profits. For this reason, he is requesting this first loan to purchase young cattle. This will be his first loan with IMON International, a Kiva field partner, and his evaluation shows he is qualified to receive the loan.  


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchase young cattle in order to expand the business.

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es: La Señora. Rosa Cáceres tiene 37 años de edad, tiene tres hijos, se dedica a la venta  leche, reside en el barrio Laureles Norte,  tiene un años y medio en la venta de leche, ha logrado tener sus clientes fijos ya que se ubica en un solo lugar, a si como también los que diario compran su leche para su alimentación. Se ubica en un punto céntrico de la capital de managua. Los planes para su familia es mejorar su nivel de vida y realizar mejoras en su vivienda. Inicio su negocio con fondos de micro financieras. El préstamo que solicita en Afodenic es con el fin de comprar mayores cantidades de leche y otros productos que le genere mayores utilidades para obtener mejores beneficios. Tiene tres ciclos de trabajar con Afodenic y da las gracias por el apoyo que ha obtenido.
texts.en:
Mrs. Rosa Cáceres is 37 years old, has three children, sells milk, and lives in the Laureles Norte neighborhood. She has been selling milk for a year and a half. She has managed to have regular clients since she is located in one single place, along with those who purchase his milk daily as part of their diet. She is located in a central point of the capital Managua. Her plans for her family are to improve her standard of living and to make improvements to her home. She began her business with micro-finance funds. The loan she is requesting from Afodenic is for the purpose of purchasing larger quantities of milk and other products which will generate greater profits to obtain higher returns. She has been working with Afondenic for three cycles and is grateful for the support that she has received.

Translated from Spanish by Heather Nicholson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase milk and derivative products

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
Hussein is a 44-year-old man who lives in Nabatieh in southern Lebanon with his wife and their three children. Hussein has been working as a car repairman and painter for 20 years.

This will be his second loan cycle through Al Majmoua and he has always paid on time. His first loan was used to improve his business. He has now requested a loan of $3,000 in order to purchase used cars for his work. With the new loan, he wants to start a new business, specifically, repairing and selling used cars.

Hussein originally decided on engaging in his business because he wanted to improve his family’s income and have an independent career. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase used cars to repair and sell

loans.name: Celestino Sebastião

texts.pt:
Celestino Sebastião C.
Localização: Boane
Actividade: Habitação – Compra de material de construção 
Empréstimo: 15,200.00MT
Início: 19/05/2009
Período de pagamento: 16 meses

Celestino nasceu no distrito da Manhiça, Província de Maputo, estudou até terceira classe. Casado maritalmente com seis filhos, sendo dois maiores e todos ainda vão a escola.
Viveu em Manhiça até 1970, tendo se mudado junto com a esposa para Boane no mesmo ano.
É carpinteiro de profissão e é proprietário de uma carpintaria e emprega duas pessoas. Sua renda mensal é de 5,000.00MT.
Com empréstimo de 15,200.00MT pretende melhorar a residência familiar e seu maior sonho é construir uma carpintaria de maior capacidade.
texts.en:
Celestino Sebastião C. Location: Boane Activity: Purchase construction materials Loan amount: 15,200 MT Start date: 19/05/2009 Payment period: 16 months Celestino was born in the district of Manhiça in the province of Maputo, and attended school through the third grade. He is married and has six children, two of them now adults. All of them are still in school. He lived in Manhiça until 1970, when he and his wife moved to Boane. He is a carpenter by trade, and owns a workshop that employs two people. His monthly income is 5,000 MT. With the requested loan of 15,200 MT he plans to improve his family's home, and his greatest dream is to build a larger carpentry workshop.

Translated from Portuguese by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials to build family's house

loans.name: Jose

texts.en:
Jose D. S. I. is 60 years old, married, and the father of 2 children, aged 3 months and 6 years old. He also supports three other people that he sends remittance payments to. He is originally from Chibauto, located in the province of Gaza, but currently resides in Boane. For the last 13 years he has worked 10 hours a day as a painting instructor in an orphanage. Before working at the orphanage, he worked Mozambique Cement.

This will be Jose's third loan with Hluvuku. The previous loans he took out were for MT 15,000 and MT 25,000. Both loans were repaid successfully. He intends to use this loan to make necessary improvements to his home.

loans.use: Construction Materials

loans.name: Fahritdin

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
       Фахритдину 43 года. Женат и отец 3-х детей. Занимается перевозкой людей, в качестве маршрутного такси. Жена домохозяйка. Фахритдин водит по маршруту № 38 Худжанд - Водник. Он работает каждый день, поэтому ему не выгодно ездить на бензине. Фахритдин хочет установить газовое оборудование. Для этого он просит займ.
texts.en:
Fahritdin is 43 years old. He is married and is a father of 3 children. He is involved in transporting people as a shuttle driver. His wife is a homemaker. Fahritdin drives on the route #38, Khujand-Vodnik. He works every day; thus, it is not profitable to use fuel. Fahritdin wants to install gas equipment. He is requesting a loan for this purpose.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Installing gas equipment

loans.name: Pel's Group

texts.en:
This group of borrowers consists of four low-income people who live together in Chong Kneas Commune, in Siem Reap province. Mrs. Pel L., age 35, has been selected to be the leader of group. To earn a living, Pel L. and her husband have been working as fishermen since earL. 2000. They both depend on the fish in and around Tunle Sap River, and they can catch over 10 kilos of fish each day to sell at the local market. Five of their children are going to school and help fishing. RecentL., this famiL.’s productivity has decreased due to frequentL. broken fishing equipment. Therefore, Pel L. has requested a loan to buy more tools and to repair some tools that are broken.

The other borrowers who have jointL. taken this loan are: Pel T., who will be using the loan to purchase additional tools for fishing operations. Pel H., a fish catcher, who is asking for a loan to decorate and repair her house. Pel H., who will use her loan to buy extra nets and traps for fishing.

loans.use: To buy more tools and to repair old tools

loans.name: Khady

texts.fr: khady S. est vendeuse de poissons dans son quartier a camberene.elle est parent beneficiaire depuis 1999 et capitalise une experience de cinq(5)ans dans son activite.elle sollicite un credit de cent cinquante mille(150 000)frs pour augmenter son fond accroitre ses benefices car c'est une dame qui contribue beaucoup a l'entretien de sa famille grace a son commerce.
texts.en:
Khady S. is a retailer of fish in her area in Camberene. She has been a parent beneficiary since 1999 and has capitalized on 5 years of experience in her business. She is seeking a loan of 150,000 CFA to increase her capital in order to increase her profits, because she is a lady who contributes significantly to supporting her family thanks to her business.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and sell goods

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy some manure

loans.name: Ziporah's Group

texts.en:
L. Ziporah has been a medical worker and birth attendant in Ibanda for over 30 years. She needs a loan to help expand her business by buying more supplies like gloves and drugs for her medical centre. She is a good lady who knows how to handle her clients, and this has won her many genuine friends. She is able to make 300,000/= in profit a month.

L. Ziporah is the leader of her lending group in Ibanda. She is a 51-year-old lady, married, with six children all in primary school, and she takes care of three dependants. Her major goal is to improve her business by providing quality services and to ensure that her family is happy and healthy.

loans.use: To buy more supplies like gloves and drugs for her medical centre

loans.name: Mercedes Group

texts.es:
El grupo Mercedes esta integrado por tres mujeres luchadoras provenientes del Municipio de Tisma, una zona ganadera, agrícola y pesquera. Este fue centro de discusión por muchos años entre los departamentos de Masaya y Granada.

Milagro de Jesús B. Soza de 37 años es la coordinadora del grupo. Ella desde hace 15 años inicio con la venta de  leña  que poco a poco ha ido creciendo, en la actualidad ella tiene trabajadores que le ayuden a  distribuir el cargamento y su mayor su ello es comprar un terreno.

Lucero L. una joven estudiante de Trabajo Social hace dos años y medio empezó a distribuir productos de la Zermat con lo cual se ayuda para seguir con sus estudios. Mientras María Lourdes M. tiene 14 años vendiendo tortilla y su mayor anhelo es construir su casa.

Ellas invertirán el crédito para adquirir los productos de acuerdo a sus negocios y así prosperar.

loans.use: Para comprar leña

loans.name: Aline

texts.fr: Z. Aline est née vers 1982 à Tori-Bossito dans le Sud du Bénin. Aline est mariée à HOUNKPONOU C. Symphorien, un Directeur d’école. Aline et Symphorien ont trois enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge dont deux enfants sont les leurs. La famille vit à Cocotomey, non loin de Cotonou. C’est le mari de Aline qui assure les charges de la famille. Ce qui permet à Aline d’investir les revenus de son activité dans celle-ci. Aline vend en effet des divers (pâtes alimentaires, riz, boîtes de conserve, condiments de sauce, etc.). C’est à Dantokpa, grand marché international du Bénin que Aline s’approvisionne en ces différents produits. Aline veut agrandir sa boutique  pour mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle. C’est pourquoi, Aline sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Aline Z. was born around 1982 in Tori-Bossito, in southern Benin. Aline is married to C. Symphorien Hounkponou, a school principal. Aline and Symphorien have three children in their care, all in school, and two of whom are their own. The family lives in Cocotomey, not far from Cotonou. It is Aline's husband who provides for the family. This allows Aline to invest her income back into her own business. Aline sells various items (food pastes, rice, canned food, sauce condiments, etc.). It is at Dantokpa, Benin's grand international market, that Aline obtains supplies of these various products. Aline wants to enlarge her store to better respond to the demands of her clientele. This is why Aline is seeking financial support through ALIDÉ (one of Kiva's field partners).

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy baskets of tomatoes and onions, boxes of food paste, and boxes of canned goods

loans.name: Akua

texts.en: Akua is 50 years old. She is widowed and the mother of five children. All her children are fully independent and live on their own. She works hard to support herself and her business. She is a supplier of local palm fruits and palm oil. Palm oil is produced from palm nuts fruits. The palm oil is processed through various stages to obtain the palm oil, which is used to prepare many local dishes like frying fish, local soaps and pastries. She produces and supplies to food vendors to prepare their meals. She also sells the palm fruits to those who need them for further processing. However, her production is on the lower side as a result of low working capital to buy stock in bulk. She wants to use the loan to buy more bags of palm fruits. She believes the loan will enable her to make more profit as we enter the Christmas festivities. She would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy bulk supply of palm oil and palm nuts fruits.

loans.name: Attah

texts.en: Attah is 40 years old. He is married and has three kids who are currently at school. He trades in maize. He travels to the northern part of the country to buy his stock of maize and sells to his customers. He requests a loan to buy an increased stock of maize to grow his business and scale up sales. He hopes to increase his savings to support the children’s education and give them better future career opportunities.

loans.use: To purchase maize in bulk.

loans.name: Milisa

texts.en:
Milisa is a 56-year-old widow with two adult children. She has a greengrocery business and sells vegetables, tomatoes, onions, and bananas. She has been in this business for 27 years and has one employee. Milisa describes herself as hardworking and determined. She has requested a loan of 20,000 KES from Kiva partner Faulu to buy vegetables (10,000 KES) and tomatoes and onions (10,000 KES).

Milisa says that through Faulu's training she has learned new business skills. Her hope for the future is simply to have a good quality of life and grow her business to be able to sell other products.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables, tomatoes and onions to sell

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Mrs. Elena P., 41 years old, is married and lives at Maloro, Tangub City. She is married to Joel, a former seaman and now her business partner, and they are blessed with one child.

Elena is engaged in a food business and has a little eatery (“carinderia” ) in their place. She started this business six years ago and now she is earning an average net income of not less than 8,000 PHP a month.

Elena joined Paglaum MPC just a year ago because she is very much interested in our products and services and for our being one of the most outstanding cooperatives in Northern Mindanao and the awarded coop for being “Most Outstanding Cooperative in the Philippines” during the search for the COOP-LGU Partnership Award, 2006.

As a good member of the PDP-LP (Paglaum Development Program for Landless People), a microfinance program of Paglaum MPC, Elena is given the privilege of obtaining 12,000 PHP as her 4th loan to add to the capital of her carinderia business. Her dream is to make her eatery better known and more progressive. She is also hoping that her child will be successful until college for a better future.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her carinderia

loans.name: Rodura

texts.en:
Rodura C. is from the village of Debuloc, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She is 27 years old. Rodura is married and has one infant child. To make a living, Rodura raises pigs for sale. Rodura has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately $200 a month from this activity.

In 2010, Rodura joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation by engaging in business activities. Rodura is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. This will be her first loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy baby livestock to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Ijiang

texts.en:
Ijiang C. is currently in the business of selling green vegetables in the market and is requesting a loan to purchase dried fish to sell. Ijiang is 35 years old and is married, with a husband who is a watch repairman. She has four children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy a motor bike for the transportation of fish from the source at the river to the market.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase dried fish to sell

loans.name: Silvia Isabel

texts.es: Silvia Isabel M. D. A., originaria y residente en la ciudad D. Usulutan, al oriente D. la capital D. El Salvador, lugar cálido y en donD. sus habitantes ejercen mucho el comercio. Ahí vive Silvia en casa propia dentro D. una colonia cercana al mercado regional, con su pequeño hijo Kevin D. un año D. edad junto a una tia que le cuida al pequeño durante el día, ya que ella debe salir a trabajar. Por las mañanas muy temprano se dirige Silvia hacia el puesto que adentro del mercado tiene, llegando dispuesta a atender a clientes, damas y caballeros, que la visitan y requieren D. sus servicios como cosmetóloga ó adquirir algún producto D. belleza. Silvia ahora  solicita un nuevo crédito con el que pueda adquirir nuevos productos para el tratamiento D. cabellos y rostro, que están solicitando sus clientes y ella actualmente no pueD. suplir dicha necesidad. Para Silvia es muy importante esto ya que su negocio es la única fuente D. ingreso con la que cuenta para la educación futura D. su hijo y los gastos ordinarios D. su hogar.-
texts.en:
Silvia Isabel M. D. A. is from the city of Usulutan, and she lives there. It is to the east of the capital of El Salvador. It is a warm place where the inhabitants engage in a lot of commerce. Silvia lives there in her own house in a neighborhood that is close to the regional market. She lives with her small, one year old son, Kevin, and an aunt who takes care of the little one during the day because Silvia has to leave to work. Silvia heads towards her stand in the market very early in the morning. She arrives ready to wait on her customers, women and men who visit her in need of her cosmetology services or to get a beauty product. Silvia is now requesting a new loan to get new products for hair and facial treatments. Her customers are requesting these products, and she currently cannot meet the need. This is very important to Silvia because her business is the only source of income she has to educate her child in the future and to pay the usual household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy new products for hair and facial treatments

loans.name: Emma Mauricia

texts.es:
Nuestra socia Emma pertenece al Banco Comunal “Qory Orcco” de la Asociación Arariwa, tiene 32 años, es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos. Emma es una persona trabajadora y emprendedora que tiene una tienda de abarrotes donde vende comestibles y también útiles escolare. El crédito que solicita Emma es para comprar cuadernos, lapiceros, papel, etc.   

La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.

(Los socios del banco comunal se reúnen cada treinta días en la ciudad de Pucyura que es distrito de la ciudad de Anta del Departamento del Cusco, Pucyura se encuentra ubicada a 40 minutos de la ciudad de Cusco).
texts.en:
Emma is a member of the Communal Bank “Qory Orcco”, which is part of Asociación Arariwa. She is 32 years old, in a common law marriage, and has three children. Emma is a hardworking and enterprising person who has a store where she sells groceries as well as school supplies. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy notebooks, pens, paper, and other items. She is grateful for this opportunity and promises to complete her payments on time.

(The members of this Communal Bank meet every 30 days in the City of Pucyura, Anta District, Department of Cusco. Pucyura is located 40 minutes away from the City of Cusco.)

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase notebooks, pens, paper, and other items

loans.name: Familia Unida De Inversiones 4 Group

texts.en:
Rafael is the coordinator of his group called Familia Unida de Inversiones (United Family of Investments). Rafael's story is representative of his group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally. (In fact, many of Esperanza's Dominican clients are recent emigrates from Haiti.)

Rafael's group is located in the slums that surround Santiago, a large city which is known for its tobacco production and where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. Rafael makes his home here in a simple structure with his long-term partner and their four children.

Rafael is excited to be taking out his second loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid his previous loan and grown his business. 

Rafael runs a neighborhood food cart, and he plans to use this loan to stock his cart with staples such as Yuca, potatoes, bananas, and eggs to sell to his clientele. He will use the profits to provide the basic necessities for his children, such as food and clothing, as well as save toward the day when he hopes to open his own supermarket.  He thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy Yuca, potatoes, bananas, and eggs to sell from his food cart.

loans.name: Kaku

texts.en:
Kaku A. is 25 years old and married to a driver. She has four children who all go to school. She is currently in the business of selling various items in her shop, such as soap, sugar, etc., and is requesting a loan to stock more boxes of biscuits and soap. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to extend the floor of her shop.

About BRAC
BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted at returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock more boxes of biscuits and soap

loans.name: Fortunato

texts.es: Fortunato tiene 53 años, es soltero y vive en su casa propia con su madre, Sabina de 81 años, a quien cuida con dedicación. Ejerce la profesión de docente de nivel primario, sin embargo el amor a las tierras que lo vieron nacer, han hecho que se dedique al cultivo de frutas cítricas, paltas y plátanos, por lo que han pasado 40 años realizando esta actividad de manera independiente. Desde entonces esta actividad lo realiza solo o con ayuda de operarios que contrata para las campañas de siembra y cosecha. Lo que más le gusta de esta actividad, es la temporada de cosecha, el ver sus productos de buena calidad y en proporción, sabe que es gracias al esfuerzo y dedicación que puso sobre sus tierras, a su vez le parece difícil trasladar sus productos hacía los mercados de la ciudad o hasta los centros de acopio para comercializarlos. Para su futuro, planea comprar una casa en la ciudad, donde pueda instalar una bodega que le genere utilidades, asimismo quiere comprar más chacras cerca de su domicilio actual. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, y como es una persona respetable, ante su grupo comunal, se compromete a pagar puntualmente para continuar accediendo  a más créditos futuros y no defraudar la confianza que le brindan. Con los mil soles que solicita, comprará varios sacos de abono orgánico, así como insecticidas, que le ayuden a controlar las plagas de sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Fortunato is 53 years old. He is single and lives in his own house with his mother, Sabina, 81 years old, whom he cares for with dedication. His profession is primary school teacher. Nevertheless, his love for the land where he was born has led him to raise citrus fruits, avocados, and bananas, and he has done this independently for 40 years. He has carried out this activity alone or with the help of workmen whom he hires for planting and harvesting. What he likes most is harvest time. When he sees his products of good quality and good size, he knows that it is due to the effort and dedication that he put into his land. At the same time, it is difficult for him to transport his products to the markets in the city or to the collection centers to sell them. In the future, he plans to buy a house in the city, where he can set up a shop that will generate profits for him. He would also like to buy more farms near his present home.

This is his first loan with MFP, and as he is a respectable person in his community bank, he promises to make the payments on time, so that he can continue accessing more credit in the future and not betray the confidence that they have shown in him. With the thousand PEN that he is applying for, he will buy sacks of organic fertilizer, as well as insecticides, which will help him control the pests on his crops.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy organic fertilizer and insecticides

loans.name: Salimatou

texts.fr: Salimatou M. est âgée de 71 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 04 enfants. Elle est membre de Banc Villageois depuis 04 ans et a 08 fois de suite bénéficié de crédit. Elle fait du petit commerce de produits divers tels que: du riz, du sucre, du thé, de l'huile etc. son prêt lui permettra de renforcer son niveau d'investissement en terme de marchandises. Son objectif est de participer à la prise en charge de la famille.
texts.en:
Salimatou M. is a 71-year-old married woman with 4 children. She has been a member of the local village loan group for 4 years, and has benefited from 8 successive loans. She runs a small business selling various products such as rice, sugar, tea, oil, etc. Her loan will allow her to strengthen the level of her business in terms of her stocks of merchandise. Her goal is to take part in providing for the family.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To strengthen her capital and increase her investment capacity

loans.name: Aminata

texts.fr: Aminata N. est une femme de 41 ans, elle est mariée et mère d'un enfants et tutrice de 3 autres enfants qui lui sont confiés par des proches. Elle est membre de Banc Villageois depuis 2 ans et a 4 fois de suite bénéficié de crédit qui lui permette de développer un petit commerce de parfum et de crèmes glacées. Avec son crédit elle va renforcer son approvisionnement afin d'augmenter sa production et générer plus de bénéfices et participer à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Aminata N. is 41 years old, married and the mother of one child. She is also the tutor of three other children entrusted to her by close friends. She has been a member of the local “Banc Villageois” loan group for the past two years, and has already been granted four successive loans, which enabled her to develop a small business selling perfume and ice cream. Her loan will enable her to increase her supplies and her production, and consequently her earnings, and participate in improving her family’s living conditions.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Develop and promote her revenue-geerating activity

loans.name: Saidahon's Group

texts.en:
In daily life, people engaged in business do not usually have time and eagerness to discuss current issues and talk politics as they have a general idea that politics and decisions of political leaders have only a small impact on their individual lives. Twenty years ago, when the collapse of Soviet Union took place, people living in the republics within did not even realize the far reaching consequences of this event. One of those consequences was the halt of almost all major industrial factories, which led to the increase in unemployment and deterioration of economic conditions. Consequently people began to leave their homelands in mass for foreign lands in search of jobs and ways of earning a wage. Saidahon T. is the leader of this group. She is thirty two years old. Her husband is working in the  Russian Federation. Every now and then he sends money to his family, which consists of five members: himself , Saidahon and their three children. Their eldest daughter is ten. She has already started helping her mother doing some light work around the house.  Saidahon prefers not to depend on her husband’s support for a living and is engaged in cattle breeding. She also has a cow and sells milk. Saidahon hopes to obtain this loan to purchase wood for building. 
Saidahon’s partners: 

Diloramhon M., 39, has three children. She trades in foodstuffs. Her husband is a car maintainer. Diloramhon manages to earn 200$ a month. Now she needs this loan to purchase soft drinks and ice - cream. During the summer, this is very profitable trade. 

Etiborhan O., 59, is a widow. She has two children, who live separately. Etiborhan used to work in a hospital, but left because of the  low salary  and started to raise cattle. Now she has two sheep and a cow. Etiborhan hopes to obtain this loan and purchase two calves.

Kuranbaeva N., 31, is a mother of two children. She and her husband are engaged in cattle breeding. Now they have four sheep and a cow. N. decided to apply for this loan as they need funds for building their new house.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan which delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To purchase wood for building

loans.name: Ema Mucacho

texts.pt:
Ema Mucacho M. nasceu no Distrito de Namaacha, Província de Maputo, sul de Moçambique, casada e mãe de 4 filhos de 12, 14, 17 e 21 anos de idade, todos vão a escola. Fez somente 5ą classe não continuou devido a guerra de desestabilização que assolou o pais. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém. 
Saiu de Namaacha para Boane quando se juntou ao seu marido. Tem um negócio e dono do mesmo ha mais de 18 anos, não possui empregados e tem um rendimento de cerca de 15.500.00mt por mês, que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum na sua conta bancária e através de Xitque (sistema tradicional de poupança rotativa).
Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através da sua sobrinha que também é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu 1º empréstimo no valor de 15.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar produtos (óleo, arroz, açúcar, cerveja, refrescos e outros produtos da primeira necessidade) para reforçar a mercadoria no seu negócio.
Compromete se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo para poder aceder a outros. No futuro pretende solicitar mais empréstimos para construir casas tipo dependências para aluguer como forma de aumentar a renda familiar.
texts.en:
Ema Mucacho M. was born in the district of Namaacha, Maputo province, in the south of Mozambique. She is married and is the mother of four children, 12, 14, 17 and 21 years old. All of them go to school. She only has her grade five – her schooling was interrupted due to the destabilizing war that devastated the country. She lives in her own house with her family and has no other dependents. Ema left Namaacha for Boane when she married her husband. She has a business and has been the owner for more than 18 years. She does not have employees. She has an income of around 15,500 MT a month, which she uses for household expenses, and still saves some in her bank account and through the Xitique (a traditional rotational savings system). She has never had loans from other banks. She got to know about Hluvuku through her niece, who is also a client of this institution. This is her first loan in the amount of 15,000 MT, with which she plans to buy products (oil, rice, sugar, beer, soft drinks, and other basic necessities) to build up the merchandise in her business. She promises to duly repay this loan in order to be able to receive others. In the future, she plans to ask for more loans in order to built rooming-type houses to rent out as a means of augmenting her family income.

Translated from Portuguese by Heidi Petersen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of products (oil, rice, sugar, beer, soft drinks, and other basic necessities)

loans.name: Petronila

texts.es:
la señora Petronila A. A. tiene 53 años de edad, vive en union libre con el señor Francisco Garcia quien se dedica a la venta de pan y dulces en Langue, Valle.
la señora A. tambien compra verduras los dias sabados para venderla los domingos ya que es el dia que mas se vende por que las personas de otras comunidades vienen a comprar a esta zona,  tambien vende dulces y pasteles. el credito lo utilizara para comprar pan, dulces y verduras. 
Petronila tiene su propia casa y vive con sus dos hijos y su marido.
tienen como 29 años de edad de vivir en su casa.
su sueño es que sus hijos puedan graduarse y que sean buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
Mrs. Petronila A. A. is 53 years old. She lives with her common-law husband Francisco Garcia, who sells bread and sweets in Langue, Valle. Mrs. A. also purchases vegetables on Saturdays to sell on Sundays, since that is the day when sales are highest, as people from other communities come to this area to shop. She also sells sweets and desserts. She will use the loan to purchase bread, sweets, and vegetables. Petronila has her own home and lives with her two children and her husband. They have lived in their house for 29 years. Her dream is that her children will graduate and be good professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase bread, sweets, and vegetables.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: purchasing sewing materials

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma C. is from Barangay Inaban, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 30 years old. Elma is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Elma owns & operates a general store, selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Elma has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 6500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Elma joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Elma is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Elma from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

location.town: Brgy. Inaban, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane N. lives in Kawala, a neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has eight children, three of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members (orphans).  

Jane has a business of selling second-hand shoes. She has been in this business for seven years, and she works six days out of every week. Jane sells her products at the market on a retail basis.   

Jane has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy bales of second-hand shoes. She also generates additional income. The main business challenge for Jane is the transportation of bales of shoes from Owino market to her stall in Kawala.  

Her goals and aspirations for her business are to boost her business and to start importing shoes herself.   

Jane lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include medication, food, rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bales of second-hand shoes

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama A. is married and living with her eight dependents. She has no educational background. Ama sells fried fish at Elmina. She uses her earnings to help her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills.  Ama will use the loan to purchase more fresh fish to fry for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ama plans to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: purchase more fresh fish to fry for sale

loans.name: Vera

texts.en:
Vera is married with grown-up children. She sells various hardware items – locks, abrasives, heaters, etc., at a hardware market in Berdyansk town. She started this business only one year ago but enjoys retail business and would like to develop it further.

Vera is requesting a loan of 10,000 Grivnas to purchase more inventory. She hopes, as a result, to receive additional income and invest most of it back in her business. She believes that hard work and a large selection will help her business to grow further.

loans.use: To increase her assortment

loans.name: Annielyn

texts.en: Annielyn R. is from the village of San Simon, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 29 years old. Annielyn is married and has a school-aged child. To make a living, Annielyn buys and sells ready-to-wear clothing and shoe products in the local community. Annielyn has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2009, Annielyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Annielyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Annielyn is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the fifth loan taken out by Annielyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and as working capital

location.town: San Simon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es:
Elsa es socia del Banco Comunal “Santiago Patrón”  ubicado en el distrito Santiago de Pupuja, provincia de Azángaro, departamento de Puno, tiene 46 años de edad, de estado civil  casada y tiene 03 hijos, tiene estudios hasta 5to de Educación Primaria.

Elsa viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 5 años,  el primer préstamo solicitado fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que le sirvió para  incrementar el capital de  su negocio venta de carne.

La señora solicitará un nuevo préstamo de S/. 2000.00 nuevos soles, dinero que le servirá para comprar más mercadería para su negocio de venta de carne, de cerámica y tejidos.

Su sueño es hacer crecer su negocio para generar más ingresos.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal es la facilidad del préstamo, las charlas y la organización de este.
texts.en:
Elsa is a member of the Santiago Patrón communal bank, located in the Santiago de Pupuja district, part of the province of Azángaro in the department of Puno. She is 46 years old, married, has 3 children, and completed up to the 5th year of elementary school.

Elsa has been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for 5 years. Her first loan requested was for 300 Peruvian Nuevos Soles (PEN), which she used to increase her meat sales business.

She is requesting a new loan of 2,000 Peruvian Nuevos Soles (PEN), which she will use to buy more merchandise for her business selling meat, ceramics, and textiles.

Her dream is to make her business grow to generate more income. What she likes most about the communal bank is the ease of the loan, the chats, and the organization.

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise for her business selling meat, ceramics and textiles.

loans.name: Gabriela

texts.en:
The story of Gabriela’s business is intertwined with a heartbreaking personal experience. One night in 1988, while living in Mexico City, her 6-month-old son stopped breathing.  Years later in the U.S., Gabriela was working as a childcare provider and enrolled in a CPR course. While helping the instructor to translate the class into Spanish, she realized that with CPR knowledge she might have been able to save her son. 
 
Over the next few years, Gabriela worked hard to become certified as a CPR instructor and an EMT and began volunteering with the Red Cross to teach in her community.  Most importantly, she taught bilingual classes to make sure her students really understood the information. 
 
One year ago, Gabriela officially founded ACC Safety Education. The business is based out of an office and classroom in Redwood City, California, but she and her children, who are both EMTs, also travel to neighboring cities to teach classes. 
 
Gabriela is proud of what she has accomplished and credits her success to the role models in her community. “In this country, we are blessed to have the example of other women who are successful and strong. We don’t have to listen to traditions that tell us ‘we can’t do this.’ I don’t care about those traditions anymore. The most people can tell me is ‘no.’ And then I’ll go and knock on the next door.”  
 
Gabriela received business coaching from a community partner, who then referred her to Opportunity Fund. A $2,600 loan will help her buy supplies, fix her computer and go to an American Medical Association conference. This small loan will also build her credit and allow her to take out a larger loan in the future to make more extensive business improvements.    
 
Looking forward, Gabriela says, “I am concentrating on my business – it’s my passion. I’d like to have more classes, more clients, and hire more teachers.” 
 
To find out more about ACC Safety Education, visit: http://accse.info

loans.use: To fix her computer, purchase supplies, attend a conference and build her business credit

loans.name: La Concepcion De Santiago Group

texts.es: En esta foto se muestra al grupo llamado la Concepcion de Santiago el cual está ubicado en la comunidad de Santiago Miahuatlan en el estado de Puebla, México. El grupo está conformado por 9 integrantes.En la forografía se muestra la actividad comercial a la que se dedica la sra. Maria Del Rosario H. A. Que es la compra y venta de los siguientes productos: bolsas de colgar hechas de material reciclable, servilleteros, servilletas, canastas, recuerdos infantiles tipo alajeros y portaretratos los cuales estan fabricados de madera, tiene un año que se dedica a esta negocio, la venta la realiza de forma ambulante en mercados, parques o lugares públicos, dice que ya es conocida por mucha gente que le compra sus productos y las ve satisfechas pues le dicen que estos estan muy bonitos, los da a buen precio y les gusta la variedad de productos que lleva.  Esta clienta es de nuevo ingreso comenta que es la primera vez que adquiere un credito de este tipo, hoy esta contenta y agradece la confianza otorgada, dice que este credito lo destinará a la compra de mas mercancia y las ganancias las invertira en otro negocio que tiene en mente, colchas y cobertores para esta temporada. Ella tiene el firme proposito de hacer crecer su negocio y llegar a tener buenas ganancias y a si lograr el proyecto de poder terminar de construir su casa que por una u otra razón no ha logrado y está segura que con la ayuda de los prestamos a futuro logrará esta meta. Ella tiene 52 años y estudió hasta sexto grado de primaria, es casada pero ya no vive con su esposo, tiene 7 hijos, 2  hombres y 5 mujeres.
texts.en:
This is a photo of the 'Concepción de Santiago' group which is located in Santiago Miahuatlan community, in the State of Puebla, Mexico.  The group has 9 members.  This photo shows the business activity of Mrs Maria Del Rosario H.
