A. which is buying and selling the following products: small bags made from recyclable material, napkin rings, napkins, baskets and childhood memory items such as little boxes and picture frames which are made of wood.

Maria has been in this business for one year.  She makes her sales as a peddler in markets, parks or public places.  She says that she is already well known by many people who buy her products and they are satisfied because they say that the things she sells are very pretty, she sells them at a good price and they like the variety of products which she offers.

Maria is a new member of the group and she says that this is the first time that she has acquired a loan of this type.  Today she is happy and grateful for the trust that has been placed in her.  She says that she will use this loan to buy more merchandise and she will invest her profits in another business which she has in mind, selling quilts and bedspreads for this season.  Maria fully intends to grow her business and make good profits and also to finish building her house which, for one reason or another, she hasn't yet managed.  She is sure that with the help of the loans she will achieve this goal in the future.  Maria is 52 years old and studied up to the sixth year of elementary school.  She is married but no longer lives with her husband.  She has 7 children: 2 grown-up sons and 5 grown-up daughters.

loans.use: To buy more handicrafts and recyclable materials

loans.name: Mujeres Latinas Group

texts.en:
The group "Mujeres Latinas" consists of seven women and one man, although the name means ¨Latina Women."  Magaly, pictured in the second row in the middle, is the group's new president.  She has been with the group for more than a year.
 
Magaly sells beauty products from catalogues to her friends and neighbors.  She is 34 years old and lives with her two children and husband in Carabayllo, north of Lima.  Now that the holiday season has arrived, she wants to increase her inventory to better serve her customers.  Magaly is also planning to stock up on panetón (Peruvian fruitcake) to sell to her customers.  

In the future, Magaly would like to have her business in a proper shop instead of out of her home, but for now she is content to simply increase her sales.  


*** The woman in the red shirt is Mrs. Zoila Rosa S. O., who is a member of the group but is not taking out a loan in this loan cycle. 

*** La señora que aparece de blusas a rayas es la Señora Rosa Petronila V. M.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Kabidolda

texts.en: Kabidolda H. is 52 years old and lives with his wife and three children in Bayan-Ulgii province in western Mongolia. He and his family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian housing tent. Kabidolda operates a transportation business in his town. He drives a minibus to transport people while his wife helps him by working as a conductor in his minibus. He works his business 15 days in a month. Kabidolda is a hardworking and honest man and is requesting a 1,600,000 MNT loan to purchase tires and a new engine for his bus.

loans.use: To purchase tires and new engine

loans.name: Dorjpalam

texts.en:
Dorjpalam S. is 55 years old and lives with her mother in a house with a fence in Har-horin sum, the ancient capital city of the Mongolian empire, in the Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. Her son currently works and lives in Korea. Dorjpalam operates a clothing business from a rented stall in the market in her town with the help of her daughter. She manages her business and has established herself in the business community. She sells a variety of clothing items that are imported from China. She has been engaged this business since 2000 and has gained a lot of experience as a businesswoman. 

In the future, she hopes to expand her business. Dorjpalam is a modest and hardworking woman and is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to import more clothing items from China for selling during the New Year holiday.

loans.use: To import more clothing items from China

loans.name: Abbia

texts.en: Abbia is a 38-year-old married female with two children, who owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. She has been doing agriculture for the last 12 years. She started by renting a machine to make popcorn, but has now bought her own machine. Her hardship is lack of enough raw materials, plus thieves. Her vision is to expand her business and educate her children. Abbia needs the loan to buy popcorn to sell.

loans.use: Buying  popcorn for resell.

loans.name: Kruoch's Group

texts.en:
This group loan consists of four people; they are located in K'am Samnar Kraom village in Kandal province. 

Mr. Kruoch T. was born in 1980, and he is the group leader. He was selected to be the group leader by the other members. He and his wife, Mrs. Kong Samrith, are farmers who own a plot of land which they use to grow rice. They face a problem with the farm because they do not have enough money to grow crops. So in order to support this farm, Mr. Kruoch T. would like to ask for a loan to buy gasoline and pesticides for growing rice. Aside from farmers, they are also earning a living by milling rice at home. 

This couple has two children who are attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy gasoline and pesticides

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

She has operated a café business for the past four years, operating from the market. Amina faces a major challenge of theft because of insecurity in the area. She hopes to expand and attract many customers in the future.

With the Kshs 25,000 she wants to purchase sacks of rice, beans, sugar and onions. She decided to work with Kiva partner Yehu to access loans to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of rice, beans, sugar and onions.

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.es:
La señora Narcisa, es socia del banco comunal Sol Naciente del Distrito de calleria, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 63 años de edad, está casada y tiene 8 hijos, todos son mayores de edad.
Lleva trabajando con los préstamos de Manuela Ramos desde hace 9 años, se dedica a la venta de frutas de la región (que son por temporadas), su esposo es el  que atiende en su casa mientras se va a entregar sus pedidos, también tiene que ver por tres  nietos que viven con ella.
Con éste préstamo de S/. 1,000.00 nuevos soles, se comprará: 2 sacos de aguaje, 1 olla grande, 1 bandeja grande, 1 mesa de madera  y  mandará a confeccionar una parrilla de fierro  para poder  calentar el aguaje (fruta de la zona).
Manuela  Ramos tiene mucho que ver en la calidad de vida que tienen  ahora la mayoría de mujeres que trabajan, gracias a los préstamos han sabido salir adelante.
texts.en:
Narcisa, 63, is a member of the Sol Naciente (Rising Sun) communal bank in Callería district, Ucayali department.  She’s married and has 8 children, all adults.

She’s been working with Manuela Ramos loans for 9 years.  She sells seasonal, regional fruit.  Her husband sells from home while she goes out to deliver orders.  She also has to care for three grandchildren that live with her.

She will use this 1000 new sol loan to buy: 2 sacks of aguaje (tropical, Andean fruit, rich in antioxidants and essential fatty acids), 1 large pot, 1 large tray and 1 wooden table and she will have a metal grill made to heat the aguaje (regional fruit).

Manuela Ramos has a lot to do with the quality of life most working women have; thanks to loans they have managed to get ahead.

loans.use: She will buy two sacks of aguaje (Moriche Palm, an Andean tropical fruit), one large pot, one large tray and one wooden table.

loans.name: Tomas

texts.en:
Tomas is 35 years old, married, and has three children aged 8, 7 and 6. He works hard to sustain his children's education. He wishes for his children to have bright futures.

Tomas is a farmer working in Sto. Niño, South Cotabato. He owns the land that he tills for planting and harvesting rice crops. His harvest is sold to the market. He has also put up a sari-sari (variety) store that his wife manages. They sell various products such as soft drinks and canned goods.

Tomas's loan will be used to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Rosa Paulina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SANTA ROSITA DE AYLLUPAMPA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Rosa Paulina; ella tiene 34 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con la crianza de sus hijos, la socia es ama de casa y su pareja trabaja en el negocio de transporte y juntos sacan adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere tener un negocio propio. La socia solicita el préstamo para hacer arreglar su casa y comprar materiales de construccion como cemento,yeso y arena.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Rosa Paulina is a member of the Communal Bank “Santa Rosita de Ayllupampa” which is located in the District and Province of Urubamba, Department of Cusco.

She is 34 years old, in a common law marriage, and has two children.  Rosa Paulina divides her time between her daily activities and raising her children.  She is a homemaker while her partner works for a transportation business.  Together they help their children move forward.  Rosa Paulina wants to have her own business.  She is requesting this loan to improve her home and purchase construction materials such as cement, plaster, and sand. 

Rosa Paulina is happy with the loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to improve her home

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es: Mi nombre es Marcelina, yo vivo en San Francisco tlachichilpa, tengo 46 años de edad enviude hace un par de años, la casa donde vivo con mis tres hijos me la dejo mi marido, si la veo mi situación un poco dificil porque mis hijos quieren seguir estudiando para que tengan mejores oportunidades de tener un trabajo y yo los quiero ayudar a cumplir sus metas, por eso me dedico a vender zapatos, los vendo por catalogo y tambien los vendo de segunda mano en el tianguis que se pone cada domingo een el pueblo, de esta forma es como ayudo a mis hijos con lo que se puede porque no siempre puedo apoyarlos como uno quisiera, los dasfios que voy teniendo es que habeces tengo que fiar la mercancía, no siempre los clientes tienen para pagar todo de contado y los tengo que esperar a que cobren quincena para que me den el resto, yo quisiera que el negocio funcionara de una mejor manera y tubiera mucha suerte para salir adelante.
texts.en: My name is Marcelina and I live in San Francisco, Tlachichilpa.  I am 46 years old and was widowed a couple of years ago.  The house where I live with my three children was left to me by my husband.  I see my situation as being a little difficult because my children want to continue studying so that they can have a better opportunity of getting work and I want to help them to achieve their goals.  For this reason, I work selling shoes.  I sell the shoes through a catalog and I also sell second-hand shoes in the street market which takes place in our village every Sunday.  This is how I help my children as best I can.  I can't always support them as I would really like.  One of the difficulties I face is that I have to sell my merchandise on credit.  My customers don't always have enough money to pay cash and so I have to wait two weeks for them to get their wages before they pay me the rest of the money they owe me.  I would like my business to work better and I would like to be lucky enough to get ahead in life.

loans.use: to buy shoes to sell

loans.name: Demetrio

texts.es:
Demetrio tiene 43 años de edad, el vive con su esposa y sus dos menores hijos.  Demetrio y su familia viven en Campos Reyes es un poblado anexo del distrito de Cayalti, distrito en el cual se desarrolla abundantemente la actividad agrícola y ganadera.

Demetrio se dedica ala actividad agrícola y tiene 10 años de experiencia desempeñándose en esta labor.  Para realizar su trabajo Demetrio tiene 2.5 de áreas de sembrío que son propias 

Demetrio es un cliente conocido por Edpyme Alternativa, pues el ya cuenta   con una experiencia crediticia con nosotros, y esta solicitando un  nuevo préstamo de  S/. 3000.  Este préstamo lo utilizará  para  invertir en su cultivo y poder comprar  insumos como urea, maquinara y semilla para el buen desarrollo de su actividad agrícola y así  optimizar la cantidad y calidad de producción.
  
Demetrio desea seguir contando con nuestro apoyo solicitando préstamos para  invertir en su cultivo, así seguir creciendo poco apoco y lograr adquirir más terrenos. En su localidad cuenta con un muy buen prestigio en su localidad, lo que hace ver que es una persona responsable y respetuosa
texts.en:
Demetrio is 43 years old and lives with his wife and two minor children.  He and his family live in Campos Reyes in a village near the district of Cayalti, which is very developed in agriculture and livestock farming.

Demetrio has been earning a living as a farmer for ten years.  He owns 2.5 patches of land where he grows his crops.

He is a well-known customer of Edpyme Alternativa and has had much loan experience with us.  He is requesting a new loan in the amount of 3,000 PEN which he will use to invest in his crop business and to buy supplies such as urea, machinery and seeds for proper development of his agriculture business so he can increase the quantity and quality of his production.

Demetrio hopes to be able to count on us to support him with this loan to be invested in his crops so he can continue to grow and acquire more farmland.  He has a very good reputation in his town and is a very responsible and respected person.

loans.use: To buy supplies and invest in his crop business

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma, age 38, is a vegetable farmer in the Philippines. She has been farming vegetables for five years now, and has borrowed 16 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

Wilma is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other necessary farm supplies.

She and her husband have five children, four of whom are enrolled in school. Her hope for the future is to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other necessary farm supplies

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en: Isaac is a 24-year-old single man.  He runs a butcher shop with one employee.  He joined Faulu Kenya so that he would get business loans easily.  So far, he has serviced one loan from Faulu Kenya which he used to boost his business.  He has requested a loan of 30,000 Kes to buy a deep freezer.  Isaac hopes to open a big restaurant in the future.

loans.use: To buy a deep freezer.

loans.name: Fernando Antonio

texts.es: Fernando Antonio vive junto a su compañera de vida. Tiene 2 hijos que asisten a un colegio público, ya que no tiene los suficientes ingresos para mantenerlos en un privado. Su actividad es bar y restaurante, que está ubicada en su vivienda. Lo inicio  con poco capital que tenia y con la ayuda de los financiamientos ha logrado crecer. Actualmente el se encuentra muy bien establecido ya que sus clientes llegan a solicitar del servicio que el proporciona. El crédito que está solicitando es para la compra granos básicos, gaseosas, jugos, manteles, sillas, licor y verduras.
texts.en:
Fernando Antonio lives together with his life partner.  They have two children who attend a public (state) school since they don't have enough money to send them to a private school.

Fernando's business is a bar / restaurant which is located in his home.  He started out with a little capital that he had and, with the help of loans, he has managed to grow his business.  The business is currently very well established as his customers come to request the service that he provides.

Fernando will use the loan that he is requesting to buy basic grains, soda, juice, tablecloths, chairs, liquor and vegetables.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, soda, juice, tablecloths, chairs, liquor and vegetables

loans.name: Lidia Aurelia

texts.es:
Lidia es socia del  Banco Comunal “Virgen de Concepción”, ubicado en el C.P. Ayrumas Carumas del distrito de Acora, provincia y departamento de Puno, tiene 42 años de edad, esta  casada y tiene 4 hijos.  Estudió hasta 4to de educación secundaria. 
La señora Lidia es una socia nueva que recientemente se incorpora al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, solicitará un préstamo de S/. 1000.00 nuevo soles, dinero que incrementará al capital de su negocio, ella se dedica a la compra y venta de ganados como ovino, vacuno también vende frutas y realiza tejidos.  La señora Lidia nos cuenta que éste préstamo será utilizado para comprar dos vacas.
Su sueño es tener un negocio de abarrotes bien abastecido y vender ropa para tener buenos ingresos económicos.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la facilidad del préstamo, las charlas y las orientaciones que brindan.
texts.en:
Lidia is a member of the Communal Bank “Virgen de Concepción” which is located in the central village of Ayrumas Carumas in the District of Acora, Province and Department of Puno. She is 42 years old, married, and has four children. Lidia completed her education through the fourth year of high school.

She is a new member who recently joined Manuela Ramos. Lidia is requesting a loan of 1000 PEN so that she can increase the capital of her business. She buys and sells livestock, such as sheep and cattle. In addition, she sells fruit and makes woven handicrafts. Sra. Lidia says that she will use this loan to buy two cows.

Her dream is to have a grocery business that is well-stocked and also sell clothing so that she can generate more income. What she likes about the Communal Bank are the convenience of the loan, the seminars, and the advice that is provided.

loans.use: to purchase two cows.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius has been practicing banana farming for the last 14 years in his hometown of Nkubu in eastern Kenya. His farm currently produces bananas, which Julius sells to middlemen. He depends mainly on the income from his farm to provide for his family's basic needs. Julius is 52 years old and married, with 4 children aged between 13 and 29. 

Julius has made a loan request of 50,000 KES through Juhudi Kilimo in order to cultivate his banana farm. The extra income from this loan will enable him to pay his child's school fees and improve his family's livelihood. Julius faces the challenges of diseases and insufficient agricultural land, which has made it difficult for him to expand his farming activities. He plans to expand his business in the future by acquiring more agricultural land.

loans.use: To cultivate his banana farm.

loans.name: Mariluz

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal “SEÑOR DE LOS MILAGROS DE CHIMPAHUAYLLA”; El banco pertenece al distrito de Huanchac, Provincia de Cusco, departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Mariluz; la socia tiene 29 años; la socia; La socia tiene 1 hijo y ella se dedica a  la artesanía, la socia compra y vende artesanía, la socia también vende bisutería en la puerta de un hotel de forma ambulatoria, la socia elabora y compra artesanía, ella compra al por mayor de los proveedores y también realiza algunas piezas como aretes, pulseras, collares, la socia desea el préstamo para invertir en la compra de artesanía y de materiales para la realización de bisutería. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de materiales para realizar trabajos de artesanía.

La socia se muestra muy satisfecha y agradecida por el apoyo que se le brindara mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus deudas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Mariluz, 29, is a member of the “Señor de los Milagros de Chimpahuaylla” communal bank belonging to Huanchac District, Cusco Province and Department.

She has a son and she makes crafts.  She is a crafts merchant.  She also sells costume jewelry in the door of a hotel.  She makes and buys crafts.  She buys from suppliers at wholesale and also makes some items like earrings, bracelets and necklaces.  She wants the loan to buy crafts and supplies to make costume jewelry.  She is requesting the loan to invest in supplies to make crafts.

She is very satisfied with and grateful for the support she’s being give through this means and commits to pay her debts in a timely fashion.

loans.use: to buy crafts making supplies.

loans.name: Jean Marie

texts.fr: Monsieur Jean Marie  est un jeune enseignant. Il est âgé  de 35 ans et habite dans la banlieue de  Guédiawaye. Il est célibataire et père d’un enfant de 7 ans. Il est promoteur d’une école de la localité depuis 5 ans. Il a choisi cette spécialité en vue de participer au développement  de son pays. L’aspect qui l’intéresse le plus dans sa profession  est l’éducation qu’il dispense aux enfants et qui sont l’avenir de sa localité. Il est sociétaire du guichet de Baye Laye depuis décembre 2010. Il sollicite un crédit de 300 000 frs prévu pour le règlement de ses frais de location et quelques charges fixes de l’école durant la période des vacances ou il n’ya pas d’entrées de fonds.
texts.en:
Mr Jean Marie is a young teacher. He is 35 years old and lives in a suburb of Guédiawaye. He is single and the father of a 7-year-old child. He has run a school in his town for five years. He decided to get involved in this activity in order to contribute to the development of his country. The main reason why he is interested in this profession is the education he can provide to children, who are the future of his town. He has been a member of the Baye Laye branch of the microfinance institution UIMCEC since December 2010.

Jean Marie applies for a loan of 300,000 CFA francs which he needs to pay rental fees and other standing charges during the vacation when the school has no income.

loans.use: to pay rental fees and other standing charges during the school vacation.

loans.name: Fredy Braulio

texts.es: El Sr. Fredy es soltero, no tiene hijos;  el Sr. Fredy se dedica a la compra y venta de agua que reparte en su cisterna, el crédito otorgado lo va a invertir en el mantenimiento a su camión cisterna, su principal desafío es que a veces el tanque de agua se malogra; su principal sueño es hacer crecer su negocio.  El Sr. Fredy está muy agradecido por el crédito otorgado.
texts.en:
Señor Fredy is single and has no children.  Señor Fredy works buying and selling water that he distributes with his cistern.  

The loan on offer will be invested in the maintenance of his cistern truck.  His main challenge is that sometimes the tank of water spoils.  His main dream is to make his business grow.

Señor Fredy is very grateful for the loan that's being offered.

loans.use: to conduct maintenance on his cistern truck.

loans.name: Emilia De Jesus

texts.es:
Emilia, administra una pupuseria y comedor, vive con su esposo y dos hijos de 13 y 15 años de edad, trabaja desde hace 10 años vendiendo pupusas y comida, su horario es de 6:00am a 5:00pm.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de maíz, chicharrón, gaseosas, gatorade, jugos, para el negocio; el propósito de obtener el préstamo es mejorar con sus ingresos y ganar más clientes.
El deseo de Emilia es tener un negocio estable, fuerte con capacidad para atender la demanda de los clientes, además de proveer para su familia todo lo que sea necesario para el desarrollo y mejorar la condición económica.
texts.en:
Emilia runs a papusa (stuffed tortilla) shop and eatery. She lives with her husband and two children aged 13 and 15. She has worked for 10 years selling papusas and food. Her workday is from 6:00am to 5:00pm.  

She is asking for a loan to buy corn, pork, soda, gatorade, and juice for the business. The purpose of obtaining the loan is to improve her income and attract more clients. 

Emilia's dream is to have a stable business with a strong ability to meet customer demand and additionally to provide for her family all that is needed to develop and improve their economic standing.

loans.use: to buy corn, pork, soda, gatorade, and juice for the business.

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es:
Oscar tiene 26 años de edad está casado con su esposa Jessica desde hace 2 años, los dos están formando una familia ambos están muy contentos por la llegada de su primera niña que acaba de nacer tiene apenas 5 meses.
El dedica a la elaboración de trajecitos deportivos, Chalequitos de lana, esta vez solicita el crédito para comprar materia prima como tela, tinta de doce a trece colores diferentes, hilo, raseros, mallas, agujas.
Encontrar la tela y pintura es un poco complicado pero nada que no se pueda resolver.
Sus éxitos son cuando vende  más esto generalmente pasa en la temporada otoño-invierno cuando hace frio sale a vender a otros lugares sus chalequitos y dice que le va muy bien. 
La única meta que tiene Oscar es obtener mejores ganancias para poder darle a su familia un patrimonio quizás una cas bien establecida 
“Estoy muy agradecido, ya que con su apoyo puedo seguir trabajando  y obteniendo mis ganancias”
texts.en:
Oscar is 26 years old and has been married to his wife Jessica for two years. They have started their own family and are very happy about the birth of their first daughter who is due in about five months. 

He works making woolen vests that are worn when playing sports. He is asking for a loan at this time to buy raw materials like fabric, 12 or 13 different colors of dye, thread, measuring tools, mallets, and needles. Finding the fabric and dye is a little complicated, but nothing he can't solve. His successes are when he sells more. This is generally in the autumn- winter season when the weather is cold. He goes out to sell the woolen vests in various places and he says it goes very well. 

The only goal that Oscar has is to secure more income in order to give his family a financial standing, perhaps a well-established house. "I am very thankful because with your help I can continue working and earning a better income."

loans.use: to buy thread, needles, fabric, wool

loans.name: Zarina's Group

texts.en:
Zarina is married and her husband is a salesman who sells different food items such as candies, biscuits, and chips to different general stores. He uses his bicycle to sell his products. Zarina is a seamstress who sews clothes for her neighbors. She is very skillful and receives regular orders every month. Her earnings help her to pay utility bills. Zarina has four sons and two daughters. Four of her children are studying and getting an education from nearby schools.

Zarina is requesting a loan from the Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With this loan, he will buy food items in bulk and improve his business. He has been operating his business for the past two years and Zarina hopes that this investment will help him sell more merchandise and make more profit.

loans.use: to buy food items in bulk

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy an industrial kitchen.

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana  is 63 years old and lives in Lumbayao, Tampilisan, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married with one child.
Ana  has a lamination business and earns approximately 5,000 PHP each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase wood to be used for lamination.
Ana has been a member of PMPC for more than one year.

loans.use: to purchase wood to be used for lamination.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is a married man, age 30, and blessed with four children, all of whom attend school. He has been operating a salon to earn a living. He has been in the business for the last two years. He also runs a barber shop for more income. 

He has requested a loan of 40,000 Kenya shillings to buy a blow dryer machine and hair chemicals. In the next 5 years, he plans to manage a wholesale business. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he has been able to adopt the culture of saving.

loans.use: To buy a blow dryer and hair chemicals.

loans.name: Aggrey

texts.en:
Aggrey is 27 and has been in active farming for four years, producing milk and eggs for the local market. He is single and says farming is his source of livelihood. He has a good relationship with Kiva partner Juhudi Kilimo, having requested two previous loans amounting to 31,200 KES and 61,200 KES respectively.
Aggrey has now requested a loan of 61,200 KES to purchase and insure another dairy cow. This will bring his number of dairy cows to four and will  boost his farming income tremendously. He is focusing on starting a grain-grinding business, too. Aggrey says that the loans have made him financially stable and turned farming into employment which makes him confident of having and taking care of a family. He says food and water shortages during dry seasons remain a major challenge.

loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow and buy more poultry birds.

loans.name: Virgilio Oscar

texts.es:
El Sr. Virgilio tiene 57 años de edad trabaja en su casa en la ciudad de Concepción, en donde tiene su taller, su esposa es la Sra. Maria, ella es ama de casa, ellos tienen dos hijos varones, ya todos mayores de edad.
Virgilio tiene una taller de autos desde hace ya varios años, este ha sido el medio gracias al cual ha podido mantener y sacar adelante a su familia. El se considera una persona muy trabajadora y humilde, ya que el viene de una familia de escasos recursos, pero gracias a su esfuerzo ha podido salir adelante.
El solicitó este créditos para la compra de repuestos para poder levantar algunos vehículos que tiene para poder hacer trabajar. El posee numerosos cliente fijos ya en su taller lo cual hace que su trabajo sea muy constante.
texts.en:
Virgilio is 57 years old and works from home, in the city of Concepción, where he has a car repair shop.  His wife, María, takes care of the house.  The couple have two sons who are both adults.

Virgilio has had a car repair shop for several years.  This business is how he has managed to support and provide for his family.  Virgilio considers himself to be a very hard-working and humble person as he comes from a poor family.  However, thanks to his hard work, he has managed to get ahead in life.

Virgilio requested this loan to buy spare parts to fix some vehicles that he has so that he is able to work.  He already has a lot of regular customers and so has a constant stream of work.

loans.use: to buy spare parts to fix some vehicles

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is a mother whose ambition in life is to educate their children and give them a better life. She is now 55 and has five adult children. Despite the hardship of living, she has a strong determination to work out her plans and achieve her goals. 

She helps her husband in managing their corn production business to ensure a fruitful harvest. They aim to increase their yields so that they will earn a higher income to support the education of their children and satisfy their necessities. 

To do this, she would like to ask for a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy corn seeds, fertilizers and pesticides needed in corn production. She believes that through this loan, she will be able to work out her plan and hopes that they will be having a plentiful harvest.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds, fertilizers and pesticides needed in corn production.

loans.name: Rukiizi Abagambakamu Group

texts.en:
Maize, beans and ground nuts is what this 35-year-old father of 4 sells in Kyenjojo Food market. This decade-long business has grown on the basis of Wilson's hard work. Weekly his profits equal to UGX 40,000.

Wilson says he is hoping  to give his kids the best education, Uganda has to offer in the future. He envisions a better future. 

He intends to use his loan to purchase more bags of maize, beans and ground nuts to resell.

loans.use: to purchase more bags of maize, beans and ground nuts to resell.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia is 55 years and lives in Cang-inte, Siquijor, Siquijor.  She is married with five adult children.  Patricia has a Sari Sari Store and earns approximately PHP 2,000 each month doing this type of work.  She has requested a loan amounting to PHP 3,000 to purchase more stock for her general Store.

Patricia has been a member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative for one month. In the future, Patricia hopes to grow and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more stock for her General Store.

loans.name: Akosua

texts.en: Akosoua  produces kenkey (fermented corn dough) for sale at Benyadze near Elmiina. She has been selling kenkey for some years. She is a single parent with 4 children. As a single parent Akosoua uses her income to pay for the school fees and the general upkeep of her children. She needs this loan to purchase bulk maize for her kenkey production. With the new profit, Akosoua wish to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase bulk maize for her kenkey (fermented corn dough) production.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is a 37-year-old married woman. She has 2 children, ages 9 and 15 years. She describes herself to be honest and God-fearing. She operates a a farm where she sells tree seedlings. She has been involved in this business for 7 years. Her business is located at a strategic place and her primary sales are to passers-by and repeat customers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be irrigation problems when it's dry. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more tree seeds. Elizabeth's business goal is to make the best nursery bed and venture into a retail shop within 5 years.

loans.use: To buy more trees seeds.

loans.name: Nana

texts.en:
Nana is a farmer who for three years has grown and sold fruit like oranges in Asafora, near Abura. He uses her income to help his wife pay their children’s school fees. 

Nana is applying for a 530 GHS loan through CRAN to hire laborers to help him on the farm. Her ambition is to keep his farm expanding.

loans.use: to hire laborers to help him on the farm.

loans.name: Duke

texts.en:
Meet 27-year-old Duke, who is a member of the Mabundu Water Point group situated in the Nyamira area of South Nyanza, Kenya. He is married and has one child. He has ventured into farming for the past five years, where his primary income source is milk, eggs, tea and a personal retail business. In the course of his farming, he enjoys poultry farming the most because it yields good returns, but his major challenge is poultry diseases.

He opted for a loan so that he can expand his poultry farm. This will yield more income for him and thus enable him to improve his family’s livelihood. Duke appreciates Kiva for helping him improve his livelihood.

loans.use: to purchase poultry.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 36 years old and married with two children. Ruth works very hard to provide for them.

Ruth runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, milk, coffee, drinks, spices, bread, soap and other snack foods.

Ruth has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future Ruth would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, milk, coffee, drinks, spices, bread, soap and other snack foods

loans.name: Benita

texts.en:
In the city of Escobedo, in the state of Nuevo Leon, lives Benita, mother of 4 children, all still under age, and is married. They all live in a small house. Given that their necessities have increased a great deal and that her husband's salary is not enough to cover them comfortably, five years ago she started making ladies' shoes. With this business she has managed to come out on top with her fmaily, by helping her husband.

Today she requires a loan in the amount of $375 for the purchase of materials she uses to make her products, and this way she can increase her sales and her income. Benita plans to repay the full sum of the loan in a term of 6 months. You can help her and contribute in an important way to the stability and development of her business. Do not wait any longer. She and her family thank you.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

En la localidad de Escobedo, en el estado de Nuevo León vive Benita, madre de 4 hijos, todos aún menores de edad, es casada y viven en una pequeña casita. Dado que las necesidades han aumentado mucho con y con el salario de su esposo no se alcanzan a cubrir satisfactoriamente. Hace 5 años ella comenzó a fabricar zapatos para dama, con esta actividad ha logrado salir adelante con su familia y ayudar a su esposo.

En este momento ella requiere de un préstamo de $ 375 DLLS, pues necesita comprar materiales que utiliza para la fabricación de sus productos, y de esta manera poder incrementar sus ventas y por ende sus ingresos. Benita planea cubrir el monto total de dicho préstamo en un plazo de 6 meses. Tú puedes ayudarla y contribuir de manera importante a la estabilidad y crecimiento de su negocio, no lo dude más, ella y su familia te lo van a agradecer.

loans.use: purchase material

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase two cows for his dairy farming business

loans.name: Albertina

texts.es:
Albertine is 76 years old. She has four children, all of whom are married. Albertine, along with her husband, work in the fields producing corn, beans, pumpkins and other vegetables, and later sells them at a market in the city or to neighbors. With the loan, they hope to purchase fertilizer and pesticides to increase their production and profits and have a better quality of life in the coming years.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

ALBERTINA TIENE 76 AÑOS , TIENE CUATRO HIJOS LOS CUALES YA ESTAN CASADOS Y ELLA JUNTO CON SU ESPOSO TRABAJAN EL CAMPO EN LA PRODUCCION DE MAIZ , FRIJOL , CALABAZAS Y VERDURAS EN GENERAL, LAS CUALES POSTERIORMENTE VENDEN EN EL MERCADO DE LA CIUDAD O A LAS PERSONAS QUE HABITAN EN COMUNIDADES CERCANAS .. FORMA PARTE DEL GRUPO ENRIQUE MOLINA 2 CON EL PRESTAMO ESPERAN COMPRAR FERTILIZANTES Y LIQUIDOS QUE EVITAN EL CRECIMIENTOS DE MALAS HIERBAS QUE PERJUDICAN A LAS COSECHAS DE VERDURAS . PARA AUMENTAR SU PRODUCCION Y OBTENER MEJORES GANANCIAS Y LOGRAR TENER UNA MEJOR VIDA EN LOS AÑOS QUE LES QUEDAN.

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Rani

texts.en:
“Five of my six children are married and the youngest lives with me. I make a living by stitching clothes. My son works as a sound technician at marriages and other events. I would like to help him improve his financial situation so that he can ensure a decent future for himself and his family. A loan will help him invest in a sound system and related equipment (microphone, speakers, amplifier etc.) which he will then be able to rent out for shows in addition to providing his services. This will help him to diversify his business and increase his income”


Rani B., Pakistan

loans.use: To purchase a sound system and related equipment (microphone, speakers, amplifier etc.) for my son

loans.name: Ning

texts.en:
Mrs. Ning S., age 33, is a widow and works as a recycler, buying, collecting, and re-selling recyclable items, earning about $8 per day in revenue. She has three children, one of whom sells souvenir products on the roadside to passing tourists near Angkor Wat, and two of whom are students.

Ning would like to borrow $700 to purchase more recyclable items for her business inventory. This will expand her income and help pay for her children’s education.

loans.use: To purchase more recyclable items for her business inventory

loans.name: Monica I.

texts.es:
Doña Mónica López, together with her son, owns a house in Llojeta in the western part of the city La Paz, she is a widow and works independently preparing French fries in her home which she sells to retailers in the city.

With previous loans she had a store built on her property (brick walls, covered with laminated sheets, “calamine”, and with doors and windows). The funds required will be used to finish the construction details of the store.

This is the sixth time that doña Mónica is asking for a loan and the financial analysis is favorable as the previous five loans have been repaid duly.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Mónica López vive en casa propia en la zona de Llojeta ladera oeste de la Ciudad de La Paz, con su hijo, ya que la señora es viuda; la señora Mónica trabaja por cuenta propia, elaborando papitas fritas en su domicilio que vende a comerciantes minoristas de la ciudad.

Con créditos anteriores realizo la construcción de una tienda en su propiedad, en obra gruesa (muros de ladrillo, cubiertas de calamina y colocado de puertas y ventanas). El crédito solicitado será destinado a la conclusión de la tienda en obra fina.

Esta es la sexta vez que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado los califica favorablemente y puede acceder a un crédito. Los cinco préstamos anteriores han sido cancelados en su totalidad y en los plazos establecidos.

loans.use: Finish  fine details in the construction of a business

loans.name: Vitolina

texts.en: Vitolina strongly supports the saying that “the more you plant and grow, the more you get.” She helps run a 6-acre taro plantation which is looked after by her husband and four laborers. Most of her family has moved overseas but she has no plans of joining them because she can get by with her taro plantation. She goes to the market twice a month where she’ll make $300.00-$400.00 ($120-160 USD) each trip. She also has a contract to sell taro in American Samoa once a month.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies for her plantation

loans.name: Nabaziza C Group

texts.en: Cathy has a stone quarrying business. Sarah is a poultry farmer and wants to use the loan to bring more chicks. Gladys wants to buy a fridge for her hotel. Angel has a bar and intends to buy more furniture with the loan. With the extra business profits, Cathy wants to start up a market stall.

loans.use: To buy more land for stone quarrying

loans.name: Amelia

texts.en:
Amelia is a sixty-six-year-old untiring businesswoman who strives for a better life in spite of difficulty and frustration. She lost her husband a couple of years ago and was left with five children for whom she is the sole support. Currently, Amelia runs a grocery store for the people in her community, who purchase different kinds of products such as detergent, bath soap, chocolate candy bars, instant powdered drink and foodstuffs such as rice, flour and vegetables. Amelia explains that her dream is to have a “Big Store” with millions of products and millions of loyal customers to visit it daily. “I know that I have to work much more than now to achieve this goal,” she says, “but I am optimistic and persistent.”

Amelia will use her loan to buy more products to replenish her store and keep building her business.

loans.use: Purchase of goods to replenish a grocery store.

loans.name: Shahlo

texts.ru:
Shahlo D. lives in Tursun-zoda, she is 25 years old, is married and has 2 children. Shahlo has a high school education and is a homemaker. She does not have a full household because she does not have the resources to purchase domestic animals and you cannot live in a rural area without a cow or at least a few calves especially with little children who need dairy products.

As a result, Shahlo has decided to purchase a dairy cow to provide her family with milk and to sell leftover milk to neighbors. This will allow her to provide her family with milk to drink, dairy products to eat and extra income. In addition, her neighbors who do not have a cow will be able to purchase milk at affordable prices. This is her dream and she is applying for a loan to purchase a dairy cow. Shahlo will pay back the loan over a 15 month period.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Дустмуродова Шахло Хусановна проживает в городе Турсун-заде. Ей 25 лет, она замужем и имеет 2 детей.Образование среднее. Домохозяйка. У нее нет хозяйства та как нет средств , для того чтобы завести домашних животных , ведь в сельской местности нельзя без коровы или хотябы бычков, тем более у нее двое маленьких детей , которым необходимо молочное питание. Поэтому Шахло решила купить корову молочной породы , чтобы обеспечить свою семью молоком, а лишнее продавать соседям. Этим она даст возможность своей семье постоянно пить молоко ,есть молочные продукты и заработать денег, кроме того ее соседи , которые не имеют корову смогут покупать молоко у нее по доступным ценам.Она мечтает об этом , а для того, чтобы купить корову у клиентки нет денег, поэтому она запланировала получить кредит.А погасить кредит она сможет в течении 15 месяцев

loans.use: Purchase a Dairy Cow

loans.name: Mahuna Lissekon Group

texts.fr:
This micro-project focuses on the conversion of palm nuts to palm oil. It was initiated by the all-female group MAHUNAN of LISSEKON, specifically in the commune of AKPRO MISSERETE. This group comprises 6 women who are very active workers. This dynamic group was created in 1995 and has been involved in this business since then. This micro-project will allow the group to increase its production capacity, to obtain higher profits, and to improve the living conditions of its members. Finally, the geographic situation of the commune is an asset for this type of business activity.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Le présent micro projet porte sur la transformation de noix de palme en huile rouge. Il est initié par le groupement féminin MAHUNAN de LISSEKON précisément dans la commune D’AKPRO MISSERETE. Ce groupement compte 6 femmes qui sont très actives pour le travail. Il s’agit d’un groupement dynamique et crée depuis 1995 et exerce cette activité jusqu’aujourd’hui. Le micro projet permettra d’augmenter la capacité de production du groupement, de dégager de bénéfice et d’améliorer les conditions de vie de ses membres. Ainsi la situation géographique de la commune est un atout pour l’exercice de cette activité.

loans.use: To buy 10 tonnes of oil palm nuts

loans.name: Lilah

texts.en: Lilah lives in district 7 of Kabul, Afghanistan. She is married, the mother of 3 children, and has a small  embroidery business. She has been involved in this business for more than two years. Her business is going well and now she wants to expand and has requested an individual loan to complete her stock and buy new embroidery machines  to improve her business and help her husband and her family. She is happy about this loan.

loans.use: Buy embroidery machines

loans.name: Gulraftor

texts.ru:
Gulraftor H. produces sour milk products to sell at the market and to her neighbors. She has a cow that yields about ten liters of milk per day. However, this isn't enough for her business to grow, so Gulraftor has applied for a twelve month loan to purchase a second cow for additional milk. With two cows, Gulraftor can increase her production volume and increase her income.

Translated from Russian by Susie Armitage, Kiva volunteer.

Холова Гулрафтор производит кисло-молочные продукты и продает на рынке и соседям. Имеет во дворе корову , которая дает около 10 литров в день. Но этого не хватает для того , чтобы равивать свой бизнес. Поэтому со сроком в 12 месяцев она хочет получить кредит для того , чтобы купить еще одну корову , которая будет давать дополнительное молоко.ь Таким образом она сможет увелить объем производимой продукции , а так же увеличить доход.

loans.use: To buy a milk cow

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a 37-year-old widow with three children. Her children are currently in school. To support her household, she has been hawking cosmetics in the neighborhood to her loyal clients. She says selling cosmetics is very lucrative, and therefore she wants to expand her inventory to enable her to make good income for the family’s needs. Mary is a member of the group called Isaiah. Members agree to guarantee for each other as a social collateral to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more cartons of cosmetics.

loans.name: Marn

texts.en:
Mr. Marn S. I, 25, and his wife, Mrs.Loa Soknear, 25, live in Preak Daung Village in Kandal Province. He is a construction worker and she is a vegetable farmer. They do not have any children.

Her field is located away from a water source, but with pump she would be able to irrigate her vegetable plants. Mr. Marn S. I is requesting a loan to buy a pump to achieve his wife goals. The rest of the money would be used to buy vegetable seeds. This is the second time Mr. Marn S. I has used a loan to improve his living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a pump for irrigating crops and purchase vegetable seeds

loans.name: Najma

texts.en:
Najma baji is the wife of M. Akram and lives in Kasur, Pakistan. Kasur is famous for its sweetmeats and decorative embroidery. Najma baji owns a two room brick house with a large front yard where she keeps her cattle. She has been living in this house for the last five years, and she has one young daughter. For the last twenty years, her husband has been a milk seller. Najma baji is a housewife and helps her husband in getting milk from the buffalos. Presently they have ten buffalos.

Najma baji successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a second loan to buy another buffalo to expand their family milk business.

loans.use: To buy another buffalo for their family milk business

loans.name: Amélé

texts.fr:
Madame G. Amélé est née en 1954 à Aklakou. Actuellement, elle vit à Kpémé où elle fait ses activités de maraîchage. Elle compte en sa charge, un total de cinq personnes qu’elle supporte à partir du revenu de son métier.

Elle a réussi à étendre son espace maraîcher pourtant, les matériels de travail lui manquent. Elle pense passer par ce canal pour solliciter un crédit afin de pouvoir acheter une motopompe. Ceci lui faciliterait le travail et augmentera sa production.

Avec le revenu de la vente des produits, elle réussira à améliorer ses conditions de travail et celles de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mrs. Amélé G. was born in 1954 in Aklakou. She currently lives in Kpémé where she is involved in vegetable farming. She is responsible for a total of five people, whom she supports with the income she makes from her trade. She has managed to extend the area she cultivates, but lacks the equipment she needs. She wants to use this channel to request a loan to purchase a motor-pump. This would make her work easier and increase production. With the income from selling her produce, she will be able to improve her working conditions as well as the living conditions of her family.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a motor-pump for vegetable farming

loans.name: Volodimir

texts.en:
Volodimir offers transportation services in Ivano-Frankivsk where he is originally from. He started his business about 5 years ago after he quit working as a driver in the State Protection Service. This enterprise has been an effective source of income for his family of four. Currently, his daily income is about 200-250 Grivnas. 

Volodimir works many hours a day to provide decent living for his family. This time he’s faced with a need to do some repair work on his vehicle and buy car insurance. He is requesting a 2,500 Grivna loan to fix the body of his car and give it a fresher, nicer look. 

Volodimir has many challenges in his work. However, he doesn’t want to go back to being a hired employee, preferring to work for himself. He is hopeful that with hard work, determination, and financial assistance his business will continue to be successful and provide him and his family with stable, long-term income. One of his long-term plans is to sell his lot of land, buy a second vehicle, hire a taxi driver and expand his business as a result.

loans.use: To purchase insurance and cover car maintenance costs

loans.name: Komla Delali

texts.fr:
Né en 1964 à Badou dans la préfecture de Wawa au centre du Togo, monsieur NOMAYO Komla Delali s’est marié avec une revendeuse et il est père de cinq (5) enfants. Il y a dix ans qu’il a crée une quincaillerie dans le quartier d’Agoè à Lomé.  Avec beaucoup d’expérience, il est bien expérimente et connaît bien ce commerce.
Il n’a jamais bénéficié du crédit au près de WAGES, et ce premier crédit qu’il sollicite lui permettra d’acheter 30 tuiles, 10 tuyaux, 12 scies, et 4 boites de peintures.
texts.en:
Born in 1964 in Badou in the prefecture of Wawa in the center of Togo, Mr. Koma Delali Nomayo is married to a merchant and is the father of 5 children. 10 years ago, he opened a little hardware store in the Agoè neighborhood in Lomé. With lots of experience, he is quite knowledgeable in his business.

He has never before received a loan from WAGES, and this first loan that he is requesting will permit him to buy 30 tiles, 10 hoses, 12 saws, and 4 boxes of paint.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of hardware items for re-sale

loans.name: Sen's Group

texts.en:
This small loan request is being made by five borrowers, all residents of Siem Reap Province. Mr. Sen S. is 32 years old and the leader. He makes a living by selling carving wood out of his home. He can earn a profit of approximately US$ 2 per day to cover his family's living expenses. He is married to Nor Chaom, 22, a grocery seller. She runs a store from their house selling various kinds of groceries to neighbors, which allows her to earn about US$ 2 a day. Besides this, she is a good housewife who takes time to care for her one young child. Mr. S. has humbly requested a loan for his wife to purchase various grocery items for sale.

The four other borrowers are

Bon S., 26 years old, a carving wood seller. He is seeking a loan to buy piglets to raise.

Te Toeun is 50 years old and is a wine distiller. He requests a loan to purchase poultry for breeding.

Khon P., 24, sells carving wood out of his home and he is asking for a loan to buy piglets to raise.

Dib C. is age 45 and makes a living distilling wine for sale. She would like to ask for a loan to purchase piglets to raise. (C.'s husband is pictured, because she was not available.)

loans.use: To purchase  grocery items for sale

loans.name: Elisa

texts.es: Elisa es una joven de 25 años, está casada y tiene una pequeña bebé recién nacida la cual la acompaña a sus jornadas de trabajo diarias. Ella vende jugo de quinua con manzana y jugo de cañihua para generar ingresos para su familia, su esposo también la ayuda cuando tiene días libres la apoya en la venta, ya que ella con una bebé pequeña y recién nacida aun no puede dedicarse netamente al trabajo que requiere de esfuerzo, ya que gracias a Dios Elisa tiene mucha clientela. Lo más difícil de su labor es la preparación bebido a que requiere ser muy minuciosa con los ingredientes para preparar los jugos como a ella y a sus clientes le gustan. Elisa se encuentra en su 8vo préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma, siendo muy puntual en los pagos, ya que los préstamos que solicita le son de mucha ayuda para su negocio. Con el dinero requerido comprará mayor cantidad de ingredientes para preparar su rico jugo de quinua y también para refaccionar el triciclo en el cual ofrece estas bebidas y así brindar un mejor servicio.
texts.en:
Elisa is a young woman of 25 years, is married, and has a small newborn baby who accompanies her daily while she is working. She sells quinoa with apple juice and cañihua juice to generate income for her family. Her husband helps her with the sales when he has days off, since with a little newborn baby she still can not devote herself completely to the work that requires such effort, since - thanks to God - Elisa has many customers. The hardest part of her work is preparing the drinks which requires being very meticulous with the ingredients to prepare the juices the way she and her clients like them. Elisa is seeking her eighth loan with Prisma Microfinance and is very punctual with the payments since the loans she requests are of great help with her business. With the requested money she will buy a larger quantity of ingredients to prepare her rich quinoa juice and repair the three wheel cart with which she offers these drinks and so provide a better service.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy ingredients for the preparation of her juices

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline F. A. is a new member of the K-MET network. She will soon be trained as a Community Health Worker by K-MET and will begin visiting patients in her community. She joined when she was told that along with volunteering, she would be eligible for a loan.

Jackline is 31, married to a driver, and the mother of 2 children – a boy and a girl, ages 11 and 9, who are both currently in school. The family lives in Molem, a village just outside of Kisumu, Kenya.

Jackline has a business selling second-hand clothing in Kibuye Market, the major market in Kisumu. Jackline buys her stock from the wholesalers in the same market. She started the business in 2007, when she decided she wanted to be able to better provide for her children.

She is applying for her first loan from K-MET, of approximately 400 USD. Jackline will use the loan money to buy clothing in bales from the wholesalers, as it is cheaper to buy in bulk than by the piece.

loans.use: To purchase used clothing for re-sale

loans.name: Subhon

texts.en:
M. Subhon is 38 years old. He dedicates his time to driving a taxi and a microbus. He currently relies on two vehicles for his public transport business, one of which he drives personally. He rents the microbus. He has a wife and three children. Subhon has about six years of experience in the public transportation field. The competition is rather high in this business because there are so many people who need it. 

His current request will help him to maintain his vehicle, since this is the tool of his trade. He is counting on your help and requesting a loan of $1200 USD for 12 months. With the loan, he’ll purchase spare parts for his microbus. With your support, Subhon will continue to progress. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. 

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy spare parts to repair his microbus

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon D. is married with four children. He has received an education through junior high school.

Simon is a photographer in Moree near Cape Coast, which he has done since 1997. His wife is a seamstress. Simon uses his income to pay for school fees, utilities and rent.

Simon will use the loan to purchase a digital camera in order to increase his business. With the new profits from his expanded business, Simon plans to build a house.

loans.use: Purchase a digital camera in order to increase his business.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en: Eunice, whose husband is a commercial motor cyclist, has been in the business of selling eggs for a long time. Pictured with two of her four children, this 42-year-old entrepreneur is requesting a loan of N50000 to purchase more eggs to sell. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more eggs to sell.

loans.name: Fuseina

texts.en: Fuseina A. is forty–nine years old. She is married and has given birth to five children, one son and four daughters. She says two of her daughters are already married. The rest of the children are in primary school. She lives with some of her children and husband in a rented apartment in a busy commercial town called Ejura in the Ashanti region of Ghana. Fuseina works to support her husband financially to provide for the family. Her husband is a farmer, while she is a trader. She trades in vegetables such as tomatoes, peppers, okro, etc. She buys from markets in nearby communities. Fuseina sells at the local market on a table top. She has been in business for over twenty years and wants a loan to procure the vegetables in bulk. She is hopeful of giving her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To buy vegetables in bulk

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en: Mohamad is a 19-year-old man living in KeterMaya, Mount Lebanon. He started working as a farmer when his father first taught him the business when he was 11 years old and he now owns his own farm. Today, Mohamad is requesting to borrow US$ 1,200 to purchase fertilizer etc.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers etc.
